Review: the beach is structurally confusing that can only describe has having multiple personality disorder every forty minutes of this twohour begins new theme virtually discarding what has been set up in the preceding act it starts off purposefully as about an innocent man seeking new thrills in dangerous environment but then in the second act the mood of the abruptly changes and it becomes story about love triangle on an idyllic island paradise that evokes visions of blue lagoon forty minutes later the mood changes once more and it becomes dumbed down version of lord of the flies where an isolated community is discovered where their moral code touts maintaining sense of bliss at all costs the time it is over you can only scratch your head and wonder what this was really meant be about the main character of the beach is angstridden richard leonardo dicaprio he travels the netherworld of bangkok where back alley merchants push their wares upon unsuspecting tourists and scantily clad women brazenly ask if you are looking for good time richards voiceover tells the audience that he has come this place because he is bored his life and feels that one way reinvigorate himself is let go of the familiar and enter into world of the unknown this seedy environment is just what richard is looking for he checks into fleabag hotel where he meets the crazed daffy robert carlisle he seems like raving lunatic obviously high from heavy drug use and looking as if he is afflicted some sort of psychosis though his jagged behavior would distress most of us richard listens him as he speaks of mysterious island that contains the most perfect beach that anyone has ever seen moreover the island itself flourishes enough hemp plants that can make small city high for life captivated the idea he asks two other hotel guests join him on his journey they are worldly etienne and the alluring francoise who have also come thailand for reasons similar richards once they finally arrive at this paradise however the mood of the story shifts richards growing desire for francoise this particular plot point is weak at best because there is absolutely no question in my mind that francoise will wind up richard etienne is about as exciting as fluffy white sand it is odd that etienne never sees this coming but paradise has way of hiding potential threats just out of view and once the three stumble across the hidden community mood shift imminent more events transpire that depict its hidden dangers for example there are marijuana fields close patrolled armed guards and the lagoon in they swim invites the occasional shark there are several ideas that are introduced in the beach and each one could merit its own featurelength there is the man vs nature angle the love triangle angle and the utopiagoneawry angle but the meanders so tremendously that its entire purpose becomes blurred dicaprio as result has an almost impossible time of trying embody the different states of mind that he and the goes through consequently the audience has an equally difficult time trying keep up

the most absurd remake of it is toss up between gus van sants psycho and mighty joe young the new disney picture based on the old rko picture knew was in trouble when polished computergenerated version of that famous rko logo appeared before the head credits there is no great demand for another giant ape moviemake that ape movie period witness the quick deaths of buddy born be wild and congo and while this latest entry is inoffensive and watchable it is also an assembly line product through and through lacking the charm and unpredictability of the jungle serials that partly inspired it theron is jill young as young girl in the wilds of africa she befriended baby gorilla after both their mothers were slain poachers that baby gorilla nicknamed joe grows immense proportions and adult jill basically bides her time looking after him playing hide and seek him and guarding him against poachers enter conservationist greg paxton who convinces jill move joe california where they can protect him better in controlled environment joe is restless at first no sooner does he finally settle in the new place than those nasty poachers show up in a plotting joes demise suffice it say the movie could have been called joe ape in the city theron so good in devils advocate and paxton so good in the recent simple plan are fine actors but not fine enough transcend the material paintbynumbers script from the hack writers of superman iv and mercury rising the plot arguably borrows more from steven spielbergs the lost world than the original the computergenerated trexi mean joewreaking havoc on the busy streets for an encore the storytelling becomes especially lazy during this final third jill shouting look joes headed for the movie theatre followed shot of joe scaling manns chinese theater moment later jill shouts again something like look joes headed for an amusement park and what do you know there is joe at the pallisades carnival scaring the bejesus out of innocent thrillseekers the seams of lastminute edits mighty joe young showunrelated scenes are patched together quick dissolves the movie sure feels uneven regardless act two is underdeveloped while little of joe smashing cars in act three goes long long way underwood tremors speechless was perhaps not the director for the job even the plentiful untamed landscape looks dull in his hands capturing the beauty of nature requires more than his point and shoot style did enjoy certain sequences especially the demoliton of blacktie dinner sequence and the prologue however implausible is touching as tyke joe acts just like t rick bakers makeup effects and puppetry are outstanding the real star of the showyet for all its technical flawlessness the creature remains too grumpy and homicidal love his facial expressions are variations on scowl be fair saw mighty joe young in cinema packed wailing childrenit is wonder was able decipher the dialogue it is certainly not for very young kidsintense fighting scenes may scare them while any time joes not on camera may bore them tears note older boys are more likely be dazzled therons colourful array of tank tops suspect bland mighty joe young is passable entertainment for family outing but they sure do not make em like they used

in the surprise success an unheralded little movie called ghost instantly rescued the moribund careers of its trio of abovethetitle stars patrick swayze demi moore and whoopi goldberg eight years later moore and goldbergs careers are not exactly thriving but they have had their share of screen successes since the same cannot be said of swayze who has just added yet another turkey his resume the aptly named black dog forget the mortal kombat moviesthis trucksploitation flick is the closest the movies has come video games good truck driver jack crews swayze must drive cargo of illegal firearms from atlanta new jersey along the way jack and his crew of three run into number of obstaclessuch as highway weigh station evil truckers and deadly uzifiring motorcyclists every so often like at the end of video game level or stage the main baddie pops up red meat loaf fresh from the triumph of spice world who wants steal the cache of guns just in case you forget his name or have trouble keeping track of who is driving what all of reds vehicles be it pickup or big rig are paintedyou guessed itred could go into more of the plot specifics such as jacks dream of having nice home his family the past trauma that sent him prison and cost him his trucking license the fbiatf crew tracking the cargo but they are of little importance all that matters director kevin hooks and writers william mickelberry and dan vining are the obstacles jack confronts in his drive from point point but they fail at even this modest goal for none of the highway chaos as credibly staged as it is is terribly interesting let alone exciting once you have seen couple of trucks bang against each other or big rig explode the first time you have seen it every time as dreary as black dog is as an entertainment the saddest part about the has nothing do what shows up onscreen it is that swayze has reduce himself such work while far from the best of actors he is certainly not horrible and he is charismatic presence do not know if it is his judgment or the dearth of quality job offers that leads him involve himself bombs such as black dog regardless if he continues on this career track could tv series be far behind

these days we are witnessing the deluge of films based on old cult tv shows most of the times the fans of these shows shudder thinking what could hacks of the present do the memories of their past but some five or six years ago there were not that many movies and the trend did not look that depressing so the people who like the author of this review grew up watching flintstones popular animated series about modern stone age family were not particularly worried when the word came about live action remake after all the producer behind the project was steven spielberg and if anything else at least the special effects would be good the plot revolves about flintstones family set in fictious stone age town of bedrock whose members enjoy the lifestyle of middle class america fred flinstone john goodman works in the quarry and one day he helps his best friend and neighbour barney rubble rick moranis and his wife betty rosie odonnell adopt baby return the favour barney switches his results of aptitude test fred and based on that fred gets wellpaid job in management but of course this is just sham corrupt official cliff vandercave kyle maclachlan and his sultry secretary sharon stone halle berry need scapegoat for their embezzlement scheme in the meantime freds wife wilma elizabeth perkins must face her mother elizabeth taylor who cannot stand fred on the superficial level the flintstones did the excellent job in bringing the animated series life computer effects are flawless and the costumes settings and other details are authentic for all the fans of the show unfortunately problems this start inadequate casting rick moranis is too thin for the role of barney while the cartoon betty used be much skinnier than rosie odonnell but the greatest problem of all is plot or be precise the lack of plot some thirty six screenwriters made sure that the plot of the is lame original characters onedimensional and many elements of the story like embezzlement and interoffice politics totally incomprehensible for the little children the main targeted audience of this result is almost unwatchable mess occasionally saved mostly excellent acting elizabeth perkins was right on mark as wilma and one of the classic example of mortal disease known as high concept after great hype movie quickly sank into oblivion and the fans of the show returned the animated version all in all is not that bad but only the hard core fans and nostalgics can find more than guilty pleasure in it

after falling down hoped that joel schumacher would mature into great director since then he has offered us two soso adaptations of john grisham novels the client and time kill and two batman movies that lowered the standards of that franchise although these disappointments dampened my enthusiasm for schumachers potential the publicity for his latest release mm raised new hope it promised be something unusual it was not the plot goes like this tom welles nicolas cage is private eye who is hired wealthy woman allegorically named mrs christian myra carter investigate an mm movie found among her late husbands belongings the movie appears be snuff in teenage girl is raped and murdered man in leather mask who reminds me of bane in schumachers batman robin because murders can be realistically simulated in movies mrs christian wants tom discover if the girl is alive or dead combing through missing persons reports tom finds the girls name and tracks her los angeles the aid of max california joaquin phoenix video store clerk and another symbolic name tom wanders through the underworld of pornography in search of snuff the plot bears an obvious resemblance paul schraders hardcore in father goes deeper and deeper into the industries of porn and sex find his missing daughter both films are modeled on dantes the inferno of course mm makes that connection overly obvious casting max as virgil and having him constantly tell tom that they were heading toward meeting the devil hardcore is much more subtle and meaningful mm had lot of promise in its better moments it is an examination of violence as entertainment and of the beast within even nice guy like tom one moment of the first sort when we first meet max he is reading truman capotes in cold blood underneath the cover of porn novel in cold blood was the father of the truecrime genre is the literary equivalent of snuff films max promises that we will see examples of the second theme when he tells tom dance the devil and the devil do not change the devil changes you tom does changei will let you discover the specifics for yourselfbut not permanently schumacher and screenwriter andrew kevin walker did not have the guts take tom so far down the dark tunnel that he could not come back walkers seven did much better job on that theme refusing compromise cage tries hard pull it off but the script does not give him enough work phoenix walks away the moviehe is smart charming and funny other cast members include fargo peter stormare camping it up as porn auteur dino velvet and the sopranos james gandolfini as soulless porn merchant who pushes tom too far in the last analysis since mm falls short of its pretensions and its promise its just another private eye story in the raymond chandlerross macdonald tradition of having the detective uncover the depravity behind the glossy facade of wealth and privilege however unlike other predictable fare in the genrelast years twilight for example mm is especially disappointing because it could have been much more than it is

i think of know what you did last summer as the movie that scream and scream could have been mind you though mean this in the worst possible way know what you did last summer is typical slasher flic without the smarts of the screams as result it is even worse than some of your better campy horror pictures see nightmare on elm street because it thinks it is about thirty times smarter than it is based on teen book of the same name and disappointingly adapted scream scribe kevin williamson know what you did last summer begins appropriately angsty modern rock music combined some startling cinematography of cliff along the ocean and an angsty sort sitting at the top the appropriate mood being set this is angsthorror for the we cut over the july th parade in small north carolina town from there we see the blond female protagonist helen shivers woodenly played sarah michelle geller getting crowned croaker queen as the blond male hero barry cox woodenly played ryan phillipe and matched brunette pair of protagonists julie james and ray bronson woodenly played party of fives jennifer love hewitt and freddie prinze jr respectively cheer her on after getting drunk at party going beach wittily discuss urban legend and indulge in some foreshadowing and having some meaningful sex if you believe what the characters say the four run down some guy crossing the windy cliff road at night his face is mangled so they cannot tell who it is and they come the decision dump him in the ocean so as not ruin any of their future chances for success in the world cut one year later the lives of our protagonists have gone from annoying bad main brunette female the bright one of the bunch has been plagued guilt and almost failed out of college blond female has forfeited her dreams of starring on guiding light and now works at the family store in town brunette male is fisherman living off the land blond male has become complete jerk and quarterback on some college football team then predictably their past comes back haunt them it all begins an irrational murder followed some taunting of protagonists the mysterious killer bad acting good actress anne heche an improbable plot bad acting the main bad actors some more killing concluding in climactic scene mostly climactic in the relief at the end of the movie all the while the actors and actresses spout off bad lines and main brunette male does his best keanu reeves imitation not that the movie was without pleasure count the illogical plot twists and bad lines for some fun mostly though note the costumes of main females and how trendily unattractive they make the otherwise eyecatching pair look

one of the most unwelcome thriller trends returns from the grave it is the ___ from hell movie starting in the early nineties we were subjected nearly every conceivable combination of relationshipsfromhell there were boyfriends from hell friendly neighborhood cops from hell nannies from hell and even secretaries from hell but hush has found an old standby that somehow was forgotten in the rush the motherinlaw from hell the motherinlaw in question is martha played jessica lange she has been singlehandedly running the family horse farm kilronan her son jackson johnathon schaech and his girlfriend helen gwyneth paltrow live in new york and have no intention move back down south the rural kilronan but those intentions are about change you see martha lives manipulation she has used it in years past breed many championship horses now she believes she can use it breed herself grandson though at first helen finds martha charming soon she is caught in the domineering marthas web of deception it is hard understand why nobody ever wises up martha schemes as written most of the characters in the must be very slow witted but then the even treats the audience like idiots it tries get away things like leaving critical piece of evidence in rather unlikely place without even batting an eye then again an audience accepts characters as shallow as these is not one that is likely question details jessica langes martha is the only semideveloped character in the and she applies her talents redeem it as much as she can character that could have been simply awful is merely groanworthy gwyneth paltrow does not have much build upon as helens only character trait seems be daughterinlaw still she fares better than johnathon schaech whose character is so nonexistent he is inexplicably missing for much of the still there have been much worse ____ from hell films even its paperthin characters and ludicrous setups hush manages create few thrills in colorbynumbers fashion you know what is coming but occasionally the will deliver shock or two the old formulas are around for reason but that does not mean they taste fresh

mugshot directorwritercinematographereditor matt mahurin cast belinda becker stella michael williams rumor robert knepper joechris robert walker random willie lassic young brother of rumor maxine joiner rumors mother runtime mortal films reviewed dennis schwartz bleak indie about stolen identity there is not much more this visually stylish than what meets the eye as it relies on shock tell its story of prolonged vicious mugging it falls into the category of being pretentious arthouse leaving bitter taste in ones mouth as it stereotypes its characters and unintentionally further inflames the racial issues it tries make heavyhanded point about disenfranchised black youths trapped their environment their only way out being crime but the story is so filled violence and its nyc setting looks like hell that it is hard enjoy this and follow what the logic in the story is supposed mean the relationship between the black mugger and his white victim is cloudy one the never determines what it wants say about it matt mahurin is virtual oneman crew in putting this together directorwriter cinematographereditor who is still photographer in his day job the works best as visually challenging piece as each shot looks like photograph carefully telling the story unfolding white photographer robert knepper is mugged black gang while he is on freelance assignment take photo shoot of harlem at night he becomes victim of amnesia and his head is bloodied as he is left in deserted harlem building as the gang leaves him for dead but one of the muggers rumor michael williams comes back and pretends help him he is wouldbe photographer who keeps scrapbook entitled mugshots in the project apartment he shares his mother and younger brother keeping his victim in the dark about who he is calling him joe and not telling him what is happening he becomes the photographer for few days he enters the photographers stylish greenwich village apartment and steals his expensive camera and decides hold the mugging vic for ransom when he finds out he has black girlfriend stella belinda becker she is the only one in the who could act the is stuck clumsy dialogue and an overuse of symbolism as it ends nothing more tell after the shock and the violent situation it created except beat it into the ground it could only be commended for how appealing the looks as if it is scrapbook of still photos put together celebrate mugging

i can imagine how good krippendorfs tribe must have looked on paper it does not surprise me in the least that group of extremely talented actors led the great richard dreyfuss and good director todd holland all wanted make this in fact it is only the expertise this excruciatingly bad script has been executed that keeps me from suggesting that you stay as far away from krippendorfs tribe as possible in retrospect can imagine how bad this could have been shudder at the possibilities of awfulness had it starred an actor less able than dreyfuss dreyfuss plays james krippendorf an anthropologist who is granted his university find an undiscovered tribe in new guinea halfway into his twoyear expedition his wife apparently dies say apparently because when or how she dies is never truly established later we find out that much of the grant money was spent on bigscreen tvs and other such pleasures so when krippendorf finds out what happens professors who do not use their grant money wisely he decides construct an elaborate lie he makes his own tribe using his three children as actors in video he simply makes up certain incredible facts about this tribe he calls the shelmickedmu audiences at krippendorfs lectures are amazed his findings that the shelmickedmu practice circumcision and proof that the typical family unit is led single father is truly amazing the anthropological community like all films like this the lie becomes more and more complex and the suspense is generated us wondering at what point it is all going fall out from under our hero dreyfuss is funny talented man and he is funny in this he has lots of positive energy and unlike most comical actors really manages play people like this realistically this also requires lot of physical humor that have never seen dreyfuss perform and he does great job jenna elfman who plays veronica mecilli scientist who wants in on krippendorfs work is also very funny and appealing here and the kid actors are great as well but we are talking about the script from hell this is one of those stories that requires such extreme suspension of disbelief that they might as well have established that the story just takes place in an alternate universe where things like this can happen but the ridiculousness of the story is not really what is so bad about it all the cliches and the irritating plot devices could have easily been overcome dreyfuss and crew no the script is plagued so many clueless stereotypes and meanspirited characters that was in disbelief as watched furthermore the manor in all of this material is covered up is truly shameless take for instance the scene in krippendorf gets veronica drunk so he can tape them having sex they get all decked out in the tribe getup complete paint darken their skin krippendorf does this because he needs footage of the mating rituals of his tribe now saw this scene coming from mile away but said myself no that would be far too tasteless there is no way they will do that oh god they did do it it is there was almost more appalled the fact that this did not bother the other audience members whom saw this found it deplorable and when krippendorf is forced admit that he did it he simply apologizes without the slightest hint of conviction in his voice the is filled scenes like these they not only insult the audience but they insult the types of people that the portrays it would take some truly professional work create videos convincing enough fool an entire community of scientists yet krippendorf does it easily in an afternoon and watching dreyfuss stumble over completely unprepared speech is funny and entertaining but think that most members of the onscreen audience would be able see that he is making everything up as he goes if were an anthropologist this would insult me immensely moving right along the plays off every stereotype our culture has ever learned regarding african tribes sure dreyfuss dressing up like chief is really funny and it allows for some entertaining scenes but the heart of this material is deeply clueless as the themes and thoughts that it provokes it is because of dreyfuss as an actor that was able watch this his character here is not good subject for because he is shameless liar and never once does he show any kind of penance for what he does suppose it was interesting see the formula defied in this case but for the purposes of good taste would have expected something no this man sets terrible example for his kids and colleagues and the writer of the charlie peters did not include single scene in krippendorf takes his kids aside and tells them that what he is doing is very bad in fact it is his eldest daughter that frequently tells him that he is doing the wrong thing and he continually shrugs off her warnings suppose it is important admit that this is funny dreyfuss and elfman and many of the contrived and insulting scenes add up picture that is anything but boring and if you are less serious than you probably will enjoy it however cannot get past these elements krippendorfs tribe is being marketed as family comedy but this is the kind of that teaches the kids of our society faulty lessons that they should not be learning little more insight into its story and themes this could have been good movie

after marketing windup of striking visuals and the promise of star caliber actors mission mars ends up throwing whiffleball fiercely unoriginal director depalma cobbles together borrowing heavily from what has gone before him there are aliens similar those in close encounters of the third kind the stranded astronaut theme is reminiscent of robinson crusoe on mars the astronauts encounter space flight difficulties that smack of apollo interior spacecraft visuals are redolent of space odyssey instead of using these components as launching pad create his own movie de palma stops right there refusing infuse the anything even remotely resembling cleverness or heart mission mars takes it is first wobbly steps at prelaunch barbeque in the perfunctory character introductions are done during these surface scans of the characters we learn that jim mcconnell sinise has lost his wife it is plot point revisted throughout the jackhammer subtlety the rest of the crew exhibit bland affability there is no contentiousness no friction add the the dramatic tension of these men and women being confined close quarters for an extended length of time maybe depalma was going for the comraderie of the right stuff but in that movie the astronauts had embers of personality warm us through the technical aspects it is the year and this is nasas first manned excursion the red planet crew led luke graham cheadle arrives on mars and quickly discovers an anomaly they investigate tragic results graham is able transmit garbled distress call back earth in response earth sends rescue team comprised of mcconnell woody blake robbins wife terri fisher nielsen and phil ohlmyer oconnell obstacles are put in the crews way and and they matterof factly go about solving them should say mcconnell goes about solving them time and again mcconnell is presented as some kind of wunderkind would not be so bad if the rest of the crew did not come across as so aggressivelly unremarkable mention should be made of the misogynistic handling of fisher in situation where the entire crews mission and life is in mortal danger on team of professionals she is portrayed as an emotion directed weak link women serve no purpose in the movie other than serve as reflection of male characters personality trait the time they land on mars and try solve the mystery of what occurred mission mars starts laying on the cliches and stilted dialogue heavy brush there is an adage in show do not tell mission mars does both repeatedly characters obsessively explain the obvious explain their actions as they are doing them explain fellow astronauts facts should be fundamental knowledge them the films conclusion is momumentally derivative anticlimatic and unsatisying as walked out wondered who the target audience might be for this the best could come up is preteen age boys but in this media saturated era this films components would have been old hat even for them have think what attracted such talent this was the lure of making good modern day bmovie the key such venture is certain depth and sincerity towards the material felt no such earnestness

some movies ask you leave your brain at the door some movies ask you believe in the impossible really have good time playing god asks just one simple eensy teensy thing so it can fully entertain you it is accomplished in just four easy follow steps crack open your skull scoop out your brain squish it under your foot several times and reverse steps two and one congratulations you now have all the necessary requirements fully enjoy whole lot of nothing some movies fail at the box office but you manage see why the producers thought it could have been good movie others are simply good ideas that are badly executed then there is playing god enters the esteemed category of movies seem have grown from the union of drunk director actors satisfied in the knowledge that this horrible flick will have no lasting impact on their careers and bunch of ripoffs or homages as they like call it from other better movies that end up looking like an unflushed toilet harsh maybe justified hell yes this is movie that is not just satisfied in ripping off other movies but feels the need remind us of that fact every ten minutes for example gunman bursts into garden the two guns in his hands firing away this does look moderately kool but the camera lingers on the actor for so long you can almost hear the director yelling oooh look look john woo two guns blazing slooooow motion and if that was not enough you can also hear the script grunting under the effort it must take try and make every single line of dialogue sound like something deep and meaningful like in tarantino movie poor timothy hutton gets deliver most of the corny lines you have admire the effort he puts into it this guy deserves better unlike most movies this one does not suffer from stupid bad guy syndrome just make things little different this time we get stupid heroes example duchovny manages distract bad guy making him go into the bathroom get some bandages now the bad guy is like stoned man so he leaves his shotgun next our hero term used as loosely as possible survival instincts and good dose of common sense seems suggest grabbing the shotgun our hero does but only after contemplating it for about thirty seconds even when he does grab it he seems unsure how hold it going so far as actually wonder if he should place finger near the trigger mind you have never fired shotgun in my life but believe you me that the bad guy would be missing most of his vital organs be he stoned or not some will argue that our hero does not have killer instinct the hell that two fbi guys have just been shot in front me along one bad guy and the other looks like he might go ballistic at any second solution boom will take the time feel sorry about it later thank you very much another prime example of the idiot hero syndrome our boy duchovny needs reach his girl before something bad happens her he knows the head bad guy has her on the tenth floor of building and that he might be running into room full of people itchy trigger fingers he still has his shotgun bring it along you say no thanks will just ditch it in the back of my car and the real kicker is this when he reaches the room and people start shooting at him he has the nerve look surprised while we are on the subject of getting shot why in hades were those fbi guys sitting their backs the door have got no formal training but even know you never sit your back the door ask mr wild bill the first and only time he did not sit his back wall cost him his life this is the major problem this movie any mook could have thought of hundred ways make it better is it so much ask that actually put little common sense into their characters for instance our heroes hide at duchovnys summer home now the bad guys could come knocking at any moment ok this time our hero does get himself gun and has it at his side most of the time but see our hero is drug addict and guess what he chooses now go clean and suffer through dt oh sure he will be really impressive when the bad guys come calling going clean is really honorable of him but would have waited until did not need be conscious or being able fire gun for an enjoyable performance timothy hutton plot holes the size of godzilla getting our intelligence insulted and several oh come on moments

preposterous religious action produced the trinity broadcasting network about code hidden within the text of the bible that when deciphered will lead the end of the world nice of those bible authors put doomsday code into the most read book ever eh michael york plays millionaire diplomat who breaks the code and sets out become god on earth and fulfill the doomsday prophecies while casper van dien terribly miscast and giving an awful performance as result plays the atheist motivational speaker who must stop him michael ironside great as always despite the silly surrounding him plays fallen priest and right hand man michael yorks character heres some subtle character development you may have missed pertaining ironsides character now despite the fact that we see him murder man in the opening scene the filmmakers are not quite sure if their audience will understand that he is evil how do they fix that make specific efforts show that his character is the only one in the who smokes there are lots of ominous shots of michael ironside smoking oooooo scary but even that was not enough for the filmmakers apparently as they later have infer that ironsides character is gay it comes out of nowhere and just makes no sense my main problem this is that despite the silly story could have been pulled off anything can be made believable if executed correctly the events of the are not shown any sense of urgency or importance for example at one point yorks character is declared chancellor of the world or something and we see one brief cheesy news report about it the movie keeps telling us that the apocalypse is coming but it never seems that way there is no world reaction anything the omega code is available on dvd from goodtimes home video it contains the in the original theatrical aspect ratio of and includes the original theatrical trailer documentary on the making of the production notes and cast and crew information the documentary runs about minutes and is actually surprisingly good it looks as though it was made for broadcast on tbn and it does comprehensive job of interviewing practically everyone in the cast and crew the exception of michael ironside unfortunately the best thing about it is that whenever crew members are interviewed they do an excellent job of explaining their profession and exactly what it is they do on movie set most documentaries tend overlook this doomsday expert hal lindsey is even interviewed you will remember his documentary from the called the late great planet earth where lindsey speculated that jimmy carter might actually be the antichrist however at the very beginning of the documentary the producers of the managed get on my bad side when interviewed they actually have the nerve say ever see raiders of the lost ark well our is like that no it is not not long shot pg

americas sweethearts has an intriguing premise and great cast but it is not nearly as edgy or funny as it should be almost all the problems the project can be traced back coscript writer billy crystal who shows the same lack of discipline the screenplay that he typically displays while cohosting comic relief charity shows robin williams and whoopi goldberg two other paragons of selfindulgence crystal ignores simple but crucial rule for screwball comedy work the characters must be placed into rigid social setting because only in that context will their unorthodox antics be humorous americas sweethearts takes place at press junket where decorum must be maintained in front of the reporters it is promising setup but the screenplay quickly blows off the rules thus dissipating the tension of the situation the end of the all the lead performers participate in huge fight room full of journalists looking on but their outbursts are only mildly amusing because the structure has been destroyed john cusack and catherine zetajones play eddie thomas and gwen harrison beloved acting duo whose marriage hit the skids when gwen began seeing hector hank azaria spanish actor an ego almost as pronounced as his lisp of the last nine films eddie and gwen made together six crossed the million mark but the prospects for their final effort space opus titled time over time are far from rosy while eddie has spent many months in new age rest clinic fretting over the breakup gwens solo films have tanked make matter worse the director of the movie christopher walken visionary who purchased the unabombers cabin and had it moved his backyard is withholding the from the studio insisting that the first screening be held at the junket desperate win over the press the studio elects hire lee billy crystal recently fired publicist salvage the situation lee hopes turn lemons into lemonade convincing eddie and gwen pretend be on the road reconciliation he enlists the help of kiki julia roberts gwens sister personal assistant and whipping girl what lee does not know is that kiki is in love eddie fact that could temper her effectiveness press junkets are haven for control freaks studios fly journalists in from around the world and put them up in plush hotel food and drink always at hand generally on the evening of their arrival writers are bussed see the featured then ferreted straight back the hotel the next day writers go the studio suites and assemble in groups of five or six for roundtable interviews every minutes or so producer director writer or actor is brought into the room for few minutes of questions publicist hovering in the corner keep an eye on things the atmosphere is one of cordial oppression writers are free ask what they want but understand that if the studio dislikes question they may not be invited future junkets representatives from tv stations face even more restrictions they get roughly five minutes interview each member of the cast and crew the studio filming the exchanges the reporters are notorious for tossing softball questions as they suck up the stars but play it safe the studios stand ready erase the tapes if anything unpleasant occurs placing two spoiled actors in setting where image is everything is inspired but the screenplay undermines the conceit the junket is moved from the handsome but highly confining four seasons hotel plush resort near las vegas for most of the the movie stars run around the sprawling grounds completely safe from the eyes of the press when they do deal journalists the it is imperative that you be on your best behavior in front of the reporters premise is declawed gwen and eddie insult each other while the tv cameras roll they scream at each other in restaurant filled the media and at the screening of the movie everyone connected the goes nuts all without any repercussions lee certainly is not bothered any of the infantile outbursts in fact he makes arrangements for footage of even more inappropriate behavior be delivered the tabloids is the studio angry about his handling of the combative actors hell no they feel lee is genius for garnering so much publicity for the movie all of underscores how billy crystal and cowriter peter tolan screwed up their own premise the comedy in americas sweethearts is based on barelyincontrol people trying contain themselves in the presence of reporters except that it does not matter because any publicity is good publicity and thus the very setup for the implodes leaving smoke and dust in place of laughter so what about the cast julia roberts at her best playing the underdog is utterly charming here although could have lived without flashbacks that exist solely as an excuse show her in fat suit and not very convincing one the way catherine zetajones makes believable brat and john cusack fleshes out his obsessed character enough make him vaguely sympathetic casting himself as the publicist billy crystal allows himself do roughly the same thing he does on comic relief stay on the sidelines of the action while tossing off cornball jokes and snarky remarks in supporting roles hank azaria wears out his welcome fast broad gestures and spanish accent that speedy gonzales would have deemed too broad seth green is amusing as toadie stanley tucci is very good as ruthless studio head and christopher walken plays the eccentric director suitable flair though he has little work come think of it little work is the operative phrase for this movie as satire americas sweethearts is toothless as romance it is at best minor pleasure such good cast such waste of their efforts had it not been taken long ago better title for the would have been much ado about nothing

do the folks at disney have no common decency they have resurrected yet another cartoon and turned it into live action hodgepodge of expensive special effects embarrassing writing and kidfriendly slapstick was not mr magoo enough people obviously not inspector gadget is not what would call ideal family entertainment younger viewers will likely be taken in the abounding goofiness but their adult companions may feel wave of nausea sweeping over them as they attempt endure this appalling minute exercise in glaring stupidity the movie is poorly edited grossly manipulative and the finished product resembles somewhat of failed jigsaw puzzle all the elements are there but the manner in director david kellogg pieces them together is laughable and trite as huge fan of the animated tv show the first thing must express is my anger toward the treatment of the main villain in the cartoon dr claw was frightening raspyvoiced presence who remained total mystery the viewer we never saw his face he simply sat back in his armchair watching surveillance cameras and gently stroking his loyal cat as child always imagined what dr claw would appear as and this curiosity kept me watching for many years the release of the liveaction movie the face of this once intriguing villain has been unrightfully exposed it is rupert everett only now dr claw is simply known as claw one word he explains like madonna he sports shiny clamp instead of the steel glove and seems far less interesting than the animated version it helps that the dashing everett is enthusiastic but he overplays the role entirely too far when all is said and done this was not very wise move on the part of the screenwriters the infamous dr claw has been turned into wisecracking game show host who makes cheap attempts at being suave and cool he does still have his cat though in the title role matthew broderick looks lost the actor while usually downright charming does not know exactly where take his character fault that again can be blamed on the hapless writers broderick first plays friendly naive security guard named john brown who dreams of becoming cop and upholding the law for the good of the people he has mad crush on pretty scientist brenda joely fisher who has stumbled upon new wave of technology involving the interaction of human tissue and electronics but one fateful night her lab is destroyed and her experiment is stolen fiendish millionaire everett who wants take over the world john courageously pursues the limousine from the scene of the crime but loses the chase when his vehicle bursts into flames in full body cast he is chosen be the first human prototype for brendas work revolutionary crime fighting tool numerous fancy gadgets dispatch bad guys and so is born inspector gadget as bad as this movie is it does have certain charm in isolated scenes broderick actually fares better playing robo gadget an evil and destructive clone that claw has set loose on the city and there are about two or three amusing punch lines the funniest being when robo gadget impersonates rampaging monster shadow puppets on brick wall and japanese man flees the scene while screaming this is why left tokyo alas the hit ratio of the ongoing gags is about in favor of not even cracking slight giggle there are so many tired plot additions gadgets talking car voiced l hughley is the same type of character as zoot the suit from my favorite martian both are wisecracking nonhuman additions designed coax laughter from smaller children well it just does not work in fact zoot functioned marvelously in comparison this and do not even get me started about the villains did not mind everetts performance but his bumbling assistants will make every adult cringe disgust the characters from the cartoon have been reduced thankless supporting roles penny michelle trachtenberg and brain the dog now have little do the action and chief quimby dabney coleman has lost considerable appeal in the transition of animation live action the special effects are everywhere but not so annoying they will cause your eyes peel over the problem here lies solely in the script perhaps the next time disney attempts remake like this they will invest more in the screenplay than the fancyschmancy visuals here is one critic crossing his fingers anyway

if you have not plunked down your hardearned money yet for wild wild west the latest summer holiday offering from will smith let me say right now that your money will be better spent on starbucks frappacino or on ben jerrys sundae these treats are great relief from the summer heat in contrast this made me simmer in disappointment can accept the fact that summer movies tend put more weight into special effects and that good stories and flavorful characters usually take back seat this was true of star wars episode but at least in that the story and the characters were still in the back seat in this they are no where be found what remains are hundreds of male extras costumed as gunslingers and foppish aristocrats lots of female extras who look like cancan dancers and clunky foot tall instrument of destruction that resembles mechanical tarantula two men are asked stop this threat one is artemus gordon kevin kline an inventor who uses his intellect and array of disguises best his opponents among his creations are false breasts and the bulletproof vest the other man is jim west will smith who prefers the shootfirstthenshootsomemore method of investigating although their individual talents must be combined achieve success their interaction one another merely seemed like second rate twoman vaudevillian act for example there is scene where west being more debonair than the reserved gordon notes that the fake breasts should be filled water rather than buckwheat is what it is currently filled now touch my breast west says gordon does so and then softly coos his approval found myself groaning at this kind of silliness the script fails generate any sense of drama humor or fun for that matter did enjoy klines reserved performance but was surprised at how much latitude they gave smith could it be that will smith is just so bankable that he is not even required act it was as if the director was yelling will smith do your own thing and action heres an example in this scene will smith is about be hanged group of angry white people he must endear himself the crowd escape the director yells will smith do your own thing and action in another scene he has masquerade as belly dancer in order save his comrades will smith do your own thing and action worse still the final battle scene aboard the mechanical tarantula is horrid mess there are cogs spinning and pulleys pulling and levers going up and down everywhere you look there is actually lot of imagination at work in this there are some genuinely clever inventions and gizmos introduced but all of this imagination is wasted in that is visually cluttered and dramatically flat and that is too bad because if there was more focus on the story rather than will smith just doing his thing this might have been palatable as it turns out wild wild west is the wild wild worst and receives my vote for biggest disappointment of the year

synopsis two con artists find the perfect patsy in harry woody harrelson an inept former journalist who trips and bumps his head into post tries slap girl and gets poked in the eye has illtimed fits of coughing and fails at everything he does the story is told from harrys point of view harry always carries around shot of whiskey although he swears he does not drink one day harry is approached the con girl rhea elisabeth shue who is similar harry in that she carries around cigarette but swears she does not smoke seduced harry agrees participate in moneymaking scheme involving faking the kidnapping of odette chloe sevigny the teenage daughter of rich man turns out it is all part of needless very puzzling extremely elaborate and convoluted scheme it involves hiring special impersonators two cons in order fool harry hero who barely has the intellectual capacity of wooden post when the kidnapped odette is found dead the clues point harry as the kidnappermurderer and the police are hot on harrys trail harry suddenly realizes he has been framed while others have taken the ransom money can he get out of this mess opinion palmetto is long uninteresting all the wrong feel hero harry is an inept bungler who trips up often and consistently overestimates his own intelligence this farcical kind of character works best in an entertaining naked gun action comedy or dragnet spoof but palmetto is played like dark serious detective noir drama and watching harrys bumbling confidence amounts an irritating distraction there is lapse in concentration in the middle of the movie as the camera goes wild on breasts buttocks short skirts colored painted nails and womens legs even when the focus is supposedly on harry and his dilema you can always notice the side of elizabeth shues breast forming prominent foreground towards the end palmetto refocuses on plot for the grand finale confusing explanation involving impersonators woody harrelson handcuffed and suspended over tub of acid as he hears the criminals confession if you can imagine shemp from the three stooges playing the detective hero of an hbo lingerie suspense thriller that is how out of synch this movie feels

starring arnold schwarzenegger danny devito emma thompson frank langella the only thing that you can say about junior is that it is disappointment and big one at that junior brings together arnold schwarzenegger and danny devito director ivan reitman these are the same men that brought us the very funny twins so foolish me was hoping for something that would at least come close the level of quality of twins so much for hopes schwarzenegger and devito play two scientists doctors hesse and arbogast who are working on new drug that will reduce the possibility of miscarriage in pregnancy unfortunately due circumstances beyond their control they are denied permission test this new drug on humans and subsequently lose their funding still believing that their drug will work they decide test it anyway on hesse so dr hesse schwarzenegger artificially inseminates himself and begins taking the drug their theory is that if the drug can prevent man from miscarrying surely it will work on woman does the thought of arnold schwarzenegger pregnant sound funny or humorous you well it must have the producers of junior admittedly schwarzenegger has the comedic talent pull it off perhaps if it had been done differently it might have actually been funny but it was not schwarzenegger pregnant is goofy at best the sight of schwarzenegger running around going through the hormone imbalances that come pregnancy and the accompanying emotional swings is not funny schwarzenegger comes very close embarrassing himself these antics kept thinking myself the time arnold wasted making this turkey he could have been making an action picture better yet schwarzenegger devito and reitman all in the same place at the same time why did not they make sequel twins anything would have been better than this mess danny devito is wasted in this movie his part could have been played any joker they pulled in off the street after seeing the movie if was devito probably would have wished they had pulled someone in off the street emma thompson is wasted here as well while thompson is best known for her jane austin adaptations she is also fine comedian too bad she did not get use any of that talent here am being too hard on this do not think so schwarzenegger and devito are two of my favorite actors in today and ivan reitman is one of the more talented directors in supporting cast of emma thompson and frank langella the filmmakers really have be trying hard make bad they certainly managed here maybe it was well intentioned but unfortunately this is movie that never should have been made if you are tempted see this do yourself favor and go rent twins that truly takes advantage of arnold schwarzenegger and danny devitos comedic talents

there are scenes in the big hit that are so awful they simply defy description the movie is infected the same kind of blunderheaded idiocy and misplaced confidence that made last action hero such chore sit through presumably the big hit is an actioncomedy difficult but not impossible genre pull off movies of this sort require fine balance and careful tone and the comedy is usually meant work as catharsis for the violence lethal weapon is perfect example of an action thriller that was also very very funny unfortunately in the big hit it seems that comedy is the main motive and the violence is only intended punctuate the laughs unfortunately there are no laughs the movie resembles some of the goofy throwaway ridiculousness of early jackie chan films but it does not benefit from chans incredible stunts and goofy charismatic presence instead we are left lot of digital effects and mark wahlberg who must have considered himself invincible after his criticallyacclaimed performance in last years boogie nights however if he wants maintain decent career he had better start selecting his projects more carefully movies like this are surefire recipe for long career in the straighttovideo market wahlberg plays melvin smiley an amiable guy who also happens be professional hitman see grosse pointe blank for the same character much better developed the movie wants us think gee how clever and ironic guy who can kill without any moral implications and yet he cannot stand for anyone not like him the fact is melvin is so desperate keep people from not liking him that he puts up both an obnoxious fiancee christina applegate horrendous new york accent and an abusive girlfriend lela rochon who is only using him for his money his constant bending over backwards please people makes him complete patsy at best and thoroughly unbelievable character at worst melvin is employed exclusively crime boss named paris avery brooks as part of team of hitmen also includes cisco lou diamond phillips and crunch bokeem woodbine one day melvin agrees do some moonlighting cisco kidnapping the teenage daughter of rich japanese mogul named jiro nishi sab shimono for million dollar ransom however not only has jiro nishi lost all his money producing big movie inside joke get it but his kidnapped daughter keiko china chow also happens be paris goddaughter so when paris finds out she is been kidnapped he takes it personally and becomes determined find out who did it not knowing the cisco is actually behind the whole scheme paris puts him in charge of rooting out the kidnapper of course cisco blames the whole thing on poor innocent melvin along the way there are several obligatory gunfights explosions and car chases plus literal cliffhanger inspired jurassic park and completely unconvincing romance between melvin and keiko who looks like she is barely pushing fifteen what the movie passes off as humor resorts thoroughly unfunny jokes about overweight jewish mothers harakiri drinking problems leaking body bags and running gag about how crunch has recently discovered the pleasures of masturbation and now spends all his time doing hand exercises not mention the pimply video store clerk who is always calling melvin and screeching about how he needs return his copy of king kong lives is two weeks overdue this mess of movie was helmed chekirk wong the latest hong kong director imported john woo faceoff who also served as executive producer woo needs stop acting as conduit for other directors and start making more of his own films wong who directed such films as rocknroll cop back in hong kong is completely tone deaf when it comes comedy maybe jokes about vexatious video clerks and vomiting on other people are funny across the ocean but they are not here at least in the manner wong handles them many of the problems can be traced back the script was penned obvious freshman writer ben ramsey in addition his vague characterizations and uninspired action sequences ramseys script assaults the audience his attempts copy the vulgar poetic rhythms of tarantino or mametstyle dialogue what he comes out is just lot of annoying blather most of spews from the lips of lou diamond phillips whose favorite phrase is it is all love and robin dunne who plays ciscos stuttering blackwannabe assistant the irritation factor of phillips and dunne combined is almost off the scale can pretty much describe the as whole

well guess it is that time of the year again the one time of the year where movie craftors are exonerated from the need even try writing script that has more dialogue than explosions it is also the best time for the handful of existing bigtime mr action heroes dust off their miniscule vocabularies pull on their black vests and charge onto our screens tersely expirating what they hope will become memorable catchphrases in america they call this time summer and it happens once every year and maybe it is the exposure all that nasty sun that does it but in the process normally weak insipid lines like consider this divorce hasta la vista baby and you are the disease am the cure actually do end up being repeated more often then the phrases from my book of biblical proverbs this is not entirely bad thing of course what am talking about am talking about the summer blockbusters the action thrillers the thisobviouslycostalotsoyouknow everyonesgoingtogo explosions gas threats flying saucers and special effects in the rash of my what big guns you have but wait mine are bigger movies there are also the usual boymeetsfishandsavesenvironment movies or whale whatever and this year the odd crop of savetheworldfromaliensorenvironment threats offerings am talking about the three batmans the speeds the terminators etc this year am talking about twister independence day the arrival the rock mission impossible and of course eraser here in singapore as our local movie critics like whine we seem get the pick of the crop of my explosion is more reallooking than yours movies but nothing else mission impossible opened in our theatres almost as soon as it did in the us the same goes for eraser is unfortunate for arnold schwarzenegger because coming so soon after what time magazine recently called mission unavoidable on account of its worldwide megaadvertising blitz eraser seems like cheaper less thoughtful imitation that is saying lot because mi the movie was already cheap thoughtless imitation of its tv originator of the ss in eraser arnie is us federal marshall who relocates trial witnesses whose testimonies place their lives in danger he does this destroying all evidence of their present existence and resituating them new identities his new case is lee cullen played vanessa williams who unlike all the other scumbags he is ever relocated is an actual real life honest person because she is so good and has such nice legs arnold spends the whole movie trying protect her and only uses the opening movie sequence save robert pastorelli from his killers lee obtains evidence that the hightechnology weapons company she works for is secretly selling sophisticated blackmarket arms people foreign accents and stringy hair of course as the formula goes her revealing this information will destroy the system as we know it because heck there are people in high places who will go down this because yes this is the biggest conspiracy in the history of the world that is america since watergate in protecting lee arnold is framed the mentorturnedevil robert deguerin nicely played james caan and ends up having prove that he is not the one killing the programmes witnesses in addition making sure lee is not accidentally torpedoed death the new green guns his enemies all have it is around this time that people in the theatre me starting humming the mission impossible theme because arnies mission includes breaking into highsecurity building run disk guess should tell you more about the particular gun everyone in this movie is so antsy about it is an electromagnetic pulse gun thing fires aluminium missiles and can see through walls it has some sort of xray vision so its user can target the victims heart even from great distances despite this figure is pretty cool feature in gun though am certainly no expert however arnold whose own heart is targeted number of times never goes flying feet backwards twofoot missile through his chest like all the others who get shot this gun instead he outruns and outsmarts his trackers each time giving eery and ironic resonance that terminator line that practically made him famous will be back like everyone else in the theater left the movie feeling that the trailers had duped me because they made me want watch this movie voluntarily although there is lot of violence in this movie not mention mutilation and some bloody tussles alligators recommend this movie most overs who need some therapeutic mindless action get over the weirdness of fargo or the hangover effect of leaving las vegas reviews rating system wait for the video little creaky but still better than staying at home gotcha pretty good bring friend amazing potent stuff perfection see it twice

the rapidfire formula that worked so well in airplane the police squad television series top secret three naked gun films and two hot shots movies has finally reached desperate deadend spy hard even ezio gregios the silence of the hams is arguably funnier than this overextended spy and actionmovie spoof leslie nielsen stars as secret agent wd who returns from retirement battle his old nemesis general rancor cackling andy griffith the jokes fly in every direction and hardly hint of restraint timing or tact most the movie is comprised of recycled airplane and naked gun gags recreated movie sequences and soggy star cameos yeah maybe we do need ray charles driving an a bus bound for speed bump but did mr hulk hogan and dr joyce brothers also have appear in the same movie leslie nielsen plays it straight his usual dopey flair there is something oddly inspiring about the sight of nielsen wearing nuns habit even the resulting sister act spoof is silly as are the bits directly lifted from home alone pulp fiction true lies etc etc adolescent males might enjoy this mess tho the butt shots breast peeks penis pokes flatulence gags and related innuendo are right up beavis and buttheads alley beyond the hilarious title sequence weird al yankovich performing the theme song spy hard is barely the stock that it is printed on my recommendation duck in while you are waiting for another movie start stay long enough see the camera dart inside of weird als nostril and then leave you will not miss thing

tim burton has now completed his evolution from the brilliant director of macabre stories about outcast individuals yearning for acceptance and into studio monkey whose name is used as part of multitiered marketing materials for crap movies and here he hits rock bottom planet of the apes did not expect much from this latest interpretation of pierre boulles classic novel planet of the apes mean how could you top the force and impact of the original intelligently coscripted rod serling of twilight zone fame combined the overbearing chuck heston growling and yelling at those damn dirty apes in one of his best roles of his career sadly sat down watch burtons version of planet of the apes and within the first minutes was checking my watch and my girlfriend big fan of the original started nod off this time around the story plays out like cross between enemy mine braveheart and project marky mark wahlberg who was enjoyable in boogie nights and the corrupter plays leo davidson hot shot s air force pilot leo and his crew are in search of some mysterious magnetic storms no real explanation given in the and leo sends one of his genetically altered smart chimps into the storms collect data leo and his crew lose communication the chimp leo hops in another ship find the monkey and then he is thrown through some type of timespace wormhole crashes lands on the twentieth century fox studio backlot all mocked up look like the amazon jungle leo ends up getting captured group of talking apes and is sold slave trader named limbo paul giamatti who in turn sells leo chimpanzee named ari helena bonham carter the kind ari then helps leo and his fellow humans escape the mountains find leos ship along the way monkeys played tim roth overacting his role of vicious general named thade and michael clarke duncan who further enhances his career playing another heavy in bad action movie strive out hunt down leo and his band of human savages just like battlefield earth in the end it all culminates into another braveheart ripoff human versus ape battle scene while rick bakers makeup work is amazing the script is pathetic hodgepodge courtesy of three writers the acting is horrible and the surprise ending feels like swing from ballpeen hammer into the temple wahlberg does not have the physical or mental presence of chuck heston carry the or any of its action sequences this remake or reinterpretation as tim burton has proclaimed it is an insult the intelligence and wit of the original the ethical arguments about the equality of species fascism and military buildup have been replaced tremendous amounts of ridiculous dialogue an unimaginative narrative structure and romance between monkey and human even chuck hestons antigun tirade in the de rigeur cameo seems shallow and jokey but the main element missing from this tim burton is tim burton even though his name is plastered across every billboard in america john badham could have directed this even joel schumacher could have directed this he probably should have burtons predominant themes of rejection isolation and the search for ones place in the universe as seen in ed wood edward scissorshands and peewees big adventure are completely absent in this planet suppose that is what happen when great director gets sucked through wormhole

the premise of this movie is well pretty farfetched tom berenger plays shale mercenary who is temporarily out of work those fools at the cia have denied his existence just because he and his buddies botched job in cuba fortunately his girl friend diane venora teacher at christopher columbus high school in miami gets her knee cap broken disgruntled student creating job opening for shale as substitute teacher not telling his girl friend who might object on pedagogical grounds he creates number of fake higher degrees for himself from yale harvard princeton et al and begins his tenure as high school teacher the students junkies drug dealers gang members sleazy sluts icepick wielders you get the picture do not really take him right away so he hits one in the face can and breaks few fingers this gets their attention certain extent so he tells them the story of the vietnam war see some homeboys from the north tried muscle in on the turf of the homeboys from the south oh yeah now they can dig it the problem is just that nobody ever explained it properly before but wait there are drugs being dealt in the school itself and behind the whole scheme in cahoots the head gang the kod no not cod but knights of destruction really is none other than the upright excop principal played the forgotten ghostbuster ernie hudson so shale does what any good teacher would do he gets his buddies together they gather together bunch of bazookas and other major weapons explosives and cool stuff like that and they have big showdown against the drug dealers and kod at the high school ok so the premise is not just farfetched it is downright dumb if this were hong kong action comedy we might just accept it but it takes itself far too seriously be truly fun oh it has its moments how one can truly hate movie in huge really huge amounts of cocaine are delivered in school busses and be fair it is almost never really boring as the action is interrupted only short sequences of actual story but over all this is pretty much madefortv movie more and bigger explosions and more foul language in fact it reminded me of miami vice without the production values babes in skimpy bikinis and pastels if you can sneak into the theater without paying go for it otherwise wait for video the flying inkpot rating system wait for the tv broadcast little creaky but still better than staying at home gotcha pretty good bring friend amazing potent stuff perfection see it twice

chris tucker is one of those guys you immediately get reaction from you either find his helium voice crazy eyes and jerky mannerisms funny or annoying think fall into the former category am one of the few who thought his turn in the fifth element as prancing princelike deejay was complete inspired lunacy and not the least bit aggravating but his new vehicle money talks just does not do him service tucker is good in the movie and this is the kind of that if people see it could make him big star but he is also really the only thing good about the movie in fact if you see money talks it should shock you beyond recognition that two of toy story writers penned the sloppy script tuckers role here is that of franklin hatchett petty los angeles con artist whose carwash scams get him dogged investigative reporter james russell charlie sheen after being busted on the job for some illegal business involving counterfeit passports franklin finds himself on bus the county jail and handcuffed slick international jewel smuggler raymond villard gerard ismael but villards thugs blow up the bus in an attempt free their leader never mind that the explosion could have instead killed him and because he and franklin are joined at the wrist franklin is allowed escape as well but not before overhearing some important information regarding diamond stash that for some reason or another is being hidden in vintage roadster waiting be auctioned off at an upcoming auto expo the local media mistakenly puts the prison breakout blame on franklin is where james comes back into the picture he makes deal protect franklin if in turn franklin gives him an exclusive interview this means james must present his new friend in the stickiest of situations formal dinner party for he and fiancee grace heather locklear also attended her uberrich parents veronica cartwright and nicely game paul sorvino and of course the bad guys track franklin down and try knock him off all the while he spars and forms an unlikely bond james this as not no buddy movie claim the print ads yeah right actually for the better part of oh minutes it appears money talks has the momentum cover entertaining ground and this is mostly due the presence of spastic motormouth tucker this is tuckers first leading role and if you imagine slightly lankier africanamerican jim carrey reliance on wild rrated raunch rather than pg physical comedy you have good idea of the conviction he assaults the role but you realize all too quickly that tuckers overstated liveliness is the only thing money talks has going for it and lively actor alone does not successful movie make it is all too easy pick out everything wrong money talks the plot is recycled buddybuddy comedythriller tripe that seemed overused even when nothing lose employed it last month everything is paintbynumbers especially the los angeles coliseum finale finds not one not two but three separate enemy factions firing at franklin as they pursue him through the bleachers the villains as many as there are are dull certain story elements are too coincidental and too much of the films dramatic agenda is played too straight scene where grace confronts james after learning franklins true identity you brought killer into my parents house is extremely silly you get the picture obviously did not have pleasant experience at money talks but the people around me appeared be having riproaring good time one gentleman several rows behind me chortled such expressive conviction began fearing for his health but tucker at least for me is pretty funny guy and aces the movies best scene where franklin passes himself off as vic damones son at james and graces engagement bash and toasts the couple barry white lyrics tuckers audience and he does have one will probably like money talks those who he irritates however will have more productive day staying home and scraping the gook out from under their toenails

soldier director paul anderson is in any presence of originality is fleeting the best moments of the are in the opning scenes where kurt russels character todd is shown growing up under strict military supervision brutality through the eyes of the innocent and stripped of it every single day growing up is something that has lot of emotional potential power behind it and the opening scenes tap into it little then it goes nowhere that idea there is perhaps one rather fleeting scene afterwards that deals the potential trauma of this dehumanization and the rest of the is just some of the biggest action movie cliches have ever seen the whole idea of the inhuman soldiertype character gaining some degree of humanity defending potential female love interest and family from his evil counterpart out kill her is done and it is been done much better was able predict the plot of the _whole_ story would not be so bad if other aspect of the somewhat interesting between the action sequences it tries deal the aforementioned issues of humanity through the performance of mr russel in the and the tiny little window his soul that is his eyes since his dialog is extremely limited his performance in that way is not all that bad but certainly is not enough carry this other performances in this are really not worth much mention at all and they generally are about as weak as their characters but enough of this stuff about plot and character right is not the most important part of an action well the action even in this aspect the is disappointment in mortal kombat director paul anderson proved that truly engaging use and choreography of action in can override problems plot and produce something entertaining however he fails repeat that in this the combat scenes particularly the big one at the end is incredibly unimaginatve fighting and combat scenes are supposed bring about thrills in this type of movie point even an otherwise unimpressive like starship troopers seemed realize but instead of reaching for something truly interesting end the it goes for the old shootem up one guy vs an army type of cinema that thought died the military action films of the if the went some of the ideas it opened up the introduction more seriously it could have been rather engaging science fiction however it utterly failed go in any new directions after that making the big disappointment

the first scene of operation condor has jackie chan preparing for secret mission he attempts pop couple of pieces of chewing gum into his mouth but misses after they ricochet off his face he says not good start as it turns out this line not only gives foreshadowing the opening sequence but the rest of the movie as well in this the latest of the jackie chan movies be released in america after first runs in hong kong chan plays an international operative codenamed condor and is tasked the united nations finding stash of gold hidden at secret base the nazis during their retreat across the saharan desert during the second world war for some reason condor is given his mission at the s embassy in spain think this may have been done so that in chase scene they could honor the time old tradition of knocking over fruit cart watch for it in any chase scene set in foreign country most notably in europe the chase will take itself through marketplace and fruit cart will be overturned it is almost guarantee anyway condor is given key is supposed unlock giant vault in the gold is hidden the problem is that the key has insulators integrated into it may mean booby trap might be electronically triggered if the key is used improperly help him figure out where the gold is hidden and how use the key correctly condor is accompanied desert expert carol cheng and the granddaughter of the captain who was in charge of hiding the gold eva cobo there are not supposed be any relatives of the nazi captain living in spain but condor finds the granddaughter looking her up in the phone book or something although these two women are supposed be integral parts of the mission they prove no help at all except get in trouble and provide an excuse for chan jump into his martial arts in fact most of the scenes are so ridiculously contrived that it seems everything is just way set up fight suppose this is not so bad since chans action is really the best part of the movie and the only reason you go see one of his films anyway if you have never seen jackie chan movie do not expect great plot but do expect be entertained his moves they are so well choreographed and often so amazing that you wonder if this guy is human knowing that he does his own stunts and knowing that this is the real stuff no computermasked bungee cords here makes the action sequences all the more exciting you have got hand it guy who is probably broken every bone in his body for the sake of his art also of note in this as in any jackie chan movie is the humor as far as know none of his films take themselves too
