seriously and even the dramatic parts have certain tongueincheek quality about them what is almost masterful is the way that humor is even integrated into the fight scenes unlike martial arts such as anything jean claude van damme where the fights get you on the visceral level fight scenes in chans movies are simply entertaining you marvel at both his moves and at the way he employs them in such way make you laugh unfortunately even chans mastery cannot save this the plot and characters are so weak that they do not hold the movie together at all and the acting is terrible carol cheng has apparently won best actress honors at the hong kong movie awards in the past but since operation condor is dubbed movie it kind of takes all bets off this combined an obviously low production value made we want turn away from the screen until heard those kicks start flying

cashing in on the success of white men cannot jump and the failure of most of their solo vehicles including the cowboy way and drop zone wesley snipes and woody harrelson have reteamed hoping that they can strike up the same success sadly if this dismal cliche ridden and mindnumbingly boring action pic is anything go they have not got chance in hell of even coming close this time out the duo play foster brothers who are transit cops following several runins their tyrannical boss robert blake who is obsessed the money train train carries all the subways takingsand will let nothing stop it now there is an original plot device harrelsons character decides try and take off the cash along the way both of them fall in love the same womananother transit cop who also hates her boss this leads the typical sibling rivalry crap that you usually find in of this standard you were always the better brother etc etc etc and does not help add anything the given better script better performers in supporting roles and shorter running time the almost went for two hoursor did it just feel like it this might and mean might have turned out okay but as it is it is stocked the worst action cliches whose only purpose appears be pad the out its painfully long running time robert blake who plays the evil boss has got be the most pathetic bad guy in history he sounds like wayne newton and appears think the best way appear evil is have your eyes bulging as though they are about burst out of their sockets but this is only one of money trains problems if you look at the script as if it was an action it lacks originality and suspense but if you try look at it as if it were heist it is even worse the final robbery sequence is almost trivialised and the characters definitely as not butch and sundance the is not all bad though snipes and harrelson when they are not using the dumb cliches that the script gives them make an agreeable duo and some of the stuntwork is indeed excellent but good stuntwork cannot save bottomofthebarrel action movie if you are really undemanding action freak there is chance you will like this but if you are looking for something original or suspenseful try somewhere elsei doubt you will find it here

girl is in word mess was never able determine what spike lee was trying accomplish this there was no sense of where the was going or any kind of coherent narrative if there was point the missed it girl the way is the way theresa randles character is addressed in the phone sex workplace all the girls are known their numbers the plot such as it is theresa randle is struggling y actress and eventually takes job as phonesex operator she begins lose contact reality as her job consumes her also she must deal the advances of her exhusband isiah washington he is an ex con thief and she tries keep him away while at the same time it is clear that she still harbors feelings for him her neighbor jimmy spike lee functions as the observer mediating between the ex husband and girl he also functions as point of stability as he watches her become seduced the lurid world of phone sex the soundtrack consisting of songs prince was jarring it kept taking my attention from the not altogether bad thing will grant you as what was transpiring onscreen was not that riveting for parts of the middle of the the music stayed blissfully in the background in the opening sequence and one scene later in the however the music was particularly loud and distracting of course have never really cared for princes or tafkap if you like music prince fans might love the soundtrack but it will probably be distracting even diehard fans of the performances the only one that stood out was spike lees buddy character jimmy he was excellent as the alwaysbroke neighbor of girl he should have stuck acting in this there are several sequences that gave me the impression that he would like be oliver stone when he grows up there are scenes shot different types of are purposely grainy and reminiscent of some of the scenes in oliver stones natural born killers in that they worked propel the narrative in this they just made me more confused there are some amusing moments and few insights into the lives of the women who use their voices make the phonesex industry the multibillion dollar industry that it has become other than that though nothing much happens there are few intense moments as when one caller becomes frightening but even that is rather lackluster am not the biggest fan of spike lee though would agree that he has done some very good work in the past in girl though he seems be floundering he had an interesting idea fairly good setup and seemed wander aimlessly from there girl earns grade of

back in chuck norris used be synonym for the action films he could not of course top the success and fame of big action names like sylvester stallone or arnold schwarzenegger but sheer quantity of his films guaranteed that he was household name among shootem up and beatem up genre aficionados that quantity was mostly provided cannon group prolific production company that dominated the bmovie market in previous decade flooding it cheap formulaic and more often than not unwatchable genre products the hitman action thriller directed chucks brother aaron is one of the last among them chuck norris here plays seattle cop betrayed shot and left for dead his partner should not surprise anyone considering the fact that the partner is being played michael parks specialised for roles of usually very mean characters surviving the shooting cop is pronounced dead and hired as deep undercover agent he infiltrates the underworld circles in seattle and becomes their top hitman using his abilities start brutal war between three major crime organisations italians french canadians and iranians since it is rather absurd expect great acting ability from chuck norris at least not in this kind of movie the biggest attraction of this should have been action well the action in this falls flat it is boring repetitive and not at all exciting it is nothing more than monotonous series of scenes that contains violence too brutal even for this type of films we know very little about norris character while on the other hand gangsters are portrayed more human dimension in the end we almost feel sorry for them since they are shown totally powerless against norris and his unstoppable and bloody crusade during the somebody obviously became aware of that problem so the screenwriter introduced the subplot dealing the black boy who gets adopted norris that caused another problem any questions about nature of that relationship had be quashed another subplot this one dealing lady lawyer who sleeps the hero and gets killed after fulfilling that screenplay obligation the photography in this is dark setting is depressive and this forgettable piece of style cinema leaves viewers without any reason justify the hour and half spent in watching it

as forgetful as some people may be it is doubtful that anyone could forget their wedding especially three times but alas professor brainard somehow manages accomplish this feat twice before the momentous night that he actually creates flubber it is amazing that he is able remember any of the processes he uses make anything the whole point here is how could man be so blatantly forgetful this is not absent minded this is almost mindless and he is professor well this is the case for about the first half of the movie then things begin settle into what might truly be considered absent minded along the way becoming absent minded from absent of mind the professor stumbles onto flubber thankfully or there would be no movie or any amusement for the audience the flubber is supposed be flying rubber but it seems have life of its own this is there strictly for the kids the properties of the flubber provide some antics for the audience when flubber coated golfballs and bowling balls assail two would be thugs although amusing this is not original what so ever and brings back haunting memories of home alone the poor professor has save the university where he teaches at get his fiancee back finally stop the plotting of an evil millionaire and do all this in the funniest way possible admittedly there are funny moments but the movie is rather shallow and does not compare very well the original the absent minded professor the whole scene the basketball game was just atrocious and totally unbelievable the basketball players stereotypically unqualified for the sport somehow manage bounce fly and dribble their way back being close winning this just sounds too bad be true the least that could have been done was keep semi close the original movie give this chance as for innovations and new ideas there is but two good ones in this movie giving life the flubber is so poorly executed that it is best forgotten and prof brainards flying robot weebo giving life the flubber would have worked beautifully if it was not for scenes of the sort where you have the flubber dancing around on tables and books for no real reason other than put in bit of music and extend the length of the movie the life of the flubber had brief and rather whimsical moments where it might have been used well but it was not and in the end might have done the movie more harm than good now weebo is totally different story it is robot that prof brainard created but forgot how and gave something of life too this is really original idea well maybe not but it is an idea that is well executed and in the end makes the poor robot the most developed and real character in the movie yes folks the little yellow robot has more emotion and character than the characters the lacks the emotional punch pull the audience in at all the acting robin williams prof brainard seems be half hearted for most of the movie and in many cases quite forced most of the acting in the movie was so convincing as fool only the part of the audience that had not quite yet reached the age people when stood up at the altar do not usually give third chances or for that matter talk the fiancee afterwards but what can be expected this is childrens movie flubber as movie does little original and is nothing special in any respect the best character in the movie being something of prop doubt that many people will find it all that great it does have its amusing moments and it is good story in the end but it does not wash up the original kids should find this movie amusing and fun and they will probably enjoy the whole movie as movie it is just kids movie and not the best of ones at that

how do you judge that is so bad but intentionally so in spiceworld the highly popular singing group the spice girls accomplish their major goal mocking themselves purposely cheezy and having lot of fun doing it if that was their goal they did fantastic job so is it fair give it such low grade when it was not really meant be much better than this honestly would rather see this before many others gave higher grades so does that mean graded it inaccurately truth be known do not really think can answer this question understand spiceworld you have understand the spice girls unless you are very very young or fairly older you probably have at least heard of them they are group of five busty british babes who have had hit singles and whose debut album sold millions they are primarily adored preteen girls who hope someday the contents of their training bras might match those of ginger spices real name geri haliwell wonderbra all five of the girls have these spicy names for they are better known than their real names there is the aforementioned ginger spice as well as sporty spice melanie chisholm or mel scary spice melanie brown or mel baby spice emma bunton and posh spice victoria addams and all of them some degree or another resemble their stage names the spice girls took the world storm and spiceworld is actually good humored spoof of all that transpired during their quick rise fame it is quite nice see what good sports the girls are and not just the one dubbed sporty about poking fun at themselves they do not take themselves too seriously and that is probably the best thing about them it is also surprising how natural they seem in front of the camera acting and not just singing and dancing they are not flawless any means but for the most part they deliver their lines without feeling staged and like them or not we get the sense the five are very at home within their characters seems reasonable since they portray themselves what makes the bad is that extreme fans of the spice girls will not get enough of their music while the rest of us do not get enough of movie the real point of this is look at the spice girls for over ninety straight minutes most of the is very blas but several parts are downright boring and then they have those sporadic moments that actually make us laugh out loud if you are big fan of the group you probably will not get enough of what you want and if you are not big fan you get too much time devoted nothing more than look at us moments for the right crowd the music video sequences will be the highlights of the but for others they will serve as threeminute lulls in hecticbutoveralluneventful storyline other key actors include richard grant as clifford the spice girls manager alan cumming as the filmmaker piers cuthertonsmyth who attempts make documentary of the group george wendt as martin barnfield producer who constantly works on pitching spice girls movie and roger moore in small selfparodizing role all provide relatively good performances keeping in mind once again that this was not meant be acted seriously even meat loaf shows up as dennis the bus driver and seems have fun it while this is continuously compared the beatles hard days night think that is an unjust comparison it is supposedly the movie studio that first mad the comparison way of press kits but do not think drector bob spiers nor the spice girls intended it be so think the studios were just trying boost hype and interest in the and have instead come off rather pretentious do not think this is trying be anything more than fun satirical look at group that got so big movie seemed the next likely step and what could have been better than selfindulged yet self mocking approach probably nothing and so it is spiceworld is movie thought would be embarrassing enjoy but now instead find myself wanting defend movie did not even give good review it is bad but it succeeds in every way it intended it gives the spice girls chance play while allowing all those obsessive fans out there indulge in every brainless moment perhaps the group is nothing more than gimmick if that is the case the movies gimmick is that it is such gimmick you might be saying spice girls movie come on but when it comes down it think that is the point

we could paraphrase michelle pfieffers character in dangerous minds and say that beyond rangoon starts an that is fair enough all movies like all school children should be given the benefit of the doubt the chance succeed after all we like think that the right combination of talent and effort can do wonders mountains can be moved and good movies can be made yeah right children fail as do films as does director john boormans latest the success of beyond rangoon hinges on the believability of patricia arquette ed wood true romance as the busty westernerinperil wandering about burma without passport though we can stomach the mild plot contrivances that get her there it is tougher task overlook the actress she is lightweight as the first scene narration demonstrates she does not have nearly enough range for the emotions that her charactera mother fleeing the memories of murdered husband and sonis supposed show she may give stronger performance than say keanu reeves in walk in the clouds not much beyond rangoon is very physically appealing thanks the practiced craftsmanship of john boorman deliverance excalibur hope and glory he keeps the narrative moving no matter how muddy the storyor the heroinegets why he chose arquette remains mystery though maybe he was thinking that the dramatic weight of the story would overcome any casting deficiencies but even after an hour of halfstated political statements and murky mass killings we still do not know enough of what is happening in this country feel distressed for the characters or their situations empty exoticism the technical credits in beyond rangoon are curious mix combining lush jungle photography bad bluescreen work also odd is the obvious dubbing done make some of the foreign characters sound less foreign and is it my mistake or do the same extras keep reappearing as different soldiers doo doo doo doo twilight zone theme or opinion of movie you be the judge

i think that saying that the xfiles is one of this summers most anticipated films is safe for five years the xfiles television show has developed dedicated fan culture whose rabid devotion the series rivals that of star trek fans the premise of both the movie and the television series is two fbi agents who investigate the paranormal fox mulder david duchovny is the avid believer whose quest find the truth about extraterrestrial life borders on the paranoid and dana scully gillian anderson is the scientific skeptic trying find rational explanation mulders flights of fancy outlining the plot of the xfiles movie is virtually impossible since be general would result in confusion yet be specific would give too much away nevertheless will try the black ooze and extraterrestrial viruslike substance is threatening earth shadow government is aware of this but tries coverup the alien existence mulder and scully know the truth is out there and so try expose both the invasion and the coverup there are three central questions have heard asked about this movie will those who do not watch the series be able understand the movie yes isolated as an individual text the xfiles can stand alone they have given enough background for anyone familiar the show or not understand the movie although some of the secondary characters histories may confuse the uninitiated those characters are not essential the this is major problem they trot out token secondary characters from the series out for an appearance and then disappear just as quickly why bring superintendent skinner into the picture in the first place and then have him sat silently on an fbi internal affairs committee why bring in the lone gunmen three computer geek conspiracy theorists for an even briefer appearance these characters are recurrent on the series and their appearance in the was met whoops from the audience suggesting their popularity among fans actually most of the audience could pass for the lone gunmen still then they vanish just as quickly the television show never gives us any answers will the movie actually explain some things yes in the xfiles we get fairly complete history of the black ooze what it is and what it wants we finally get some understanding of the motivations behind the shadow government there are even some subtle tieins contemporary ufoology including the greys and the roswell crash of is the movie any good no the xfiles is dreadful movie and shows some fundamental problems writercreator chris carters talents and the relationship between cinema and television first off the screenplay series creator chris carter is sloppy and cliched after approximately fortyfive minutes the length of television episode minus the commercials the pace drops snails crawl not long after that point when carter attempts answer some questions we have had about the series we wish he had not the explanations are so trite and ridiculous that one would have preferred it had carter not explained quite so much am willing suspend my disbelief fair bit but the absurdity carter wants me swallow was just too much breaking the suspension of disbelief destroys the movie and listening other fans leave the cinema maybe the series too the explanations are not only absurd they are tired and unoriginal the extraterrestrials breed and gestate like those from the alien series and their craft looks like leftover set piece from independence day note that the alien movies id and the xfiles are all from thcentury fox studio that is beginning cannibalize itself think the xfiles is noteworthy for being the only movie based on television series be produced while the series was still running in comparing the movie and television series certain aspects of the respective media emerge the avoidance of the series answer the questions it raised annoyed and frustrated many people however rather liked that about the series television allows you impose as much or as little meaning on show as you want it is the proverbial blank screen we project our minds on meaning on television is open and ambiguous it is the nature of the medium cinema on the other hand is the opposite it projects onto us the filmmakers mind we can in some films fill the textual gaps ourselves but that almost never happens in an american meaning in cinema needs be selfcontained and determined so when the xfiles made that jump from small big screen carter needed take into consideration the differences in the medium as well he did not making explicit what the television show left implicit carter reveals the limits of his creativity and skill when they say that fans make tv show it is not far from the truth on television fan culture must impose its meanings on the text because there is nothing there how true that is when we see the explicit xfiles there is nothing there the following was printed in the st johns express st johns newfoundland canada all views are the authors but copyright is held
