contrary popular belief not every single foregin released an american market is masterpiece some of them are not even good some examples of this principle are the aboslutely dreadful un indien dans la ville presented as little indian big city and remade into that crap tim allen flick junglejungle and this what could have been clever little sex comedy turns into one mess of french flick french twist the cool american title not the real one was gazon maudit literally meaning twisted ground or something like that deals married couple kids and the intrusion of stranger who kinda screws things up for them loli and alain chabat victoria abril and alain chabat are not exactly happily married always on business trips alain chabat more than once cheats on her and she eventually finds out and one day she meets butch mechanic marijo the cowriterdirector josiane balasko and they two kinda hit it off so she decides she will get back at alain chabat doing the obvious sleeping marijo but she soons starts not only fall in love marijo but she is also realizes she is still in love alain chabat so of course she does the obvious from that she decides keep them both she will be and sleep each of them for days each then on sunday she will rest herself after all she needs it if she is gonna have more sex than sylvia kristel the goes on for over an hour and half through stupidity after stupidity moronic twist after moronic twist and soon there is the little ironic ending know it is completely different culture and am quite familiar the french and their cinema but this is just bad none of the characters are more intelligent than peter stormare in fargo movie where stupid characters were backed up make point and any action they do is pretty much just get hopeful chuckle from the audience what is shocking is this was not only one of frances biggest hits but it was nominated for lot of cesars french equivalent of oscars the writing and directing is really the big problem it josiane balasko does good acting job her role but her little sex comedy is not very humerous entertaining or even deep at all even woody allens notverygood midsummer nights sex comedy is intelligent wellwritten and possesses some depth this is shallow unfunny and pretty annoying watch the moves at the pace of snail and is damnnear painful watch thank god for the fast forward button the acting however is not bad at all the actors do the best they can the bad material and victoria abril is pretty likable despite the script and the fact that she is stupid enough try divide herself over two people when she has kids and alain chabat has some funny moments as the neurotic husband but french twist is just pretty lame it is not overly horrible and has couple very very very brief moments but it is just really crap and an example of an illadvised distribution of foreign

i can see decent sports movie struggling break free of oliver stones any given sunday it is an entertaining movie that offers both insight and excitement into the rockem sockem profession of pro football unfortunately the director seems have only one priority on his mind sprucing up the an assortment of fancy camera maneuvers in altering each frame quickflash photography and dizzying inyourface editing stone appears have completely ignored the matter of plausible character development and football politics we see glimpses of greatness but any given sunday has its agenda all tangled in technical gobbledygook it grows tiresome and monotonous yes stone has pulled brian depalma matters of importance are pushed aside right from the getgo tony damato al pacino coach of the struggling miami sharks finds his team stuck in losing rut aging quarterback cap rooney dennis quaid appears be losing his touch and damato cannot seem ignite any passion in his squad when cap is injured on the field and after patch of unlikely events occur thirdstring qb willie beaman jamie foxx is brought into the game once in the huddle and this becomes an ingame ritual beaman horks all over the field nerves you see eventually though the ancy youngster wins the game for his teammates sparking his rise fame in the football world the endorsements the music videos etc and stone straps us in for the jolting ride of behindthescenes stress and fury that the business is apparently like and believe it there is some intriguing insight posed but in the big scheme of things stone fumbles the ball the problem the directors visual approach is this he uses extravagant editing devices when more conventional approach would have been appropriate football is an exciting game watch but stone seems think dizzying the audience an assault on the senses will only add the adrenaline rush guess he is mistaken any given sunday is visual kaleidoscope that leaves the audience in frustrated stupor more frequently than it excites them many football fans including one attended are liable be disappointed the ultrastylish way stone has decided present the game in return threestar becomes unfortunately degraded due the directors tampering in welcome scenes when the visual pummeling comes break this actually shows decent character development and interaction for instance heated returns between damato and feisty young owner christina pagniacci cameron diaz are enjoyable watch there is also solid performance from jamie foxx who experiments great success in his first trek into dramatic territory the stellar supporting cast includes matthew modine aaron eckhart lauren holly annmargret and charlton heston in an extraordinarily brief appearance unfortunately too many big names are wasted typical demise for such large and experienced cast pacino makes some interesting progress his character you begin identify coach damato and the morals he is striving for but often felt he was just another play thing stone could weave in and out of his editing dynamics any given sunday is watchable but disappointing sports in plot and characters take back seat excessive filmmaking technique and very distant back seat at that

this wellconceived but ultra sugary comingofage is not for everyone and include myself as one of those who found it too sappy for my digestion joseph cross joshua beal is yearold who is saddened the recent loss of his grandfather loggia bone marrow cancer loggia is wonderful in relating the child in such wholesome manner it almost saves this from drowning in syrup the beals are like sitcom idyllic family where everyone is just so nice and affluent and properly religious without being fanatical the beals the father denis leary and his wife dana delany are both successful doctors julia stiles plays joshuas older sister needling her younger brother but also showing that she really cares about him this is family seemingly conceived in heaven but living in south philadelphia sending their children wellrun catholic school joshua the protagonist and the narrator of this yarn is handsome sweet intelligent friendly and endearing child who does well in school relates the nuns and priests and talks politely his wellmeaning parents all this mawkish interplay makes it almost too nauseating watch the plot arises when joseph has problem coping the death of his beloved grandfather who promised be him forever his answer is search for god pretty heady stuff for youngster his age do but that is just the way it is sometimes this search for god takes us nowhere because as his friend david reifsnyder says where can you look for him if he does not exist now that is smart kid but joseph looks for him in the usual places and what better place than start in the parochial school he attends one of his teachers is the kindhearted sister terry rosie odonnell who wears philly baseball hat and equates the jesus stories baseball making him the cleanup hitter and in my opinion if she was not big tv star would have vocation as parochial school teacher she is that convincing throughout the she is saved from answering any tough sic question about god the bell as it rings end the class nothing much happens in the search for god there is no parody of the catholic school though visiting cardinal is found the boy not be able talk god but this is gentle stuff no real criticism or search for god is attempted what comes next into play is some hokum is designed not upset anyone as joseph has reassuring encounter real live angel blond little boy his own age and dressed like him in the catholic school uniform who wears the innocuous smile of goodygoody the ends as this angel tells him his grandfather is all right his quest is ended as apparently angels do not have wings and are approachable and god well maybe that is for another down the road this part of the was the final straw for me could not swallow any more goo as this flopped commercially his next one the sixth sense pared down the schmaltz and came up smelling like rose though if you look through the cleverness of both scripts this director is loaded hokum all he has learned how do is hide the hokum better well god bless him if he can do that this is nice family picture and there is room for it in it is just too bad that it had nothing relevent or even truthful say about death children in parochial elementary school or for that matter about god and that family of his they are too good for words yet the meant well and its benign message had its heart in the right place for those who want see something soft without bite it this is the one

battlefield earth is the best comedy of the year it has be the other prospect is just too horrifying consider bad movie syndrome struck me again so after witnessing how much battlefield earth has been proclaimed train wreck in both critical and popular circles felt the masochistic urge see the disaster firsthand is it as bad as advertised oh yes very much so the plot is incomprehensible the acting is atrocious the special effects are mediocre the action is dull the implausibilities are legion the dialogue is cringeinducing the whole package is funny when it wants be serious and irritating when it wants be funny do not even want continue reviewing this movie would like purge the atrocity from my mind as soon as possible but you probably want read my thrashing in all its sarcastic glory so here it is the premise is basically ripoff of planet of the apes only minus the apes and philosophical discussion and plus race of evil aliens from the planet psychlo the year is the psychlos have conquered earth and the human population has been enslaved only handful of humans escaped radiationrich areas escape the aliens they live out their lives in fear one man johnny goodboy know know tyler barry pepper ventures the outworld and is captured the psychlos there he confronts the psychlo head of security big ugly klingonlooking creature called terl john travolta pressed into slavery johnny vows lead revolution and take the planet back meanwhile terl is faced his own problems he has recently learned that he is stuck living on earth he hates for the rest of his career because he pissed off his boss sleeping the big mans daughter he decides give johnny knowledge of the psychlo language and technology this is where the plot gets ridiculous so the mananimal can lead mining expedition into places the psychlos cannot go terl then plans keep the mined gold for himself of course his plan does not work so many things wrong this movie where begin how about travolta whose clout brought about this the cinematic version of scientology guru ron hubbards scifi novel early previews for battlefield earth constant shots of makeupladen travolta cackling like lex luthor had me and several audience members remarking what the hell is travolta thinking the movie did nothing stem such remarks all that ridiculous cackling he did in the trailers is in full force here terl cackles after nearly every line and so does every other psychlo of course this makes every scene hilariously overwrought no more so than when the script clumsily stumbles into political commentary the psychlos are probably supposed be some kind of satire of corporate america but ceos generally do not laugh maniacally after denying pay raises their employees you were going be promoted but now you are not fwahahahahahahahaha it is no big surprise terl loses the humans he is an idiot he breaks every kind of supervillain rule in the book he underestimates his enemies assuming he will win just because he is smarter he uses the word leverage like some sort of scientologist mantra not content go the james bond villain route of explaining his plans the hero he hooks him up machine that gives him knowledge of all the psychlos language and technology why this machine is even around in the first place is beyond me he then appears shocked that johnny points gun at him no wonder this guy never got his promotion the plot inconsistencies are too numerous mention why do the psychlos build an earth base in both they and the human slaves must wear little breathing apparatuses survive how come the psychlos are wasting their time mining for gold when the doors of fort knox are wide open how in the world did all those fighter jets survive sitting in hangar for years and how do all these previously braindead cavemen learn fly them so quickly there is whole lot more scratch ones head about in battlefield earth bring scorecard track the plot holes director roger christian shoots battlefield earth in the most distracting way possible tilting nearly every shot sideways for no discernible reason all the characters appear be standing on the walls and it is awfully difficult watch movie when you must tilt your head just watch ordinary passages of dialogue the action sequences are atrociously edited every one turned into an endless slowmotion parade that drains all potential excitement are these things really so hard construct my respect for supposed lightweight action directors has grown leaps and bounds after witnessing in battlefield earth how badly an action sequence can be shot this movie is an absolute headache it is not just the shot selection and editing the movie quite frankly makes no sense for most of battlefield earths running time just did not know what was happening it did not have anything do me finding the events stupid or illogical though they certainly are really had no idea what the hell was going on when pieced the plot together later it did not look any better heres how much of disaster this is battlefield earth is already the worst movie of the year and it is going take something really really inept top it the only thing we can take comfort in about the is that no one will be suckered into joining the church of scientology because of it in fact would think that hubbards cult would want distance themselves from this bomb as fast as possible thatll teach me give into bad movie syndrome again

long time buddies and neil diamond tribute band members wayne steve zahn happy texas and d jack black high fidelity watch in horror as third mate darren silverman jason biggs american pie disappears under the thumb of his new fiance judith amanda peet the whole nine yards controlling psychiatrist they are doubly troubled when the return of darrens one and only love sandy perkins amanda detmer final destination returns their home town but does not cause ripple in darrens devotion judith there is only one thing wayne and d can think of doing they kidnap judith and fake her death in saving silverman written hank nelken and greg depaul after seeing friend engaged the wrong woman saving silverman is directed hit comedy director dennis dugan of such films as big daddy brain donors and problem child it is dismal thirdrate farrelly brothers rip off that attempts milk humor from such inspired bits of whimsy as having darrens love interest come from family of circus freaks and be about become nun gross out gags include visualization of darren getting butt cheek implants saving silverman is almost saved stars zahn and black these two are so comically talented they can take bad material and still deliver the goods they are in animal house mode while the rest of the trawls along and comes up empty jason biggs can attribute his entire career the luck of having been cast in the smash hit american pie peet shows some physical moves but no flair for comedy here while detmer slaps brave sweet smile onto her face and soldiers through lee ermey full metal jacket is one note in an embarrassing performance as psychopathic exfootball coach neil diamond appears at the films climax as himself and miraculously enlivens the proceedings belting out some of his old standards

well if you are up for stellar effects then this is the movie for you because thats all that there really is found that after watching this movie it had many many gaps and flaws in simple logic in the plot for one thing white leading actor who has black daughter does leave some curiosity am not saying that this is not possible but it does leave one wonder know did another thing is that this movie has sections are painfully stretched out and certain scenes are repeated essentially but slight variations there was one scene that should have been short but it was horribly stretched and somewhere in the middle of it found myself thinking ok enough already get on it there are also times where you have wonder why things happen the way they do things just magically happen and there is no prelude or anything of the sort another thing that noticed towards the end was that some characters just vanished without trace but they were fairly major through most of the beginning this movie is also very predictable you can almost tell the final story somewhere in the middle and you definitely know what will happen at given moment granted this is hard omit but here its just blatant it sits there and stares at you also some of the things that happen are little too predictable and several cliques are repeated it gets boring at times tell you the truth even though there is still action going on another little point might add is that the main character is supposed be quiet chaos mathematician not some shoot them up type of hero some of the characters are not proper for their roles the acting is fine but the characters just do not seem add up if was base my review totally on the plot then would not rate this movie too highly but that is just the thing this movie is not just the plot its the whole package and this package is really well done the whole movie is really well done and looks really good and if one was overlook the flaws in the plot and characters then this is really movie the special effects are just amazing you cannot tell that the dinosaurs are created it looks like they were there live in few instances of course you know its fake but there are other times that you just would not be able say that the creature was not there during filming extinct or not another thing is the destruction scenes wow those were masterpieces well some of them were they were well choreographed and along the dinos make this one of the reasons see this movie this movie is fairly long but it is action packed so it should do well in the box office unfortunately it will take away from fifth element but alas what can we do may be too cynical for my age but this movie is only worth seeing for the effects and for it few funny moments go see it in matinee if you really must see it its not worth full price if you ask me one little side note although my opinion of this movie may not have been the best the way that this movie was marketed and how many theaters it was shown in toronto this opening weekend is nothing short of stupid there were theater movie theaters that were playing this movie around the clock think that some people really want money badly and think that this type of activity hurts the movie industry let the other movies also have chance you know any movie that much play would succeed even if it was the worst movie ever made thought would put this here deflate the movie hype about this flick its not that bad movie but its not that great either hope you people realize this

when is produced on shoestring budget couple of hardworking filmmakers and when it tells the story of genuine tragedy the easy path for reviewer who hated the movie is give it pass toss out your usual objectivity ignore how many times you checked your watch while viewing it forget how unbearable it was sit through and find some meaningless way compliment it this of course will be of no service your readers but at least you will avoid the hate mail from the movies fans thus it is heavy heart that review the movie paulina not be confused the recent movie paulie about talking parrot directed vicky funari as labor of intense love she spent the last one third of her life on the movie blends documentary footage historic and fanciful recreations relate the bitterly sad and true story of paulina cruz suarez paulina was maid in vickys household when vicky was young got learn the films background when attended screening in the two women who made it were present for those without such context the reaction the may be that it is parody of bad indie the acting is amateurish the story is maudlin and it has all the visual appeal of bad home movie grainy and overexposed the movie shot on mm and videotape has little recommend it confusingly composed the movie jumps about jarringly as it tells its story quite bloody at times the story full of horrific images seems designed shock and repulse us why else would you include scene completely nude and bloody yearold paulina another scene has teenage paulina being fondled on bus the man sitting next her in retaliation she bites off part of his finger this covers the both of them in bucket of blood the passengers on the bus then view the girl in their minds as everything from saint sinner one for example sees her as an aztec priestess holding out large heart that she had just cut from body the lugubrious tale has paulina being raped and beaten certainly she had endure miserable life but that does not guarantee that movie about her will necessarily being good felt trapped in the theater watching it only the opportunity talk the filmmakers afterwards made the movie bearable paulina runs the is in spanish english subtitles it is not rated but would be an for violence and nudity and would be acceptable for older teenagers

in this years summer movie preview issue of _entertainment_weekly_ theresa connelly described her writingdirecting debut _polish_wedding_ as child that did not quite become the child thought it would one wonders what exactly she originally had in mind for this jumbled comedydrama that appears doomed at its most basic elements the family at the center of _polish_wedding_ is the pzoniaks consists of mother jadzia lena olin father bolek gabriel byrne sole daughter hala claire danes and four sons of varying degrees of facelessness it is large family but there is not sympathetic one in the whole bunch certainly not in the primary trio jadzia takes pride in building and maintaining home and family but she is kind of hypocrite since she is carrying on an affair businessman rade serbedzija her excuse for her affair is neglect from bolek who is such passive wimp that one cannot connect his sadness and frustration also how could he possibly pay so little attention the saucy sexy jadzia hala is spoiled selfcentered high school dropout whose reckless sexual experimentation predictably leads pregnancy such an unappealing set of characters it is no surprise that _polish_wedding_s plot complications are far from involving naturally jadzia and bolek would like hala marry the young cop russell schuster adam trese who fathered the child but he refuses make such commitment hohum another complication involving the decidedly unvirginal hala being selected crown statue of the virgin mary is first played for laughs and then inexplicably as profound statement in the films climaxwhich ironically is funnier than any of the films lame attempts at humor such as painfully labored slapstick attempt where jadzia leads her sons in charge beat up russell that scene is but one in number of writing miscues connelly the jadziabolek conflict is resolved in an overly pat way not unfamiliar sitcom viewers the halarussell conflict is not resolved in as contrived manner but their ultimate resolution will leave viewers wondering if they had missed something and then there is some atrocious dialogue am sure was not supposed be as ridiculous as they sound look at all these pickles just looking at them gives me such great sadness as misguided as _polish_wedding_ is the affair is something of letdown considering the strong performances byrne danes and especially the fiery olin they obviously believed in connelly and her materiala faith that audiences will be hardpressed share

several days after having seen this movie am still trying determine what director christopher guest man whose sense of humor usually appreciate found funny in either the concept or the execution of almost heroes this is dreadful motion picture lowbrow example of period piece comedy terrible production values and an exceptionally poor laughstojokes ratio there is kind of desperation in the movies approach humor that reveals the makers uncertainty about how entertaining the material is the manic style betrays itself as lastditch attempt hide the flaws of failed script the premise does not sound especially amusing begin almost heroes tells the tale of two explorers the effeminate leslie edwards matthew perry and the uncouth bartholomew hunt chris farley who are racing lewis and clark on the trip the american northwest edwards and hunt are accompanied the kinds of weirdoes we find in road movies albeit of the earlyth century variety including frenchman named guy fontenot who claims speak hundreds of languages none of prove be useful pretty indian maiden who turns into the obligatory love interest and bizarre man who suffers series of debilitating injuries along the way the intrepid explorers encounter bears bald eagles aging native american warriors and conquistador named hildago kevin dunn who raves about his beautiful hair the explorers trek takes them through forests across the snowcapped rocky mountains and over waterfall this setup leads lot of shouting great deal of lunacy and very few laughs farley engages in his usual shtick of falling down and bellowing but aside from an momentarily diverting confrontation an eagle his heart does not seem be in it matthew perry one of the stars of tvs friends who had some modest success in the romantic comedy fools rush in is badly miscast as foil for farley and an antidote his runaway energy perry lacks the necessary edge of the proverbial straight man am not big fan of david spade and did not like tommy boy but at least he and farley worked well together as far as the supporting players go none of them makes more than fleeting impression eugene levy is wasted and kevin dunn is about as interesting here as he is in godzilla frankly it is disappointment see something this dumb and ugly come from christopher guest the brilliant comic force behind such films as this is spinal tap the big picture and waiting for guffman although guest gets the costumes right this nearlyinconsequential success is no substitute for the weak script and unfunny execution the special effects such as they are are execrable for an example of some really poor blue screen work look at the scenes where the characters are shooting the rapids they are obviously getting buckets of water thrown on them and where farley is being carried off an eagle even though farley did not have the most stellar of acting careers he does not deserve the kind of unfortunate epitaph offered almost heroes while some of the more outrageous attempts at humor may coax few guffaws from year old boys the level of comedy in almost heroes falls far below the level of sophomoric farley fans who see this as way say goodbye should be commended for their loyalty since it takes real stamina stay seated for the full running length of this cinematic torture session

when was nine started buying the coolest toy figures in my local department store masters of the universe was the pinnacle of what was after for action figures they combined science fiction and fantasy had cool names like mekanek and stinkor and each came its own little comic book read of course the animated series produced filmation remains one of the most wildly successful television products in world history given the tremendous success of the toys and the cartoon not mention its moderately successful spinoff shera princess of power it was inevitable that production company would put two and two together come the result of trillions and make liveaction masters movie let us be blunt masters of the universe is very bad movie the story is painfully dull and mindnumbingly cliched hands up who would not guess heman and skeletor take their fight into the real world and is acted out either incredibly untalented actors dolph lundgren as heman for one or good actors james tolkan meg foster given such awful characters and dialogue that they cannot help but seem terrible it is extremely clear that someone making the movie wanted it be as good as star wars we have the alien bounty hunters the desert skif technology stormtrooper lookalikes and musical score so reminiscent of john williams that deja vu is too polite term use in describing it blatant uninspired ripoff would appear more appropriate tv fans might want check out courtney cox monica in friends and robert duncan mcneill lt paris in star trek voyager very early in their careers and not doing well in them either so in the face of such mindless submediocrity is there anything make masters of the universe worth watching at all yes there is one incredible good reason his name is frank langella langella has always been one of the underrated actors of appearing in countless films over the years here he plays skeletor the villain of the piece dressed in opulent black velvet robes and bearing skull for face he is one part darth vader one part emperor and two parts grim reaper given this character langella falls right into it style and precision skeletor is believable interesting and manages tread the fine line between being homage the past and startlingly original in his own right masters of the universe remember loving it when was eleven at twenty one it is difficult see why but as said it is blessed superlative villain who makes the entire thing worth the tedium of the remainder besides this year marks the films th anniversary watch it some friends for good laugh and celebrate

in gia angelina jolie plays the titular character the first socalled supermodel and right there you have the biggest hurdle this movie had overcome in my eyes anyway just do not see how the life of model is worthy of two hour despite this kept an open mind when began watching the movie sadly though my fears were realized it is just not possible make an interesting fulllength about person who spends their days wearing different clothes the movie follows the rise and fall of gia no last name tumultuous woman who does not particularly enjoy the world of fashion she becomes famous more quickly than she can handle and finds herself hooked on drugs and on woman she cannot have the last hour of the is just one scene after another of gia getting high losing job and going into rehab this formula is repeated several times and really got tired of it in general tend dislike movies featuring heavy drug use no because it offends me or anything like that it just bores me quite frankly do not see the appeal so when director shows me pointofview shot of junkie complete tipsy camera angles and echoing voices am left somewhat unimpressed the first hour of the though was actually quite engaging we see gia as she is discovered and moves new york her boyfriend these early scenes were interesting we are shown the fashion world through newcomers eyes and it was perspective had not seen before the movie begins go downhill however once gia becomes an established model from that point lost all interest in the movie and was counting the minutes before it would end it all seemed so excessive fine so gia had drug problem does this really need dominate the could not the same effect have been had five or ten minute montage of scenes featuring gia experimenting drugs or perhaps this is meant be warning aspiring models not get into the drug world quite possibly although since have no desire become model this warning is lost on me as stated at the beginning of this review simply do not see how the life of model is worthy of featurelength motion picture what do they do that warrants movie strut their stuff for thousands of dollars an hour suppose the same could be said about making movies about baseball players for example but at least somebody like lou gehrig led an interesting life gia did not and the end of the all knew about gia for sure was that she hated modelling was bisexual and was heavily into drugs not exactly meaningful contribution society as far as am concerned

talk about beating dead horse when home alone was released in it was breath of fresh air and the final box office tally indicated how much audiences appreciated genuinelyfunny family the unexpectedly high gross guaranteed sequel so two years later we were subjected home alone might as well have been called clone alone for all of the originality it exhibited for john hughes two home alone movies were not enough he began recycling the same kinds of villains and situations in almost every movie he was involved including pathetic box office bomb called babys day out last years liveaction dalmatians and this years flubber now inexplicably hughes has exhumed not only these wornout plot elements but the home alone name as well the result worst sequel edging out speed and batman and robin home alone changing the characters hughes who wrote and coproduced the along his coconspirator director raja gosnell has attempted inject new life into series that is way past the point of cardiac arrest the new kid alex pruitt is played alex linz one fine day and the only thing he has going for him is terminal cuteness he is not half as interesting as macaulay culkin once was the villains pale copies of joe pesci and daniel stern are even less engaging than the pair of idiots in flubber in home alone there are four of them olek krupa david thornton lenny von dohlen and rya kihlstedt but all that means is an opportunity for twice as many pratfalls this time the kid is not left home alone because his parents have gone on trip instead he has developed bad case of chicken pox so he cannot go school his dad kevin kilner is away on business and his mom haviland morris has run errands so for the most part he is all himself during the day through series of coincidences too irritating relate top secret s air force integrated circuit comes into his possession it is wanted gang of four international crooks who intend break into alexs home retrieve it the eight year old who is wise beyond his years booby traps the house all sorts of rube goldbergtype devices designed humiliate and incapacitate the villains the movies climax takes place during raging snowstorm only none of the falling flakes looks remotely believable previously the most counterfeitlooking snow effects can remember were in star trek iii these are far worse in fact the production values are so shoddy that there are some scenes in the midst of this nearblizzard when shining sun can be seen if it is wonderful life could generate real looking snow back in the why cannot home alone has significantly larger budget and technology at its disposal there has been an ongoing debate regarding the appropriateness of liveaction cartoon violence for young children home alone will add fuel the fire it is one thing see wyle coyote flattened ton acme weight but quite another watch running lawn mower fall on lenny von dohlen adults and even older children will recognize that this is obviously fake and intended be humorous but what about five and sixyear olds the level of violence in home alone is extreme many of alexs schemes are nasty enough kill but because this is family no one dies despite being electrocuted falling thirty feet and getting smacked on the head barbell not only is home alone unnecessary but it is offensive it is an exercise in tediousness and there is not genuine laugh be found from the beginning the end unless some strange quirk of fate you have missed every movie associated john hughes and thus have not seen this stuff before cannot imagine anyone reasonable attention span being more than momentarily distracted this pointless adventure maybe that is why the only ones laughing at the screening attended were still in their thumbsucking years

conventional wisdom among collectibles retailers is that childrens items begin dramatically escalate in price about twentyfive or thirty years after the item was made that is when the kids of that time have jobs disposable income and desire revisit the awe and wonderment of childhood that has disappeared from their lives check out the prices of toys from the late sixties and you will find that yogi bear lunch boxes are demanding big bucks there is heavy nostalgia nowadays for the late sixties and early seventies and nowhere is it more apparent than on the big screen boomers are now mostly in their forties and fifties and have lived in the workaday world for long time they would like recapture some of that fun they remember from days of yore seems more than eager churn out product help them directors are zealous put their stamp on icons from that time and for the most part they are messing it up mission impossible lost in space godzilla zorro none of these successfully capture the originals none of these are even good films you can now add the avengers the list the british television series began in super secret agent john steed thenpatrick macnee and his third partner emma peel thendiana rigg are the pair that the american audience fell for surrealistic and witty the series fit the mood of the times the leatherclad rigg probably did not hurt the ratings either after all it is not coincidence that you cannot pronounce her characters name without appeal now we are in the nineties steed nowralph fiennes and peel nowuma thurman are battling evil genius sir august de wynter sean connery who is screwing englands weather that is about as much of plot as we have there is some footage about lot of other things that either do not make sense or make even less sense we get betrayal for some unknown reason evil clones appear and vanish and have no connection the remarkably ineffective giant flying robot wasps machine guns in their belly come from nowhere for no good reason there is high tech hot air balloon but have no idea why anyones in it the spy agency is run man called mother who is in wheelchair and woman named father who is blind at least in some scenes there is probably reason for all of this but we will never know it macnee makes an appearance of sorts he is the voice for an invisible man whose character goes nowhere in scene that does nothing group of villains sits around table all clad in huge pastelcolored teddy bear outfits at first it is humorous watch the teddies waddle around but then it becomes goofy the movie is medley of clutter confusion and wrong decisions around every corner it feels like major portions of the are missing the storyline jumps rather than flows reportedly the was recut several times this is one of those times where the whole is less than the sum of the parts especially since some of the parts appear be missing there is one good point where peel is running from one room another in house designed escher other than that the effects are secondrate the weather threat is old hat as are the scenes of huge tornadoes thurman almost makes an adequate emma peel but it does not work she looks good dresses in all the right fetish outfits but there is no spark fiennes fares even less well macnees steed was witty man of the world sense of humor fiennes agent comes across as dour kid in grownup clothes who has never been out of his home town even connery one of the greatest living actors does not have much of presence outside of few fiery scenes the action scenes are difficult follow director jeremiah chechik responsible for the atrocious remake of diabolique somehow manages put the camera exactly where it should not be things happen people move around but even if the utmost effort you were able care about any of it the scenes are bewildering the primary allure of the original was the interaction between the two leads witty banter and an underplayed sexual tension were winning combination admittedly there are few humorous sexual puns in the but there is no chemistry and the repartee is anything but clever one of emma peels first lines of dialog is rules are made be broken it does not get any better advance word alone should have been enough scare off anyone the release date was changed several times connery refuses promote the there was no screening for critics may have been good choice for warner brothers at least this way they get something of an audience for the first weekend before the news gets out admittedly have not seen an episode of the television series for couple of decades my guess is that it would be severely dated now no matter how antiquated it might be there is no doubt that it holds up better than this is at first viewing there is no reason waste any part of the last few days of summer inside watching this movie no reason at all

the following review encompasses two versions of dune dune the theatrical version runtime minutes capsule review cut down just over two hours nervous studio executives the theatrical version of dune is spectacular mess and may be incomprehensible those unfamiliar the book the films visual splendour mystical beauty and impressive action scenes only partly compensate for gaping holes in the narrative dune the extended version runtime minutes capsule review bit of throwtogether assembled mca tv special projects for cable television it was disowned director david lynch but it is considerably closer his original vision virtue of its improved characterisation and clearer storyline quality dubs of this version from the outofprint japanese laserdisc release are available from various dealers on the world wide web the review released in and made on then mammoth budget of million the of frank herberts cult novel dune was eagerly awaited scifi fans director david lynch blue velvet eraserhead twin peaks was working on his biggest production date mammoth undertaking filmed under trying conditions on location in mexico the screenplay was lynchs own chosen after the script submitted original author herbert was rejected dune is set in universe ruled powerful families overseen successive line of emperors the key cosmic power is the planet arrakis dune windswept desert planet that is home giant sandworms and the precious spice melange the spice is the most valuable commodity in the universe it extends the life and expands the consciousness of those who consume it most importantly it allows the navigators of the spacing guild once human but now hideously mutated fold space and navigate their spacecraft across mammoth distances instantaneously enabling interstellar commerce and trade flourish lynchs necessity excises parts of the book while retaining the storys two main strands one is the longstanding rivalry between two families houses atreides and house harkonnen and their battle for lucrative mining rights on arrakis the second strand is the emergence of young paul atreides as the reluctant messiah longawaited the natives of arrakis the fremen the deeply religious fremen want control over their homeworld and young paul may be the fulfilment of their prophecy that man would come from the outer worlds and lead them freedom unfortunately this epic story unfolds in confusing and haphazard manner in the theatrical cut of the runs minutes shorter than what lynch originally intended the thinking among universals ohsowise money men was that films over two hours in duration were not popular audiences at the time and would not do well at the box office lynchs initial cut running at closer three or more hours the studio demanded that further cuts be made what great idea why not trim down an already complex so as make it almost incomprehensible the most glaring consequence of this oneeyed stupidity is hopelessly jumpy narrative leaving us badly underdeveloped characters thus their personalities are vague their motivations unclear and in the case of pauls father duke leto their demise rather meaningless the end result is distinct chill we cannot warm most of the cast and we do not care much for them and it hardly helps that the voiceover narration is sparse and that the duneesque language and terminology sounds like so much gobbledegook those unfamiliar the book dune is also very serous the constant selftalk various characters makes it so serious and selfabsorbed at times that you may find it hard not wince embarrassment the overall impression is world full of people so intense that no one is allowed joke lest the universe come crashing down around them humour or at least gentle kind of humour as distinct from the harkonnens mad sadistic kind is hard find you may balk at the comparison but as writer lynch could well have done some lessons from george lucus star wars trilogy the theatrical version is still some way from being complete disaster however it still possesses enough of lynchs stylistic quirks and enough visual invention sustain the interest of viewers taste for imaginative scifi special effects whiz carlo rambaldis giant sandworms are an awesome sight both the production design anthony masters and costume design bob ringwood are striking and original and the magnificent score toto and brian eno is one of the most underrated soundtracks of the last twenty years these elements in place and the benefit of freddie francis lush cinematography the is at least feast for the senses see it in the widescreen format if you can and despite all the cuts several cast members still make strong impression most notably kenneth mcmillan as the supremely nasty baron vladimir harkonnen sian phillips also registers strongly as the reverend mother gaius helen mohiam leader of the bene gesserit religious order who is secret aim is manipulate pauls destiny for its own shadowy ends as paul atreides the young kyle maclachlan starts off somewhat shakily but as his character grows in strength so does his performance and he emerges as credible leader of the fremen crusade the conclusion any assessment of this must take into account that frank herberts original novel is complex piece of work and presents tough challenge for any filmmaker david lynch took brave stab at it and partly due forces beyond his control ended up an officially released version that fails in several key respects dune certainly confused and frustrated lot of people on its release many chose stay away altogether as the films disastrous box office showing attests the extended version however is rather different beast in lynch stated his intention release his own special edition directors cut of the on home video clear indication of his dissatisfaction the version that ended up in the theatres but alas he failed do so choosing move on other projects in way then it is partly lynchs own fault that what appeared instead was an unauthorised extended version put together in mca tv special projects for airing on cable networks in the usa stung into action lynch successfully petitioned the directors guild take his name off the credits and replace it allen smithee the standard pseudonym for directors who wish disown their own work he also had the screenwriting credit changed the anonymous judas booth certainly looking at the results of mcas handiwork there is at least half dozen instances that for sheer technical sloppiness are good enough reasons for the director object but these gripes must be considered in light of the improvements that the extended cut of dune offers in several crucial areas most of the changes involve the restoration or extension of cut scenes and the addition of extra narration both of fill many holes in the original versions storyline pauls relationship his father and associates is more intimate moments of humour and warmth lacking previously the political skulduggery involving the emperor the spacing guild the bene gesserits and the two warring houses is far better explained pauls initiation into the fremen way of life on arrakis is also fleshed out considerably and as further background new prologue has been added featuring narration and painted stills give us brief history of the dune universe as piece of storytelling then mca tvs version of dune is clearly superior as piece of editing however it is at times surprisingly inept the use of painted stills in the new prologue works well enough but their occasional appearance once the action begins is inappropriate there is some sloppy cutting too and in few instances shots even appear out of order and the use of repeated footage fabricate certain scenes eg ships coming and going soldiers coming and going is at times clearly outofcontext this is the kind of thing lynch objected and rightly so it should also be noted that several questionable scenes and shots from the theatrical version were deleted satisfy the censorship demands of s television but the most notable omission is gratuitous piece of nonsense from lynch that was not even in herberts book the scene features baron harkonnen killing beautiful young man in front of his slobbering henchmen pulling out his heart plug its surreal and disturbing episode that is very lynchesque but adds nothing what we already know the baron is nasty piece of work despite its own peculiar flaws then the extended version of dune is generally superior all up it contains minutes of restored footage and approximately another minutes of either altered fabricated or newly created sequences unless the idiosyncratic lynch has sudden change of heart the alan smithee version remains the closest we will get what the movie should have been on repeated viewings one suspects it is closer than what lynch would be prepared admit still as one of this centurys great sciencefiction novels some fans and perhaps the late herbert himself would argue that dune deserved better fate in its transfer the screen rumours circulating of new six hour miniseries planned production company new amsterdam entertainment in it is unlikely that we have heard the last of the dune saga

in many european intellectuals especially those on the left political hemisphere became obsessed the rise of fascism was not so hard expect because the social turmoil of and economic decline of seemed be the breeding ground for many dangerous ideologies in such times when political involvement could be associated noble passion many filmmakers tried warn the present generations of dangers that lurk ahead giving the look of prewar europe and circumstances that led phenomena like fascist italy and nazi germany of course there were authors who jumped on the bandwagon for other less noble reasons for them moral depravity of fascism could be explained the audience explicitly showing sexual depravity of those era naturally made some of those films very popular among teen audience one of such filmmakers was italian director tinto brass who later made career shooting expensive stylish soft porn salon kitty his is very losely based on the novel peter nordern book that deals bizarre yet true story that took place in the first years of ww in walter schellenberg one of the heads of nazi intelligence service has set up the elite exclusive brothel in berlin clientele comprised of top nazi officials and foreign diplomats none of the customers knew that the girls were all nazi agents and that all the rooms happened be bugged the most bizarre thing is the fact that not even kitty nominal madame of the brothel did not know the real purpose of that enterprise screenplay tinto brass of course simplifies the story and changes few names schellenberg is now wallenberg helmut berger ambitious nazi official who wants use the brothel in order blackmail his way the top kitty kellerman ingrid thulin apart from being madam has second job as cabaret singer caught in the net of depravity is sweet innocent girl margerithe theresa ann savoy thrown into brothel there she falls in love customer hans reiter bekim fehmiu disenchanted pilot of luftwaffe when margerithe discovers that her lover had been executed for defeatist speeches he made in the brothel she finds out that the place is bugged she informs the madam of the real situation and both women decide confront wallenberg those who tend bash benigni for exploiting holocaust as the topic of comedy would probably go bananas watching this that uses the darkest pages of european history for cheap sexploitation but although salon kitty does not happen be anything more than rather more stylish and expensive soft porn although not very successful some of supposedly erotic scenes are quite unappealing it does try have more multidimensional characters and even something resembling dramatic conflict this time between powerhungry and scruples wallenberg and hedonistic womanhood symbolised kitty unfortunately brass seems overuse other cinematical references probably thinking that he could repeat the successful interaction of berger and thulin in luchino viscontis the damned but the most noticeable and irritating is ingrid thulins unsuccessful attempt imitate lisa minellis musical numbers from cabaret all in all salon kitty is failure although some very interesting moments

dr dolittle th century fox running time hour minutes starring eddie murphy directed betty thomas riding high on the success of the nutty professor murphy returns in this abysmal comedy he plays doctor john dolittle who as child had the ability understand animals however after being exorcised he loses this ability and we fast forward see dolittle in crummy job surrounding crummy people most notably dr mark weller played oliver platt however bonk on the head his ability understand animals returns and comedy is ready and waiting happen except comedy never does happen doctor dolittle even the excellent premise rarely manages raise laugh poor old murphy looks bored stiff throughout the whole movie and his performance suffers the manic murphy we saw in the is gone his more mature and more boring twin appears be getting all the work in the the voices of the animals include albert brooks chris rock the new eddie murphy and norm mcdonald as lucky the dog are marginally better and at least they put enthusiasm in the movie sadly most of their lines are pretty dumb and they are not funny dumb like dumb dumber but just boring dumb the even succumbs fart jokes halfway through in desperate attempt raise some laughs there are few good jokes in the script but they are few and far between if had choose favourite performance it would probably be albert brooks tiger who has certain charm about him sadly he is barely in the movie and rocks really annoying hamster is given far too much screen time joke wise we are thankfully spared the mocking and insulting type of jokes that featured heavily in the nutty professor the director betty thomas has well done better films she bought us private parts and the brady bunch movie were sadly much better than this the scenes lack any charm she just gets the job done the animals themselves are reasonable realistic although most of them are obviously puppets there is an impressive looking tiger however and the lip sync is pretty good you would have no problem guessing that most of the close ups are puppets however their jilted movement was hoping jim hensons workshop who created the furry friends would have done better job doctor dolittle in the end is disappointment for everyone involved murphy has done much better movies e trading places the director has seen better days and even the creatures are not that good the target audience aged between who are undemanding will probably like it however thanks it is dumbed down humour everyone else however should give doctor dolittle miss

the generals daughter is heartless absurd movie so hopelessly dedicated its inane plot that it forgets entirely about its own characters director simon west treats issues like rape and sexual fetish hamhanded obscenity creating that banks almost entirely on exploitation and offensive pseudodepth what is worse is that the movie is haphazardly glued together two characters who are neither interesting nor sympathetic the ridiculous story requires them do unbelievable things in the interest of reaching dark conclusion in sudden rain storm john travolta finds himself in the middle of the mess playing warrant officer paul brenner brenner is assigned find the murderer and rape of captain elizabeth campbell leslie stefanson daughter of general joe campbell james cromwell brenner is teamed up exspouse sarah sunderland madeline stowe and they check out all the suspects on the base including elizabeths mentor colonel moore james woods soon it becomes apparent that elizabeth was into kinky sexual stuff but the question comes down why and of course who eberts law of the economy of characters can be applied here one interesting thing noted is that not only are all the characters suspects at some point including the two protagonists but almost all of them end up directly intertwined the story perhaps should have issued spoiler alert before mentioning that but it is painfully obvious from the beginning that everyone in the is hiding something on story level the generals daughter is ineptly constructed the adapted christopher bertolini and william goldman from nelson demilles novel was apparently based on true story plods along its conclusion filling in the blanks stale unrealistic dialogue and shocking plot developments having not read the novel it is difficult determine if these problems are the fault of the adapters or the original author but suppose they all are guilty some degree scene after scene stumbles pointless insincerity minutes after finding the dead young woman brenner and sunderland engage in sarcastic dialogue includes endless strings of forced lines sunderland actually asks brenner why was she killed would have answered if knew then the movie would already be over only after we have spent twenty minutes or so these characters do we learn that they have sordid history together this angle though apparently present develop their characters is never explored not that it really matters since the characters consistently do ludicrous things for no other reason than drive the plot in one scene sunderland is attacked man in mask she sees one of his rings and she and brenner find the man later that day based on the ring instead of questioning him like as they would real suspect they take him brenners houseboat beat him up and pour hot coffee in his lap this scene really pushed me over the edge not because it is gratuitous and meanspirited but because it illustrates the films complete disregard for the characters and the audience it was impossible for me feel anything for these people beyond this scene mostly because nothing they do comes as surprise realized that these constructs on screen are not actually characters but devices present only serve the story this would have been bad enough without the wests need hose his movie down in tasteless images of rape and sexual misconduct compelling films about sexual crimes do not spend lot of time on rape flashbacks and they certainly do not show as much skin and sweat as typical pornographic picture these scenes are not the least bit powerful on the contrary they are intended simply provide the audience the necessary resentment for the villain whomever that may turn out be in addition the movie treats sexual fetishes and sadomasochism in particular as if it is perversion of everything we know be pure this standpoint is certainly allowed but only in accompaniment welldeveloped themes back it up as it is the forgets that lot of people have sexual fetishes and that putting on pair of handcuffs does not make person insane perhaps the only positive elements in the generals daughter are couple of the performances james woods has few terrific scenes and plays his role sharp witty subtlety also liked james cromwell mostly because he comes across as slightly sympathetic despite the obvious intent of west make him villainous nonetheless these performances are undermined entirely the dreary obligatory atmosphere and the senseless neglect of characterization the generals daughter is the worst kind of it pretends have soul be of strict moral code when in fact it has nothing more than group of cardboard cutouts forcefeeding the audience toxic landfill of plot contrivances and onesided moral judgments

disneys air bud tells boyandhisdog story twist the pooch is quite an accomplished basketball player granted for family comedy it is not very funny or successful idea begin but it does not seem matter air bud is surprisingly solemn save for occasional moments of forced slapstick the movie wags its tale straight face not very enjoyable approach if air bud had realized its own absurdity then it possibly could have been better here we are actually asked cheer moment when the dog marches out save the big game clad in two pairs of sneakers and even jersey its number yeah whatever the movie opens as golden retriever buddy as himself escapes from his current owner abusive clownforhire norm snively michael jeter he ends up in fernwell washington where mopey newkidontheblock josh kevin zegers is trying cope the move and the recent death of his father buddy kevin kevin buddy once the dog proves his oncourt prowess kevins selfesteem rockets they both win places in the schools basketball team the animal as their mascot but before they can make it the finals snively surfaces reclaim buddy everything plays out just as one would think heavy on predictability light on an actual story the movie follows calculated chain of events kevins gloom fades snively gets his comeuppance and buddy contracts rabies and must be executed old yellerstyle okay that last ones lie but at least it would have been quicker sendoff than air bud courtroom climax no joke there is even fauxcute musical montage where reluctant buddy gets cleanedup splish splash paint cans are spilled and newspapers are buried all in the name of formula the end credits note that no special visual effects were used in the basketball sequences of this motion picture that very well may be true and although see dog sink shots is quite sight movie cannot exist on feat alone but air bud does not seem be interested in anything else friend of mine insists he saw buddy while back on segment of david lettermans stupid pet tricks cannot think of more appropriate connection this movie is stupid pet trick
