bad movies described as swift descent into sinful pleasure decay and debauchery are hard watch bad movies that resemble bad films are even harder watch shadow hours falls into the latter category mishmashed train wreck of bmovie actors including michael dorn aka star treks worf an uninteresting plot vain attempts at capitalizing on the underground scenes of seedy los angeles and really really bad directing and horrendous music videoesque ballistic editing that was taught me in school right before decided drop out the revolves around the life of michael holloway balthazar getty who is trying restart his life his onedimensional wife chloe rebecca gayheart after nasty bout of drug and alcohol addictions michael takes job of working the graveyard shift at the local gas station and is bombarded the ugliness and weirdness of the nightlife of a one night he meets strange gent named stuart mr buckaroo banzai peter weller he drives porsche smokes french cigarettes and drones on about life eventually coaxing mike into exploring the underbelly of a together tour of punk bars sm clubs and bareknuckle fights the then throws in murder mystery cop played peter greene acting like he wants get the chance at reprisal of his role in the mask the then simply dissolves into cheap ripoff of dantes inferno mixed an old stephen cannell television pilot the pace of the is jarring and utterly without focus other horrors include the endless montages of people pumping gas and the charlie sheen johnny depp richard griecoesque acting of balthazar getty peter weller clearly knows his career is completely gone and does not give two shits about it and after the cheap exploitation of bondage clubs dance clubs and brothels damn is not anyone safe any more from the ugly eye of way back in great but crazy director named abel ferrara made his worse and called it fear city shadow hours reminds me of an almost perfect sequel directorwriter isaac eaton producers peter alevey andrea mia shon greenblatt balthazar getty starring balthazar getty peter weller rebecca gayheart peter greene frederic forrest brad douriff michael dorn

bruce willis needs stay away from straightforward action pictures mercury rising adds growing list including such stinkers as the jackal last man standing striking distance and the last boy scout of stale actioners he has headlined and though mercury rising tries spice things up throwing an autistic kid in the mix it is every bit as stale art jeffries bruce willis is your typical tormented fbi agent you know the type haunted his job yet so good at what he does that even physically assaulting another agent merely gets him slap on the wrist enter simon miko hughes an autistic boy who like rain man and all other autistic people is savant he can merely gaze at superencrypted message and while little computer beeps go off in his head he can understand what it says naturally this talent has brought him the attention of the federal government lt col nicholas kudrow alec baldwin an nsa official bubbling over evil has spent countless time and money implementing the newest unbreakable code mercury however when two of his underlings robert stanton and bodhi pine elfman publish mercuryencrypted message in puzzle magazine as final test of its effectiveness simon cracks the code naturally this infuriates kudrow who sends terminatorlike hitman l ginter eliminate the security hazard and that is where art jeffries comes in for some reason that is never explained in the the fbi is called in help and through series of intricate machinations art becomes the sole protector of the young autistic boy in few unrealistic sequences he enlists the aid of stranger stacey kim dickens help out but she is given very little do overall the central concept behind mercury rising is ludicrous why bother trying kill the kid mean who would know it is not like the kid or anyone else for that matter knew he was cracking government supercypher and even if he is eliminated what does that help he is already proven that mercury can be broken there is always the chance that someone else would crack it but guess without kid in jeopardy there is not much of movie here for all its faults the actually starts relatively well once you pass the painfully familiar teaser the flirts developing real characters and semblance of plot then mr terminator the hitman appears and everything begins going downhill quickly miko hughes does decent job for his age at creating touching performance however do not go this looking for any new insights into autism not that many people will instead he merely becomes the latest unique partner in routine buddycop movie think cop and half twist willis and baldwin are just overplaying type rather than creating nuanced character baldwin simply oozes sliminess and for willis part he simply recycles the stock role of the loner copfbi agent he has honed in the die hard series as almost an afterthought about halfway through the carelessly gives him character trait an addiction and then drops it in the next scene but the biggest problem mercury rising is the screenplay this was not well thought out at all the goes extraordinary lengths pad in as many convenient coincidences as possible the carbon paper scene alone is unworthy of the most gullible audience member at first the bad scenes just trickle in but the gruesomely bad finale they are veritable flood the films few decent moments come in the form of bad jokes mainly from the geeks who developed the supercode but they are not nearly enough make the worthwhile mercury rising is thriller that you are more likely groan at than cheer

capsule godawful comedy that is amazingly shabby and cutrate and rather bereft of laughs was having bad week in my life when saw austin powers international man of mystery desperately needed something cheer me up or at least distract me so could get clear head get some perspective even dumb movies can do that for me sometimes tried hard not let my dejection affect my judgment but am certain now that austin powers would have also sucked rocks through bamboo shoots on the day won the lottery michael myers has taken character that would barely have supported fiveminute sketch on saturday night live and stretched it the length of feature padding it out toilet jokes and the sort of propsstrategicallypositionedbetweennakedactorsandcamera gags that benny hill got tired of fifteen years ago the plot what little there is of it back in the swinging mod hep sixties do not think am doing disservice the movies attempted early look and feel describing it that way sexy british secret agent austin powers tangled his nemesis dr evil evil launched himself into orbit and cryogenically forze himself return decades later when powers was out of the picture powers also had himself frozen and he wakes up find the nineties very hard time deal the basic gag that of powers total inability cope the nineties is not so much exhausted during the course of the movie as never even really dealt the bulk of the movie is taken up dumb jokes of several basic rubrics james bond gags of this movie has no end right down the silly character names inept slapstick toilet humor and strategically placed props the movies amazingly bereft of ideas come think of it couple of bright exceptions one is dr evils son there is sidesplitting scene where father and son go an encounter group chaired carrie fisher and the other is throwaway gag where austin mimics various forms of transportation from behind couch it is visual gag hard describe and hard recommend seeing the movie for lot of sixties kitsch has been resurrected and thrown on the screen for this movie but it is desperate rather than clever instead of skewering the whole thing it is rather bloodless and unfunny tribute myers himself is also desperate he is given an idea play not character plus the attempts make the character work giving him relationship another sexy albeit nineties agent are waste of time wanted have the movie end him trying yet again get it on her only have her deck him one couple of exceptions the movie misses all of its own best moments the movie even looks cheesy and not in good way kept wondering if it had been transferred down from hidef video or something so grainy was the stock in good many scenes the whole thing has the air of being done on the cheap my definition of comedy is simply did it make me laugh the few times that laughed in austin powers were completely offset the time spent cringing and wanting out the most damning thing could say about the movie is that wayne and garth would most likely have shoved it into mike tysons shorts and sent it sailing

battlefield earth is the worst of and guarantee you that nothing else this year will even come close in fact will be surprised if see anything this bad in the next ten years based on the novel scientology guru ron hubbard battlefield earth begins and we immediately find out two pieces of key information it is the year and an alien race called the psychlos sounds like tag team of mexican wrestlers conquered our planet in nine minutes ok we are all of seconds in and have zillion questions racing through my mind when were we conquered the audience is led believe that this happened about years earlier and if that is the case then we are going get into whole bunch of problems later trust me keep reading also why do not we get see earth get conquered how the hell do you make popcorn scifi flick and not deliver the goods on the one event that sets up the humans now live as cavemen or slave labor and for the films first act we focus on one particular cavemen group outside of denver colorado they grunt and groan and babble about monsters so when the psychlos conquered earth were the only humans not captured herd of newborn babies that crawled their way safety in the hills none of these characters have any knowledge of the planet being conquered whenever that was this is definitely not the way start an actionscifi one of the humans wanders out into the wilderness and stumbles across what he thinks is monster and he begins fight it the monster turns out be dinosaur from an old miniature golf course he turns around and sees all sorts of other characters from the golf course some shrubs growing over them so in years this stupid little golf course has stood the test of time only few weeds growing over it anyway some of the humans are captured the psychlos led terl john travolta smarmy and opportunistic alien planning on stealing recently discovered gold deposit the cavemen led barry pepper are forced do their bidding or whatever but eventually they gain the upper hand and reclaim the planet or something so these cavemen are able do what earth failed do years earlier and we are supposed believe that earth was conquered in nine minutes group of buffoonish aliens who cannot even handle few cavemen one of the ways the humans reclaim the planet is taking control of abandoned air force jets and using them fight the psychlos so jets left unattended for years are still able fly please if leave my car unattended for two weeks have replace every fluid and hose under the hood why did the psychlos leave jets around anyway should not they have destroyed military installations during their massive nine minute campaign against us the psychlos refer humans as man animals but yet dogs are still dogs why are not they dog animals the psychlos are after mining earths precious resources but for years are unaware of fort knox why do even care at this point am fan of travoltas and am glad see he is back on the alist in despite the fact that he occasionally puts out crowd pleasing dreck like michael and phenomenon but how did he possibly think this was good movie and how did he think he was giving good performance here he is more than capable of making menacing villain see broken arrow and faceoff but whenever his character came on screen could not hold back my laughter now despite the different facial features members of this alien race seem have travolta just looks like travolta all of the other aliens have weird foreheads or other pointy bones on their face but travolta just has goatee also travoltas acts sort of phony upperclass snooty accent and constantly whines about bureaucratic nonsense back on his home world ooooo scary villain as producer he should know better and as an actor he should definitely know better you can make dumb but good scifi love independence day for example but there is absolutely nothing entertaining about battlefield earth did everything possibly could stay awake during the screening cleaned my glasses walked around the theater made grocery list chose my lottery numbers for the week replayed super bowl xxv in my head commercials and still was compelled scrutinize the insides of my eyelids the time we actually reach the year people should still be avoiding this folks save your cash do not go see it do not rent it and do not buy it you would be more entertained taking the money you would use for this movie and just throwing it into the wind watching it sail away hell send it us here at the jacksonville journal we will entertain you plenty that kind of money unless of course you are just captivated countless slow motion shots of barry pepper running is just about all you will come away from this movie that and headache editors note for some reason though the day after my screening converted scientology am not sure why something just made me feel compelled make the choice

jet li busted onto the american action movie scene when he stole the show in lethal weapon his wicked looks his nasty moves and his undeniable charisma it only took another two years for megaproducer joel silver set him up in an allamerican movie primed take over some of the empty actionhero seats left alleged cokehead van damme and that pudgy guy named steven seagal would this take li past his rival asian action counterparts namely chow yunfat and jackie chan let us find out plot rival chinese and black gangster organizations fall further out of favor from one another when members of their respective families start turning up dead that is when badass jet li blasts into the picture find out who the men were behind his brothers death and exact some of his own style of revenge critique three words not enough action simple enough not enough hong kong kickass jet li action compensate for horribly predictable screenplay bad actors crappy dialogue and ohso many overthetop melodramatic moments and romance angle why one must ask why love fight scenes and really dig jet li too but this little ditty barely contained three memorable action sequences and jet well the poor dude was barely in the movie and thought this was supposed be his big break how bout giving the slickster some more opportunities show us his kungfu fighting chops slap him in few more scenes and give him more chances practice his actingenglish abilities what letdown even black mask was more entertaining than this glossed up empty shell of in fact am sure that more time was spent gathering the hits for the soundtrack of this than were on the socalled screenplay felt like was watching soundtrack rather than movie most of the time the sad part about the bad script is that it would not matter so much if the actually had some decent actors spouting out the tacky lines but no save lindo and aaliyah who were not too shabby thought the rest of the cast was picked primarily from their inability deliver lines convincingly and what was the deal the whole nfl franchise deal run some year old looking guy acting like he is the overlord of drug ring what mess then again do not want it seem like am complaining solely about the story was completely foreseeable since we all go see these movies for the action anyway not the story well guess that is what disappointed me the most out of this there were couple of cool fight scenes li but simply not enough satisfy my overall craving also as much as love the way they incorporate wires and special effects in some of their stunts couple of the exaggerated fight scenes were simply too obvious stunt it should be seamless fellas not necessarily against the laws of gravity the one cool thing that was original in the movie was the way in the director showed us some of the inside cracklings of the human body when penetrated blow but that simple creative touch could not save the rest of this films uninteresting plot movements am disappointed for jet li that this did not give him the real opportunity star in good story many great action scenes hopefully the next time will be charm for this charismatic actor for now just hope that for his sake the films title is not premonition of the movies ultimate fate at the boxoffice

one night during torrential downpour that flooded the streets we went see what else hard rain so are we all going die the sheriff randy quaid asks in the storys opening line as he evacuates his flooded town the answer is pretty much yes but not nearly soon enough and add insult injury the supposedly dead regretfully often turn out not be so populating this bad tvmovieoftheweek material are host of talented actors one can only hope they were rewarded handsomely for acting in this hopelessly muddled picture besides the obvious hardships of acting most scenes while dog paddling in the water they will all receive black marks on their records for appearing in this dismal movie graham yosts script serves up one cliche after another for the actors who thankfully managed mumble quite few of the lines director mikael salomons staging is so confusing that you may have trouble figuring out what is happening the befuddled presentation is exacerbated peter menzies jr dark and ugly cinematography the plot concerns an armored car that gets stuck in the raging water onboard are guards tom and his uncle charlie christian slater who is much better in his tender roles as in untamed heart plays tom edward asner drops briefly take on the role of the soon be dead charlie coming their rescue is gang headed jim played on autopilot the great actor morgan freeman he views the loot three million dollars worth as his retirement plan the entire movie is one big watery chase the sheriff and his posse tracking jim and his gang who are in turn after tom along the way tom picks up love interest in the person of crucifixweapon wielding woman named karen played in totally wasted performance minnie driver the action sequences are repetitive and without much interest they do feature lots of explosions and gunfire keep you awake christopher youngs emotionless score for the has single trait earshattering loudness the plot holes are as big as the ones in the dam that breaks submerging the town the characters have an infinite number of bullets and rarely do they have bother reloading their guns the weapons and the ammunition spend most of the time under water or being rained on but always fire perfectly when one of the bad guys drops gun into the water it stays in the same place until much later when tom swims get it even though the swift water is so strong it is uprooting large trees counting these improbabilities is one of the more enjoyable ways spend your time as you wait for the characters kill each other the show has single but unprintable good line betty white plays an incessantly bossy wife and when her henpecked husband finally told her off our audience roared laughter the show concludes sickening set of twists the best that can be said of the picture is that it is merely stupefyingly awful as opposed laughably bad hard rain runs it is rated for violence and would be fine for teenagers the two families behind us shockingly had halfdozen preschoolers among them

vampires starts out almost in the style of spaghetti western an attack on small homestead in new mexico the house has nest of vampires and jack crow james woods is leading team of vampire hunters in clean them out while the initial imagery is little overdramatic it gives way what is fairly decent action sequence that is enough action last us while and we could director john carpenter would let us get story line but it is not very long and there is not much plot until the next big action scene then there is only bit more of plot before the next action scene after that the plot is kept minimum and the interesting ideas in the plot really get the short end and that is something of pity because the based on the book vampire john steakley gives us myth for the origins of vampires and explains why vampires are so intertwined religious imagery this could be an interesting departure from the standard vampire but carpenter decides tell us about it rather than show it what carpenter saves his serious screen time for sequence of spectacular fights between hunters and vampires there is lot of fighting and lots of gore anything intriguing is kept minimum so it does not get in the way of pleasing the action fans this has not always been carpenters style his version of the thing has action but also challenges the viewer do little thinking about the films central science fictional question jack crow heads vampire swat team cleaning up nests of vampires hightech spears and crossbows in the early part of the his team is wiped out particularly mean vampire valek thomas ian griffith who has been tipped off who crow is now crow team is gone and he is down himself and his sidekick tony montoya daniel baldwin make matters worse he does not know the people on his own side tony and his backers he can trust meanwhile jack is sure the vampires are looking for something that must be hidden somewhere here in new mexico if this is sounding like very tired police corruption plot few obvious substitutions that is exactly what it is the same story looks just as well two partner cops looking for gang of hood who are themselves looking for packet of heroin but carpenter goes against familiar principle of show people do not tell them just about everything in the plot other than the fights we are told about in the dialog and not shown fundamental questions in the plot like where does crow get his funding why are the vampires in new mexicowhat do they want and why do they want it what is the connection of the vampires and the catholic church how did crow come be vampire hunter and why devote his life it the answers any of these questions could have been dramatized but instead are revealed through dialog now if all this was not bad enough carpenter misuses the james wood persona woods plays particular sort of cool lowlife very well but carpenter leads off the having woods do some sergioleone style mythic posturing while his crew prepares for an attack he stands staring fixedly through shades at the house that will be his target woods does not work as larger than life mythic hero that is not his style and it just does not work very well there are some simple things that carpenter should be looking for as director that he misses in one scene we are looking at motel room dead people on the floor one female corpse is on the floor in front of chair so that there is about an inch of daylight between her and the chair as the actress breathes the gap widening and narrowing makes it obvious her arm is moving up and down one also wonders how the existence of vampires is kept secret these vampires do not maintain low profile there are arguably logical flaws in the there is some question in my mind whether carpenter has consistent policy on what effect bullets have on vampires it would take some rationalization explain why in some scenes sunlight has dramatic effect on vampires yet in scene toward the end vampire can walk under burned roof that lets him be swept beams of sunlight suspect that the book on this was based was better thought out while might recommend this an action audience would say that what look for in vampire vampires rates on the scale and on the scale perhaps will read the book

when considering david finchers latest the game four words come mind do not believe the hype this michael douglas vehicle from the director of seven is not nearly as clever or innovatively suspenseful as it would have us believe the draws us in an intriguing concept aided no doubt the riveting trailer where jaded millionaire douglas is presented the opportunity enter into living fantasy this is not simply virtual reality this is real life deadly twist on his th birthday nicholas van orton douglas is invited dinner his underachieving younger brother conrad sean penn conrad has special birthday present for his brother he hands nicholas gift certificate and tells him contact company called consumer recreation services they make your life fun conrad tells him nicholas humors his brother telling him he will call but it is clear he has no time for any foolish fantasy roleplaying as he calls it then for reasons that are never really made clear nicholas decides go crs and see what they are all about he ends up spending whole day going through their screening process me made no sense considering the tight schedule he keeps claiming have nevertheless when it seems nicholas has been rejected as crs client the weird things start happening of course when we have only covered about minutes of screen time what else should we expect douglas has built his modern career around playing powerful violent and unlikable men being manipulated unseen hands one of those films basic instinct came from the creative minds of writer joe eszterhas and director paul verhoeven the premise of the game is not unlike the concept of another verhoeven total recall in that case the premise was implanting someone elses memories as way enhance ones own life through dream vacation yet in both films the real goal is create vicarious bond the audience we live the adventure along the protagonist reacting each twist and turn in theory the key the suspense is not being tell what is real and what is not all we can do is hang on until the end of the ride when the truth is finally revealed now for those of you who forgot let me say this again do not believe the hype the game is not thrilling roller coaster ride as suspensethriller it does not do much but spin in circles the third reel was fighting back sleep and checking my watch as endured the predictable plot is it any wonder douglas will not be able resist the charms of mysterious potentially lifethreatening blonde ever heard of glenn close no well how about sharon stone thought so if anything in this surprises you at all would guess you have not seen that many films there is no suspense here trust me looked hard find some had settle for contrived gimmicks and ridiculously implausible situations fincher aims for hitchcock but lands somewhere just north of joe eszterhas there are those that might say the game is not intended be viewed literally would submit that is exactly the way tried view the the simply does not have the teeth bite into any real psychological issues there is moment early in the where van orton realizing his game has begun smiles as he walks through the airport trying figure out who is in on the whole thing he is charged his paranoia he is looking at the world through new eyes it is the last thoughtprovoking moment in the from there on the director only wants stay step ahead of us any significant archetype that is set up in the beginning of the is simply turned into plot device at the outset we are told each game is tailored the individual ultimately this game is supposed work like crucible trying this obscenely wealthy and emotionally detached aristocrat fire proving his soul yet as douglas endures his personal gauntlet we are given very few pieces of the puzzle illuminate us on who this man really is wanted like this more than did look at it as just anothergreat idea poorly realized can think of at least two other superior films where watching the did not mean we were seeing what was really happening bryan singers the usual suspects for one that was truly unique in its ability get you lost in the details before pulling back show you the full masterpiece on the canvas also there is the underrated jacobs ladder tim robbins that really has be watched twice before you recognize the significance of all its symbolism here are two examples of films that do not simply manipulate for manipulations sake there are films that use their labyrinth structure lead us meaningful place one major issue that comes up in the game is whether or not the whole illusion is just highly sophisticated con game well can tell you right now after you have spent your dollars you may be asking yourself the same thing

weighed down tired plot lines and spielbergs reliance on formulas _saving private ryan_ is mediocre nods in the direction of realism before descending into an abyss of cliches there ought be law against steven spielberg making movies about truly serious topics spielbergs greatest strength as director is the polished formulaic way in every aspect of the falls carefully into place make perfect story but for topic of such weight as combat in the second world war or the holocaust this technique backfires for it creates coherent comprehensible and redemptive narratives out of events whose size complexity and evil are utterly beyond the reach of human ken in this way spielberg trivializes the awesome evil of the stories he films _saving private ryan_ tells the story of eight men who have been detailed on pr mission pull young man ryan whose three other brothers were just killed in fighting elsewhere out of combat on the normandy front just after dday ryan is paratrooper who dropped behind enemy lines the night before the landings and became separated from his fellow soldiers the search for him takes the eight soldiers across the hellish terrain of world war ii combat in france there is no denying spielberg came within shouting distance of making great war movie the equipment uniforms and weapons are superbly done the opening sequence in captain miller tom hanks leads his men onto omaha beach is quite possibly the closest anyone has come actually capturing the unendurably savage intensity of modern infantry combat another pleasing aspect of the is spielbergs brave depiction of scenes largely unknown american audiences such as the shooting of prisoners allied soldiers the banality of death in combat the routine foulups in the execution of the war and the cynicism of the troops the technical side of the is peerless as always the camera work is magnificent the pacing perfect the sets convincing the directing without flaw hanks will no doubt be nominated for an oscar for his performance was utterly convincing and the supporting cast was excellent though ted danson seems mite out of place as paratroop colonel yet the attempt at realistic depiction of combat falls flat on its face because realism is not something can be represented single instances or events it has thoroughly permeate the context at every level of the or the story fails convince throughout the movie spielberg repeatedly showed only single examples of the grotesque wounds produced modern mechanized devices exception men are shown burning death relative frequency for example we see only one man guts spilled out on the ground here and there men lose limbs in one scene miller is pulling man safety there is an explosion and miller looks back see he is only pulling half man but the rest of the corpses are remarkably intact there are no shoes only feet in them no limbs scattered everywhere no torsos without limbs no charred corpses and most importantly all corpses have heads in fairness there are smattering of wicked head wounds the relentless dehumanization of the war in even corpses failed retain any indentity is softpedaled in the ultimately _saving private ryan_ bows both convention and the unwritten rules of wartime photography in its portrayal of wounds and death in war rather than saying _saving private ryan_ is realistic it would be better describe it as having realistic moments another aspect of the hollywoodization of the war is the lack of realistic dialogue and in particular the lack of swearing anyone familiar the literature on the behavior of the men during the war such as fussells superb _wartime understanding and behavior in the second world war_ has an extensive discussion on swearing knows that the troops swore fluently and without letup who is this private ryan that we have die for him asks one infantrymen in the group of eight rendered in wartime demotic that should have been expressed as who is this little pecker that we have get our dicks shot off for him or some variant thereof conversations should have been literally sprinkled the word and largely about the search for food and sex this is all the more inexplicable because the movie already had an rating due violence so swearing could not possibly have been eliminated make it family however the most troubling aspect of the is the spielbergization of the topic the most intense hell humans have ever created for themselves is not emotionally wrenching enough for steven spielberg he cannot just cede control the material he has be bigger than it as if afraid let the viewer find their own perhaps unsettled and not entirely clear emotional foothold in the material spielberg has package it in hallmark moments give the war meaning and coherence it never had the opening and closing scenes of ryan and his family in the war cemetary reminscent of the closing scene from _schindlers list the saccharine exchange between ryan and his wife at the close every bit as bad as schindlers monologue about how his car tiepin or ring could have saved another jew quotes from abraham lincoln and emerson captain millers last words private ryan and an unbelievable storyline in prisoner whom they free earlier in the movie comes back kill the captain that particular subplot is so hokey so predictable it nigh on ruins the nowhere in the is there resolute depiction of the meaninglessness stupidity and waste characterized the experience of war the men who actually fought in combat imagine if miller had been killed friendly fire or collateral damage because of its failure mine deeply into the terrible realities of world war ii _saving private ryan_ can only pan for small truths in the shallows

if you are going make twohour injoke why bother releasing it the general public if you are going create that will appeal primarily bigname actors and people who know woody allen then why waste the time of the rest of us peons playing it in theaters while watching celebrity realized that allen had only marginal interest in creating story about real people what he really wanted do was continue on his recent kick of conceited selfdeprecation celebrity is yet another in allen tells story about himself living in world that he is familiar dealing people like the ones he actually knows allen recruited poor kenneth branagh bumble through this picture in an imitation of allen so perfect that it almost made me like the more branagh plays lee simon journalistturnedscreenwriter who divorces his wife robin judy davis shacks up some hot women famke janssen charlize theron winona ryder and goes about trying get big stars melanie griffith leonardo dicaprio read his script about an armored car robbery the usual elements of recent allen films are all here including the sexual insecurity of the main character lots of selfloathing women and tiring continuum of episodes that are only loosely related one another unless you work in the industry or know woody allen personally it is not likely that you will find whole lot of interest in celebrity aside from all the injokes the story falls far short of compelling and the characters are all empty and lifeless branagh proves once again that he is superb performer nailing his imitation of allen flawlessly the problem is that he is the same character allen always plays character who is getting more than little dull watch mean come on how many times have you seen this guy he hates his work and he cannot be satisfied any one woman and at the end of the movie nothing has been solved he brings all of his problems upon himself crashing his car because he is receiving fellatio and other such stunts so it is pretty hard care about him in addition is not allen capable of creating characters who are not just like him know he is but he did not do it in celebrity the vacant emotional attachment the main character is not recaptured in the supporting performances davis playing the same woman low selfesteem that she played in deconstructing harry has few touching moments but ends up the same despicable celebritytype that fills the rest of the movie some of the actresses are saved because of their beauty theron and ryder especially but they are not likable people only famke janssen as book editor interested in simons new novel has any life the men in the picture do not do much better joe mantegna is pretty dull as the man who remarries robin while dicaprio as christian slaterjohnny depptype spoiled young actor is funny but disengaging what is really insulting about celebrity is how dull and standard its themes are allen seems think that he is making an insightful movie about the way normal people look at celebrities the main problem this is that the character whom we are supposed identify simon is not normal guy he is just as entrenched in the image as the rest of the characters the other problem is that the image we get of these celebrities is no more enlightening than the view the media gives us none of them register as realistic interesting characters they mostly just function as set pieces for boring dialogue in addition allen decides he needs scene in the theme is expressed explicitly robin in this scene says something like it is interesting see the way we all look at the people we celebrate celebrity is arguably allens biggest misfire date it does have few good scenes therons superorgasmic model character is kind of funny and the last scene might have been moving had the rest of the shown us character or two but celebrity is failure at the core unless allens point was make selfindulgent movie about himself and his friends if he wanted make his audience feel like they were on the outside of big joke then he succeeded in that for one do not enjoy feeling like an outsider

it used be that not just anyone could become vampire usually you had be an aristocrat count such as dracula or karnstein qualify you would have have modicum of sophistication so you would at least look cool or suave when biting into some young damsels throat but today in our overly politically correct world any scuzzylooking longhaired unshaven lout or any spikedhaired harridans can put the bite on you the same token be vampire hunter one had have some sort of medical training and knowledge of the occult or maybe perhaps be some sort of professional soldier or at least one who retired honors not in these times all you need are some sharp weapons some bullets forged from silver and any yahoo can be buffy or blade without sounding elitist the fear of vampires has greatly diminished because of this lack of exclusivity brings us blade the latest in long line of vampire movies in it seems half the population is putting the bite on the other half not only are there thousands of vampires but they seem move from city city pay off police departments and most importantly establish their own exclusive afterhours raves in the highlight is the sprinkler system going off and dousing all the occupants in blood shower all that blood you wonder why they have hunt for victims you also wonder when they get the time get their clothes drycleaned and why no cleaner ever complains about all the bloodstains blade is based on marvel comic book character is like comic book all visual the plot is basically blade repetitiously slashing his way through the vampire army seeking their leader deacon frost it is all hokum and nonsense of course but the filmmakers play it straight unfortunately at least at the advance screening attended the audience did not see it that way and laughed through much of the proceedings you know movie is in trouble when the scenes of blood and gore that should elicit screams of fright instead evoke peels of laughter another telltale sign is when the audience seems be admiring the heros costume more than the hero also it seems it is not enough for todays vampire merely have fangs he must also be proficient in the martial arts why supernatural being one of the undead needs such skills is beyond me of course this concept dates the hammer filmsrun run shaw production of legend of the seven golden vampires in dracula is defeated seven karatechopping siblings wesley snipes is buff as blade he growls his lines the few he has and spends most of the time glowering as if he was suffering from indigestion or having second thoughts about starring in and coproducing this turkey blade is just another example of how the vampire once honorable member of the horror family has gone downhill this dud mostly makes you yearn for those quaint old days when christopher lee could be stopped just dangling crucifix in his face todays vampires lack the panache the style of bela lugosi or christopher lee they are not even worthy enough carry those great bloodsuckers capes they are more farcical than frightful this whole enterprise is one dull blade that could have used lots of sharpening

hav plenty as we are told in the beginning and reminded during the is true story life itself is series of true stories but most are not movie material as scripted directed and acted cinematic newcomer christopher scott cherot hav plenty limps along at best its dialog is so stilted you know what they say no women no cry that the actors are content read the screenplay rather than invest much energy in trying act it in the story lee plenty cherot is yearold author and teaching assistant the movie happens mainly over the new years holiday consists of series of incidents in various single and married women try kiss lee or take him bed since he consistently refuses caroline gooden tammi katherine jones figures that he must be gay eventually he and havilland hav savage chenoa maxwell get together proving that he was not gay after all just picky sexy women can sit on his lap and ask him go bed them but he will not even kiss them he is man who knows his mind he frequently shares directly the audience in series of trite and overly cute monologues filled wealthy africanamericans the story is closest in tone love jones was better hav plentys story does not go anywhere at the end it subjects us lee plentys new is movie of the movie we have just seen but even worse acting remember folks that as outrageous as this all seems this is true story hav tells the camera but the problem is that it is not outrageous at all or even the least bit interesting hav plenty is not so much bad as it is total waste of the audiences time hav plenty runs it is rated for profanity and would be fine for most teenagers

was character that had honor odd that gibson himself seems have very little of it would not kill in front of children and protects his blond woman there is nothing bad about him he is character person eberts review and he liked gibson in the role because he is comic at heart playing bad guy that is why we are allowed root for him and it is true gibson walks the movie as if he is smiling at joke he that am the th person post newsgroup review of payback after this many reviews why would anyone want read this really do not care am just trying gain membership into the online critics society posting as many reviews as can

note some may consider portions of the following text be spoilers be forewarned quick robin the antishark repellant adam west in the batman feature casually kicking at patheticlooking rubber shark attached his leg had never thought that an entry in the modern incarnation of the batman feature would approach this level of campiness but in many instances batman and robin nears and at some point even exceeds this standard this is disasterously bad easily the worst in the series date and fairly epitomizes cinematic definition of the word excessive it is loud garish and obnoxious pointless gratuitous action sequences and set pieces clutter up the screen elaborate production design the point of overkill batman and robin features the caped crusaders george clooney debuting as batman chris odonnell returing as robin squaring off against another bevy of chemicallyinduced villains the nefarious icecold mr freeze arnold schwarzenegger armed weapon freezes everything in its sights and the slinky poison ivy uma thurman who has the ability blow powerful love dust into the faces of men in order so that they will fall helplessly in love her not that the dust is really necessary accomplish this result but whatever and then dispatch them poisoned kiss ivys side is the giant steroid monster bane jeep swanson grunting hulk of beast the villains goals are noble ones freeze steals diamonds power his climate suit in order keep his body temperature at zero degrees so that he can survive in order devise cure for his beloved wife vendela dying of degenerative disease and frozen in suspended animation and ivys intent is restore the dominance of plant life on earth albeit destroying all human life meanwhile on the homefront life at wayne manor is thrown into upheaval the illness of butler alfred pennyworth michael gough and the arrival of his niece barbara alicia silverstone akiva goldsmans screenplay for the is ridiculous and laughably bad astonishingly terrible dialogue lame jokes and an awful bythenumber plot simply coasts along and fails generate any genuine excitement it makes goldsmans screenplay of batman forever thought was dreadful look positively inspired in comparison am still astonished that cheesy plot device would seen used in no joke an episode of gilligans island somehow make its way into multimillion dollar blockbuster production joel schumachers direction of batman and robin is horrific terrible balance of flashiness over substance there is clear conceit towards neon in this even moreso than his previous batman forever the revamped batcave helpfully sporting gigantic glowing emblems for the dynamic duo just in case suppose if they ever happen forget that the batcave is the headquarters of batman and robin and neon prominently figuring in an utterlypointless fight sequence bane and street gang over ivys chosen new abode another action sequence fails serve any useful point other than chew up five minutes of screentime involves an incredibly uninvolving latenight motorcycle race barbara and some gotham goons mr schumachers focus for batman and robin appears be make the as visually striking as possible the detriment of the story there are drastic shifts in the tone of the between allout camp and heartfelt drama the latter completely unconvincing and ineffective it is perhaps not the most promising of signs when the group was burst out laughing within twenty seconds of the films opening even before single line of dialogue had been uttered is batman and robin supposed be campy think it is it is hard imagine that the filmmakers could have intended many parts of the be taken at all seriously one of my favourites was when bane helpfully grunted bomb each time he laid down an explosive device in the gotham observatory is it supposed be as overly campy as it turned out be somehow doubt it the subplot involving afred is delivered so solemnly and such graveness that the impression is made that the is not attempting be the utter farce it is arnold schwarzenegger is topbilled in the as the villainous mr freeze and is bland and uninteresting perhaps the worst thing that villain can be mr schwarzeneggers attempts be menacing are laughable and his attempts at conveying pathos are laughable frankly everything he does onscreen is laughable the end of the was stifling chuckle every time he simply appeared onscreen the bulk of his performance consists of uttering nearunintelligble puns and oneliners featuring every possible permutation of cool in the least inventive way george clooney has been given very little do in batman and robin being overshadowed the villains and consequently he looks rather uncomfortable in the his batman is hardly an imposing figure chris odonnell is unimpressive in onenote performance while alicia silverstone lackadasically fails make any impression at all the films one saving grace undoubtably uma thurmans entertaining performance as sexy villainess poison ivy her work in batman and robin is certainly overthetop but in controlled fashion works splendidly within the tone of the ms thurmans comic timing is impeccable and reminds us that it takes skilled performers make campiness work successfully am already starting positively reassess jim carreys performance in batman forever her amusing poison ivy is the most entertaining character in the and when she is offscreen the greatly suffers figure that if one has die being kissed death uma thurman is not halfbad way go while batman and robin was hardly ride of pulsepounding excitement must admit that was not bored watching it although did glance at my watch repeatedly through the screening my attention was kept through anticipation of the utterance of yet another terrible pun or oneliner and awaiting yet another scene fall flat it is been long time since have laughed so much at movie at of course is the operative word

undiscovered country but pillers notquitehalfbaked screenplay should ultimately claim responsibility for insurrections failure am about give the same advice rick berman and co as have given the financiers of james bond movies it is time breathe life into this workhorse hiring solid genre writers and real director while we are at it put that visor back on laforge for three hundred years the baku species who look just like humans have lived on ringedplanet that might as well be called the fountain of youth six hundred of them occupy the briar patch the area affected metaphasic radition positive energy that reverses the aging process in the elderly but evil ruafo this is probably abrahams last stop before performing amadeus at dinner theatre near you leader of the sona who look just like burn victims after reconstructive surgery wants relocate the baku and movie his people onto the briar patch in their place in order replenish his dying breed the federation is all for this but picard feels this is direct violation of the prime directive not interfere the development of an alien race never mind that the baku did not exactly evolvethey went wandering in the universe one day and stumbled upon the magic world every time frakes gives an interview lately he seems top whatever ludicrous statement he last gave regarding this installment he has called it comedy thinking mans picture throwback the old series and most grievously he has likened it john ford western presume that is some john ford he went school not the director of the searchers he has also gone on record as saying paramount recut the from his version that is no excusesomeone generated this footage muddy cinematography and sitcom sets are the least of its problems star trek insurrection appears have been beamed in from the planet plotholia consider such curiosities picards love interest anij donna murphy can slow things down staring at them such as waterfall or falling rocks her scientific explanation for this do not ask worf gets pimple he is reexperiencing klingon puberty thanks the timedefying atmosphere laforge regains his eyesight trust me levar burtons real eyes are scarier than those electronic lenses he wore in first contact and troi brags about her firm boobs but picard remains as bald as an androids butt most suspiciously what exactly is the problem letting this endangered race have little fun in the sun the filmmakers cloud the issue some nonsense about family feud of sorts and they also turn ruafo into completely powermad superfreak just so the characters will have something do in the climax and if you have seen return of the jedi you have seen the ending of this movie did not picard himself previously disobey the prime directive when he prevented the borg from assimilating millions frakes lucked out first contact and repeat viewings of that reveal the seeds of what went wrong in his direction of insurrection he has no sense of comic timing and he mines for acting chemistry where none exists take look at the painful troi gets drunk scene in fc and you will get the general idea of insurrections unsuccessfully jokey and hollow tone even the worst shatner and co treks like the final frontier maintained watchability thanks the effortless charming comaraderie between kirk spock and bones neither first contact nor insurrection has any idea what do crusher gates mcfadden whom must say maintains fabulous physique troi or laforge and all three next generation films spend too much time on data who is the franchises answer urkel need cheap laugh have data say something sexual or start singing or lift up four hundred pound boulder as if it is the hunk of styrofoam it really is heres my proposed title for number data star data trek data data data data data in this movie data will become preoccupied learning blow his nose while crusher and troi watch silently from yards away and laforge points his sinister gaze at the android in doubly robotic observation star trek insurrection had one nice eerie silent moment that hints at better darker am not saying all of them should be star trek ii the wrath of khan but this one boldly went where no movie should go again

this is one of the worst bigscreen experiences have had for while this plus showgirls and basic instinct paul verhoeven has stamped himself as currently one of the worst blockbuster directors his celebrated total recall was admit successfully scripted but it nonetheless contained directorial flaws obviously nobody wanted invest too much money in production from someone like verhoeven the result being that much of the special effects in starship seemed fake but not everything bad in the was the directors fault even though he was one of the guys who employed the actors it is surprising that none of the actors received nominations for the razzie awards expected five for the acting categories casserole vanity devoid dense ribald dingy miasma and jackass bushy are in serious need of acting school no they have pass primary school drama classes first while total was written well starship is purely pathetic all right it is supposed be fastpaced entertainment and you are supposed turn off your intellect completely and enjoy the action sequences and special effects that is guts and gore as matter of fact found the activity incredibly boring complete waste of more than two hours half of the was bad episode of beverly hills dina meyer was in beverly hills while another quarter was simply nothing things like presenting irrelevant information in an irritating way on the web and the rest was display of humans fighting computergenerated images the battles were all the same jumping around shoot or get stabbed and on barren planets that only had giant insects there were not even any stunts consider slightly more exciting than pictures running around wonder what the insects eat if there is nothing but them on the planets there is so much laughable treatment in this and it is frankly not amusing when jokes are intended this type of story is obviously aimed at yearolds who cannot see it anyway because of the violence and some sexuality but then there are always yearolds who have that frame of mind the pointless plot begins when johnnys vanity devoid girlfriend carmen richards decides that she wants join the troopers fight the insects who are throwing asteroids at earth johnny then signs up as trooper also after an overacted argument his parents but there is another girl dizzy meyer who likes johnny and then there is another boy who likes carmen results in love quadrangle is not better because it means augmented worsethanstereotyped soap opera increased bitchiness and more bad beverly hills melrose and the result of this love quadrangle at the end is also rather stupid anyway getting back the thing you might call plot johnny is too stupid be pilot and has join the infantry while his girl and the other dude are in the same league dizzy comes chasing johnny and joins the infantry also they then start training contains what roger ebert calls ips idiot plot syndrome moments when only an idiot would have made such obvious mistakes then real combat and guess what that is about as complex as it gets oh and one of their friends carl neil patrick harris k doogie howser d becomes involved in war intelligence and his abilities at the end are really corny and make me want spray insecticide on someone for it he is my fifth nom for razzie the troopers fight fall in love die kill and try act naturally they win or sort of halfwin of course in between and at the end there are soldiers chatting and smiling while carrying grievous wounds caused bug legs the bugs also suffer from ips why would you release hold of your captive before killing it is not it also amazing that earthlings have not invented better handheld weapons then the only question that remains is why gave it one star instead of zero well maybe aquarter of star for the originality of the cosex shower scene and the very brief moments of suspense another quarter for copying zulu and letting the good guys the bugs win and half star for the suckingout of the brain of one of those people who call themselves actors but there should have been more the troopers deserved die

phew what mess for his fifth collaboration director rich ard donner lethal weapon iiii maverick mel gibson plays motormouth maybe mentally ill new york city cabbie jerry whose wild conspiracy theories are all but ignored alice julia roberts acting all serious the justice department employee that he has crush on she not interested but another person is cia psychiatrist patrick stewart who promptly kidnaps him is one of jerrys conjectures correct is the metal strip in the new bill being used track your movements is oliver stone still alive because he cut deal george bush spread dis information is this movie really about any of the crazed cabbies theories no no and no as it turns out there is some other nonsense going on here involving and revolving around jerrys background hint pay attention an early scene where jerry blacks out and flashes back in quick succession images of an interrogation room hypodermic needles and ms roberts herself the initial premise is pretty good and is played for while at delightfully dizzying clip mel is wideropen that we have ever seen him and if his characters relationship roberts initially strains credibility their combined star power is blissfully intoxicating the highest wattage of the summer perhaps even when the plot contrivances begin intrude the two remain randy dandy screen pair there is great scene in jerrys fortress er apartment alice trying act casual as her hyperactive host tries remember the combination locked coffee bean container he stores in another locked con tainer his fridge other hilarious moments of there are many include trio of memorable conventionbreakers where alice ditches tail jerry coldcocks someone and later eludes foot pursuit each in uproariously unexpected fashion that is donners own ladyhawke playing in the theater btw let us see other pleasures include brilliant title sequence jazzy score from carter burwell and the worthpayingtosee sight of roberts pumping lead into one bad guy and slamming anothers head into wall oh pretty woman getting the latter however requires slogging through an increasingly overburdened and ultimately unappealing story the last hour of conspiracy theory devolves from tolerable torturous almost unwatchable more stuff happens of the stupid shit variety than is worth mentioning here except perhaps for late sequence that has alice locating jerry in an abandoned wing of mental hospital hearing his voice carrying through the air ducts and here thought it was wabbit season good god who rewrites these movies and do they arrive in nondescript black vehicles

in french the phrase noir literally means black webster defines it as type of crime featuring cynical malevolent characters in sleazy setting and an ominous atmosphere that is conveyed shadowy photography and foreboding background music classic noir including such memorable fare as the big sleep the original cape fear and orson welles striking touch of evil employed black and white photography emphasize the long shadows associated the genre color came into play neonoir films like chinatown and blade runner a confidential easily the best of is wonderful piece of contemporary neonoir filmmaking for textbook example of how take all the elements of neonoir and create an absolute mess there is palmetto based on just another sucker short story written british author rene raymond under the pseudonym james hadley chase palmetto shows what happens when filmmaker puts style ahead of substance director volker schlondorff tin drum the handmaids tale stated we were not even sure for long time if it was going be thriller or comedy it shows palmetto is too preposterous too be taken seriously as thriller and too ponderous work as comedy the story begins when journalist harry barber woody harrelson is released from prison someone turned states witness and revealed that harry was framed reward for blowing the lid on corruption in the small florida town of palmetto bitter and broke harry plans hitchhike miami and start his life over but exgirlfriend nina gina gershon appears return him palmetto while hanging out at bar he notices that beautiful woman has left her purse in phone booth harry pockets her cash only have the woman reappear and catch him her money in his pocket no problem though the radiant blonde is rhea malroux elisabeth shue the young wife of very rich older man heart problems and she has proposition for harry rhea needs threatening voice and someone collect the ransom for the staged kidnapping of her teenage stepdaughter odette chloe sevigny the girls want bilk halfmillion dollar ransom from the old man and will happily give harry for helping the scam things go wrong of course odette is found dead leaving harry frantically trying dispose of the corpse and cover his tracks in an ironic twist harry is asked work for the local a office they need press liaison field questions about odettes kidnapping and feel that harry is the perfect man for the job not bad setup for noir if only schlondorff knew how handle the material but he never settles on consistent tone the actors do not know what do their characters either muddling the proceedings even further as if that was not enough the story suffers from major problems in logic woody harrelson is talented actor an admirable willingness take on risky parts but he is lost here presented as crusading journalist who was horribly wronged it makes no sense that harry would be stupid and dishonest enough get caught up in this scheme harrelson clearly does not know what do harrys character so he spends most of the glowering sweating and generally acting miserable meanwhile elisabeth shue gives goofy performance behaving like vamp on nitrous oxide as the stepdaughter chloe sevigny lays on so many slurpy quirks that she comes off like juliette lewis jr despite number of steamy scenes there is no chemistry between harrelson and the women make matters worse schlondorff badly dubs in dialogue while the characters lips are running over each others bodies two particularly bad scenes highlight the films problems while driving body in his trunk harry has minor car wreck and cop shows up the officer wants help change harrys flat tire and asks him open the trunk harrys pathetic attempts keep the trunk closed might have worked if played as comedy but under schlondorffs grim direction the scene is just embarrassing the films nadir comes when bad guy prepares kill harry and nina we are supposed be horrified watching our hero dangling over bathtub filled acid but this point the has foundered so badly that the scene is merely reminiscent of when jessica and roger rabbit were suspended over vat of dip had palmetto been played tongue firmly in cheek it might have been an entertaining shaggy dog story but under the harsh direction of schlondorff the is just sluggish paintbynumbers exercise in neo noir cluelessness avoid this nonsense and go see a confidential instead

plot lara croft is british rich and kicks lot of ass she also likes raid tombs but when the illuminata discover that all nine planets are about stand in alignment for the first time in years and that lara holds the key time well needless say they want nab it from her oh yeah lara also likes sport lot of tight shirts hummanahummanahummana critique angelina jolie was great in this movie there were also about three action scenes that were pretty cool look at in this uhhhhhm unfortunately the rest of the movie sucked bad dialogue generic sidekicks and bad guys lame mystery yodaesque moments mumbojumbo being sprouted about and even some crappy cgi near the end all in all this movie was not the horror show that some of the early reviews had warned us about especially since every other scene does feature jolies torpedoes begging burst out of her lucky shirts but it was quite the letdown nonetheless especially when you consider the major opportunity that the filmmakers had here create cool hip woman hero based on popular video game do not know guess you have put most of the blame on director simon west who did not really tie the whole movie together all that well the lacked energy consistent pace and well fun time felt kinda depressed while watching this movie all that father crap was horrible and the dialogue given poor john voight recite was just plain embarrassing and am not even gonna mention his moustache hehehe why have this shite in the movie at all especially hated the scenes in some ghostlike figure friend or child would ramble on about lara crofts father while all the time am not giving one ounce of crap as what they are talking about guess that is called lack of character development right that is when movie builds enough background into the characters on the screen so that we could actually get into it and care about them did not care about anyone in this movie and was bored during most of its let us explain why we are doing all this gobbledygook moments and even though thought that jolie kicked some mighty ass damn did she look sexy blasting those guns or what everybody else around her was so goddamn boring her butler was throwaway no personality her sidekick was supposed be funny but just annoyed me every time he said the word bugger and he says it lot trust me and all of the socalled bad guys just spewed onedimension they had no spark no energy amongst them and even though few of the action scenes in the movie were cool see the trailer and you will know ones am talking about the overall picture was lame and the dialogue and mystical bullcrap just buried it even further also for movie that is supposed be about all of these exotic locations was not necessarily impressed any of its exterior shots and even less so its interiors all looked like they were shot in the same room mind you will not go as far as say that it is the worst movie of the year remember that actually have go see freddie prinze jr movies also but it is definitely the worst that have seen during this summer movie season of course it is still early and am sure there are few more garbage heaps coming down the pike skip this one altogether and rent any of the indiana jones movies instead trust me you will miss the boobs but end your night some rocksolid porn and it is all good where is joblo coming from raiders of the lost ark the mummy lost in space the mummy returns the generals daughter romancing the stone wild wild west mission impossible

it happens every year the days get longer the weather gets warmer and the studios start releasing their bigbudget blockbusters this years crop already seems inferior that of past summers even lackluster trio of batman robin the fifth element and the lost world the marketing blitz in has been centered on godzilla heeere leezerd leezerd does not make me optimistic about future summers godzilla is of course based on series of cult movies translation really bad movies only few people can tolerate from japan that turn up really late at night on ted turnerowned cable stations that this bigbudget remake will not rise above its roots is fairly obvious the credits show us the origin of godzilla in five words nuclear explosion creates giant lizard sounds like an enquirer headline does not it the mushroom cloud is followed the inevitable discovery sequence this time japanese guy is eating noodles chopsticks while watching sumo wrestling if that as not stereotype when he discovers the telltale radar blip people die cut our protagonist played matthew broderick he makes his first appearance wearing headphones warbling along singin in the rain it is nonetoosubtle sign that he wishes he were in classier movie no dice bueller from the beginning poor matthew has do embarassing things like fondle giant earthworms and stand in godzillas enormous footprint every disaster movie has have knowitall scientist and this time broderick is it as the worlds leading expert on radiated earthworms and would not you love have that printed on your business card broderick is invaluable the government he immediately dispels vicki lewis theory that godzilla is dinosaur because hey you cannot take seriously the intellectual arguments of newsradio cast members broderick instead hits the nail on the head announcing godzilla is radiated lizard the radiation is not an anamoly he announces and lightning strikes believe this is mutated abberation he continues and lightning strikes again it is vocabulary lightning you see activated words of four syllables or more meanwhile we are introduced our new york cast headed an ambitious broadcast journalist maria patillo brodericks former love gee what are the odds their paths will cross again at dramatically important time poor patillo has been trying get ahead in the news business for years but has been held down heartless anchorman harry shearer italian cameraman hank azaria tells her she is not ruthless enough nice does not get you anywhere in this town it is dog eat dog actually it is lizard eat city as godzilla emerges from the atlantic begin rampage on the big apples core the filmmakers provide us onenote drunk fisherman who hooks godzilla think have got bite he announces as gigantic tidal wave begins rushing toward him you can guess what happens next similar reactions spring forth as the monster prowls the city hearing the rumble of approaching footsteps one new yorker remarks please do not tell me that is another parade please do not tell me that is the best line you could come up mayor ebert is not pleased played the principal from head of the class he continually makes the wrong decision when given an option and bickers his assistant gene guess the filmmakers knew they would be getting two thumbs down from the critics and did not even bother kiss ass the problem is if you are going attack siskel and ebert you should at least make it funny dialogue like did not we agree that we were not going have any sweets until after the election followed back off gene just does not work for me other lame running jokes include everyone mispronouncing the broderick characters last name and frenchman jean renos inability find good cup of coffee in new york there is even more fun be had as godzilla progresses as the beast heads back into hiding broderick suggests the military lure it out food cue twelve dump trucks all dropping fish into new york intersection broderick that is lot of fish that ambush fails but broderick soon figures out why godzilla came new york buying worth of home pregnancy tests and running lizard blood through them yep godzillas children makes you wonder just what kind of creature would be horny enough have sex godzilla that is until broderick explains that godzilla reproduces asexually like linda tripp godzilla comes us from the makers of independence day so it has lot of dumb action scenes destructive special effects and shallow subplots look no further than patillos betrayal of broderick patillo what have done animal what have become and the climactic godzillas nest sequence in madison square garden the main difference is independence day was about the experience it had real global patriotic element it and some genuinely fun characters godzilla has lots of rain and lightning reptilian action ripped off from jurassic park and endless product placement from the likes of kodak blockbuster juicy fruit swatch sprint and bumble bee tuna yes bumble bee actually paid be known as the official tuna of godzilla that fact alone is twice as interesting as anything in the movie

i heard actor skeet ulrich discussing this in couple of interviews and in both instances he felt the strange compulsion compare it little series of films called lethal weapon now personally remember those films as starring major motion picture star being funny having great action sequences great chemistry decent character development hmmm okay now on my review of chill factor plot graveyard shift regular working joe and ice cream truck driver fall onto malicious plan an exarmy general propose nuclear device international prospects when the device suddenly falls into their reluctant laps they must keep it cool on ice and rush it over an army base before the contraption ticks over degrees fahrenheit and kills millions of people critique speed on an icecream truck is probably the pitch that was used sell this onetone movie its backers but unfortunately the only way that anyone could compare this that tensionfilled original two hours of cinema is in its distinct honor of being the complete opposite of what that and the lethal weapon movies stood for this is seasoned in cliches plenty of badly written dialogue over the top acting from cuba gooding jr zero chemistry between the two leads and horribly tacky bad guys tossed in complete an overall bad movie recipe my friend and enjoyed watching this movie certain extent because some of the lines in it were so bad and obviously written that we just had crack up that and the formula for the films script followed the proverbial and you guessed it scenario and what about all those catchy hip names get us relate the characters elvis and nighshift oh what talent lies in the minds of these screenwriters and yes it actually took two guys come up this regurgitated drivel it is unfathomable me as how actors skeet ulrich and cuba gooding jr got involved in this oneweekoldbluecheesesmelling project did they actually think that it would boost their careers or did they know that the script sucked but discounted any fall from grace knowing full well that the stack of cash in their back pockets would pad their fall most probably the latter have you seen either fled or bulletproof well despite the slight differences in plot the essentials are basically the same here you get black guy and white guy being chased bunch of people having no choice but work together get somewhere hating each other at first but over time learning respect one another as individuals yawn add that the fact that our actually has bad guys who are all dressed in black drive black cars and black vans and run around all kinds of telecommunicative devices sprinkled around their head not too conspicuous eh call me partypooper but as much as like nice cheezy movie as much as the next guy this just does not even try do anything original or reasonably entertaining one cool scene boat careening down mountainside and another nuclear device obliterating everything on an island do not fun buddyaction flick make show cuba the money everybody little known facts about this and its stars this is not little known fact or anything but damn is it just me or does skeet ulrich look an awful lot like greatlooking actor johnny depp skeets reallife nicknames include chester skeeter and mosquito he stands was born in north carolina and got married in that sexkitten actress from clay pigeons georgina cates they own farm together in virginia and seven dogs skeet has long scar on his chest from openheart surgery done when he was correct ventricle defect actor cuba gooding jr was born in the bronx new york in he breakdanced during the closing ceremonies of the olympic games in los angeles he stands actress hudson leick who plays one of the bad guysgirls in his movie is better known from her role as callisto on the popular tv series xena princess warrior this reportedly had budget of million am not exactly sure where all this money went but it certainly did not register onscreen interestingly enough director hugh johnson who makes his big screen debut this was the cinematographer on the white squall and the demi moore vehicle i jane

it is some sad irony that screened fright night part on the day that one of it is stars roddy mcdowall passed away at the age of mcdowall was one of the most talented and prolific actors in having career that spanned over years and appearing in more than films fright night part probably will not be counted among his more memorable roles this is really sad considering how good the first fright night was william ragsdale and roddy mcdowall both reprised their roles as the somewhat reluctant vampire killers who seem be the only ones that realize that vampires walk among us at least in the movies anyway it has been several years since charlie brewster ragsdale and bmovie actor turned late night horror host peter vincent mcdowall came face face real live vampire who just happened be charlies next door neighbor charlie and peter won that battle but apparently even vampires have relatives who get pissed if you kill members of their family apparently charlies former bloodsucking next door neighbor had sister who was none too pleased find out that some kid and an aging actor staked her sibling so she decides exact little bit of revenge this ends up forcing charlie and peter battle the forces of darkness yet again one of the things that made fright night such success was chris sarandon who played charlies stylish next door neighbor taste for blood fright night part tries duplicate that modern style but it falls sort while they are stylish the vamps in this just do not have the personality of the undead in the first the exception of werewolf who adds some much needed comic relief few of the scenes one bright spot speaking from strictly sexist point of view is traci lin who plays charlies very skeptical girlfriend it is really shame that her career has not been better since she made this ragsdale does fair job in this but does not give nearly the performance that he did in the original roddy mcdowall makes the most what he is given unfortunately is not much is shame because his character was lot of fun in the original movie guess would have say that the first was superior product in every way the original always left you feeling danger was lurking right around the corner part had more of the feel of music video never good thing for horror another minus for part was the traditional scenes that leave the audience on the edge of their seats waiting for
