something jump out of shadow where very rare for that matter they were almost nonexistent if was going watch horror this would be far from my first choice the first fright night on the other hand would be right up near the top of my list if was in the mood for roddy mcdowall would probably head the science fiction section of my local video store and rent planet of the apes either way fright night part would most likely not enter into the equation

sometimes stellar cast can compensate for lot of things and pushing tin certainly features some name stars who are going places billy bob thornton cate blanchett angelina jolie and oh yes john cusack who might not realize it at first but he is actually the veteran among this quartet of finelooking people sometimes terrific cast like this can compensate for lackluster screen treatment of an idea that has hip comedy written all over it compensate for workmanlike but uninspired direction compensate for an obnoxious score that would have anyone but the tone deaf screaming for the exits compensate for clich characterizations compensate for embarrassing you have be joking situations etc in pushing tin thornton blanchett jolie and cusack do not have an earthly from the opening sequence the is in big trouble squiggly quirky credits fakelooking passenger planes circling new york and anne dudleys inyourear music making us wonder how she ever got that best original score nomination for the full monty let alone won it but for one was not ready walk just yet so quickly we descend into tightlyedited air traffic controllers montage screams us in large capital letters these people have difficult job yes what their frantic mileaminute instructional personas juggling planes and passengers lives like some huge real midair video game hip cool demonic auctioneer nick the zone falzone cusack is the best in the biz of course until some hipper cooler leatherclad flyboy assist in the guise of russell bell thornton shows up challenge falzones finite air space boys will be boys and some heavy duty testosterone starts exuding then the macho oneupmanship begins it does not stop seeing who can juggle three within cats whisker of each other oh no there are some broken hoop dreams some wannaseehowfasticandrives and then the ultimate showdown was that my wife saw you last night director mike newell four weddings and funeral must have read different draft of this script because the one that is being acted out up there between newark jfk and la guardia does not have an ounce of subtlety and newell has made some awfully goodand funnymovies before the antics of these air traffic controllers will make you cringe they will make you frown in disbelief they will have you constantly looking at your watch but wait there is still minutes go the films only saving grace is blanchett whose connie falzone is spunky brash long island housewife who wants better herself taking art classes this is wonderful accomplishment for the fine actress who has previously played redheaded australian gambler oscar and lucinda and tempestuous british monarch elizabeth but she is not enough save the picture thornton looks terrific and performs solidly but his character is joke jolie as russells knock em dead wife is not bad but the upandcoming actress disappoints allowing herself be displayed like plaything cusack cracks gum dons shades and acts hip throughout but like everything else in the his performance is forced in the last ten minutes or so for some inexplicable reason things start coming together and you begin get sense of how this might have been like the trailer teases but it is too little too late fine cast aside pushing tin is nothing more than an embarrassment

the most depressing thing about the depressingly pedestrian james bond the world is not enough is its final frame white letters on black background proclaiming james bond will return oh certainly hope not pierce brosnan in his third and reportedly last goround as james bond the world is not enough is the best example date that enough is enough in this the th chapter in the seeminglyendless franchise featuring ian flemings debonair british secret agent who likes his martinisand his nemesesshaken not stirred the subinspired screenwriters have chosen rehash all of the setups stunts and sexy encounters of the previous bond flicks rather than coming up anything the slightest bit original we have got previouslyused speedboat chases ski chases and sticky situations aboard nuclear submarines we have got couple of hottotrot babes without an ounce of acting ability between them we have got postcold war megalomaniac bent on world domination slash destruction here played skinheaded robert carlyle mean lean panache and as has been the case since the spy who loved me we have got plot that has nothing whatsoever do anything conceived mr fleming we have also got main title song garbage very little effort you can fit the lyrics both songs from tomorrow never dies while originality was never the series strong suit the films were almost always fun at least some thought going into the nonstop stunts cannot think of one memorable setpiece in the entireand very dull the world is not enough in addition michael apted yes the respected director of such films as coal miners daughter nell and the up documentary series takes embarrassing advantage of the full range of bond clich you get the talking killer plot deviceyou know the scenario the bad guy has the good guy at his mercy yet waxes poetic just long enough die of old age and you get slew of highpriced assassins who cannot hit barn door at paces in the films opening minutes of an endless bond chases sultry sniper along the thames and the leatherclad lovely fails hit bonds soupedup fishing boat bazooka when he pulls within few feet of her later she takes off in hot air balloon bond dangling from guy rope beneath her but is still unable take him out these reliable absurdities are more frustrating than usual since there are no distractions other than occasional ads for luxury automobiles vodka or credit cards in and among the rampant product placements brosnan grapples carlyle braveheart sophie marceau as former kidnap victim slash heiress elektra king she is terrible wild things denise richards as nuclear physicist lord help me she is laughable and judi dench as dame judi brings the only shred of dignity series that has long since jettisoned its selfrespect about the time roger moore inherited bonds walther ppk brosnan goes through the motions the grace and charm you would expect of the former remington steele star but even he has be thinking there is more life than an easy paycheck he is given plenty of wiseacre asides deliver but only one of them do not know any doctor jokes made me chuckle although thought christmas only comes once year is more in keeping the series penchant for grownworthy puns

when walt disney pictures announced liveaction feature based on the cartoon series of mr magoo special interests groups representing the visionimpaired let out cry of dismay mr magoo they claimed would be an insult the men and women they represented in fact they were wrong mr magoo is not just an insult the blind and nearblind it is an insult every human being who has the misfortune suffer through this dreadfully unfunny minute atrocity it is stating the obvious remark that disney appears have run out of original ideas look at their roster of and releases and you will see shocking list of retreads including dalmatians george of the jungle junglejungle that darn cat flubber and now mr magoo the best of these george of the jungle was mildly entertaining the worst mr magoo exposes just how painful bad movie experience can be the first problem mr magoo is the script despite the collaboration of naked gun scribe pat proft mr magoo is comically barren from beginning end there is not laugh be found every attempt at humor and there are lots of them falls flat an audible thud you would think that out of the dozens of gags jammed into this at least few would work but that is not the case have had more laughs during ingmar bergman pictures then there is leslie nielsen who looks sounds and acts absolutely nothing like the animated character memorably voiced jim backus in the past nielsen has proven his comic aptitude roles in movies like airplane and the naked gun lately however he has been getting lazy taking parts in the likes of dracula dead and loving it spy hard and mr magoo even if nielsen was in top form it would take an incredible stretch of imagination see him as magoo especially since we are reminded of the original the short cartoon segments that open and close the but top form is not phrase would use describe his performance here this is strictly takethemoneyand run operation the story like many disney stories can be described in one long sentence magoo is the only witness the theft of rare jewel from museum and as he is trying apprehend the thieves on his own the police mistake him for the robber the cops are played ernie hudson and stephen tobolowsky who take their lumps early and often the bad guys are kelly lynch who does lot of martial artstype kicking nick chinlund and malcolm mcdowell who has the good sense look embarrassed matt keeslar portrays one of magoos sidekicks his nephew waldo the bumbling mans other more interesting companion is dog named angus most of mr magoos humor comes in the form of failed slapstick the cartoon violence level in this does not approach that of home alone or flubber but it is still pretty acute characters getting hit on the head sledgehammers and knocked off snowy precipices there is nonviolent bit magoo preparing chicken dinner that could have been funny if it was handled better but compared mr beans recent similar misadventure it does not hold up well then there is the series of lame jokes that result from magoos near blindness such as the occasion when he mistakes wild animal for baby am willing cut director stanley tong little slack tong hong kong maker trying break into the market has helmed several jackie chan movies including first strike rumble in the bronx and supercop his chief talent that of choreographing martial arts fights is wasted here despite some high kicking kelly lynch like john woo hard target and ringo lam maximum risk before him it appears that tong has been consigned the purgatory of making bad movie as his entry into the american mainstream it is worth noting that unlike many disney films hold perverse appeal for the under crowd while driving parents distraction mr magoo appears bore viewers of all ages the screening attended was walltowall kids and for the most part they did not seem be enjoying themselves when the was over asked one little girl what she thought of it her pained expression confirmed the adage that picture can indeed be worth thousand words mr magoo is the kind of movie that should be rejected any potential viewer sight unseen

david spade has snide sarcastic sense of humor that works perfectly on the tv sitcom just shoot me it also served as good showcase for him when he costarred opposite the late chris farley in tommy boy and black sheep lost and found marks the comedians first attempt at going solo in movie and it also reveals that when spade does not have reliable backup system his brand of humor seems more desperate than one may expect david spade is not the problem lost and found he plays dylan ramsey the sweet main character the best of his abilities the story revolves around dylans obsessions his beautiful new neighbour lila dubois sophie marceau from braveheart and her terrier named jack dylan believes that the best way womans heart is through her dog and so he kidnaps jack planning stage fake rescue in hope win lila over there are three good things about lost and found the first is spade the second is sophie marceau lovely actress who is been planted into the wrong movie lastly there is the dog who is used here in similar context puffy from there is something about mary unfortunately director jeff pollack finds more humor in putting jack through cycle in the drier than he does simply making him look cute this kind of physical humor is dead pollack does everything but beat the poor pooch baseball bat get laughs and this procedure is cheap unfunny and resoundingly cruel this is where start get fuzzy also in this unusual blend is apparently sweetnatured love story between dylan and lila given the meanspirited comedy that the movie is obviously striving for found this hard swallow and why does dylan even deserve someone like lila after kidnapping her precious dog and putting it through such pain predictably lost and found opts for happy ending one that feels so sentimental gooey and rings so false that it sets off siren in your head that makes you feel bit cheated david spade who also cowrote the movie tries hard so very hard make this project amusing there are some choice scenes that are quite funny but the movie is only sporadically funny patrick bruel plays the stock character of rene the pompous jerk who also wants win lila over his good looks and money jon lovitz and martin sheen are welcome additions in two tiny supporting roles despite few positive attributes lost and found just does not work if you are searching for an enjoyable romanticcomedy you could do far better than this obvious misguided failure that shows blatant disregard for what it is trying present

its pathetic attempt at improving on shakespeare classic its just another piece of teen fluff kids in high school are not that witty the wittiness is not witty enough the comedy is not funny the acting is poor the music the poster its worse than she is all that classic borderline classic excellent good better than average average disappointing poor awful crap classic

sometimes wonder just what the censors are thinking take this naked killer among it is ingredients are heavy doses of violence rape sequences straight and lesbian sex scenes and what our system calls coarse language but what do those intelligent people at the censorship bureau choose remove in case someone will get offended one word penis that is it in spite of everything else in the movie the one thing that the censors decide is too much is penis it really restores you are faith in the system huh anyway that is just side point when naked killer was released in the local independent cinemas around melbourne it was advertised ad nausuem as hip cool controversial thriller what they forgot mention was that it is not very good the plot involves male cop tinam simon yam investigating series of brutal murders while getting haircut he meets and finds himself attracted girl named kitty chingmy yau who after extracting revenge on the man who killed her father falls in professional killer sister cindy svenwara madoka realising kitty has potential cindy decides train kitty in several unusual and ridiculous ways and gives her new identity however in the course of his investigation tinam who believed kitty had disappeared runs into her again but is not quite sure if it is her complicate matters the actual serial killlers princess and baby who former students of cindy and have been told kill their old master and her new student from then the action ensues all in all this is not well done movie the script is awful the direction all over the place the editing is jerky and confusing and the subtitling is surprisingly poor however the are few stand alone pieces that do entertain the shoot out in the car park is almost woolike in adrenaline the fight scenes are energetic and guess it must get few points for trying something little different let me put this way if you like action get something else if you like strong women in movies get something else if you have do decide between this and black cat for your hong kong female action do not get either even for curiosity value it just is not worth it let us face it if ever the was movie that became popular on it is subject alone this is it

after seeing blaze and driving miss daisy was ready for some mindless funoh maybe something like tango cash maybe not mindless fun is one thing but braindead slop is another matter altogether tango cash has lowest common denominator written all over it the movie stars sylvester stallone and kurt russell as rival undercover cops in a russell plays cash reckless slob who dresses in jeans and tee shirts stallone plays tango wealthy investor who works on the force strictly for the thrill of it he does not need the money in an effort change his image stallone goes for yuppie gq look in the wearing spectacles and three piece suits the two detectives reluctantly become partners after they are framed for murder and have break out of prison clear their names tango cash is unbearably noisy for starters there is harold faltermeyers annoying synthesized score gets old after four notes make matters worse the filmmakers seem think that when it comes loud explosions and screeching cars the more the merrier in fact the movie begins not one but two car chases there is nothing like good old car chase introduce the characters in movie screenwriter randy feldmans brain must have gone mush from watching too many cop shows on tv his shockingly stupid screenplay undermines anything and everything the movie has going for it such as stallones efforts convince you that tango is an intellectual in movie the iq level of an amoeba even great actor is going have trouble looking intelligentand stallone is no lawrence olivier it is hard imagine anyone reading feldmans script and thinking want be in this movie the films plot does not have one original bone in its body andagainyou have point your finger at the screenwriting feldmans story line succumbs every crime thriller cliche in the book making tango cash altogether generic and predictable they simply could have called it action movie every character every twist and turn is stolen from television or from other movies adding insult injury tango cash is about as believable as road runner cartoon action movies do not have be realistic but they should absorb you enough so that you are not thinking about the lack of realism the only artistic aspect of tango cash is the cinematography there are some spectacular shots especially during the rainy nighttime prison break in tango and cash slide safety on electrical wires the films main draw is the chemistry between stallone and russell unfortunately their relationship rarely progresses past macho competition as they endlessly bicker about who packs more meat in his pants the dialogue consists of nothing but oneliners and consequently the attempts at character development are embarrassing it is shame because workable screenplay russell and stallone could have turned tango cash into charming lethal weaponesque adventure tango cash tries maintain light tone and you do laugh about once every five minutes seeing russell in drag is the movies funniest moment but you probably already have seen it in the commercials furthermore the light tone does not sit well against the relentlessly brutal violence machine guns and torture generally do not mix well comedy jack palance appears in tango cash doing what he does best playing sleazy conniving villain his character however is runofthemill except for his strange obsession mice like many movie villains palance likes play games in fact he sets ridiculously elaborate trap for tango and cash trap sends the two detectives prison so they can be beaten and electrocuted some meanies in the boiler room you have wonder why palance does not just shoot the detectives in the head the story would crumble if any of the characters were do anything intelligent teri hatcher plays stallones sister and russells loveinterest and she is just as pretty as can be but regrettably hatchers acting is not on par her exceptional beauty every time she opens her mouth you cringe corny dialogue and atrocious acting are always fatal combination there is really very little if anything recommend in the and more the point tango definitely is not worth penny of your cashso do not bother

in the th warrior arab poet ahmed ibn fahdlan antonio banderas finds himself kicked out of baghdad for feeling up the kings old lady his translator screen legend omar sharif in small role ahmed heads north act as ambassador the northmen vikings he finds group of warriors mourning the loss of their king messenger soon arrives from another kingdom requesting assistance soothsayer says that thirteen warriors must answer the summons twelve northmen and one outsider thus ahmed becomes the th warrior on the trip ahmed manages learn the vikings language listening their fireside conversations bit farfetched it is true but we have swallow it if this flick is going manage few lines of dialogue amidst the grunting ahmed who is called ibn the vikings forms friendships herger the joyous dennis storh and the viking leader buliwyf vladimir kulich when they arrive in the other kingdom the thirteen warriors discover that they are facing an army of supernatural cannibals that live up in the caves hereafter most of the movie is battle scenes the cannibals attack the vikings the vikings attack the cannibals the cannibals attack the well you get the idea just add some action there is also viking vs viking duel other movies insert scenes between the fights these scenes are called character development suspect that the th warrior had better script at one time and that it fell through the cracks because of the tagteam direction the movie started off in the hands of john mctiernan you will notice lot of similarities between warrior and mctiernans predator including the chittering jungle sounds somewhere along the line mctiernan bailed and michael crichton took over crichton whose novel eaters of the dead is the basis for warrior has directed small assortment of goofy sciencefiction thrillers westworld coma looker runaway their result of their consecutive efforts is murky and pointless movie perhaps what the th warrior needs more than anything else is villain the eaters of the dead are faceless mob in blackface they have no personality and the end they do not even seem particularly threatening the audience has no target toward channel its aggression mctiernan should know about the importance of an interesting villain it was his die hard that made villains seem fun and attracted bigname stars the evil roles in action films the th warrior suffers from lack of vision it wants be predator meets braveheart meets the magnificent seven meets dances wolves so many competing goals all it can do is echo what it might have been it might have been satisfying action it might have been beautifullyrendered medieval epic it might have been thoughtprovoking examination of the meeting of cultures what shame it turned out be nothing in particular bottom line if you want see antonio swing his sword rent the mask of zorro

there is not much good about this movie not much can say about the acting directing or writing that would make you consider seeing this movie so will get my one good comment out of the way at least joel schuemacher batman robin did not direct it or it would be titled technicolor city in fact there is nothing colorful about this movie its dark and depressingly gloomy right down the bitter end the plot has tendency be interesting but all that passes while your laughing at the ridiculous things thrown into what could have been fascinating movie the plot is impossible explain due how senseless it gets so will just touch on the bare minimum john murdoch rufus sewell awakes in the bathtub of cheap hotel only find out he has forgotten everything john must find out who he is before the strangers k mind erasing aliens find him and use him for their own evil conspiracy during the some interesting points are raised about human individuality and the existence of inherently evil people any of these points however are completely erased from your mind as you watch the actors stumble through the dreadful script as mentioned earlier nothing but the atmosphere is right in this the acting is bland and since there is virtually no character development no one seems care the special effects are low budget and some even hilariously fake sign of true bmovie the direction is poor and there is little continuity not that you would expect it in movie switching realities constantly lastly the script is weak and has no concept of reality and does not deserve have the word science in sciencefiction if have not got my point across will say it more plainly this is bad movie lets hope the next movie alex wish was tim burton proyas is at least tolerable

varsity blues is the best of thus far unfortunately it is also the first have seen from it is another one of those smalltown sports movies that involves flawed but goodheartedfrom it is another one of those smalltown sports movies that involves flawed but goodhearted protagonist rough and meanspirited coach and the big game the end will the underdog overcome great odds and triumph will everyone in the town turn against the coach will the team win the climactic game do cats bathe themselves regularly the socalled hero in question is john moxin james van der beek senior at west canaan high school who plays for the varsity football team but is really just hoping get scholarship at brown university so that he can get out of the deadend town at least he is got the right idea since west canaan texas is portrayed in the as frankly pathetic the whole town treating the weekly football games as the second coming heck in one scene the front page of the towns newspaper is proclaiming about the west canaan badgers big win the night before when the teams star quarterback is severely injured tearing the ligaments in his leg john finds himself taking over as the teams leader but his few minutes of glory do not last long as he begins have problems his girlfriend amy smart when she discovers he spent an evening another girl ali larter and after staying out all night his drinking buddies at strip joint all of the teenagers in the are portrayed as raging alcoholics the team loses their secondtolast game putting john at feuds the coach jon voight who like gary oldman is overstaying his welcome in the typecasted role as the bad guy worse yet the coach is threatening ruin johns scholarship chances if the badgers do not win their final game the plotting of varsity blues is as old as the hills and contains every cliche in the book admittedly was never exactly bored while was watching it but hasten add that was rarely ever entertained throughout all could really think of is how virtually the same exact story had been filmed great deal more thoughtfulness and maturity in all the right moves one of the biggest problems had the is how little of interest any of the characters actually were least of all certainly not john who played van der beek of tvs dawsons creek is pretty much bore without any engaging qualities while probably should not blame this on van der beek since the inauspicious and bythenumbers screenplay peter iliff is not of any help he is still certainly not in the league of tom cruise in all the right moves the story revolving around john meanwhile is extemely thin throughout particularly for its minute running time and it alternates between uninspired comic relief as in when the students see their sex education teacher working as stripper at the club and heavyhanded melodrama the romance between john and his girlfriend had the potential be an adequate subplot but we also learned very little about her is unfortunate since amy smart whom do not think have seen before in past films is probably the only character written any sort of intelligence smart does not allow her character become the passive girlfriend instead coming off as young woman her own ideas and opinions it is too bad the camera did not linger on her long enough so we could hear some of those thoughts the adult characters probably fare the worse of any since they all must play residents of dimwitted town that cares about nothing but football johns relationship his parents can also be telegraphed far in advance his father is set on him becoming football player at university but john does not want any part of that his mother stands beside her big strong husband and is passive female finally jon voight plays the stock bully coach character and he does nothing make the thankless role any more than onedimensional saving varsity blues from being total washout are few amusing sequences including one set in the sex education class did get laugh out of me the scenes of playing football were wellshot and thankfully did not overstay their welcome as many sports films fall victim but leaving the theater the question had in my mind was why did this need be made seem be asking this question quite lot lately since the same old stories seem be cranking out of do we really need another highschool sports no we do not and certainly not one of this lowcaliber felt like cutandpaste job of spare parts from much better but similar films varsity blues no doubt is the first one however include an earnest scene in one of the characters is only wearing whipped cream on their private parts

for touted as exploring relationships and black sexuality trois is surprisingly tame despite it is lurid subject matter and it is passing nod fatal attraction it moves along flat uninspired dialogue as it sets up surprising climax that tries mightily overthrow the considerable dead weight of the rest of the freshly moved atlanta jermaine dourdan and his wife jasmine moore have the trappings of perfect life they have beautiful house in suburbia jermaine is lawyer on the fast track at his firm jasmine is his supportive wife who is finishing up her college degree in an opening montage via home video of the pair we see the unremarkable story of their marriage and early marital triumphs this is couple that has it all into this eden slithers the lure of lust despite his outward appearance jermaine reveals himself as selfish and covetous of his wife more as possession than person glimmer of his true nature peeks out during an early sex scene his wife as he goes about his business oblivious jasmines concerns we also find that he has been relentlessly asking jasmine participate in menage atrois much jasmines dismay as jermaine puts it do not you want be sexually free jermaine shares his desire coworker terrence smith who obligingly sets jermaine up woman who might be interested in just such an encounter the woman jade palmer is direct counterpoint jasmine jade at one point was college student too unlike jasmine she found herself pregnant dropped out of school and now struggles make ends meet further reinforce their differences it is revealed that jade is involved in custody battle over her son inevitably through liquor and touch of duplicity on jermaines part the forbidden act is consummated the aftermath of the encounter sidesteps into fatal attraction territory as acts of violence are perpetrated upon jermaines property the hint that the violence may escalate this point trois shows itself be soap opera without the requisite melodrama fatal attraction without the social significance the exploration of relationships is strictly superficial and stereotypical jermaine comes off as insincere sexually driven and selfish jasmine is bland and subservient jade comes off bit sympathetically but that is negated her moral bankruptcy yet another tale of sexually aggressive dog of man who imposes his will upon his accommodating innocent mate the last minutes will undoubtly throw you curve but this point will you even care if the rest of the movie was as dynamic as the ending perhaps there could have been some freshness it as it stands trois is pretty standard fare

mission mars is one of those annoying movies where in the middle of the movie you get the sneaking suspicion that the reason the trailer looks so good is because they showcased all the best parts of the movie all five minutes of it mission does give you payoff but when it does come it is too little too late mission has some good ideas but they get lost in the unbearably boring delivery dimeadozen dialogue and spate of good actors wasted in cardboardcutout roles am sure the director and writers were very proud of each hallmark moment they came up so they stretch each dramatic moment out like silly putty until it loses all its charm glances do not communicate any deeper emotions just because you draw them out for five hours on end the spends an hour on this kind of stuff building its climax lot of it is cliched glorification of family relationships marriage friendship unite we stand divided we fall kind of crap there are some spectacular special effects sequences in this and give it points for trying stay true the science know trying is the key word here the sequence the martian demonstrating their history is oddly beautiful and touching but as mentioned then we are so sick of the goddamn thing we want the movie be over great design good intentions but no cigar if you are not die hard scifi fx or jerry oconnell fan his character is the only one who has some semblance of character do not waste your eight bucks on this and what the hell tim robbins died halfway through the movie in stupid way too that is just unforgiveable

my friend here in school just made two minutelong for one of his classes that includes staged anal rape scene done two guys and shot on the shadow of the incident banana being used as the instrument of penetration as sick as this all is watching it is one of the most admittingly hysterical moments have ever witnessed sure it may be in bad taste but what the hell is bad taste other than something that may be offensive some but is riotously amusing the rest then there is caligula this features incest necrophilia beastuality anal rape homosexual felatio of both sexes elaborate and lengthy orgies greasedup fist forced up mans rear wine poured down man who is had his urinary tracts tied off penis chopped off and fed hungry dogs etc etc etc this could very well be respectable and if could have been had the following not occurred the events were graphically shot in clear view the tone was not that of trying shock comically but well show historical accuracy the was million dollar production lavish sets rather impressive cast and whopping hour running time produced and funded none other than bob guccione owner of penthouse magazine caligula comes across as the most hysterical dramatic picture since plan from outer space because underneath there is sense that everything this is doing is not only accurate and justified but also brilliantly entertaining after all it is not really the fact that this features the aforementioned disgusting moments but that it actually believes in them as dramatic weaponry no should be discarded because its content because is never about what it is about it is about how it is about as the old cliche goes those who bash this for content are glancing over the biggest and most obvious problem caligula and that is that it is nothing but overdramaticized bullshit from start finish without second of credibility in its mammoth running time caligula allegedly tells the true story of the evil roman emporer of the same name man who was so insanely decadent that his assasination came as blessing or so guess even though almost every single roman emporer was assasinated as well and for much the same reasons the opens on the wrong note of course quote from mark appearing before any image graces the screen using the overused passage what shall it profit man if he should gain the whole world an dlose his own soul depite the fact that the opening scene of the is of the emporer before he was an emporer fucking around his own sister in field suppose if one has lose their soul one has have soul in the first place the plot is so incomprehensibly done that all or anyone else can make out of it is that caligula disastrously played the great malcom mcdowell performance that does the opposite that his performance in clockwork orange did is next in line for the throne but cannot wait for the current emporer tiberius peter toole ditto only for his performance in lawrence of arabia his grandfather die so he kills him and ascends the throne then he abuses his position marries woman helen mirren who retains her dignity as an actor not exactly acting so he does not just have sleep his sister dreadful teresa ann savoy there be pretty naked and willing hop in the sack mac or anyone he asks her hop in abuses his position little more little more and little more and then believe invades england then is killed off the filler instead of recounting his life is supposed be as guccione claims the ultimate portrait of decadent pagan rome complete orgies vicious deaths and lots of nudity but instead of being the historical accurate it really really wants be it instead becomes gucciones twisted masturbatory image of what it could be like oh is not it great that they just loved having sex and that they killed people so disgustingly and would not it be great if could make couple bucks selling this shit off as accuracy even though it is so blatantly real bad porn that have completely convinced myself that it is not mean why not just show roman orgy when can spend good ten minutes examining every single facet that makes it up and it is not just that it is disgusting or vile or whatever adjective you want use describe this it is that in where the entire feel it is going for is not felt it is also the sloppiest expensive movie of all time the sets are lavish but so blatantly innacurate that wonder if no historian wanting have his name on this explains this but that does not matter since the cinematography is so dark that you wonder if light meter was used at all making this not only dark and ugly but just plain dark the camera operation is also the worst have ever seen in my entire life not only does this hold the record for the most unnecessary zooms in one single shot ever but often the camera will lose its subjects and pan around till they find them then have them out of focus the editing is so sloppy that some scenes are absolutely impossible follow there is no writer speak of what the hell does it mean that it is adapted from an original screenplay gore vidal but nevertheless the dialogue is shit so laughably bad that cannot in good faith believe that anyone an iq over could say them straight face my favorite being the line when caligula inquires the doctor about the health of the dying tiberius he could go at any moment but care he could last year or so the music in this is mostly prokofiev and khachaturian they use his gorgeous adagio of spartacus and phrygia ad nauseum used in an attempt give the some emotion but instead feels as if it was shipped in from elsewhere the orgy scenes and one infamous lesbo scene between penthouse pets lori wagner and aneeka dilorenzo are the result of reshoots guccione himself are so obviously removed from everything else in this that it only adds the embrassment every five seconds or so the cuts random nudity as if it was afraid its audience would forget this is rated john gielgud represents the only voice of sanity walking around in his brief role as if he was constantly the mantra am going kill my agent am going kill my agent and so on and so on for over hours making caligula about as exciting and enriching as three hour college lecture class and twice as deliriously annoying guccione in his pursuit of historical accuracy has instead made that is such painstaking arduous task watch in its entirety that doubt anyone can sit through an hour of it without irreversible psychological damage throughout the entire the presence of guccione is easily felt as if he were standing there at the edge of the screen pretentiously looking down upon us saying look what can get away and if you do not like this then you are prig and worse than that you know nothing about history uh huh there is clear difference between historical accuracy and doing something that is artistically good showed roman decadence as something that was perhaps liberating for some but could not last that would probably make for good but using historical accuracy as licence get away any kind of disgustingfordisgustingnesssake acts is total total bullshit and all can say is that guccione and the makers of this have lost any kind of touch either entertainment or eroticism and have developed pathetic and sadistic taste for both judging from this there is that came out in called the cook the thief his wife and her lover magnifcent legendary cult director peter greenaway also starring helen mirren deals graphic sex heartstopping violence and gore and even little cannibalism for good measure that not only never patronized its viewers but also handled them in way that was shocking yes but also in bizarre way entertaining and totally involving there were real characters there in real situation and best of all passion and just the right amount of restraint as not get off on the fact that it is going be offensive many that achieved everything it wanted do and has since retained status as one of those cult films that is not only popular but actualy good and it is everything caligula might have been but alas was not

remember back in the mid when crime and macabre movies were all the rage pulp fiction and fargo both managed get oscar nominations for the best picture and not surprisingly slew of ripoffs followed in the years thereafter that fad seems be over but here comes christopher mcquarrie writing and directing the way of the gun that at first glance looks like another of those wannabes but upon closer inspection does not look like anything comprehendable it is crime story so wrapped up in its own little world it has claustrophobic atmosphere that will not allow the story much room expand outside its handful of characters and somehow still manages turn simple premise into something so complex its ridiculous complexity should come as no surprise anyone who is familiar mcquarrie he wrote the usual suspects has become cult favorite despite little critical acclaim that had great story and was well directed but had such an elaborate confusing screenplay it leaves many viewers scratching their heads after repeated viewings you have wonder if mcquarrie really had everything mapped out or if he was going for the idea that if it is really confusing and about criminals and cops that makes it fascinating the way of the gun mcquarrie seems be capitalizing on the same idea but this time the story is far less commercial shame because maybe that would have helped the tells the story of two drifters no ambition and barely reason live but are not hellbent on death either played ryan phillipie and benecio del toro they get lucky when they hear about scheme between bigshot exec guy and his trophy wife who are going have baby through in vitro fertilization they figure they can kidnap the surrogate mother played juliette lewis and get nice ransom along the way we continually learn of the shady dealings between the exec his wife their hired goons and the bag man played james caan the only actor in the who looks like he knows what he is doing the exec is some kind of money launderer so he obviously cannot call the authorities for help his goons and the bag man are on the kidnappers trail and each make different offers get the mother back the execs son is doctor who also gets pulled into the fray and wants make sure his patient is all right meanwhile each of these characters has something hidden up their collective sleeves and the doublecrosses secret love affairs and torrid pasts come as no surprise even though little of it has any relevance at all mcquarrie does not know the meaning of the word simple he seems be more interested in showing us how clever he is than making good movie everything has be complicated and confusing so much so that it is the point of surrealism nothing is what it seems in this reality it is one of those movies where you get dropped right into the middle of the criminal world and are expected know most of the industrys rules and regulations every scene caans character exemplifies this perfectly the kidnappers already know who he is and even chat him getting into conversations about the business and how it works and we are hardly given clue as what they are talking about these characters are probably supposed be great criminal sketches but they are more like ideas rippedoff from sketches found in david mamets trash no one here really acts like real person and the story is even further removed from reality it is like dream without any appeal take the opening scene for example the phillipe and del toro characters are in parking lot across the street from bar or club counting their money and stuff they sit on brandnew mercedes and the car alarm goes off the owner is waiting in line and yells at them get away from his car but they do not move the guy and his loudmouth pottymouth girlfriend and about other people cross the street and gang up on them you would think phillipe and del toro are going pull out guns and scare them away but they do not instead phillipe throws one punch and the two get beat down mob there is lot of things did not understand about this scene first of all the owner of the mercedes is not some yuppie or old rich snob he is like hippie straight out of the secondly the two main characters seem believe that they can actually take on the mob unarmed lastly it serves no purpose in the long run because later in the the two are packing more artillery than small countrys army if they were suicidal they would not have gone on the kidnapping job in the first place and where they get all those guns is never explained either there is lot more could pick apart about this but that would be an exercise in futility what it all comes down is that nothing here is what it seems would be great if this movie were about pretty much any other story than what it is absolutely none of the characters are likable or believable and it is all coated thin layer of black comedy is good for chuckle here and there but this is definitely not flatout black comedy and its use of such seems like desperate attempt kill screen time any you see whether you like it or not you can at least understand what the appeal was it why someone would want make it and why someone would want see it cannot say either for the way of the gun because it has very little going for it and cannot imagine anyone intelligently defending it

_dirty_work_ has premise of deliciously meanspirited potential mitch weaver norm macdonald and his lifelong best friend sam mckenna artie lange are losers in life they were constantly picked on in school and now they cannot hold regular jobs but as the trailer goes there is one thing mitch weaver is good atrevenge so he and sam parlay their unmatched skill in gettingeven schemes into marketable revengeforhire business called dirty work inc this should be the groundwork for wonderfully wicked black comedy but for called _dirty_work_ what ensues is rather clean of spirit in fact what makes mitch and sam start up their business is not giddy desire give bullies taste of their own medicine but rather more sappy reason sams father jack warden needs heart transplant and in order for him move at the top of the recipient list his compulsively betting doctor chevy chase asks the guys for pay off his bookie so for all the scheming that goes on beneath every underhanded plot isgasp heart undercuts the inherent nastiness of the premise not that there is not lot of nastiness on displaythere is but of different sort there are frequent sexual references most prominently in the form of prostitutes and sams impotent fathers ongoing lust for them and for rated pg director bob saget yes that bob saget of _full_house_ and _americas_funniest_home_videos_ fame and writers frank sebastiano fred wolf and macdonald himself stretch the boundaries of good taste rather fararguably bit too much so was not one but two separate instances of sodomy between animals really necessary but the issue of course is not so much of taste as it is humoras in is it funny or not the answer is resounding no it is not that macdonald is not funny guy he was one of the more consistently funny performers on _saturday_night_live_ before his muchtalkedabout firing and his dry brand of smartass wit translates well the big screen it also does not hurt that he is natural likable screen presence he is able give some of his lines nice acid touch but for the most part the oneliners as written are flat and the broad slapstick gags just do not work one running gag has him being literally tossed out of buildingsa real riot still macdonalds few shining moments are just about the only moments the has the late chris farley as hysterical as he ever was is amusing in cameo role but as whole the supporting players are amateurish and seemingly free from any directorial guidance saget tries juice up the proceedings kitschy cameos gary coleman adam sandler and john goodman but their minimal novelty value cannot prevent _dirty_work_ from sputtering the end of its brief minute running time the closes on sad note of desperation an indulgent reel of outtakes from only those involved in the production would derive any amusement come think of it cannot imagine anyone but those involved in the production find much amusement in the entirety of _dirty_work_

americas favorite homicidal plaything takes wicked wife in bride of chucky and their unholy matrimony is something old nothing new the burning question on the minds of most moviegoers however has nothing do nuptial specifics or even how the movie stacks up but rather whether or not the duo gets down and dirty on their bloodsoaked honeymoon the answer is sickandtwisted yes and viewers are treated shadowy glimpse of some hotenoughtomeltrubber or at least singe it lovin guess they are anatomically correct chucky again voiced brad dourif of course is the star of the childs play series my buddytype doll possessed the spirit of slain serial killer in bride the plot heh picks up his girlfriend tiffany jennifer tilly resurrecting chuckys remains he was blown up at the end of childs play the help of black arts manual called voodoo for dummies silly mortal before long she is also been reduced shinhigh figurine status and the plastic incarnations of these onetime lunatic lovebirds hit the road scope out some potential new human bodies the rest of this rocky horror puppet show plays out as tiff and the chuckster stalk young couple nick stabile and katherine heigl conjugal plans of their own leading them towards new jersey grave where magical soultransferring amulet allegedly lies in wait along the way our murderous barbie and ken go through postmarriage motions similar any given pair of newlyweds bicker argue kiss and make up but when they squabble over who is going do the dishes watch out hey even faux people have got work through their problems director ronny yu keeps the mayhem flashy and stages an inventive scene or two but not even visual flair can make up for the fact that these creepy kewpies are neither scary nor menacing when one of them charges it is nothing good forward punt could not take care of and when climactic chase scene is needed one of the dimbulb protagonists must _pick_chucky_up_ so the demonic toy can force his hostage run at gunpoint throw in some silly casualties and ridiculous ending will son of chucky be next and this is bizarrely bad minutes at the movies as is the thing do in post scream slasher cinema don mancinis screenplay slathers on the injokes and genreparody but little of the humor succeeds proving selfreference can be completely worthless when it lacks bite be fair though most of bride of chucky is on autopilot so it is not quite right single out one misfired aspect of the similarly shaky the acting ranges from screeching camp boring bland the effects are not that special and the story is one big groaner heres hoping chucky and his entire clan past present and future rest in peace

this is the first in what would become the most successful series of horror films of all time fair warning those of you who might be inclined watch this movie for the first appearance of everyones favorite goaliemaskwearing homicidal maniac jason the guy who single handedly controlled the overpopulation problem around the crystal lake area does not start his quest find the most interesting household item kill someone until the sequel while he does have small role in this we the audience have depend on another blood thirsty maniac rack up the body count the plot like every other friday the th movie goes something like this crazed killer murders as many unsuspecting teenagers as hesheit possibly can in the space of minute movie the reasons that the afore mentioned unsuspecting teenagers come into contact the bloodthirsty killer are usually of little importance the story but for those of you out there that might actually care about such trivial matters in movie such as plot here are the basics bunch of unsuspecting teens get summer job at long closed summer camp they are days away from the arrival of the kids and they are spending their time fixing the place up and making sure it is ready for the kids sadly they start being butchered one one the bloodthirsty killer at this point would usually say something about the quality of acting directing or maybe something about the high quality of the production since am not going do that feel free assume that if did it would not be positive will say that this movie looks as if it was made for about hundred bucks and that includes the actors salaries if you are used recent horror films like scream you are in for bit of surprise the only saving grace for friday the th is that it was really the first of its kind the killer taking real pride in their work using as many methods of murder as they could none of this single murder weapon stuff life that unimaginative leatherface in chainsaw massacre or the creatively stifled imagination of halloweens michael myers who just used brute force or really big kitchen knife nope in the friday the th movies you can always count on the killer taking great pride in his work one fun fact about this movie is that the cast includes very young kevin bacon although after this movie it is wonder he ever worked again the main reason see friday the th is if you want watch all of the series from the beginning if not stick the later films jason everyones favorite hockey fan friday the th is the sort of movie that is fun sit down and get couple of scares from just do not sit down expecting whole lot

there is good and timely story trapped deep within the excess of murder in the first new movie about the abuses of our prison system country wrapped up in feverish debate over the crime issue and the rights of the accused and the incarcerated in jeopardy this expose would offer something rare recent american moviesa point of view but director marc rocco makes it clear from the beginning that pretentious often nauseating camera movements and slick mtv style lighting and editing are far more important there is not moment in the picture where he surrenders technique for pure storytelling and everything suffers christian slater and kevin bacon star as defense attorney and alcatraz inmate respectively after spending an unprecedented amount of time in an isolated cell for attempting escape bacon murders another prisoner and faces trial his young lawyer slater is fresh out of law school but determined put alcatraz on trial for the abuses of it warden gary oldman the result is the usual courtroom theatrics imagine stanley kramer production shot hyperactive school students there is very little praise here outside of kevin bacons earnest overacting and the appropriate story there is lot of overacting from everyoneyou know you are in trouble right away when lee ermey the drill sergeant in full metal jacket is cast as judge the center of reason and moderation slater has never been convincing and certainly is not here and oldman is on bad streak of hammy performances but the worst feeling you get while watching murder in the first is that the man behind the camera could care less about telling good story there are long exchanges of dialogue where the camera is not even moving near the characters let alone them how frustrating it must be for actors work under these conditions if there is anything that has alway distinguished american films over the rest of the world it is our ability tell good story have we forgotten

this is the worst movie have viewed so far in the avengers silly man dressed in bowler hat woman wearing tight leathers evil scientists dressed in teddy bear suits greater evil sir august de wynter wearing kilt the question is what could have gone wrong potentially great idea big name cast the same question was probably asked of last years stinker batman and robin feel the production got little too smug the script little smart and direction was somehow lost in the chaos of random events that collided together form movie my greatest criticism rests on the fact that there was no chemistry between emma peel and john steed thurman and fiennes something that was vital element of the tv serial of the same name the dialogue goes on and on about tea and other finer british perks but does not allow much room for character development and interaction except perhaps grate on the viewers nerves one wonders why the dynamic pair bother kissing in the end except for pure english formality connery as sir august does not fair better than thurman or fiennes his dialogue is as erratic as stormy weather mostly embarrassing and poor quality if there is movie you would prefer never see believe the avengers would be good choice for one thing you will not have witness product that is far inferior the three high profile names that is associated the title cannot understand how something so poorly produced could have been released but put it down one of those freak happenings in nature like lightning you cannot see it coming until it hits you

synopsis bigbreasted and dimwitted sculptress britt gets really mad at her grad student boyfriend because he spends too much time on his thoughttransference experiments instead of her art showings elderly evil scientist everett longstreet switches minds britts boy in the meantime and goes completely mental comments naked souls opens naked woman and the movie makes no illusion that it is scifi vehicle designed show pamela andersons um talents if you are really interested in seeing andersons talents however suggest you skip over this dud and watch the infamous pam and tommy lee honeymoon sex tape now available on home video at least that movie you do not have go through the painful experience of watching pamela try pronounce multiple syllable words like eclectic premise does exist in the movie basically while anderson wears skimpy clothes barely contain her talents she practices her art brilliantly slapping plaster of paris on naked women her boyfriend meanwhile spends hours day in morgue trying view the memories of dead prison inmates because this will make difference humanity whatever the movie fails explain how these two hooked up be grateful after we meet the evil everett longstreet lots of technobabble and mystical mumbojumbo get tossed about pammy has sex replete cheesy makeout music and minds get transferred never fear though pammy uses her sharp mental abilities ahem save her boyfriend in the end unfortunately no one saves the movie avoid this wouldbe scifi thriller unless you are in for good laugh or two

wonderland is rather sugary romance that is as subtle as ton of bricks falling on you you can see its plot developing from mile away you are lured into its benign story of single yearold girl looking for soul mate in boston as that city is depicted as miniwonderland for singles this is star oriented and the star who carries the is erin hope davis that this is dating about singles who for reasons of fate or luck or whatnot have not had successful match and are now putting most of their energy into fulfilling their careers is nothing new this type of has been done often and better many times in contemporary films the fictionalized documentary unmade beds did it more provocatively and more of sense of urgency than this the main quirk in the plot here is that hopes pushy mother hollan visits her in boston sees her daughters livein relationship radical protester hoffman breakup and decides put personal ad in the newspaper for her harvard medical school dropout daughter who works as nurse this is done without her knowledge it is cornball sitcom stuff but at least it is handled as best it could be the actors and director it is easy like erin she is bright caring and attractively blonde it is equally easy care for the soul mate she keeps missing contact the financially strapped ruggedly handsome intelligent yearold alan alan who no longer wants work his father as plumber but is doing volunteer work at the aquarium and attending college be marine biologist of course he comes across as being so good though he does kill some fish in the aquarium that it is hard believe he is for real or just some cardboard shining knight put into the story give it an ideal shoot for the contrived story revolves around their near misses in meeting each other in such spots as the subway at restaurant or on the phone alans brother answers erins ad few of his pals as they each try respond her ad in phony way making bet that the first who gets tongue kiss her that the others witness will win the bet this subplot was as obnoxious see take place as it is hear told that we have see erin go through several dates prove the point how ego sick these guys are each one more annoying than the other culminating in the most obnoxious one of all that brazilian lover jose who is about as charming as snakeoil salesman who is actually the one she nearly flies away for holiday in brazil was not only incredulous but downright contrary the rich presentation of her character that was the heart of the story anyway as expected alls well that ends well for this watchable piece of fluff that comes over on screen better than it does when relating its storyline the dialogue was actually not bad those dating erin or trying flirt her seemed be uttering authentic things they would actually say in their situation and oh the way wonderland refers the stop on the boston metro it is where greyhound racing takes place

be warned brit love story in the offing effeminate mildmannered karl is about take beatng from bunch of ruffians at school as he bathes himself under shower his genitals tucked between his legs in the manner of posing transvestite he is only just saved prentice who appears in all respects barring his protective attitude towards karl be your average streetwise punkinthemaking the ensuing scene ends up both boys being ridiculed and then unfairly expelled from the school they do not see each other for another eighteen yeas in that time prentice has matured into somewhat loveable if brash and bullheaed goon who screws up his jobs and relationships while gamely clinging onto perennial adolescence via lether jackets motorcycles and punk rock music karl on the other hand has grown up become kim drabby insecure woman who works as verse writer for greeting card company chance brings the two together and love such as will inevitably blossom in your quirky british romantic comedy is what this skewed little story is largely about if at this point you think you are going get any cheap laughs that genderbending theme see the birdcage wong foo priscilla queen of the desert you can just go home and brood on your own maladjusted sexuality you lowlife deadbeat kim is postoperative transsexual thank you very much newborn woman for all purposes confusions and sensitivities that deserve treatment touch of delicacy personally give me those cheap laughs any day would rather enjoy obvious camp than endure the shallow exploration of soft hearted transsexual love story different for girls comes up promising enough proposition but does nothing that surpasses the merely workmanlike it refusing make the audience really uncomfortable the notion of kim and prentices relation ship or at the very least feel uncomfortable for them prentice for example does not seem give hiself all that much grief when he becomes attracted kim despite being fightpicking beerdrinking macho kind of guy and kim for all her insecurities and fears is always saved any truly disturbing victimisation in the and instead drawing them into basically wimpy love story the manages lobotomise itself lightweight comedy as it is doomed be it could have still have hacked it the requisitive endearing couple but this does not either since even mrs doubtfire is sexier than steven mackintoshs kim foyle and as either sex he is just plainly simpering wanker nobody should like prentice does though and that is never explained but then rupert graves gives us so heroic performance as prentice the guy who never grew up and if there is bafta prize for most convincing portrayal of rabid fan at buzzcocks concert he should win that too that guess there is no reason explain why he is so screwed up if oddly enough you grow like this show you will be wanting your happy ending and the will not fail you there either snide underling at kims office gets her comeuppance misogynistic police officer who beats up prentice gets his comeuppance the couple prevail against disagreeable society and come together in kims apartment kims sister and her impotent sargetype husband kiss and make up after tiff tv movie subplot incidental juxtaposition and best of all kim sheds her insecurities and learns how ride the motorcycle and wear leathers making prentice ride pilion awwww terrific closure happy ending but just what is it that is differnt for girls anyway if you figure that one out let me know the flying inkpot rating system wait for the tv broadcast little creaky but still better than staying at home gotcha pretty good bring friend amazing potent stuff perfection see it twice

a silly that tries be black comedy but plays more like lightweight comedy its main asset being beautiful location along spains mountainous coastline howard pigeon jeff goldblum is yearold mineral water salesman who is married for years wife constantly nagging him elizabeth mimi rogers after surprise birthday party for him where his wife bawls him out for coming late his surprise party he confides his best friend that he cannot stand it anymore and then tells him his plan kill her while vacationing in the same barcelona hotel where they spent their honeymoon jeff is going through severe midlife crises worried that he looks older than his age he incessantly talks himself mostly agonizing over his bitter marriage and chastising himself why he went out elizabeth for second time and then why he married her just because she laughed at his jokes and was attractive he stutters and acts like man who has lost his confidence things change on their vacation as elizabeth makes an effort be nice while jeff now becomes the grouch he nervously rehearses his murder plan in the hotel room accident the gun goes off and into the pillow where he imagined elizabeth would be sitting when other hotel guests and staff come check about the gunshot he nervously explains that it was the tv realizing how unworkable his plan is he places the gun in the shattered pillow and throws it into the ocean while he waits for elizabeth but elizabeth found his behavior odd during the entire trip and when after great deal of effort get reservation at the hotels star restaurant he insists on eating in the room she decides she had enough of him and checks out without telling him as result he goes the police report her missing while the police telegram comes from his wife saying she left him and is going away because she wants be alone his boss and all those he works are sympathetic him and he gets job promotion but soon the pillow the gun is fished out of the water giving the police cause arrest him and search his home there they find letters he has written incriminating him the murder the police also find out from the hotel staff about the gunshot heard in his room in jail things look bad for him no one believes him including his friends and lawyer his boss fires him and the papers have field day the headline story pigeon jailbird out on bail he realizes that his only hope is track down his wife through call placed on his credit card he tracks her down mountain resort once there he learns that she took hike up the steep mountain and he gets priest be his mountain guide after telling him the true story the is watchable just for the antics of the jeff goldblum comic performance he is someone coming apart the seams while mimi rogers is his perfect foil it was mostly pantomine humor the comedy charged in the changing facial expressions of the characters and the absurdity of the situation very minor farce that might appeal the sitcom crowd the just did not take its situation seriously and the story had many gaps in it so it had no chance for black humor develop it instead played its setup of the henpecked husband acting out his fantasy strictly for entertainment value see how many chuckles it could draw

imagination create the fear in this movie well thought that was what the filmmakers were supposed do use their imagination and create good movie mean anyone can use their imagination and not pay bucks for it but even if you like this idea then what are you imagining an entity called the blair witch some rednecks fucking these kids are either of these things really scary when you think about it have special effects be scary or creepy actually the less the better see the equally awful remake of the haunting but you have do something you cant just count on us all having nostalgic memories of how shoot anything smoothly at all minor quibble there there is feeling in me that the people that like this movie are suckers that the filmmakers are just laughing their asses off all the way the bank and think there is good chance they will see this again and say themselves what was thinking but if they do not then thats fine if it works for them then that is okay guess just lament that making this movie hit we are going be subjected more of the nothing is more approach pretty soon we are going get some movies like this just still shot of prison jail cell for minutes and we will have use our imagination and think ourselves my god would not it be scary spend life in prison this movie is the scariest movie of all time or shot of coffin some funeral directors arguing each other man do you know how scary it would be die now this is the scariest movie of all time r

let me start off saying that leading up the release of the latest bond really was not looking forward it as much as have some of the previous films am not sure if it was the fairly lackluster trailers or the everpresent dread that the next will fall back into the miserable ways of the timothy dalton years am happy report that any doubts were erased after about the first minutes of the that point it was evident that mr bond was back vengeance all doubts would have probably been erased sooner except for the fact that the first ten minutes of the were not exactly pleasant experience it seems that nobody told the geniuses working at the theater that the house lights are supposed be turned off when the movie starts it took reminder from an audience member clue them in guess they can be excused though taking tickets and cleaning up popcorn between shows is extremely taxing on the brain anyway after somebody remembered what the light switch was for settled in for bond think the most noticeable aspect of this the th in the series is that it really goes back the almost tongue in cheek style of the roger moore films there were probably more oneliners in this movie than in the last several combined and bonds last oneliner in the is about the best of the series the world is not enough also contained perhaps the most action of any movie of the series everything from wild boat chases the usual assortment of cool bond gadgets trotted out just when there seems be no way out for for the most part the action sequences worked very well although there were couple of times that thought some things were bit over the top even for bond think some of the blame can be laid at the feet of director michael apted while he did good job for the most part there were points in the movie specifically during action sequences that he seemed loose site of the fact that he was making essentially an action most noticeably sequences on snow covered mountain and one involving bond getting through closing door looked like apted thought he was filming some sort of high brow art movie he almost seemed like he did not know what he was doing but they were brief scenes and really should not take away from the otherwise solid job that apted did in directing if you have ever seen bond you will not be shocked learn that plot has never been their strong suit the world is not enough is no exception this time we have yet another over villain that bond has stop for the good of the world matches wits the terrorist renard robert carlyle man who has bullet lodged in his brain that makes him impervious pain why this point is included is beyond me they took great pains explain his condition but it only came up later in the movie as scene that can only be described as looking like an afterthought anyway renard like the typical terrorist that he is is bent on some harebrained scheme involving mideast oil pipeline guess world domination just is not as attractive terrorists as money making venture anymore bond is brought in protect the pipelines owner elektra king sophie marceau who is the daughter of one of renards recent victims along the way bond has enlist the help of nuclear scientist dr christmas jones denise richards and his old rival valentin zukovsky robert carlyle like all bond films you basically just have suspend disbelief over the plot since it is ridiculous beyond words my biggest complaint would be that it was about the most disjointed of any of the bond films there was at least one point that had stop and try remember why bond was where he was and why he was doing what he was doing the buddy that saw the movie was completely confused over an earlier kidnapping of marceaus character it was alluded earlier in the movie briefly although not included in the later it became big part of the story and left him the distinct feeling that he had missed something but because it is bond the beautiful women and nifty gadgets seem make you forget about script problems quite quickly after all it is not shakespeare how about the cast brosnan seems get better each of his appearances as grew up the roger moore version of bond so really enjoyed the lighter style that brosnan brings the character judi dench as had bigger role in this than in her two previous appearances in the role she brought the talent her that one would expect from an oscar winner robbie coltrane was easily one of the best parts in goldeneye so it was nice see his russian mobster character revived in this movie coltrane gets more screen time simply leads him stealing even more scenes then there are the bond girls sophie marceau might be one of the most beautiful actresses working today there is just something about her breathtaking eyes that makes her natural play the innocent victim those that saw her in braveheart know she is more than just pretty face marceau may be the most talented actress ever play bond love interest then we have denise richards there was no doubt in my mind that she was cast exclusively for her looks and after you see the outfits she wears you will not have any trouble guessing what part of her anatomy caught the producers eyes was pleasantly surprised find that she really did good job playing nuclear scientist admittedly there was one point that the audience snickered bit at one of her technical lines of dialogue but other than that she stacks up no pun intended her bond girl predecessors nicely must say that the biggest disappointment was robert carlyles character while carlyle did fine job the material that he had his character just never worked for me the producers tried very hard add more complexity his character but it just never quite got off the ground guess was hoping for bit more regarding the whole impervious pain aspect of his character but the writers decided play up the emotional side of his character this might have worked well in another movie but do not go see bond movies for their deep characterizations last but not least we have desmond llewelyn as this is the th appearance for llewelyn as bonds gadget guy and he is as good as ever although his screen time has grown far more limited in the past few films he is still treat watch rumors abound that this may be his last appearance in the role he says future appearances are up higher power the producers have introduced his protege and future replacement bumbling and somewhat pompous character played comedy master john cleese while we do not see much of him in this think it is fair say that desmond llewelyns legacy whenever it is passed on will be in very capable hands so how does it stack up despite some problems the world is not enough is very entertaining movie and all things considered what problems it does have are small compared some that have plagued earlier bond movies this is easily the best of the brosnan films it may even be the best of the entire series certainly in the top one thing is for sure even after movies there is still plenty of life left in the james bond series heres looking forward bond number

seen september at m at the sony nickelodeon theaters boston ma theater matt perreault for free using my sonyloews critics pass theater rating okay seats sound and picture modern society is now inundated more sex and sexuality than it ever has been before from teenage sitcoms ncrated films about fetishes the biggest debate of the subject is whether or not it affects reality or just reflects it your friends and neighbors takes different approach as it is that revolves almost entirely around sex and how can be used for both pain and pleasure even within small circle of friends one of the most important aspects of the that most be noted and analyzed before the can really be dissected as whole is writerdirector neil labutes basic setup and some of the unique methods he employs tell the story firstly and most importantly is the fact the script tells rather complex detailed story of lust betrayal arrogance hypocrisy greed and just plain stupidity between six different characters three men three women without hardly any supporting characters few have line or two mostly extras everything they do will somehow affect another character and ultimately come fullcircle back themselves whether it be positive or negative but just state this is arbitrary and explaining and criticizing the process is difficult labutes ability tell his story through few characters is remarkable feat but what is specifically impressive is the fact the characters names are never revealed until the end credits roll for the sake of this review will describe the characters and refer them as their main
