characteristic another interesting accomplishment is the fact every scene takes place inside limited focus we are always able tell where the characters are someones home the gym restaurant hotel room etc but what the city they live in what year it is what the society is like etc is relatively unknown the is complete character study the tight intense drama of the theater no one plot dominates the story makes the first act bit tedious for its lack of background we are simply dropped in on the characters lives and are expected figure out the rest the characters are group of middleclass white people who are all successful at what they do but they are only concern right now seems be their sex lives first there is barry eckhart and mary brenneman married couple who are going through dry spell not unlike many other couples in other situations who do not know what they are problem is barry is kind of dorky businessman who loves his wife and the sex they have but does not have lot of ambition he just follows everyone else mary is writer of some sort but lacks aggression and emotion like her husband and is the meekness character but ironically does not hesitate commit adultery just feel something labutes script does good job in characterizing mary and barry as individuals but is very light on chemistry and connection between the two obviously this is the theme is enhanced the actors good performances but at the same time seems just bit hollow another couple is jerry stiller and terri keener who live together and seem have been involved each other for long time yet they constantly argue over anything and everything their sex life is also fraught problems and for some reason they continue do it throughout their infidelitous relationship if only one aspect of the could use improvement it would be this area it is natural for married couple become bored each other but why would two people who can barely stand each other continue have sex and live together what did they ever see in the other person begin labute never really answers but since the is more concerned the payoff than the process it still makes for good drama tension and manip ulation so intricate and deceitful it is fascinating two other characters act as catalysts cary jason patric and cheri natassja kinski cary is an arrogant hostile sexmaniac who defines the word bastard somehow he is able bend women his will either through charm or just attitude into getting his way he is the kind of guy everyone should stay away from as we realize he is secretly perverted but somehow barry finds comfort in his company although jerry is always nervous around him patric gives an outstanding performance so much so that we want know more about him despite how intimidating and unlikable he is cheri is character labute uses as catalyst see how the other characters react her she works in an art museum and at some point throughout the each character will engage her in almost the exact same conversation and her reaction is always different from becoming involved in relationship one brushing it off as small talk another being outright appalled yet another she is sweet woman perhaps the most normal of any of the characters and although her symbolism is obvious her role as the outsider is the most relatable will not reveal who cheats on who and how each character is specifically affected the others action as that is the hook of the the first two acts begin set up the characters and eachs scenarios but it is often difficult tell what they will do about it and whom the result is sometimes surprising other times predictable but the actual course of actions is always fascinating for while everyone has their fun but ultimately each characters guilt attitude or ignorance will disserve them one of the most important things note is how realistic the story is supposed be since the characters only interact each other there is not much pop culture references as almost everything has deeper philosophy behind it are we assume that these people are as the title states our friends and neighbors do not know of anyone going through the same situations as these people often times the is not unlike network melodrama other times situations are like those not seen outside porno movie but what this does have that the others do not is repercussions in the end although the creates its own reality it goes show that even the immoral are not immortal in what way your friends and neighbors is supposed work is open interpretation it definitely has lot say about the price that comes infidelity but it could have been even better had it expanded on that theme more specifically still it is an accomplishment in filmmaking because it has put timeless theme into modern perspective

the characters in palmetto collectively sweat enough fill lake erie and it is just the right way capture the films ripe atmosphere of sensuality tension and even farce this humid floridaset thriller nurtures modestly absurd edginess that often winks at itself is very much good thing since the actors and director are in on the joke as far as setup is concerned the movie is nothing we have not seen before but be patient palmetto spins some pretty wicked story twists that we really do not see coming it is not classic any means but it sure is quite an engaging surprise harry barber woody harrelson is fresh out of prison where he is served couple of years for crime he did not commit even though he harbors animosity towards the obtuse local officials harrys first order of business is return his home town of palmetto be his sculptor girlfriend nina gina gershon while searching for work he catches the eye of rhea malroux elisabeth shue the mysterious sexbomb wife of palmetto millionaire rhea proposes scheme thatll get harry easy play small part in the staged kidnaping of her jailbait stepdaughter odette chloe sevigny you do like risks do not you mr barber rhea alluringly coos boys form line behind me part of palmetto success can be attributed the performance of elisabeth shue who demonstrates here that her oscarnominated turn in leaving las vegas might merely be foreshadowing great things come shues seductive campy delight and pulls off barbara stanwyckgloria swanson combo admirable relish the other actors form solid ensemble around her including sevigny kids tantalizingly slutty as teen tease as well as the everlikeable gershon cast far cry from her extreme roles in bound and showgirls harrelson is still doing fine followup work the people vs larry flynt palmetto does have its share of grievances harrelsons narration is needless suppose and gershons nina cries be meatier than she ultimately is one of the plots unexpected angles that harry is asked the police become the press liaison for the very crime in he is involved could have been played little better there are moments when you question the tone but it is never so unstable that it deserves the reproach it is been receiving from most other critics if palmetto did not want be laughed at would it really have tacked on climax that plays like liveaction who framed roger rabbit although few elements can be questioned the movie works well on its own terms thanks juicy cast especially shue and the nifty material approach from director volker schlondorff you remember him from last summers suddenly repopular the tin drum right everything runs smoothly and for fans of revelationheavy endings this films got few shocks in store that will not even dream of revealing palmetto is generous amount of fun watch and that is all you need know

you have got mail is the very definition of cute movie it is got cute stars cute storyline and even cute pets despite this overwhelming cuteness or maybe because of it loved you have got mail know know am supposed be critic am not supposed love transparent and formula pictures like this but darn it somewhere along the way you have got mail reeled me in hook line and sinker the movie stars tom hanks and meg ryan as two somewhat unhappy new yorkers who meet in an aol online chat room and quickly become close friends without ever knowing each others identity as the movie progresses though they begin discover that they have lot in common each other meanwhile in reallife they are bitter competitors she owns quaint little childrens bookstore he owns one of those gigantic superbookstores that offer impersonal service and discount prices while his store threatens run her store out of business their online relationship grows stronger you have got mail is as artificial as movies come everything is nice and happy and the end all the characters have gotten exactly what they wanted out of life there are no real conflicts no major disappointments no unresolved issues nevertheless quite enjoyed it in fact cannot remember the last time had such good time at the movies think sometimes you have be able watch movie and just get drawn into it the fact that stars hank and ryan are at the top of their game does not hurt either in particular hanks is at his best here turning his charmmeter up everytime he was on screen he had my full attention and despite the fact that he was driving little bookstores out of business was rooting for him it was good see hanks back doing what he does best playing the affable everyman you have got mail certainly will not be winning any awards but as an exercise in pure entertainment it is as good as it gets

the sudden liberal emergence of personal privacy abounding in the news lately what that whole clinton thing going on you know million bucks discover the president got boinked an intern oh please government waste my taxes just bit more would you it is about time tony scott helmed the newest action pic disguised as an important if not slightly ignorant social statement this and crimson tide he is created two successfully chilly films that are interesting exciting even pretty smart but never totally riveting as cinema and the problem think each of these films is that each is too obsessed its message ever be really satisfying and too obsessed looking all cutting edge ever be totally smart that dealt civil war inside nuclear submarine over whether or not follow rules or question them and was appropriately scary and all but never totally thrilling or overly brilliant enemy of the state is the same way it is engrossing for its entire running time and it is scary the way that it shows mans decent into kafkaism but it is too technical it is too cold and not as fascinating or exciting as it could be it casts will smith one of the better big budget leading men in movies these days because he is charming and witty and never uninteresting and hopes that his charisma can make up for his character not being well developed enough really be person hate do this but last years the game got it damn perfect it casts michael douglas as deeply flawed human being man who is cold and has cut off everyone from his life and then pulls everything he thought he had as security blanket away from him and watched what happened the result was not only that was exciting and chilling but also the best mindfuck of the entire year not that want every kafkaesque be the game this years the spanish prisoner succeeds less thrills and chills but it should be an example of what works and what does not will smiths character is frankly too perfect at least too movie perfect he had an affair another woman lisa bonet ha ha but his relationship his wife regina king is basically fine regardless he has kid and he is raking in money as lawyer albeit very good and reasonably moral one so he generally does not have any real problems as human being and is therefore boring except that he is played will smith who embodies him about as much will smith charm as he can without entering id men in black territory he is good dramatic actor just see the first half hour of six degrees of separation for proof of this not that he is not great the whole time and here he makes his character likable and sympathetic without any real strain on his character makes the lack any real deep interesting qualities smith becomes involved in mass conspiracy involving the assasination of senator opposed government law that would create world surveillance extinguishing privacy as we know it from the world under the pretense that it would make crime easier control when he is passed disk of the event caught on tape an outside party nature observer played uh jason lee the government wants the disk and is prepared destroy his life get it as smiths plight is dramatized we are introduced the masterminds who surveillance him sitting in vans disguised as other businesses staring at computers and pulling out tricks faster than speeding bullet these guys played jack black jamie kennedy and seth green are the most interesting part of this because they are well fascinating they are doing their jobs are evil but the does not view them as such and they almost become our friends we like these guys for the sole reason that the does not automatically judge them as the villains they are also scary because we get the idea that they are not fully aware of the impact their jobs have on the world it is as if they are obsessed their jobs not because they are evil but because hey it is fun job and no one else can do it like them unfortunately this also backfires bit on the instead of being the flashlight in the darkened room that the game was you see everything and are thus not as freaked out because you know what is going on sure you are chilled but you are not exacty freaked out what is going on but what do you expect from tony scott the man who never met fivesecond piece of he ever liked he is notbad director because hell he is always interesting watch if not occasionally moronic exhibit days of thunder but the reason he is not great is because he is too technical and calculated his shots are perfectly executed and leave nothing the imagination and they are always making sure you are paying attention this is incredibly annoying and it reduces enemy of the state mechanical mishmash of flashy images that never expand the mind at any great depths but still manage entertain without any real problems despite never actually becoming great it is never actually boring and it is always intriguing watching the government setup smith is endlessly fascinating and since we care about smiths likeable protagonist we are setup for good two hours worth of tom clancyesque entertainment add the best big cast this side of the annual woody allen everyone from gabriel byrne dan butler pop up for cameos and you have got good old fashioned escapist drama does all the thinking for you so that you never have actually question the debate over personal privacy and so you can follow will smiths plight without minutes worth of boredom

mary nortons childrens book series the borrowers has been made into several belowaverage television movies so was not too enthused as entered the theater for the bigscreen debut of the minute clan but was in for shock the borrowers is actually thoroughly delightful movie plenty of good laughs and even some decent special effects the lender family is being thrown out of their longtime home their aunt who owned the property never left will now an unscrupulous lawyer ocious potter john goodman plans demolish the house and replace it an ultramodern housing development but the lenders are not alone in their house living under the floorboards is family of borrowers inch tall people who make their living as scavengers from the human beans above the clock family of borrowers is as distressed as the lenders especially once they discover the evil potter actually has copy of the will leaves the home the lenders so it is up the clocks pod jim broadbent and homily celia imrie along their kids arrietty flora newbigin and peagreen tom felton recover the will and save the household but when potter learns of the tiny people he enlists the skills of exterminator jeff mark williams kill off the clan there is plenty of attention detail in the borrowers especially in the furnishings of the clock family house made out of lost board game parts and credit cards the background details are nearly as rich as the entertaining story the various predicaments of the clock family are clever and thrilling based on an original story the screenwriters did good job at imagining all the potential and unusual perils that could exist for inch tall person as the villain john goodmans performance veers on the edge of being overthetop but his performance suits the role well and he does very well in the films many slapstick moments nearly seamless mix of oversized sets bluescreen shots and cgi the special effects in the borrowers are very well done there are few times when you can spot the effects at work but none of them are so jarring that you lose the suspension of disbelief hopefully the borrowers will surpass the curse of being labeled childrenonly movie for it is surprisingly entertaining and fun watch

touchstone pictures and spyglass entertainment presents birnbaum barber production in association jackie chan films limited production jackie chan owen wilson shanghai noon lucy liu music randy edelman co producers ned dowd jules daly executive producer jackie chan willie chan and solon so produced roger birnbaum gary barber and jonathan glickman written alfred gough miles millar directed tom dey rated pg for mild language adult situations drug use martial art action and violence minutes super mm panavision what can you say about jackie chan that has not already been said since the release of rumble in the bronx back in the s release jackie has become fairly recognizable commodity on americas video shelves having made over films jackie has finally succeeded in bringing his style of actioncomedy the west his latest release shanghai noon is joyful tribute spoof of the classic western and adding jackie chan into the genre the tag line for the the western gets kick in the pants rings true jackie stars as chon wang lesser imperial guard in the forbidden city of china the royal princess pei pei lucy liu is set be married the obnoxious son of nobleman from another prefecture unwilling follow her fathers wishes princess pei pei the assistance of her english tutor decides escape america but this is all ploy devised exiled guard lo fong will lead the princess kidnapping and ransom unable take any legal action the ransom demands are met and three of the forbidden citys bravest guards played cui ya hi rong guang yu and eric chen are ordered transport the ransom payment lo fong in carson city nevada chon wang pleads the imperial court and is given permission join the team as he is looked upon as buffoon on train in the s jackie meets up bandit roy obannon owen wilson he is much less of bandit than he is glory hog looking simple for the notoriety and fame that being bandit will bring him his gang in tow roy attempts rob the train when one of his gang murders the chinese interpreter of the royal court who also happens be chon wangs uncle chon wang gives chase foiling the attempted robbery but also leaving himself stranded in the desert as the disgraced guard wanders through the desert he again comes upon roy who has been left for dead his former gang buried up his neck in the desert roy pleads chon dig him out chon demands know where carson city is roy directs him and chon leaves but not before sticking two chopsticks into roys mouth and telling him dig himself chon soon finds himself confronted angry crow warriors friendly sioux tribe gunslingers horse that thinks and behaves like dog and an indian bride brandon merrill before once again running into roy shanghai noon is just good fun the chemistry between the cast is remarkable the performances are all acceptable within the whimsical levels of the jackies performance is as good as anything he is done before he is not called on do much acting here as the character is not written any depth but jackies natural charisma shines through and his comic timing is so perfect both physically and surprise verbally that once again he commands the screen whenever he is on owen wilson last seen in the embarrassing remake of the haunting gives good natured performance as roy obannon his innocence is refreshing and fun bad guy that is not really bad his scenes jackie are some of the best bits of comic dueling since martin and lewis lucy liu as princess pei pei is given little do in the script but for change does not play nymphet or some other deviant the character is noble woman of status and wealth but finds greater cause as result of her own imprisonment the rest of the performances are all broadly drawn comic performances nothing here is realistic mind you shanghai noon is first and foremost light jovial and the performances match that style ease the cinematography dan mindel is gorgeous using calgary alberta as the prime location mr mindel is able create lush romantic western feel the nothing here really looks like nevada but the locations are so beautifully shot and staged the can be looked upon as loving tribute earlier films of the genre and as such the script alfred gough and miles millar plays fast and loose history but reverence past films homage such films as high noon obviously red river and most notably butch cassidy the sundance kid all bring sense of nostalgia the it is comforting experience at time when the western is considered either old hat or irrelevant here is that embraces those old attitudes and dare say clich and manages make them palatable and refreshing here is that is not contemptuous of the genre this is the purest horse opera since the days of george obrian or john wayne director tom dey has crafted loving tribute hollywoods past in this his first mr dey shows both love of character and of craftsmanship that is refreshing see nothing here really stands out or takes ones attention away from the story or action and that is as it should be when jackie chan is your star and what of the action and stunts well while not up level of drunken master or any of jackies hong kong films shanghai noon is miles ahead of anything jackie has done in an american before his timing choreography and creativity are still as sharp as ever jackie even gets recreate few scenes from his earlier films obvious those of us that have seen those films but refreshingly fun for those unfamiliar finally jackie can honestly say that he has made an s his way and incorporating his style sum up shanghai noon is fun summer confection not too heavy and not too light fun and entertaining that the whole family can enjoy parents be advised there are scenes of smoking drunkenness and peyote use an enjoyable and charming that can and will be enjoyed again and again

the reunion is not an original idea in any way shape or form it is been done throughout history over and over again and has become one of the many subgenres like the prep school subgenre the angstfilled teen subgenre and the slasher subgenre what makes peters friends so remarkable is not how it does not follow the rules of this subgenre but how it follows it so well and creates characters that would not mind hanging what are the rules of the reunion subgenre well you need group of friends most of them married or at least dating and sometimes even married or dating eachother you need have them brought back together over some sort of crisis they are not have spoken together much since they split apart the reunion has come in intervals divisible they all have be slightly highly neurotic the reunion has bring them together seperate them little crises then bring them back together because after all they are friends there has be some sex or at least some making out either between the friends or other people that are there or were invited eightly they are all unhappy or marginally so there is some sort of sexual tension amongst some of them that is built up over the years the friends are all wildly successful in the world of entertainment and the arts sometimes internationally so the is filled nostalgic radio hits from the time when they were friends sometimes causing them get together in dancesong since it follows these rules so closely it will probably be and has been coined off as just british big chill and in some ways it is both follow the rules as said and both feature lots of bitching big confessionals and broken relationships but while the big chill was at least me tad too whiny and unsatisfying peters friends hits its mark making this funny dramatic and poignant the friends of peters were all in the same theatre group back in performig wildly outrageous british acts for people far too stuck up enjoy them the opening scene has them all dancing in tux tops and tutus after peters stephen fry wealthy father richard briers hardly on screen enough register but oh well dies leaving giant mansion him he has decide whether or not keep it not sure what do it immeadiately he decides throw giant reunion party inviting back all his old chums of course all or most of his chums follow the tenth rule andrew kenneth branagh also directing here is an actor who is unhappily married tv star carol cowriter rita rudner maggie emma thompson is successfuly publisher of selfhelp books but looks like she needs them more than her customers as she is lonely and unhappy roger and mary hugh laurie and imelda staunton who were also married in sense and sensibility are married and are the most successful creators of jingles in the uk but have suffered tragedy as one of their newly born twins has recently died and sarah alphonsia emmanuel is as promiscuous as ever having new boyfriend as of two weeks named brian tony slattery who is married and wants divorce because of her giving her doubts as for peter things seem okay the features lots of innerfriend jokes and even some old theatre anecdotes at least find lot of fun in as have done lots of theatre myself and there are big confessions brawls between the friends and the end almost everyone is unhappy even though some have resolved their problems long before the end kinda dug the final twist would seem forced an anticlimactic but for some reason felt the same way the rest of the friends did maybe it is because the people in this are so likable that just wanted join their clique that is really what makes peters friends so lovable the way you just want hang group of friends who can be so dysfuntional sometimes but when someones in crisis can come together wonderfully for one another it is when you have giant crisis like this and people want selflessly help you out instead of subtely pushing you away that makes you realize you have true friends and these people are true friends not mention kenneth branagh is able make the seem nostalgic for the a decade grew up in unfortunately without taking us outside of the there are some classics and anticlassics like tears for fears everybody wants rule the world but unfortunately no stupidfun songs think if ever did an reunion would put some crap go gos song on or at least some good old come on eileen but this is the british we are talking about oh well but anyway the direction is pretty good although nothing amazing branaghs forte is really making shakespeare fresh and magical but at least he is very good making less ambiguous like this the writing is good from rita rudner and martin bregman lots of good oneliners and even some really bad but good puns mock the fact that andrew lives in a peter while cutting some logs asks him is he has wood in a and andrew says no but we have punishment like that the actors as in most speaking movies are better than their material though some standout performances the six friends as well as the outsiders like slattery rudner and phyllida law as the old housekeeper of the peters mansion little note should be made about hugh lauries performance as he looks like he took some massive doses of prozac before doing this mean have never seen him actually act this dramatically peters friends is really enjoyable makes people like me pine for some sort of future reunion although do not know what kind will have like most people do not look forward my high school reunion because of the way these friends are still able maintain the same amount of care they have for one another and after such long period of seperation just look forward the day when can have friends like that

once upon time solitary ogre named shrek mike myers was really annoyed discover that his swamp had been invaded three blind mice seven dwarves and all the other fairy tale characters in the land banished from their home lord farquaad john lithgow unwittingly befriended nonstop talking donkey eddie murphy shrek travels dulloc speak farquaad where he stumbles into joust and comes up the winner his prize save princess fiona cameron diaz from tower surrounded molten flame and protected dragon so she can become farquaads bride the ogre agrees the task in return for getting his solitary lifestyle back in shrek it took four writers ted elliott and terry rossio the road el dorado roger h schulman balto and joe stillman beavis and butthead do america adapt william steigs childrens book the bad news they have genericized an already simple plotline while heavily under the influence of william goldmans the princess bride the good news there is so much wacky humor culled from both fairy tales and popular culture that this movie should keep you in stitches we get our first inkling that we are in for real treat as one of farquaads men intent on rounding up magical creatures offers five schillings for the possessed boy after observing dreamworks rendition of disneys animated pinocchio meanwhile within the castle walls gingerbread man being tortured farquaad spits icing and yells eat me before breaking down and solemnly asking do you know the muffin man shrek green giant bobbly antennaelike ears is grumpy recluse who really yearns fit in although who could put up his habit of making candles from his own ear wax donkey is hyperactive endearingly stunted creature who can talk and therefore believes will make great misfit pairing the uncooperative shrek donkey proves his worth sweet talking the princessguarding dragon the princess proves be more than shade offbeat after learning she is not getting the fairy tale issue rescue she is been expecting when fionas true colors are exposed including opportunies for some tomboyish gross out humor spark develops between her and shrek the scripts details are gleefully impish constantly poking fun at disney from the theme park world of farquaads dulloc its turnstyle entrance and it is small world parody of an information booth the blue bird meets most undisneyish fate after duetting fiona snow white style popular culture is represented references babe and charlies angels via the matrix myers chooses his so married an axe murderer scottish brogue for shrek in order give his voice some heft while this may prove distracting for anyone familiar that overall it works more than not eddie murphy steals the show as the fasttalking motownsinging donkey proving once again his talent as vocal performer is it another wink at disney that donkey is paired dragon creature murphy portrayed in disneys mulan lithgows good choice for the supercilious heightchallenged villain lord farquaad diaz is energetic but ultimately nondescript voicing princess fiona better choice would have been minnie driver who is proven herself terrific vocal talent in such diverse animations as disneys tarzan princess mononoke and the south park movie the computer animation looks terrific particularly donkey although it will not elicit the types of oohs and aahs of pixars work toy story bugs life toy story in keeping its hip style pop music is used like myers voice may be initially jarring but ultimately satisfies while surveying bridal candidates via dating game parody broadcast snow whites evil queens mirror farquaad is told fiona likes pina coladas cue jimmy buffet shrek has good lessons for kids and humor targetted at every age group in the family while it may be derivative of the the princess bride shrek addresses new generation similar sensibilities and does not suffer in the comparison

some movies have such an impact that they linger in your mind long after the credits have rolled making you think carefully and recollect on what you have just seen finished mike figgis leaving las vegas hours ago and it is still as haunting as when hit rewind on the vcr alot of people refer this as that flick where nick cage plays that alcoholic dude leaving las vegas is not so much movie about alcoholism as it is story about two people who except each other for what they are drunk and whore ben nicolas cage in possibly the best male performance of the past twenty years is the drunk his family and friends have long since abandon him and all he has left is his liquor in scene early in the we see ben staggering into resteraunt looking for friend of his mooch some money off of he finds the guy richard lewis having dinner buddy and two chicks trying crack witty jokes that just come out stupid when ben approaches the table you can clearly sense that everyone immediatly feels uncomfortable after lewis gives ben the money he coldly says think it would be best if you did not contact me again now even though through the course of the some much more depressing things happen this is when felt the most for ben there was such look of sorrow and dispare on his face not sound hokey or anything it almost brought tear my eye it turns out that ben was once semisuccessful player and apparently pretty popular guy now he spends his time getting robbed hookers and trying desperatly pick up women not so much for the sex but for the company for someone talk or spend time once he is fired from his job ben decides burn all his belongings collect all his cash and relocate las vegas slowly drink himself death one night he runs into prostitute brilliant performance elizabeth shue how far she has come since adventures in babysitting named sera she is involved in an abusive relationship her pimp scumbag who getsoff cutting her they are both very lonely selfdestructive people they immediatly hit it off both of them realizing that they need one another and it is not even sexual relationship they do not even have sex until like the last ten minutes of the leaving las vegas is not about plot the exception of what have already revealed all happens in the first thirty minutes or so the way there is not too much of story it it is more about people and how they react one another from what can see this is basically perfect the direction is great mike figgis doing brilliant mix between the glamor of las vegas and the moody smokey atmosphere of noir and it contains two of the best performances come out of the or any other decade for that matter but do not go rushing out see this movie without knowing what you are getting yourself into first off if you are easily offended frank sexual dialouge stay away from leaving las vegas it is filled lengthy discussions of orgasms rape and various forms of perverted activities involving burbon that is right secondly if you are not in the mood see very depressing do not see it however if you are cool those two things you are in for one of the most memorable experiences you will ever have

run lola run german import that gained stellar reputation at the sundance festival is dazzling and kinetic that deals the subjects of fate and chance for berserk and retroactive minutes of nonstop movement we follow fieryhaired heroine named lola franka potente as she sprints save her boyfriend from the clutches of drug dealers lola has roughly twenty minutes somehow retrieve marks in time save manni moritz bleibtreu from being killed the dealer but in something of pseudo groundhog day approach director tom tykwer gives lola three separate chances best navigate her way toward the goal in these trio of episodes we gradually learn the unique effects of fate for even if tiny changes are made in lolas journey the future can be seriously altered run lola run is an experience like fight club or the matrix in that each takes you through supercharged wormhole of bending reality in surreal and exciting ways in addition all three movies have visual style that separates them from the rest of the pack lola is no exception stylish quickflash camera work and cinematography that serves as scintillating eye candy from the getgo tykwers world is landscape of mood and color brilliant shades of red and pink including lolas fiery hair used as effective symbolism throughout it is visual style and mindblowing pace run lola run is one of the more invigorating movies of the year even more so when considering the fact it is all stuffed rather nonchalantly into an minute time period as heroine potente does little more than run wildly through the streets as the title suggests but she has certain flair and charisma her exemplary running form made me wonder if she is actually track star meanwhile bleibtreu does an equally fantastic job of bringing the dopey but passionate manni life both actors perform beyond the call of duty the dazzling fun comes from predicting what each episode holds in store for lola and the outcome is ultimately rewarding several twists and turns are unique and unexpected the other characters lola runs into both purposely and inadvertently include her banker father herbert kraup and friendly security guard armin rohde but aside from the two leads no one has more than few minutes of screen time additional stars that could not possibly be ignored are cinematographer frank griebe and editor mathilde bonnefroy who are both responsible for the films eyecatching visual elegance run lola run is subtitled so be prepared meet the challenge of reading the lightningfast dialogue occasional sections of it are especially fast this is only one of the minor chores involved in watching the other is the sense that we never get really recognize who the real people are in this hyperactive situation most are just chess pieces in tykwers elaborate game of visual presentation and he never really makes significant move any but the average viewer is likely be so absorbed in the action that few will realize the lack of potency in few elements of the screenplay few petty gripes aside this is wild exhilarating ride that turns maniacally on its wheel of originality most people believe foreign films are mainly boring talky character studies perhaps run lola run will recharge their batteries not only does this offer insight into some intriguing questions of fate and destiny it also delivers whiteknuckle visual rollercoaster ride of overwhelming audacity like how the experience must have been for the persistent title character run lola run is exhausting

in the sweet hereafter writerdirector atom egoyan takes us beyond the tragedy of death into the tragedy of living he shows us how it is not dying that hurts but rather the pain of living in the hereafter of death and dealing the loss and grief that it brings on cold winter day in small isolated town in british columbia school bus full of children slides off the highway and onto frozen lake where it cracks through the ice and sinks fourteen children die and numerous others are hurt for the residents of this small town all of whose children were on that bus it is an earthshattering event that resolutely alters their lives they have always relied on each other in the past deal heartache and pain but it seems that this tragedy is more than they can handle alberta and risa walker who own local motel and lost their child in the accident hire an attorney named mitchell stephens ian holm bring lawsuit against someone anyone for responsibility the bus driver dolores driscoll gabrielle rose is kindly woman who loved the children and although she lives burden of guilt is not held responsible for the accident the bus seems have simply slipped on some ice and there was nothing should could do prevent it however according stephens there are no accidents in life and someone will pay for this tragedy whether that be the manufacturer of the bus or the guardrail the bus broke through he goes through the town approaching the parents who have lost children asking them join the class action suit and find vent for their anger and for his work stephens will receive onethird of the settlement money however it is immediately apparent that stephens has little or no interest in the money he is driven something else something deeper that he shares in common the grieving parents he has lost child too but not in the same manner his daughter zoe caerthan banks who once almost died in his arms as young child after spider bite has been in and out of drug rehab clinics and detox stations for ten years she calls him on an irregular basis begging him for money but refusing tell him what she needs it for do not know who am taking he tells her in his mind his daughter is dead the lawsuit is stephens not only way mend the towns pain but also his own however not everyone in town wants it happen billy ansell bruce greenwood who was driving behind the bus when the accident happened and lost two children wants nothing do it he has already lost his wife and he buries his grief in an affair married woman he does not want talk about the accident and he sees the lawsuit as nothing more than the unnecessary opening of old wounds him the town should be able take care of its own pain and it does not need outsiders like stephens getting in the way central the sweet hereafter is the tale of nicole burnell sarah polley teenage girl who dreams of being singer before the accident turned her into wheelchair girl as she puts it aside from stephens nicole is the most complex character in the and it is she who ultimately decides the fate of the town and how the lawsuit will turn out it is also her sad haunted voice that we often hear on the soundtrack reading robert brownings poem about the pied piper and how when he led all the towns children away one was left behind because he was crippled obviously nicole is that child and she feels somehow betrayed that the rest of the towns children left her alone dying in the wreck her situation is further complicated because she is involved in loving but incestuous relationship her father tom mccamus there is only one fleeting scene that suggests this relationship but it is somehow tied into the final act of the of all the storylines in the sweet hereafter this is the most complicated and unresolved although its implications stretch throughout the entirety of the egoyan knows that the kinds of questions he brings up have no simple answers if any at all and he does not condescend the audience trying neatly wrap it up what egoyan has done in the sweet hereafter is really nothing short of miraculous in his adaptation of the novel russell banks he has made deeply moving about lawyer transcending the pettiness of law and driving headlong into the deeper meaning of what is loss and how pitiful monetary and material possessions are when compared human life egoyan has always been talented but distant and cerebral filmmaker whose work suffered only in that it felt so cold the sweet hereafter is quite the opposite egoyans stylistic and narrative structures work brilliantly heighten the impact of the natural emotion and draw the audience into the tragedy the sweet hereafter seems contain the combined emotional impact that all his other films lacked the is filled beautiful subtle performances from all the actors especially ian holm as the lawyer and sarah polley as the sad child who was left behind the beautiful roving camerawork paul sarossy and the haunting melodic musical score mychael danna both previous egoyan collaborators give the visual and aural cohesiveness the thematic elements like his earlier films egoyan weaves together multiple storylines that form blanketing whole he works time as fluid substance shifting back and forth between the past the distant past and the present effortless ease the actual bus wreck itself does not happen until midway through the but that time the event has built up so much emotion that egoyan can it from distance no graphic detail and still have it carry great devastating weight because human life has become such cheap commodity in movies it is astounding that egoyan can convey so much heartbreak in such simple direct terms certainly one of the best films of the sweet hereafter is deeply rewarding mystifying and ultimately human

when first heard about scream in was told that it was spoof of horror movies from the master of the horror himself wes craven it ridiculed the cliches of the genre overemphasizing them making the teenagers do what they know they are not supposed do when serial killer is stalking them do not run up the stairs when you can easily go out the front door never say will be right back etc when first heard this description figured that it was an easy way out of making bad movie how hard is it make an extremely terrible but claim it is actually mockery of other bad movies was this wes cravens remedy from making real bad movies such as vampires in brooklyn it just seemed cheap me then actually saw the movie and the first twenty minutes involving drew barrymore and nailbitingly intense phone conversation completely changed my attitude scream is not only clever parody of your standard horror flick it is also pretty scary movie if you have seen million of these kinds of films you know exactly what is going happen this is part of the fun of watching scream the movie reminds avid horror fans how similar and repetitive the genre is and it also reminds them how great guilty pleasure it can be watch pointless and predictable violence innocent attractive teenagers those who rarely see these types of movies scream is thrilling unpredictable ride that could be mistaken as serious slasher there is nothing wrong that misjudgment though have witnessed viewers from both sides of the audience the newbies horror and the fanatics their opinions on the were so different but both very positive from these varied reviews am convinced that scream has not only revived the teen horror movie and the normal teen romance movies but also the hilarious parodies of these and other categories films that both deride and celebrate genres like galaxy quest and the big hit would not have existed in my opinion if it was not for the outstanding success of scream the low budget gem may alongside pulp fiction be the most influential of the this influence may exist the chagrin of some moviegoers who despise movies like teaching mrs tingle or television programs such as dawsons creek but others such as myself we congratulate the movie that has opened new doors for excellent young actors screenwriters and directors scream is also an extremely funny movie thanks its quicklypaced script kevin williamson within the are characters who tell other characters as well as the audience the basic rules and cliches of horror movie mainly from the rants of randy jamie kennedy and stu matthew lillard we are reminded not only of the obvious and hilarious rules but also some of the more subtle stereotypes that when thought over are mostly true as well the virgin always survives have sex and you are dead meat not only are we treated these rules on plate but also the rules are referenced number of different films and actors the script feels like an obsessive essay from college geek who has nothing better do but find every little blunder from every little for his own selfsatisfaction in this case williamson finds these errors for the audiences satisfaction and amusement hear there is new movie coming out called scary movie is spoof of scream is spoof of scary movies will certainly see the but have the feeling that this parody will be more obviously ridiculing the genre rather than screams perfect subtlety however my last gut feeling about this stuff scream was dead wrong so who knows

in present day hanoi three sisters reflect on their parents relationship while trying define their own in writerdirector tran anh hungs the scent of green papaya the vertical ray of the sun youngest sister lien tran nu yenkhe greets the day hai ngo quanq hai the only brother whom she rooms and relentlessly flirts their morning ritual of tai chi and lou reed precedes crossing the street eldest sister suongs nguyen nhu quynh cafe where lien works for breakfast the three sisters lovingly prepare their mothers memorial banquet of traditional delicacies prepared as much for look as taste while giggling over the differences between the sexes after the family breaks from the banquet we learn that suongs young son little monkey is doted upon but there is distance developing her husband quoc chu ngoc hung who is leaving for one of his habitual botanical photography trips middle sister khanh tran manh cuong tells her writer husband she is pregnant before he leaves on trip saigon research tuan mysterious man in his motherinlaws past lien keeps crawling into hais bed at night causing him fall out of it the initial serenity we witnessed starts turning into soap opera before coming full circle one month later as the three women prepare their fathers memorial banquet the vertical ray of the sun is contemplative piece where strong passions exist underneath calm exteriors sly humor self deceit and harsh truths all exist in the cyclic screenplay tran anh hung and his cinematographer mark lee pingbin flowers of shanghai linger over and repeat the small gestures of everyday life wife washes her husbands hands woman makes water dance in bowl man pulls his lover face him before they part small spaces such as rooms alleys and courtyards create intimacy the color green symbolizing life and tranquility is used heavily in the films visual styling lapsing into yellowish hues and blues writerdirector tran anh hungs recalls ang lees eat drink man woman another tale of three sisters of varying modernity coming together traditionally for parent but while lees more traditionally storydriven resulted in radical changes for all concerned the vertical ray of the suns characters strive for peaceful harmony watching it is like trailing your fingertips in stream on cool spring day

star wars episode the phantom menace review review jamey hughton stars starringliam neeson ewan mcgregor natalie portman and jake lloyd directorgeorge lucas rated all the hype that star wars episode the phantom menace has been receiving it seems almost impossible avoid interest in seeing the the movie is easily the most anticipated motion picture ever marketing campaign so strong it has brought colonel sanders the taco bell chihuahua and pizza hut together can george lucas succeed yet again transporting us back long time ago in galaxy far far away yes this star wars prequel may be the worst of the bunch amateurish dialogue and an overall lack of humanity but that does not mean it fails comply on the basis of solid entertainment the phantom menace features the most eyecatching jawdropping visual look in cinematic history the tremendous action sequences will have you clinging your arm rest and the special effects are nothing short of the best and most plentiful ever be caught on the vast digitized worlds and sheer imagination that was applied this project is astounding the phantom menace is delectable feast for the senses even if it has some disappointing aspects after we are treated the famous prologue in the sky john williams thundering score we meet quigon jonn liam neeson and young obiwan kenobi ewan mcgregor jedi master and his trainee padawan they are on the ship accommodating the fleet headquarters for the evil trade federation and have been sent settle disputes regarding the taxation of trade routes the planet of naboo oh but enough about that the prime concern for this prequel is introducing young anakin skywalker jake lloyd into the picture as you already know this seemingly charming lad is the boy who will soon become darth vader spectacular pod race comes soon hereafter this particular race is the most exciting energetic highoctane action sequence that you will ever see one of the delights of the series is meeting the newest set of strange alien creatures that lucas has devised and the phantom menace is no exception loved sebulba the ratlike scoundrel whom anakin has face in the pod race and boss nass the leader of the gungans who are neighbouring species naboo one character who has been subject criticism is jarjar binks member of the gungan race jarjar speaks like roger rabbit on hallucinogenic drug and is there for the sole purpose of supplying comic relief yes he is initially annoying but can admit laughing over some of his harmless goofy antics there is some lack of dramatic pull in this star wars entry but the presentation almost makes you forget the plot and character lapses the final lightsaber battle between the jedis and the horrific and terminally underused villain darth maul is spectacular behold jabba the hutt yoda cpo and rd have cameo appearances lucas has not forget how captivate an audience even if his latest shows obvious signs of tiredness one can only wonder what the possible technology will present for the next two installments episodes and ii when they arrive you will know where find me

bob the happy bastards quickie review must admit no doubts single new is quite catchy it was bouncy and energetic enough get me go see this new from director doug limon the man who had brought us the humorous swingers little while back the result movie that is just as good as that song really it follows the lives of several individuals over the course of one weekend first we hear about grocery bagger sara polley who runs into monetary situation problem and ends up selling bogus drugs at rave bad results as drug dealer feels he is been swindled her then comes the story of an english grocery store worker same store who heads vegas for the weekend friends where sex gunplay and stolen car trouble come into play then we see the story of two gay movie actors played scott wolf and jay mohr who deal cops strange insurance presentation and hitting girl sara their car and finally we come another grocery worker katie holmes who has strange fascination said drug dealer the one mentioned earlier really it is all confusing keep track of in review format your best bet is just well go the movie features some very good acting from all angles and limon adds the same humorous energy he had swingers this particular product the dialogue is pretty snappy and the resolution is pretty well realized not going for the sappy happy ending nor the dreaded bad ending think of it as well ending the intertwining of stories is particularly good element the movie as it is never really confusing and tells different sides of the story like sliding doors kinda did however it is better suited for the younger generation who want little spice in their flicks sliding doors kinda is not

while watching shallow grave found myself periodically noticing thematic similarities the coens blood simple both are good films in several characters none of whom are the most conscientious have walked the earth but still are not really evil indulge in an act of deception that soon necessitates more serious crimes the body count rises and before long seemingly normal people have blood on their hands both films are also flawed but for different reasons blood simple is unrelentingly dark and moody but its characterizations were little hollow shallow grave on the other hand is nearly flawless for an hour and twenty minutes and then the filmmakers throw away much of what they would accomplished for more standard audiencepleasing ending the events of the were sufficiently intense and disturbing that honestly felt quite troubled what was witnessing on screen most of the time yet there was slight grin on my face at the end as the begins we are introduced alex ewan mcgregor juliet kerry fox and david christopher eccleston scottish trio living in an apartment in glasgow they are all sarcastic and occasionally obnoxious but other than that they seem like fairly normal bunch man named hugo moves into the apartments remaining vacancy and the next morning he is found dead of drug overdose juliet is about call the police when alex discovers that hugo had brought him suitcase filled the brim cash presumably from criminal activities the three eventually decide keep the money and cover up the death after drawing of straws the particularly unenviable task of mutilating the body so as make it unidentifiable and burying it falls david who had been the most reluctant partake in the scheme from the beginning all of this transpires in the first twenty minutes or so of the and part of what makes shallow grave so brilliant for while is that honestly had no idea what was coming next other than the obvious question of why they do not report the death and simply hide the cash is not addressed the plotting and characterization while sometimes predictable worked in way that kept my attention and on more than one occasion gave me chills will therefore attempt continue this review in way that does not give away too much of the plot broadly the trio are in danger due hugos underworld connections as two goons search for the money and kill several people in the process police inspector ken stott is clearly suspicious and visits the apartment asking pointed questions and trying unnerve the three suspects exchanging banal and weirdly humorous bits of dialogue junior detective david meanwhile becomes increasingly paranoid moves into the attic and develops an affinity for sharp objects director danny boyle effectively creates an atmosphere of mounting tension and suspicion in the apartment and finally the three seem ready turn against each other while do not consider myself the happy endings are automatically stupid type thought that shallow grave really should have ended in tragedy realistic analysis of the story up the last ten minutes of the would indicate that all three characters were probably about end up in prison in the mental hospital or in the morgue this could have been accomplished quite credibly but then boyle and screenwriter john hodge seem flinch and opt for more conventional caper ending in we get kick out of seeing who outsmarted whom and nothing more granted this is not really happy ending but it is still pretty lighthearted compared what preceded it really should not say anything more about the ending as far as details go but let me add that it seemed not only shallow and lazy but also inconsistent the rest of the and not very believable yes this ending made me crack smile for couple of minutes but ultimately it left me feeling as if would been cheated still shallow grave was brilliant most of the way through and it does at least meet the minimum requirements for an entertaining thriller and am therefore awarding it three stars guess just cannot help but think about that fourth star that boyle and hodge let slip away

since most movies about slavery shield us from the true horrors of what they are portraying it is fitting say that beloved come as real shock as it is confusing bizarre and as tough watch as any have seen all year and that is not necessarily because of the threehour running time beloved is challenging watch filled tough and powerful poetry that takes us completely off guard and instead of straightforward hollywoodized story about what happened the slaves after they were freed beloved comes off as cry of anguish from all those who actually lived through what happened or rather toni morrison who wrote the novel upon this is based beloved tells the story of an exslave named sethe played oprah winfrey who lives on large farm in the north her children when the opens her house is being terrorized poltergeist shakes things up wounds the dog and makes things generally uncomfortable for the family sethe is proud though and will not move her sons run away leaving only her and her daughter denver kimberly elise alone the ghost is there without any factual explanation couple years pass and the ghost remains and one day man named paul danny glover another exslave who knew sethe years ago when they worked on plantation together arrives asking for lodging he has been wandering around since he left the plantation and when he enters the house it turns red and becomes incredibly hot when he remarks about what he thinks is evil sethe replies it as not evil it is just sad some more time passes and paul has become fervent member of the household and the ghost disappears but when they return one day from going out they discover young woman sitting in the house her name is beloved and as played thandie newton she has almost zero motor skills she stumbles around halfgrabbing onto things and knocking them over and when she speaks she lets out low guttural sound that eventually turns into baby talk they let her into her house and she begins turn things upside down beloved acts like an incredibly difficult chamber drama paired ghost story most of the scenes consist of people arguing in one claustrophobic lowlit room the occasional flash the past where we see images of such horror that we thank god for modernday psychoanalysts sethe and paul have lived through such hellish times that they are forever implanted the memories of their slavehood on the old plantation includes such images as sethe being raped the white plantation hands her nipples being licked prompting her cry out paul when reminiscing about it they took my milk worst of all was the month after her freedom when she was allowed live like free person working other blacks on farm and then seeing that her old plantation owners have arrived presumedly take her and her children back she runs the barn near carrying her four children and when her old owners burst in they discover she has murdered one of them and is ready murder the rest of them if they do not leave them alone when she is inquired about this moment paul in moment halfway through the she says she does not regret it she killed her daughter so that she would not have live through the horror she did and she has convinced herself she did the right thing of course beloved is really her daugher materialized though we are not flat out told that until later on in the beloved represents the pain and suffering the slaves went through and shows how difficult it was for them deal their freedom after being tortured for so long thus beloved becomes sortaredux of the andrei tarkofsky scifi classic solaris where cosmonaut discovers that his wife who commited suicide years before has materialized when he is orbiting over planet complex brain system that spoke volumes about humanity and our memories how we are constantly regretting what happened in the past and when if it ever literally came back haunt us it would control us completely beloved moves along freely without lot of explanation and for the most part this is extremely respectable the most interesting films are the ones that do not explain everything for us leaving gaps in the characters that we are supposed fill in how they act in the present tense sethe is never fully explained as character but we understand all her actions since she is being played oprah winfrey it is been well over decade since her last major performance in the color purple but judging from these two films will bet she is one of the best actresses working today if she was strictly an actress her talk show suppose is great entity has prevented her from becoming noteworthy actress and that is shame because she brings so much this movie emotion sadness strength watching the strong sethe who is so afraid of the past that she is built rather strong protective coating around herself break down when she discovers who beloved really is is what makes this movie really great she makes it real that is not say this is perfect in fact would wager say that the fact that it is confusing and painful watch is what prevents this from being the truly great it is while oprahs performance is powerful and easily sympathetic and am dying see her win at least an oscar nomination this february the structure of the does not show what happened her children till halfway through the prevents us from really making cohesive connection the it does not necessarily move as though they are memories of one particular character and the end it has lost control over sethe and as she takes bed we are unable truly identify her anymore but despite its tediousness perhaps that is the point the distancing the end of the may be just part of the way it has been built from the start since they figure she has crossed over from being identifiable and it needs get back reality and for the most part this seems like the cry of pain from the slaves that it really wants be jonathan demmes direction is bizarre in nature the story and he creates the right mood making it tough sit through making sure that the audience feels as uncomfortable as the characters there is more admire here like the way that the flashbacks pop up freely and without real organization just like they would be in real life and the way that the ending leaves it somewhat open more pain and suffering but laced touch of optimism the acting not only from winfrey is amazing and anticipate not only she will get an oscar nomination everyone has been raving about thandie newtons performance and how it should be rewarded however it must be noted that out of everyone she had the easiest part act like baby throw things stumble around chew food your mouth open do think there is another performance worthy of oscar conisderation but it is kimberly elise as the daugher who has stay sensible and sane and has carry the burden of her mothers loss of reality towards the end it is not that newton is not great she is as annoying and wacky as the role demands it is just that elise has the tougher job and pulls it off even better despite the fact that this has winfrey written all over it and not that of writer morrison or director demme beloved has still not done well costing think around ninety million dollars it has since grossed about twentytwo unfortunately this is little too intense for viewers even for me and can stand almost anything recently viewed the hour long epic caligula the worst have ever seen in my life and did it in mere sittings although respect beloved cannot say that really enjoyed it

usually movie is about something more than soiled rug but not the big lebowski the new offering from the creators of critical hit fargo is say the least wildly entertaining originality has always been strong trait in the coen brothers movies and the big lebowski is insanely original it begins oddly enough when jeff the dude lebowski jeff bridges is mistaken for millionaire jeff the big lebowski david huddleston who is wife bunny tara reid owes money all over town two goons out collect on bunnys debt break into dudes house they attempt collect the money that bunny owes them and one of them urinates on his rug the next day dude explains his situation his bowling team steve buscemi john goodman respectively he is advised go the big lebowski and get him pay for the defiled rug he does this and shortly after gets tied up in kidnapping caper this is extremely funny movie lots of belly laugh moments the coen brothers have assembled great cast that play off each other perfectly also several great supporting roles john turturro as child molesting bowler named jesus the coens script plays off perfectly and it all goes together make it extremely entertaining doubt this movie will be nearly as popular as fargo but its off the wall moments make it so far the best of if you like anything else the coen brothers have done you will love this one if not they give this one try its little different

the opening scene of young couple in van pulling up loading their guns kissing each other and uttering what sounds like rock and roll actually it is lock and load you cannot help thinking tarantino and of course its storyline of crazy girl and boy in love who turn violent bank robbery the unapologetically takes its place alongside all those other films from bonnie clyde natural born killers but if most of those movies have their roots in pulp fiction exploring modern myth of the doomed rebels on the run normal life takes much more psychologically realistic look at the phenomenon inspired true events we have heard that one before and yet in no other tale of violent couples has it seemed so solidly demonstrated or so strangely poignant for this is story of real people whose lives take on steadily unreal quality who in their search for normal life find themselves increasingly unhinged beginning their final arrest the goes back trace the relationship between chris luke perry policeman and pam ashley judd factory worker they fall in love and marry but pams increasingly erratic behaviour going on spending sprees slashing herself knife after an argument begin trouble the solid and stable chris when chris gets sacked they find themselves heavily in debt and near breaking up then chris begins rob banks luke perry accomplishes the notinconsiderable feat of making us nearly forget that he was ever in beverly hills or buffy the vampire slayer moustached tough paternal look and yet voice and eyes that suggest sadness verging on exasperation he is perfectly cast as the longsuffering husband it is another of john mcnaughtons coups of castingagainsttype after transforming robert de niro into nerd and bill murray into gangster in mad dog and glory but it is the character of pam who commands centrestage and ashley judd rises the challenge great alternating currents of ferocity and tenderness making pam into fascinating yet often infuriating person if the performance falls short of greatness however it is perhaps because the role of the mad woman has been done so often before it is virtually staple of cinema whether it is in betty blue tom viv or georgia as in those movies there is the danger that the performance seems mannered collection of screwy tics and tantrums designed for the oscar presentation piece judd does not entirely avoid this pitfall but pams craziness is best and most movingly presented in counterpoint the more normal chris when pam reacts her fatherinlaws death showing up at the funeral in rollerblades and blaring headphones chris face is the picture of pained restraint of course it is the question of what is normal that is asked in normal life mcnaughton constantly offers up the ironies of the aspirations for the average domestic life and its kinship insanity it is the rational chris that loves guns shooting is about precision control and the crazy pam that loves astronomy and yearns for dog who is then called chaos chaos and you and me we are real family she notes wryly it is chris methodical mind and his knowledge of police procedure that allows him be such successful bank robber his wellplanned disguise as bearded roaring man of terror is another piece of method in madness in the carpark where he sets out for his first robbery huge sign on shopping mall stands out in the background buymore the perfectly respectable consumptioncrazy american dream that has driven pam her extravagant purchases and both of them into desperate situations it is not perfect some of the dialogue is touch too banal perhaps intentionally the use of the punk hardcore soundtrack in pams crazed scenes comes rather too close making emotional disturbance seem glamourous and sexy an image only detracts from the rest of the indeed as in mcnaughtons seminal henry portrait of serial killer it is the avoidance of glamour or sensationalism the denial of some of the standard thrills of the outlaw genre that gives this determinedly unflashy moving its great strengths mcnaughton has filmed this story quiet coolly realistic method that works far better than any nbk theatrics at unsettling the viewer the suburbs their miles of whitefenced houses and identikit malls take on sense of claustrophobic blankness in its very different way this makes for as haunting backdrop as the wide open spaces in terence malicks badlands while pam shares the yearnings of malicks heroes escape from ordinary life chris takes up crime precisely so that they can lead normal life their little house on the suburbs is financed his violent robberies but these are dreams defined constrained and even doomed the limitations of the normal conventional world pams final scene takes place at the edge of the suburbs where wild bushes grow symbolically the frontier the outer limits of her society but also quite literally the end of the road where there is nowhere left go but the final tragic denouement the flying inkpots rating system wait for the video little creaky but still better than staying at home gotcha pretty good bring friend amazing potent stuff perfection see it twice

it is not often that laugh so hard at movie that my head hurts but that is just what happened me at uhf weird al yankovics big screen debut uhf is television parody la airplane and like airplane the movie is extraordinarily stupid but it is dumb in the best way movie can be dumb it is so silly and outrageous it is hilarious the movie stars weird al as george newman world class nerd hyperactive imagination the type who fantasizes he is indiana jones and who uses hostess twinkies as hot dog buns george is basically loser his daydreams and smartalec attitude perpetually prevent him from holding onto job for more than two weeks but george finally gets chance funnel his creativity into something productive when his uncle wins channel in poker game and makes him the general manager of the struggling uhf television station george revives channel innovative programming shows like wheel of fish and movies like conan the librarian as the stations ratings rise it comes into competition channel the leading vhf networkaffiliate as j fletcherchannel illnatured hardnosed ownerveteran stage and actor kevin mccarthy is flamboyantly sleazy he really hams it up his snorts grimaces and scowls uhf satirizes anything and everything do television including game shows tabloid talk shows childrens shows dizzy news women and movieseverything from rambo close encounters the funniest scene the one that made my head spin is commercial for spatulas has be seen be believed like most movies in its genre uhf is hit or miss for every gag that works at least one fizzles for instance weird als mock video of money for nothing dire straits is only mildly amusing and brings the grinding halt although it does have some nifty computer animation but the funniest bits in uhf are so hysterical that we can forgive the ones that fail we know another gut wrencher is on the way in fact uhf hits the mark often enough make it the most effective airplanetype movie since well since airplane much of the credit goes weird als exceptionally inventive script and the movies winsome cast weird al seems little stiff at the beginning but because he is not afraid look silly he ultimately has lot of fun his character the real standout is michael richards as stanley the dimwitted janitor who becomes the host of his own childrens show stanley spadowskis playhouse stanleys offbeat mixedup personality is big hit the audience and makes him an overnight star he is an endearing mixture of goodnatured innocence highenergy enthusiasm and puppydog cuteness and above all he is good janitor who adores his work another highlight is vintage cameo the incomparable emo philips the cast also features gedde watanabe the chinese foreignexchange student in sixteen candles as the karate master who hosts the hit series wheel of fish also aboard for the ride is fran drescher who plays pamela finklestein channel roving reporter unfortunately as weird als girlfriend victoria jackson is wasted in role that calls for nothing but whimpering whining and sulking her character is extraneous and should have been either further integrated into the story or cut from the script altogether while uhf is not an absolute mustsee it is definitely the ticket if you are looking for wild and zany whackedout comedy the movie is good enough see in the theaters but it may work even better on television the very medium at it pokes fun

it is hard not recommend the others the supernatural thriller written and directed alejandro amen bar open your eyes adroitly establishes and maintains lowkey atmosphere of menace the cinematography javier aguirresarobe is as good as have ever seen and nicole kidman gives another in her growing body of fine performances but the pacing of the story moves from deliberate downright sluggish and the payoff of the tale left me less than satisfied overall the plays like very high quality version of any number of old twilight zone episodes where the characters spend great deal of time wandering about looking afraid and disoriented only learn they are actually childs toy military test subject or department store dummy watching those vintage shows and listening the players chatter always wanted shout get on it as much as appreciated the atmosphere and acting in the others my reaction was much the same set at an island mansion off the coast of england during world war ii the story focuses on grace kidman who tends her children anne alakina mann and nicholas james bentley and worries about her husband charles christopher eccleston missing serviceman anne and nicholas suffer from photosensitivity and grace patrols the estate the keys all doors protecting the little ones from excess light making sure that only one door is open at time at the beginning of the three servants mrs mills fionnula flanagan young mute lydia elaine cassidy and mr tuttle eric sykes an aging gardener join the family the two that speak seem agreeable enough at first but it soon becomes apparent that they know something that grace does not make matters worse the children are upset nicholas is unusually jittery and anne claims be seeing ghosts grace attempts blame the troubles on the new arrivals her home only realize that whatever is happening is beyond them that is essentially the whole story the tension growing until the pivotal moment when everything becomes clear earlier there is an outstanding scene where grace darts outside only be enveloped in fold after fold of shimmering fog the visuals in the otherworldly sequence courtesy of aguirresarobe are simply astounding also enjoyed the presence of religion rarity in films dealing the supernatural grace is christian and answers her childrens questions about life and death the assurance of devout worshiper when mother is away though the kids speculate whether her statements are fact or folklore just as real children do but those nice touches fail enliven that is too slow or make up for lackluster ending the others sets out be classic ghost story but fails grasp that special something that makes such films more than layers of mist
