private matter is based on the true story of sherri finkbine and the events in her life during the after becoming pregnant for the fifth time she learns that some tranquilizers she had taken have seriously deformed her unborn child she and her husband decide the help of her doctor have an abortion but this is the and abortion is illegal her doctor has made arrangements have the procedure performed withing the law claiming that the child is endangering the mothers life everything is about work out just fine until sherri has the uncontrollable urge talk about her situation local reporter this sets off media frenzy and immediately sherri is the most hated woman in the world she and her husband are fired from their jobs reporters are surrounding their home at all times and most importantly no one in the country and eventually other countries will perform the abortion this causes emotion problems for all involved private matter is fascinating story and it is hard believe that this only happened years or so ago it is only flaw is that not once is there ever satisfactory confrontation sherri and any of her opponents one woman passing her on the street telss her burn in hell and when sherri appropriately yells back just tell me what am supposed do the woman has no answer no one apparently had an answer they just wanted control what should have been only the choice of sherri and her husband this is an important telling an important story it is not just about not wanting another child it is about not wanting child who will cause severe changes in their family none of could be beneficial sydney pollack served as executive producer for this made for hbo movie

director jan de bont certainly knows how make top quality action films you need look no further than die hard he was director of photography speed and last years twister for examples of his hi octane edge of your seat thrill prowess speed is no exception this time the action takes place on huge cruise liner on sandra bullock and jason patrick are trying develop their relationship yep that is right no keanu reeves this time but fear not jason patrick is more than up the job speaking of the job at hand is stop completely bonkers terrorist willem dafoe from crashing the liner into huge island after stealing diamond collection the reason for this act of destruction is revenge after years of working for the company that builds cruise liner computers he contracts copper poisoning and is retired naturally what entails next is lot of runningjumping about and general high quality action as jason patrick does his level best save the day thinking back on this you cannot help but admire it is structure the way willem dafoe initiates his plan and throws red herrings the crew and passengers the race against time save the liner from crashing and of course the finale chase scence although this is ruined an over the top one too many stunt and explosion simple in construction effective in it is execution and the result clear and concise highly enjoyable action the acting is adequate although it is darned obvious that sandra bullock is only in it create hot totty appeal the men and she does that perfectly jason patrick fills the action hero role superbly and willem dafoe is just great as the crazed terrorist overall speed is most enjoyable thrill ride not up it is predecessors high calibre but very good all the same there is plenty going on some of the thrills are quite tense and it also proves that you do not need blood and guts make good action movie

after indecent proposal and up close and personal redford was wise direct himself in picture at last redford may look great onscreen but over the past few years he is proven himself bigger talent behind the camera ordinary people is one of the best films of the nineteeneighties and it was the first picture he helmed while the milagro beanfield war was only occasionally successful at combining magicrealism um realism and have never been much of fan of river runs through it the chagrin of many quiz show was dazzling energetic and convincing the horse whisperer represents both his directorial return nature films and the first time in that subgenre redford seems equally concerned humans and scenery scottthomas plays annie maclean an uptight but respected new york magazine editor whose daughter grace johanssen loses leg and good friend when an early morning ride climaxes their horses colliding semi graces horse survived but barely and has gone mad annie refuses put the animal out of his misery believing that if the horse heals it will mend graces newlybroken spirit eventually mother and daughter travel alone montana be tom booker redford famed horse whisperer who has gift of calming horses simple looks and touches leaving busy husband neill behind eventually they move onto the booker ranch the rest of toms family and annie finds herself falling in love all things montana including naturally tom the wise and lonely trainer the horse whisperer is delicately made dare say lyrical since many peoples ear that word is synonymous boring hardly the horse whisperer has little offer in the way of surprise but it does have an honesty that is refreshing and consistently enjoyable watch especially in the final third of the story scottthomas and johanssen seem like mother and daughter and you have no doubt believing that the mountain vistas would put these new yorkers under spell especially since p robert richardsons photography casts montana as heaven on earth gimmicky but effective technique the filmmakers employ is switch in aspect ratio from squarish widescreen when the central location shifts from new york montana the underrated sam neill turns in perhaps his most heartfelt emotive performance as the niceguy husband who is as authoritive and likeable as tom he is indeed refreshing change from the sexist lout of husband so many writers resort as shortcut for explaining away the cheating spouses motivation unfortunately one of the horse whisperers only flaws is the chemistry between wouldbe lovers scottthomas and redford liked both of them but did not necessarily believe that redford would fall for such cold fish even if the countryside air thawed her slightly luckily and curiously this is such rich and textured movie that it does not quite mattertheir adultery seems like an afterthought the obligatory subplot that ties many of the characters complex relationships together

sam matthew broderick is an astronomer in small american town and engaged teacher linda kelly preston he is head over heels in love and lindas sudden departure new york city live her new lover anton tch ky karyo comes as complete surprise him but as we all know love is blind and so sam leaves for new york as well win her back he moves into an abandoned house across the street from antons apartment and installs camera obscura watch them suddenly antons ex maggie shows up but she does not want her former lover back on the contrary all she wants do is vaporize him she may say that she does not want kill him but the possibility does not bother her too much either after all people die every day in spite of their different motives the two team up and fall for each other as things move on the story sounds like something we all have seen million times but we have not griffin dunne brings us the most charming comedy since while you where sleeping the camera obscura adds special something the movie and makes it an exceptional romantic comedy everything about the movie is perfect from set design casting the dialogues are inspired and the touches of black humor add certain bite meg ryan known from when harry met sally or sleepless in seattle surprises in role that may finally help her get rid of her sweet little girl image she impresses the viewer as maneating biker girl even more surprising is the fact that the viewer believes her much more so than in last years courage under fire where she played gulf war pilot matthew broderick is the goodnatured and somewhat naive sam who has trouble accepting reality the viewer can tell that he does not only watch the stars but also tries reach out for them he has trouble keeping in touch reality after all who would leave everything behind chase lost love his naivet that we do not question for minute throughout the movie clashes maggies exaggerated wish for revenge she would do anything harm anton she does not hesitate use sam for her plan and makes him understand right from the beginning that nothing will happen between the two of them that makes the scenes when they innocently share bed have potatoe chips and watch the action across the street like saturday night show on tv even funnier tch ky karyo is perfect as anton he is well repulsive that is all there is say about him you cannot really manage pity him even after all his mishaps he not only took sams bride away from him he is also french chef worlds collide e the usa and france this can only go wrong even if maggies revenge schemes are at times shocking you just cannot sympathize man who plays je taime moi non plus on his tape deck not everyone is captured the french charme that linda and even maggie fell for sam certainly is not too bad for anton for him things take turn the worse addicted love is one of this years most pleasant surprises

copyright graeme huggan carry on henry is all about henry viii and his eight wives sid james plays henry who no sooner has the started is getting rid of his present queen and hopes find another one soon as part of his alliance france he requests the handinmarriage the queen of normandy joan sims she comes england in the hope of marrying henry but when he finds out that she loves garlic and has reeking garlic breath he is totally averse the idea of marriage henrys court is very corrupt the cardinal terry scott trying bribe cromwell kenneth williams and cromwell trying bribe the king there is state of crisis when the king puts marie the queen sims in the tower of london ready for execution the queen is pregnant but she has not liased the king before so fingers are pointed at sir roger de lodgerley played charles hawtrey who has rather lecherous character play this time the cardinal and cromwell decide get signed confession from sir roger using all kinds of torture devices owing circumstances sir roger is sometimes needed sign that he is the father and sometimes that he is not this is because of renewed threats the king of france peter gilmore come over himself in the end he does then henry has found himself new queen played none other than barbara windsor it looks like he has some explaining do there are standout performances sid james as henry joan sims as marie and terry scott in an unusual role as the cardinal also there are cameos from kenneth connor and peter butterworth who plays barbaras father the set and costume design is first class and the overall production of this is good there is even an early appearance from david prowse who later became the green cross code man and darth vader the does have it is downsides though as it is getting pretty routine for the carryon team stage historical films and the inventive streak of the script seems run out pretty quickly there is also the absence of hattie jacques and bernard bresslaw who could have helped the along however overall the is funny and there are plenty of laughs and saucy jokes so that is why mainly recommend it carry on fans only but there is enough humour in the make it worth anyones while sit down and watch it

this dumb cowboy blondie who thinks he is darn good loverboy decides leave his dusty ol town somewhere in texas and go new york he puts on his beloved cowboy attire and off he hops on the next new york coach when he arrives new york he immediately sets out play mr playboy thinking he is the best darn stud in the wholo new york city obviously he fails he meets the cripple rico dustin hoffman who is terrifically good in bar rico has leg that is paralysed from the knee down so he walks in peculiar way rico is thief and wants get some money off this rich dumb cowboy he cheats our cowboy out of through somewhat detailed routine and disappears soon our cowboy runs out of money he gets kicked out of his hotel and starts getting hungry walking through the city everybodys talkin playing in the background oh and his prided techno transistor radio in hand he spots rico in cafe rico halfscared pours out all the money in his pocket filthy cents our cowboy hungry is forgiving he is glad he found someone he knows rico offers make it up for him and he invites him his place and what filthy cold place it is our cowboy falls asleep instantly in the junk bed when he finally wakes jumps up he finds rico looking at him you wanna cupacoffee rico asks in his friendly sleazy somewhatchildish manner while he smokes on ciggy what are you goddamn faggot what do you want from me where are my shoes what did you do them but all his doubts turn out be unfounded rico really has heart together they live in the junk apartment and almost freeze death rico is convinced that the best place be is florida where the sun shines beautifully and there are lots of coconut trees but he falls sick and is convinced that his cure is go florida we will soon be in miami is the last sentence uttered in this and what shocking moving end of it is the classic theme music midnight cowboy helps bring about the feeling of attachment that most viewers will experience towards the end of the whether the attachment is the two main characters or their dreams is probably as debatable as whether it was the acting or the direction that makes this so memorable

playwright tom stoppard and screenwriter marc norman took on an astonishingly difficult task they wanted write script about william shakespeare that parallels shakespeares works they also wanted poke fun at the way all of us envision shakespeare mean really who does not think of shakespeare as guy seething so much passion that he can barely write play without exploding into passionate introspective verbal couplet of iambic pentameter stoppard and norman are men who love shakespeare and they wanted make movie for everyone else who loves shakespeare and despite the difficulty of their task they have succeeded shakespeare in love is one of the smartest funniest most touching films of the year it is so rare that picture such high aspirations succeeds in all of its endeavors but here we have movie that defines success it is at once charmingly acted and flawlessly written it could have been smug selfimportant movie that panders diehard shakespeare fans but the appeal of this is almost universal if you have ever read play shakespeare or know anything about his life it is likely that you will find grand entertainment in shakespeare in love joseph fiennes brother of ralph stars as shakespeare himself he is delightful irresistible lad concerned mostly women and detached from lifes more serious problems debt plague etc he is commissioned write plays for various people queen elizabeth judi dench wants comedies while local slimeball philip henslowe geoffrey rush needs him write play so that he can pay off his debts hugh fennymann tom wilkinson shakespeare however has trouble focusing on his work he begins work on comedy about boy named romeo and girl named ethel this all changes however when he meets viola de lesseps radiant gwyneth paltrow young heiress set marry the financiallyoriented lord wessex colin firth shakespeare instantly falls in love her he first meets her when she pretends be man try out for the part of romeo he discovers her identity and confronts her later she of course falls in love him although their love is doomed because she absolutely must marry the tyrannical lord wessex but she continues act because she loves shakespeares writing so much and soon the production later becomes romeo and juliet is set be performed shakespeare in love is an amazingly good not because it works as great entertainment but because it pays attention detail and knows its subject matter was instantly won over joseph fiennes in the lead role he has such searing optimism and energy he is clearly man who admires shakespeare and even in the shortcomings that he gives his character inability turn away from women attention deficit disorder we sense great deal of affection and care he practically overflows passion in every scene fiennes is matched paltrow whose english accent is so good that wonder where she actually comes from she is an actress who exudes strength and conviction in every performance have seen her in the two performers work perfectly together taking the passionate scenes as far as possible without making them melodramatic and wringing the comedic scenes for every conceivable laugh of course it does not hurt that they have masterful script work stoppard whose play rozencrantz and guildenstern are dead inspired an interesting is full of dry wit and boundless understated humor all of his plays have similarly dry humor the first intelligent step stoppard and norman took was harmonizing the events of the romeo and juliet one of the funniest scenes in the is an imitation of the famous terrace scene from the play in the movie shakespeare is bumbling about while viola is trying fend off her nurse maid director john madden does fantastic job dabbling in slapstick humor scenes like these would have seemed obtuse in the hands of lesser director am going have see the movie again am certain there are numerous references that missed in fact doubt it is possible gather everything just one viewing stoppard is master of detail you will notice familiar lines placed throughout the not as lines of play but as dialogue suggesting that shakespeare simply spoke like that all the time there is also brilliant running joke in shakespeare is in constant competition christopher marlowe and the fact that marlowe is played the openlyhomosexual rupert everett is joke in of itself proposing slightly twisted explanation marlowes mysterious death in pub there is also scene featuring wideeyed dog that is so funny that hurt myself laughing there is no dog in this play no no dog the ensemble cast is perhaps the strongest this year geoffrey rush is nearly unrecognizable as the detestable henslowe wilkinson is also hard recognize but has great role as thug who takes his part as the apothecary so seriously ben affleck playing one of the actors in the company shows great range both in his accent his is almost as good as paltrows and in humor he has some of the best oneliners in the movie colin firth always stuck playing the sap does good job being hateful judi dench however has the best supporting performance as queen elizabeth rarely has so much depth been conveyed in so few words my single minor complaint about shakespeare in love is that feel like could have been more moved the end the story is moving but there are few missed opportunities in the final scenes but my quibbling is not important what is important is that acknowledge the quality of this picture the sheer skill it has been written acted and produced shakespeare in love tries so many things and nails every one of them it is that both loves shakespeare and makes fun of him in the actors writers and director are all perfectly in sync it is also movie that has the potential introduce lot of people shakespeares work in positive way without seeming condescending or superior admire this not only because it passes so pleasantly but because it has lofty aspirations and succeeds in them not just any can poke fun at shakespeare and get away it

titantic writer and director james camerons much anticipated and sometimes ridiculed epic arrives shortly into the theaters so the question naturally arises whether the is worth it as business proposition it seems hard see how it can ever break even but as movie it is nothing short of wonderful if you have already neatly categorized it as yet another disaster movie la volcano or the poseidon adventure think again the movie is both great love story told the disaster as backdrop and portrayal of one of the worlds most memorable disasters made real and personal seeing it through the eyes of two young lovers in either case it is filmmaking at its best when we entered the press screening my wife asked the publicity rep if there would be an intermission since the runs three and quarter hours long he said no but that the time would go so fast she would never notice the length amazingly he was right titanic is one of the few long films that does not suffer because of it the lush picture filmed russell carpenter in mm opens in the present two diving subs exploring the wreck of the titanic on the bottom of the ocean fortune hunter brock lovett bill paxton leads the expedition looking for the worlds most valuable diamond necklace that went down the ship known back then as the ship of dreams the necklaces hundredyearold former owner rose dewitt bukater gloria stuart finds brock tell him her story although almost all of the movie happens in flashback one of the engineers shows the elderly rose exactly how the ship was sunk using computer simulation the movie takes the time explain what will happen later adds immensely making lucid story out of what would have otherwise been hopelessly confusing after twenty minutes the story makes its jump the past as the titanic leaves on her maiden voyage in classic movie theme the two parts of the ship first class and steerage thirdclass exist in sharp contrast the strength of the script is the way it paints the differences between rich and poor without excessive moralizing entering the ship on its day out is rose along her millionaire fiance cal hockley played perfect snobbishness billy zane and thanks last minute winning poker hand an itinerant artist named jack dawson gets himself into little shared cabin in third class even her own promenade deck rose feels trapped on the ship what an upcoming marriage man she loathes in contrast jack can barely contain his euphoria at being on board after jack saves rose from committing suicide they start brief but impassioned love affair never tawdry and rarely explicit their romance has the power sweep the audience into the story leonardo dicaprio in his best performance ever plays jack confidence and charisma in so many ways small and large he makes all the right decisions in his approach the part when he confronts cal for example he remains composed and polite and yet subtly undermines every one of cals supercilious putdowns kate winslet gives wonderfully captivating performance as young rose the chemistry between these two academy award nominees him for what is eating gilbert grape and her for sense and sensibility is nothing short of astonishing from the scene where he embarrasses her repeatedly asking if she loves her finace the beautiful one of them hanging off the ships bow the one where she embarrasses him asking him paint her nude they dazzle the screen pair of mesmerizing performances if the breaks after an hour and half is how long cameron wisely waits have the iceberg show up you will still get one of the best films of the year peter lamonts sets are more than authentic one scene for example starts the planningtoretire captain played insouciance bernard hill having his tea on deck it then shifts the ships massive gears and then the brighthot boiler room filled sweating muscular men shoveling in the coals the handsome interior common rooms of the ship resemble palace more than an ocean liner easily the most fascinating part of the story is what happens after the iceberg hits and before the battle the water begins in earnest at first since the iceberg tears series of little gashes in the hull not some big gaping hole the passengers view the hit as more of curiosity than anything else what lark we have struck an iceberg now let us get back our brandy and cigars the ships musicians play like troopers through it all even after the panic sets in after all they see it as their duty calm the passengers when the musicians are about die they politely thank each other for the pleasure of being able play together and they mean it their civility borders on insanity but it is touching nevertheless the story is so rich that my description has merely touched the surface there are more than enough characters love and hate and all of the casting is deadon special effects work best when their presence becomes almost undetectable in titanic for he created ninetenths scale model of the entire ship cameron strove for accuracy at all costs the most dramatic moment in the happens when the ship breaks in two and the front section becomes vertical in the water people are flung like ants either into the water be shortly frozen death or into other parts of the ship be crushed immediately besides being romantic and dramatic the script includes liberal doses of humor from the many deliciously subtle verbal putdowns the physical comedy as when jack teaches rose spit like man the show elicits laughter in addition perhaps few tears it is goodbye for little while less than confident father tells his little girl since it was indeed women and children first this boats for mommies and children therell be boat in little while for daddies basically there was design decision have fewer than half of the necessary life boats it made the decks look too crowded otherwise perhaps the sinking is best summarized one of the guggenheims onboard the ship in the dining room the lifeboats gone and the ship certain sink he is offered life jacket one of the crew no thanks the elegantly attired guggenheim replies we are dressed in our best and would prefer go down like gentlemen but we would like brandy titanic runs it is rated pg for tastefully and delicately presented sex and nudity and would be fine for kids twelve and up

the sweet hereafter could serve as textbook example of the difference between television movies and real movies consider for moment what television producer would do book that features fatal school bus accident and lawyer out sign up the bereaved lots of hot sensationalism interrupted breaks sell beer and toothpaste topflight writer and director atom egoyan delivers instead tremendous power whose most notable trait is its touching subtlety based on respected book of the same name author russell banks the movie represents rethinking of the storys structure not merely literal adaptation of the novel told in linear form four narrators in the book egoyans version happens instead in overlapping time sequences and without narrator the author is even on record as applauding egoyans changes in the press notes the books author describes the story as parable of lost children he says it asks what town does in the absence of its children picking up on this egoyan has flashback in sitter nicole burnell played grace sarah polley reads parts of the pied piper from an old illustrated book her two charges periodically throughout the picture nicoles readings are heard in voiceover you have never heard this moving poem read so sweetly or in such an appropriate moment they and the rest of the towns children come into harms way some live and others are seriously injured and the entire small canadian town where the accident occurs is never the same again although the physical damage is inflicted mainly on the children the adults bear the emotional scars of the loss ian holm in arguably the best performance of his distinguished career plays mitchell stephens an intense man of quiet misery mitchell is the outsider in the story set in small snowencrusted community in the british columbian wilderness his mission there is singular one sign up the parents so that he can sue someone anyone on their behalf if this seems crass well it is but mitchell approaches his job the dedication of religious zealot the story unfolds slowly and always believably each little aspect has its own fascination as mitchell interviews wendell and rita walker played quiet realism maury chaykin and alberta watson he has simple task he wants them suggest some model couple in the village who has lost child so that he can use that couple form the basis of the suit wendell ticks off one town member after another and then as one can in small town enumerates each persons numerous faults although the town is no peyton place people there do have their foibles one of the best parents in the town appears be billy ansell bruce greenwood who rides his pickup behind the school bus everyday just so he can wave goodbye his kids well single parent billys fault is that he has regularly scheduled trysts the married rita his confessions rita about his feelings of loss are one of the many heartfelt outpourings in the story the accident itself simple one of bus hitting patch of ice is not shown until the middle of the picture but nevertheless the mystery about it builds throughout the although the picture is no detective story finding out exactly what happened is subtheme in movie that is primarily character study of town gripped tragedy as the injured bus driver gabrielle rose dolores driscoll plays the role of dedicated individual who loves kids passion and for whom the tragedy takes on special meaning round out the story mitchell has his own private tragedy bear his daughter zoe caerthan banks is drug addict who has bounced in and out of one halfway house and recovery center after another fond of calling her dad on his cell phone so she can ask for money or help she interrupts him at many emotionally charged moments as he attempts sign up the townsfolk can help you mitchell tries reassure billy not unless you can raise the dead billy snaps back mitchells pitch is never an easy one and worrying about zoe only makes it harder mychael dannas haunting music sets the stage for tragedy the cinematography paul sarossy is sweeping in its outdoor grandeur but it is in the warm shadowy intimate moments indoors where it works best the show is ripe for emotional manipulation never plays its audience still when the house lights go up you may feel as did could barely breathe was so overcome the sum total of what had witnessed more than anything the is like master painting each cinematic brush stroke is carefully laid down egoyan the beauty building each dollop of paint the final color in place the masterpiece is complete and the ending credits roll the sweet hereafter runs it is rated for mature themes sexuality and some profanity and would be fine teenagers

warning those who have not seen seven this review contains some spoiler information seven is powerful fullyrealized on the level of the silence of the lambs it is disturbing that accomplishes its biggest of goalsit occupies the viewers mind long after the closing credits have rolled while this is not for the squeamish there is no denying that seven demands attention for it is that transcends its genre in both style and substance for starters classifying seven as thriller would not be an altogether complete classification of this while was genuinely thrilled throughout would rather call seven an intense drama because that is what it deliversmeaningful scenes relentlessness that does not readily let up part of director david finchers accomplishment is in style he seems have knack for knowing exactly how the average person fears something as simple as corpse and visually fincher shows us the remains of murder victims in alltoorealistic and graphic terms courtesy of rob bottins alwaysgrisly special effects throw in the appropriate but nottobeunderestimated effects of lighting and foreboding score and the result is technical masterpiece of the murder scene these scenes alone are quite impressive as fascinating as they are harrowing yet seven is more than just technical accomplishment in addition style fincher supplies substance seven has compelling characters that it wants us know and understand and fincher ties them all together in completely pessimistic view of society detective william somerset morgan freeman is man who has nearly given up on the world its easy see why the world does not make sense somerset drives this point home rather ghastly story of robbery victim who was attacked just blocks from the police precinct after knocked down and robbed of his wallet the attacker stabbed the helpless man in both eyes why should somerset believe that following this murder investigation and picking up the pieces he will be able catch the killer somersets new partner david mills brad pitt has not given up on the world perhaps because he is still young and perhaps having this optimism he is naive in this films portrayal of the world he completely disagrees somersets abandonment of hope however davids wife gwyneth paltrow has so much fear of her urban surroundings she is not even sure if she wants tell her husband about her recent pregnancy let alone carry it until birth and attempt raise it in this environment these three characters are all performed skill and authenticity that makes them feel like real people and not the typical characters lesser might have offered and in addition making clear how each of these characters sees the world fincher gives us support for why they feel the way they do but if there is one character that underlines the message seven is trying convey it has be the killer john doe kevin spacey sevens payoff lies in its ability allow us see how the killer views the world and what drives him do what he does one important thing remember about doe is how easy it is simply dismiss him as psycho no motives behind his slayings this is exactly the mistake mills makes in the extremely intense and superbly performed closing scenes were allowed see that doe is in his mind merely product of society he is killer who kills those who are bringing society down in his mind he did not kill innocent people and perhaps they were not completely innocent but then again who is hes absolutely infuriated that mills believes that the murder victims were innocent really seven does not just comment on the superficial obviousness of how screwedup john doe is seven makes larger statements about how screwedup society is hinting that societys degradation is simply conducive of creating more john does besides the stylistic and largerissue arguments for seeing this recommend seven because it is after all also very slick and wellmade thriller it features exciting plot developments commanding performances lots of suspense and conclusion that is chilling riveting and quite unfair but then again its cruel world

modern audiences are more likely be familiar les misirables from the popbroadway musical rather than victor hugos original tome adapted several times for the cinema this latest effort does superb job of translating the characters story and heart of the novel the screen liam neeson stars as jean valjean as young man valjean stole some bread satisfy his hunger and he was sentenced years of hard labor for his crimes prison hardened him and on his release he seems doomed life of crime and squalor however an unexpected act of compassion changes his outlook on life and he vows become better man however he runs up against one man who does not believe in reform inspector javert geoffrey rush is an obsessive law abider he has no tolerance for anyone who breaks the rules even benign intentions he once served as guard at the labor camp where valjean served and after valjean breaks his parole javert devotes himself bringing him justice two women also get caught up in the struggle fantine uma thurman is an unwed mother suffocating in an unforgiving society her daughter cosette mimi newman and later claire danes is her life yet she cannot afford raise her instead cosette is sent live cruel foster family extorts money from fantine and forces cosette into life little better than slave director bille august manages create faithful adaptation of victor hugos novel though omitting some of the political undertones remains true the overall story and tone of the book hopefully you will not as some clueless members of the audience did wonder where all the songs went the movie manages be completely engrossing without the andrew lloyd webber flourishes the experience is bolstered strong performances throughout though neeson and rush deservedly take center stage their core roles neeson in particular deserves kudos for his portrayal of man trying do good but continually haunted his past the supporting cast is also extraordinary the only actor who dims in comparison is hans matheson playing the revolutionary marius the slightly loses its luster during his brief love affair but it is transitory and truly only distracting when contrasted the rest of the the novel les misirables is any account an epic both in its scope and in its length while it would be nearly impossible cram everything from its pages into two hour movie this latest attempt does an admirable job at the translation it too is an epic and one worth seeing

i was born in makes me barely old enough remember bell buttons tracks and disco however since was years old have seen more than my share of adult films mention this only because thinks its important state up front that am not against pornogrpahy have seen enough of these films know the range of content and quality available director paul thomas andersons boogie nights offers us view into the world of porn during the period considered be the golden age of adult cinema the mid late this was the period when xrated movies were real movies shot on shown in movie theaters and even reviewed legitimate critics this was an age when porn directors actually aspired make innovative often educational films films that attempted tell real story one of the more fascinating aspects of this is how like in an any other billion dollar industry the creative visionaries tend be ignorant the trends that will soon make them obsolete in this case the arrival of the now ubiquitous videocassette burt reynolds manages resuscitate his career portraying such an auteur known as jack horner horners has steady family of performers some of whom live in his plush a home but in the world of porn performers are commodity the fresher the better when horner scouts fresh faced stud bussing tables at his favorite discotheque he decides add him his stable it is pairing that leads meteoric rise and fall for young man reaching his prime and an old man rapidly speeding past his as directed anderson the camera moves through many of the scenes an eerie omnipresence and an almost childlike curiosity peer beyond the closed door boogie nights provides voyeuristic peep into the underbelly of a hardcore scene but the peep show doesnut let us walk away when the titillation ends the downside of voyeurism is sometimes we end up seeing things we wish we hadnut the films final image what we we once found titillating has now become grim reminder of the vanity of fame and the high price of realizing your dreams boogie nights is not about sex it does not glorify porn or the lifestyles of the performers in fact the is not really about pornography at all pornography is merely the setting tell compelling story about lost and forgotten group of people who form their own subculture find acceptance of who they are the goes brilliant often hilarious and sometimes harrowing lengths show us that the people who choose produce or perform in these films are generally not all that bright and lack the basic tools function in the mainstream world yet like in the lauded tarantino films these people still have their own moral code their own concepts of integrity and their own needs experess themselves creatively the characters we meet are like road map of dysfuntion first stop the den mother julianne moore in denial about her addiction cocaine as she tries retain custody of her son second stop the cuckold crewman william macy who keeps discovering his wife having sex anyone and everyone the wife is played in hilarious cameos reallife porn star nina hartley but the driving force behind the plot is year old eddie adams eddie is blessed natural endowment so famous that people actually pay just see it no real ambition of his own he hooks up jack horner fullfill his destiny of fame his alcoholic mother clearly dissatisfied her own lot abuses him verbally and drives him out of the house horner introduces him amber waves moore who immediately adopts him nuclear family is born the surrogate relationship that develops between amber waves and her babies provides some of the films most poignant scenes clearly she is not even fit manage her own life let alone nurture these lost children but the need love and be loved is so strong they easily ignore the dangers of the less subtle addiction she introduces them even the viewer is somehow lulled into feeling like the love she offers is similar being in real family then again perhaps its not so different from real families at all eddie adams who later takes on the screen name dirk diggler is skillfully acted former popstar mark wahlberg say former pop star because this performance wahlberg can officially quit his day job this is bold and brave territory for such young man he pulls it off marvelously wahlberg is big bright star big bright future boogie nights plays very much in the spirit of the people versus larry flynt without the first amendment preachiness its intimate studies of character make it the superior wahlbergs surprising performance is on par woody harrelsons but in my opinion boogie nights is not the best of the year got the feeling that itus hour running time could have been cut or minutes without losing any of its resonance still if the subject matter of this intimidates you thereus no doubt that once you start watching boogie nights you may still feel like its not your thing but youull find yourself grooving it anyway ya know kinda like disco

i remember making pact right after patch adams not be easily be suckered movies dripping sentimentality but darn it music of the heart is just layered feelgood material and bright characterizations it is hard dislike movie that uses such skill it is manipulation in addition it is also terrific family this is the true story of violin teacher roberta guaspari who fought the school board keep the musical program active in handful of inner city harlem schools it could also be described as mrs streeps opus yes meryl streep brings her dramatic clout the demanding role of guaspari and that brings both good news and bad out of the gate possibly because of her distracting star power and the rushed writing it is relatively difficult identify robertas character and grasp her academic pointofview she is very strict her students but what insight does that create into the story slowly but surely we begin recognize the intentions of the character and show admiration for the thoughtfulness and human feeling that streep has once again applied one thoroughly interesting fact about music of the heart lies the unlikely presence in the directors chair horror veteran wes craven after leaving an impression the scream films and the original nightmare on elm street craven has attempted precarious crossover drama at first his inexperience the genre is fairly obvious but as the progresses craven finds surprisingly comfortable niche directing this material it does not carry the heartwarming courage of mr hollands opus but music of the heart is casually assured and filled little morsels of dramatic truth the tag team of streep and craven works better than you would anticipate yes oscar could come calling once again for meryl streep but it is the solid ensemble cast that makes music of the heart work angela bassett displays her usual forceful stamina as janet williams the principal at an inner city school who initially does not hire roberta because of her lack of experience blueeyed adian quinn is endearing as always playing new love interest gloria estefan also delivers in the tiny role of supportive secondgrade teacher and the three lead actresses together produce flaming fireball of estrogenic force it is like schoolteachers version of thelma and louise in restrained but effective manner the movie tackles more issues than just guasparis teaching of violin there is some powerful moments between roberta and her two sons who must cope when their father leaves them for another woman in it is dramatic buildup the movie manages produce some authentic moments of feeling and warmth it is good movie for anyone see although missing out on the experience would not be lifealtering decision it is commendable of wes craven be attempting such difficult crossover and also for achieving his intricate goal watching this heartfelt chick flick about morals and musical instruments who may ask yourself this is the guy who directed scream of course when the third installment of that series comes around in february craven directing you may find yourself wondering this is the guy who directed music of the heart mission accomplished wes thankfully there is no layer of artificial sentiment covering the in it is entirety it is wholesome and agreeable movie for the whole family despite the periodic flaws that surface every once in awhile the child actors are cute and perform up par even if some of their problems are clich and predictable in the extreme the mother who does not want her son be learning white mans music the unexpected casuality basically everything is there it does not strike the perfect chord but music of the heart is highly convincing the uplifting true story of roberta guaspari could have been told better but music of the heart is still edifying enough properly divulge her morals

vannesa kensington austin do you smoke after sex austin powers i do not know baby have never looked and so begins our journey into the most anticipated sequel of the summer season austin powers the sequel the sleeper hit of is filled the brim uproarious sight gags and lurid toilet jokes that will make you keel over hilarity the mind of mike myers is obviously very bizarre place myers returns as the swinging spy and his archnemesis the bald headed dr evil who is given much of the spotlight here there is an early scene in dr evil and his son scott seth green appear on jerry springer segment entitled my dad is evil and wants take over the world hosted springer himself most of these talkshow gags spoofing everything from oprah regis and kathie lee are no longer as funny as they once were happily this is an exception especially when fight breaks out between dr evil and the other guests sample dialogue come back here you mother you want piece of me the audience was in stitches there are many good things about this sequel dr evil is now assisted minime verne troyer pintsized clone who is the result of an experiment gone awry minime is the most perfect new character that any fan could ask for and troyer does terrific job of mimicking everything that his big brother does pinkie and all mindy sterling returns as frau farbissina evils loudmouth assassin sidekick and here we are treated brief romantic liaison between the two in an underground bedroom chamber this works surprisingly well afterward there is even meeting at the coffee machine where their awkwardness is expressed in scene you would expect in any normal office environment oh yes the plot after short honeymoon vanessa kensington elizabeth hurley that goes disastrously wrong powers is back on the case thwart the diabolical plans of dr evil in the original the subject of the day was cryogenic freezing that enabled the characters hop between two time periods here it is time travel dr evil has this crazy plan steal austins mojo the source of his sexual powers so he jumps through time portal back into when powers is still is his freezing chamber there he employs grotesque pound scottish assassin named fat bastard also myers commandeer the mojo so that our future hero is left completely shagless meanwhile austin is informed of evils wrongdoing basil exposition michael york and is supplied his very own timetraveling device in the form of volkswagen beetle once back in powers meets foxy cia operative named felicity shagwell heather graham and learns of dr evils plans destroy washington dc lazer on the moon in one of the many uproarious jabs at star wars evil calls the moon base death star if there ever was movie that knew from the start it was complete joke it is austin powers the spy who shagged me ap has many hilarious moments much more so than the original austin powers but what it does not have is the confident support system that the first boasted and the jokes are now more scattershot and hitandmiss while myers has knack for delivering clever inspired gags he sometimes does not know when call it quits the hilarious scene in the original involving mustafa will ferrell and his refusal die is played out here in disappointing and tired manner robert wagner as dr evils man has only one scene early on in the where he lacks all the focus of the character one nice surprise is rob lowe as the young who patterns wagners voice and movements right down tee there are more recycled jokes from the predecessor including kristen johnston as ivana humpalot an unfunny rendition of alotta fagina but myers has clearly put so much dedication into this project and many bits are sidesplittingly funny do not miss an extended visual gag in tent where the shadows leave much the imagination of the new characters graham does not leave much of an impression her performance is merely okay and she lacks the gungho enthusiasm that made elizabeth hurley so enjoyable before her and as for fat bastard well he provides one or two hilarious moments but all of the obesity jokes and bathroom talk go too far but my most severe complaint mr bigglesworth was only in one scene but gritted teeth managed get over that this sequel will not leave fans disappointed it is more often than not laugh riot and look optimistically the future where foresee more installments the austin powers collection if myers can up the quota of fresh ideas we should be in store for much more jamey hughton jamey hughton has written weekly column in the starphoenix saskatoon sk since november he was writing finalist in the canadian ytv achievement awards

the premise of the new teentargeted horror final destination causes recollection of memorable simpsons halloween episode after attempting repair malfunctioning toaster lovably ignorant patriarch homer realizes he has created portable timemachine after trek into the cretaceous period homer observes that any minor alteration made there will erupt into starling chain of events and seriously modify the present world again and again homer toys the master plan and pays dearly for it the characters of final destination have also tampered the blueprint schematics of their existence their design someone is after them the strict intent of correcting the mistake that someone is death you see alex browning devon sawa and six others have cheated the grim reaper but the dude has got some tricks up his sleeve for high school excursion alexs french class is traveling paris airline transport alex tense and neurotic has shocking premonition after boarding he sees the plane and every passenger on it spontaneously explode in midair in panic of sheer lunacy alex charges his way through the aisle and demands removal from the aircraft after handful of others including one teacher follow and are denied admittance back onto the plane the unwitting survivors watch in horror as the plane actually explodes in the drizzling night sky the loony vision alex experiences does actually materialize but death will not be cheated so easily and one one the survivors of flight are offed in mysteriously gruesome circumstances the grisly murder count baffles the local officials and fbi before delve into the meat of the review would just like confer is that one helluva premise or what final destination creepy beyond rational comprehension probably reads more like an unsettling xfiles episode than the simpsons therefore the surprise is minimal when you discover the mutual creators behind both are glen morgan and james wong on familiar turf the task of establishing footing is not difficult for morgan and wong and the opening minutes of final destination reflects that unlike most thrillers the setup is crisp and cool you just deeply sincerely hope that the momentum will not unspool leaving us secondstring effort nothing but cheap derivative shocks young viewers have palpable reason expect this kind of formula deterioration what i know what you did last summer and sequel idle hands and movie nifty premise that just plunged like an anvil urban legend after the setup when remained slouched apprehensively in my chair started really have fun final destination low and behold teen thriller that is actually unsettling actually suspenseful and yes actually intelligent some splotty logic and heap of characteristic genre flaws aside this is among the most refreshing and allout enjoyable horror movies submerge since the cuttingedge scream in final destination stimulates the nerves and offers exhilarating retaliation strike against all the bloodspattered slasher crap we have endured throughout the past few years not that the characters are that good sawa is game as alex connectthedots personality that we never fully comprehend in addition the survivors are endearing geek tod chad donella jocky controlfreak carter kerr smith of dawsons creek carters ditzy girlfriend terry amanda detmer the nonetoosubtly named billy hitchcock seann william scott supplier of lukewarm comic relief and lone teacher the emotionally delicate ms lewton kristin cloke aside from alex the primary center of interest is intended be ali larter varsity blues playing an abstract character named clear rivers what were her parents thinking the personality of clear is written such vague nebulous definition that she resembles walking flashcard saying hello am the offbeat character designed identify the main characters plight toss few stereotypical fbi agents daniel roebuck and roger guenveur smith and ummm spiritual mortician former candyman tony todd into the mix and you have what could be another generic teenage frightfest slicing dicing and assorted disembowelments not so final destination has no slicing and dicing or at least none dealt human killer and the thought of death itself as the unseen stalker is unique and frightening the extra dimension of disconcerting irony rejuvenates the decaying murdererontheloose concept assistance from shrewd intelligently paced screenplay morgan wong and jeffrey reddick the plot twists are fun and clever without toppling into utter absurdity listen up reindeer games but suppose the most satisfying aspect of final destination is the murder scenes creative resourceful and breathlessly inventive the death sequences involve an unlikely string of events leading characters demise what will trigger the accident will it be the john denver record just put on play rocky mountain high yeah sick humor will it be the leaking toilet the falling fishing reel in the corner the murders are startling and largely unforeseen including one surprise incident that made the audience jump out of their seats and giggle nervously for roughly minute afterward sense of giddy unpredictability is added this inventive approach it gets sorta tasteless and cheap sometimes but who cares it is fun in that simple regard final destination is my cup of tea this stylishly executed thriller although tagged laughable circumstances and the occasional snippet of lame dialogue is an immensely entertaining jaunt the dark side after the show it will also have an frightening impact on you when will your design expire is death waiting around the corner the final effect is major case of the heebiejeebies

it is easy see why the late stanley kubrick believed steven spielberg would be the perfect director for his i artificial intelligence just as it is understandable why spielberg was attracted the material for here we have another lost boy trying find his way home an outcast seeking family themes very familiar from most of spielbergs body of work from sugarland express close encounters of the third kind t empire of the sun hook saving private ryan naming just few examples i is set in an undefined near future in giant technological advances have led the creation of robots who serve every purpose from housekeeping fulfilling sexual fantasies it is an era when robots are treated merely as sophisticated appliances the last great leap in robotic evolution is the addition of emotions and the number of births limited the government many couples are yearning for children and professor hobby william hurt has the solution robotic boy named david haley joel osment who is programmed love as test david is placed henry swinton sam robards and his wife monica frances oconnor their naturalborn son has been cryogenically frozen until cure can be found for his illness the first third of i deals davids life the swintons and how that is changed the recovery and return of their son martin circumstances force david be cut off from the swintons he is abandoned and alone david highly influenced the fairy tale pinocchio feels that if he becomes real boy he can rekindle monicas love for him the films second act follows davids search for the blue fairy whom he believes will be able fulfill his wish during these adventures he meets and is helped gigolo joe jude law robot who specializes in sex spielberg is at his top form in this sequence offering brutal flesh fair where robots are destroyed via sadistic methods for the amusement of paying customers here is where kubricks influence is strongly felt as the movie explores the fear and distrust humans have for robots the savagery conjures up images from the late directors clockwork orange at about two hours and minutes the begins falter during the last minutes sequence that seems most spielbergian images that appear be borrowed from close encounters it is all very anticlimatic and jarring these scenes seem almost superfluous as if from different i is dark fairy tale that deserves its pg rating it is story combining hope and intolerance sacrifice and bigotry and while it does not coalesce perfectly the movie does offer some disturbing images but i is really showcase for the acting talents of the amazing young osment if ever an actor deserved an academy award nomination it is this lad who brings sense of joy and wonder the role of david being created for the express purpose of loving he shines when monica beaming love as eager as puppy please after being left in the woods he is confused lost hurt focusing on one objective become real boy and find his way home so he can redeem himself in his mothers eyes law is pleasant as the carefree robot who really does not understand davids quest but is nonetheless happy help him on his journey probably the toughest role is oconnors monica playing an emotional fragile woman who sees david as substitute for her lost martin she grows conflicted after her boy returns and she begins perceive david not as second chance but as threat her family she gives her character enough emotional chaos that you cannot fault her for her course of action many of i futuristic sets are breathtaking especially mostly submerged new york lost the world the melting of the polar ice caps i is flawed and you cannot get through the entire feature without pondering even subconsciously how it would have turned out kubrick instead of spielberg behind the camera would it have been darker more cynical we will never know we can only judge what is before us on the screen collaboration of two cinematic giants i is most interesting and thoughtprovoking examination of future that is quickly gaining on us

heres word analogy amistad is the lost world as schindlers list is jurassic park in after steven spielberg made the monster dino hit many critics described schindlers list as the directors penance as if there was need for him apologize for making crowdpleasing blockbuster now after threeyear layoff spielberg is back vengeance once again his summer release was special effectsloaded actionadventure flick dinosaurs munching on human appetizers now following his pattern he has fashioned another serious inspirational christmas release about the nature of humanity that is amistad although not as masterful as schindlers list amistad is nevertheless gripping motion picture thematically rich impeccably crafted and intellectually stimulating the only area where this movie falls little short is in its emotional impact watching schindlers list was powerful almost spiritual experience spielberg pulled us into the narrative absorbed us in the drama then finally let us go exhausted and shattered threeplus hours later aspects of the movie have stayed me ever since amistad while fine example of making is not as transcendent the incident of the ship la amistad is not found in any history books but considering who writes the texts that is not surprise however the event is part of the american social and legal fabric and while amistad does not adhere rigorously the actual account most of the basic facts are in order several mostly minor changes have been made enhance the films dramatic force on the whole while amistad may not be faithful all of the details of the situation it is true the spirit and meaning of what transpired one stormy night during the summer of the men imprisoned on the spanish slave ship la amistad escape led the lionhearted cinque djimon hounsou they take control of the vessel killing most of the crew adrift somewhere off the coast of cuba and uncertain how make their way back africa they rely on the two surviving spaniards navigate the eastward journey they are tricked however and the la amistad makes its way northward off the united states eastern coastline is eventually captured an american naval ship near connecticut the kidnapped africans are shackled and thrown into prison charged murder and piracy the first men come the africans defense are abolitionists theodore joadson morgan freeman and lewis tappan stellan skarsgard they are soon joined roger baldwin matthew mcconaughey property attorney of little repute aided advice from former president john quincy adams anthony hopkins baldwin proves more persuasive orator than anyone gave him credit for and his central argument that the prisoners were illegally kidnapped free men not property convinces the judge but powerful forces have aligned against baldwins cause current president martin van buren nigel hawthorne eager please southern voters and year old queen isabella of spain anna paquin begins pulling strings behindthescenes ensure that none of the africans goes free at its heart amistad is tale of human courage cinque is heroic figure whose spirit remains unbreakable regardless of the pain and indignity he is subjected he is free man not slave and while he recognizes that he may die as result of his struggle he will not give it up effectively portrayed newcomer djimon hounsou whose passion and screen presence arrest our attention cinque is the key viewers seeing the amistad africans as more than symbols in battle of ideologies they are individuals and our ability make that distinction is crucial the movies success amplify this point spielberg presents many scenes from the africans pointofview detailing their occasionallyhumorous observations about some of the white mans seeminglystrange rituals the larger struggle is of course one of defining humanity as the nazis felt justified in slaughtering jews because they viewed their victims as subhuman so the proslavery forces of amistad use similar defense the abolitionists regard the africans as men but the slavers and their supporters see them as animals or property in sense the morality of slavery is on trial here the specter of civil war would break out less than three decades later looming over everything amistads presentation of the legal and political intricacies surrounding the trial are fascinating making this movie one of the most engrossing courtroom dramas in recent history four claimants come forward against the africans the state wants them tried for murder the queen of spain who wants them handed over her under the provision of an americanspanish treaty two american naval officers who claim the right of high seas salvage and the two surviving spaniards from la amistad who demand that their property be returned them baldwin must counter all of these claims while facing challenge his own preconceived notions as the result of relationship he develops cinque even though attorney and client are divided language barrier they gradually learn communicate aside from cinque who is fullyrealized individual characterization is spotty but the acting is topnotch matthew mcconaughey successfully overcomes his pretty boy image become baldwin but the lawyer is never particularly welldefined outside of his role in the la amistad case likewise while morgan freeman and stellan skarsgard are effective as joadson and tappan they are never anything more than abolitionists nigel hawthorne who played the title character in the madness of king george presents martin van buren as spineless sycophant whom justice means far less than winning an election finally there is anthony hopkins whose towering portrayal of john quincy adams is as compelling as anything the great actor has recently done hopkins who can convincingly play such diverse figures as serial killer an emotionallycrippled english butler and richard nixon makes us believe that he is adams his tenminute speech about freedom and human values is unforgettable one point of difference worth noting between amistad and schindlers list is this films lack of welldefined human villain schindlers list had ralph fiennes superblyrealized amon goeth who was not only threedimensional character but personification of all that the nazis stood for there is no such figure in amistad the villain is slavery but an ideology no matter how evil is rarely the best adversary it is spielbergs credit that he has fashioned such compelling motion picture without prominent antagonist amistads trek the screen encountered some choppy waters author barbara chaseriboud has cried plagiarism charge denied the makers comes in the midst of an upsurge of interest in the incident an opera of the same name opened in chicago on november numerous books about the subject are showing up on bookstore shelves it remains be seen how much longevity the amistad phenomena has but one thing is certain spielbergs rousing substantive leading the way the spotlight has now illuminated this chapter of american history

you know you are in for truly different cinematic experience the moment you realize steve buscemi has been cast as the movie in questions most normal character such is the case the big lebowski joel and ethan coens first venture since their fargo nabbed nationwide acclaim and mantlepiece of academy award nods there is no need fear that the coens suffered creative burnout that accomplishment because lebowski is an effort that makes words like strange and unusual seem like an understatement thanks in part delicious characterization and an allencompassing sense of humor the is smashing success the central oddball here is the dude jeff bridges an unemployed cad whose ambitions appear be zilch beyond smoking pot drinking beer and going bowling are you college students already rooting for him or what one night pair of thugs break into his house and pee on his carpet threatening act that is supposed be carried out against famous pasadena millionaire david huddleston who shares his birth name jeff lebowski the dude once the dude realizes this coincidence he visits the big lebowski in hopes claim reparations for his soiled rug and is back his normal life alley pals walter john goodman hotheaded vietnam vet and donny buscemi mildmannered surfer before too long soon though lebowskis trampy trophy wife bunny tara reid is kidnaped and held for hefty ransom and he turns the dude for help it seems bunnys troubles are related line of work she is kept secret from her husband she is actually an adult star and is very in debt shady producer named jackie treehorn the dude now on lebowskis payroll accepts the offer and agrees handle the money drop walter tags along and insists that the dude keep the cash for himself chaos obviously ensues and the dude eventually finds himself in hot water cops crooks and lebowskis ultraeccentric artist daughter maude julianne moore the big lebowski deserves win the coens the same amount of acclaim that fargo did while that black comedy was certainly better lebowski is at least as breathtakingly imaginative the movie boasts milehigh absurdity level that sometimes threatens topple over but thankfully never does the coens joel directed ethan produced and both wrote keep you in stitches as they unravel their exceedingly loopy tale and must be commended for juggling number of people and subplots one would expect find in robert altman flick whether we are watching bridges fend off marmet in his bathtub or moore don viking duds and dance in busby berkeleyesque dream sequence the big lebowski is immensely lively there are those who will dislike this but not because it is boring the cast has great deal of fun the bounteous material they are given bridges exudes likeable surprisingly sweet presence his dude sure is not the cleanest guy around but you would still follow him another movie goodman merits first oscar consideration as walters manic temper is one of the big lebowski many highlights the same goes for moore whose throaty delectable performance as maude is hilarious hoot john turturro may very well steal the movie his two scenes as colorful bowler from rival faction sam elliotts rambling narration gets the off solid start and some will recognize peter stormare fargo silent heavy as carl hungus porn star who is really samurai swordwielding german nihilist and hasbeen pop star only in its final third does the movie falter couple of loose plot threads and some cast members who quickly disappear and never emerge for curtain call these flaws are forgivable though the coens have crafted tale so rich personality that it is hard look at the final product anything but big grin on your face without doubt the big lebowski is the best so far this year sure we are only three months in and the competition deep rising desperate measures the wedding singer etc has been pretty bland but it is still the gospel truth maybe during next awards season lebowski will not be far cry from fargo

a couple of months ago when first downloaded the faceoff trailer from the net my initial reaction was fourteen carrot gold yawn followed swiftly press of my computers delete key not wanting waste six or seven megabytes of precious space on this pisspoor trailer then started reading the first wave of reviews from the s unique excellent mustsee well thought still skeptical suppose might as well go see it when it gets here here of course was still three months away will admit when trotted off see this the only john woo movie had seen before was the fairly enjoyable but highly forgetable broken arrow would heard good things about his previous work movies like hard boiled but his films were definitely not on my mustsee list that let me tell you has changed completely knew this fact only five minutes into the after the brilliantly shot and acted opening sequence where sean archer loses his son blew me off my feet the acting throughout the is staggeringly good for an action flick seriously have never been big john travolta fan but he like cage perfectly suited his role in the movie sorry make that roles in the movie even travoltas great performance however paled in comparison cages character portrayals my favourite cage scene was definitely when he was crashed out in compardre dietrich hasslers hideout half drugged out of his mind he sits there reclining back in chair talking about his sons death from castors perspective does not it just break your heart he mutters coldly now do not go thinking from the previous comments about brilliant acting that this is drama focused movie it is not that is what really makes this movie unique it is an action movie brilliantly portrayed characters not common mix at all suspension of disbelief is paramount in this movie though that is the only way overlook the fact that travolta and cage fire around rounds at each other and never hit several action scenes are just so well choreographed that they just make wish that you could press rewind and watch it over again the part where archer and troy have stand off on either side of doublesided mirror is just plain brilliant whilst cages and travoltas performances would be enough alone sustain most movies the lesser characters are just as intriguing joan allen who usually sticks the straight drama movies plays her part perfectly as archers long suffering wife like the fact that her character did not end up toting gun at the end of the movie it would have wrecked her potrayal gina gershon was surprising say the least as castor troys mistreated girlfriend make that one of castor troys mistreated girlfriends other movies would have used her character as just window dressing sex object but instead her character is very strong and independent dominique swain who plays archers daughter also does nice job though her character is not as explored as much as allens or gershons faults well there were some have say first the movies ending whilst being very good overall was bit too drawn out for it is own good after the two combatants begin duelling again after the final boat crash you cannot help but think geez are you guys nuclear powered or what there were certain bits that were not handled properly like where archer appears safe and sound on solid ground after jumping off the converted oil platformprison more explanation here would have been nice overall this movie was not perfect but thought it was about as close as an action movie has ever came perfect many critics have claimed that this movie will change the way action movies are made certainly hope so

those print and television ads trumpeting that grease is still the word are right on the money celebrate its th anniversary this quintessential movie musical is getting the royal treatment reserved for classics like star wars welldeserved redcarpet rerelease that is fantastic especially when considering of all the classic characters and scenes the has served up who can forget aspiring beautician frenchie didi conn being serenaded her tellitlikeitis guardian angel frankie avalon or the hardnosed principal eve arden reminding the student body be an athletic supporter rooting for the home team or national bandstand emcee vince fontaine edd byrnes flirting marty pre empty nest dinah manhoff and these are all probably considered minor moments very skinny john travolta and very young olivia newtonjohn have the respective leads of danny zuko and sandy olsson and their pairing still ranks as one of screendoms most effervescently charming for those eight of you who are not familiar the story heres brief recap greaser bad boy danny and aussie good girl sandy are reunited for their senior year at rydell high after brief fling during the summer both thought she was going return her native continent before school started but both were wrong sandy tries rekindle their relationship but dannys too cool cat fall for her wholesome appeal in front of his tbird buddies including jeff conaway so sandy hooks up gang herself the pink ladies headed sassy sexy rizzo stockard channing just superb as an independent woman well ahead of her time and danny who still really feels love for her attempts compromise of ideals in order win her back the drag race finale is yet something of drag and never have thought much of greased lightening the films big guy number that choreography ack but grease flaws amount too few carp the movies first showpiece is summer nights where danny and sandy separately recount wildly different versions of their funinthesun romance not only is nights tremendously catchy but it is also smart look at how men and women see the same events varying eyes there has yet be liveaction musical sequence that rivals the onetwo punch of you are the one that want and we go together grease euphoric cappers all this and some of the most pleasing moments come from the smaller quieter moments the oscarnominated hopelessly devoted you is lovely showcase for newtonjohn and channings lamenting ballad there are worse things could do is one of grease most unjustly overlooked tunes the soundtrack is remastered though travolta still hits that awful high note at the end of nights and the restored widescreen allows us see previously panandscannedout choreography but nothing else has changed no computergenerated backgrounds no outtakes or new musical numbers no jabba the hutt cameos and it is testament grease timeless success that nothing needs be changed it is the same allaround blast it is always been an appealing cast in fun story told great music viewers grease will probably recall disco and bellbottoms as much as it made its original audience nostalgic for doowop and poodle skirts but regardless of what decade it transports us we can all agree on one thing without doubt grease is still the word

the party is one of those classic slapstick comedies that will leave you at times cracking up the takes place for the most part in realtime during an exclusive evening party that is attended only the biggest names in hrundi bakshi played very well peter sellers is struggling actor who just came america from his homeland india hrundi tries out his acting talents but it seems that he just is not cut out for the job on the set of his current that he stars in hrundi seems make everything go for the worse during the filming of this movie set in the hrundi manages annoy the director herbert ellis in any way he can this includes pitiful acting job in many scenes wearing an underwater watch in one scene and accidentally detonating massive set many of the producers and big names want hrundi out of the business forever and when the director makes personal phone call mr clutterbuck edward mckinley pleading for hrundis ejection from everything is pretty much over for hrundi clutterbuck writes his name down on piece of paper insure that hrundi will never again work in but when this piece of paper turns out be the guest list for clutterbucks exclusive party hrundi is invited and certain chaos is bound occur of course as predicted hrundi causes lots of trouble each scene in hrundi encounters situation usually one that he cannot handle is almost always very humorous and each scene hrundi and the drunken waiter who is alone hilarious adds the comedy in great way the party can be compared many other films of it is type specifically the trio of naked gun movies and the airplane movies but the party is delightful movie that incorporates very well played out comedy into believable situations it also includes number of memorable scenes can anyone say birdy numnum if you are in the mood for fun and enjoyable slapstick comedy check out the party it is not going be one of your alltime favorites but if you enjoy this type of humor you will enjoy the party

once again the battle is dreamworks versus disney earlier this year the mammoth companies fought the death their endoftheworld asteroid flicks deep impact and armageddon here we are now just few
