months later and they are at it again dueling bug movies antz and bugs life what find so astonishing is that both pairs of movies are so inherently similar in both story and execution mean come on what were the chances of two studios both deciding bring out computeranimated films about bugs as was the case the meteor movies disney has come out on top though antz is likable movie bugs life is far superior in fact this movie made me realize what was wrong antz became immersed in the world of bugs life while antz just made me scrutinize everything but it is not really fair base an entire review on comparison bugs life is remarkable in its own right and deserves be seen apart from any other computeranimated about bugs in fact it is one of the best films this year it is smart subtle and funny but it is also perfect family entertainment and relentlessly entertaining have not had such good time at the movies in months it tells the story of an ant named flick voice dave foley he is nice guy but he is also troublemaker the ants spend all season putting together the offering big pile of food that they provide for the grasshoppers just before the grasshoppers come flick accidentally knocks over the offering and ruins everything for the entire colony the grasshoppers leader hopper kevin spacey is enraged and tells them that the ants need twice the food the end of summer or they are all dead flick feeling responsible for this sets off look for help he realizes that the only way be rid of the grasshoppers is fight them he heads the city the city being house few miles away where he finds colorful bunch of circus bugs ladybug denis leary who is spectacular black widow bonnie hunt caterpillar joe ranft butterfly madeline kahn rhinoceros beetle michael mcshane and stick david hydepierce also giving hilarious performance flick does not know they are actors and they do not know that flick needs them kill bunch of grasshoppers so they return the colony flick and find themselves in an unusual position the most obvious element of bugs life is the quality of animation created pixar the same people who brought us toy story bugs life has some of the most amazing visuals have ever seen the bugs seem inhabit threedimensional space and occasionally there will be shot that is indistinguishable from live action this is lush colorful world full of life and imagination the way the animators insert the things all of us see in our daily lives matches bottlecaps tin cans etc and make them active objects in the bugs world is innovative the is also mercilessly exciting particularly in superblystaged scene involving our heroes escape from bird little bird never seemed so huge and threatening but the makers of bugs life know where the importance lies story and characters flick solid voice work from foley is great guy lead the story but the real treat comes the circus bugs they are such likable group of characters the standouts are the stick hydepierce is so good francis the ladybug and the big fat caterpillar all of these bugs have more than token personality makes the suspenseful scenes work because we care about the bugs and it also keeps the tearjerking scenes from seeming obligatory in my review of antz said that the is clever copout because it presents bunch of little humans reacting an antlike existence in concept bugs life is basically the same movie except that was never given enough time find things that did not like about it such strong work in both animation and script bugs life is nothing but joy sit through it really is too bad that it had come out so close that other bug movie but bugs life is so good that am sure it will find its audience after slew of endlessly violent and cynical movies it is downright refreshing sit through an innocent picture like this and laugh without feeling guilty

eight years after its release disney has decided rerelease the little mermaid theatrically for days and long nights only coincidentally it was reintroduced theaters the same day foxs animated anastasia was released you know disney they cannot deal the threat of any other studio getting even small piece of the crust of the kiddie entertainment pie so when someone else wants make little money they counter an old masterpiece from their vault and you know what went see this cartoon rather than the brand new one from fox let no one say disney is losing its monopoly on the market they still have hotels on boardwalk _and_ park place believe it or not today november at m saw the little mermaid for the first time it took me few years get over an aversion this movie that was caused seven years ago when stayed one of my moms friends for couple weeks they had young child who listened the little mermaid soundtrack constantly and over that two week period heard every song from the movie probably hundred times the time got back home promised myself would never see the movie but promises are made be broken especially when you are looking at day limited engagement damn those shrewd disney marketers and their mind games the little mermaid is based on hans christian anderson fairy tale but it is disneyized means lots of talking animals and bursting into song it also means the heroine is total babe who shows off cleavage from seashell bra at all times never wanted so much be pair of shells the heroine of course is ariel voice of jodi benson yearold mermaid who is going through that rebellious phase she skips her concert explore wrecked ship and hang out seagull that talks like buddy hackett who tries orient her the mysterious world of humans she is also dealing feelings she has not had before comes when you get scales in places you did not use have them about handsome prince no disney movie would be complete without one her father king triton of the merpeople strictly forbids such lusting after the ways of the savage humans in condemnation that reads as notsosubtle analogy about old fashioned parents who forbid interracial dating what is king do though the girls in love and even total destruction of her little shrine the human world does not deter her ariel saves the princes life when hurricane rises up and just has meet him she makes deal ursula the sea witch voice of pat carroll you know she is evil because she has huge potbelly and one of the worst asses in cartoon history she also has octopus tentacles for feet something those dr scholls corn pads will not fix and offers help ariel out she will make her human for three days if ariel will give up her pretty voice ariel has three days make that prince kiss her or else she becomes slave the witch forever and if she pricks her finger on sewing machine or eats an evil apple she will fall asleep forever it is simplistic plot yes but the little mermaid was revolution in the disney world coming after such lackluster efforts as the black cauldron and oliver and company it ranks as one of the best disney cartoons certainly since the all the elements are there memorable songs like under the sea and kiss the girl cartoon animals like sebastian and flounder an evil villain who still has characterization and charm and fair amount of humor that caters adults as well as children the little mermaid is worth bigscreen ticket in so hurry up you only have five days left serving america for more than th of century

in flashback the teenage girl in the eccentric family in the canadian the hanging garden tells her senile grandmother that she is going school dance horrified the grandmother wants know if her granddaughter knows the rule of if you do not break off kiss the count of then you committed sin the boy and most of all the grandmother wants know if she has protection she must carry rosary in her pocket at all times the richly acted is written and directed thom fitzgerald in quirky but loving style although some may refer the as yet another dysfunctional family picture that moniker misses the mark yes every member of the household has their own special problems but the writer did not choose name so many characters for various flowers accident this delightful little picture mixes love tragedy and pathos resulting in hopeful and almost magical concoction during the opening credits we observe the boy sweet william at the center of the story first he is an average sized young lad who is slapped offscreen his father next he is pound teenager played hopelessness and depression troy veinotte when the opening credits end we cut years later william is now an averagesized reasonably happy adult played love and compassion chris leavins william has returned after years absence attend the marriage of his freespirited and foulmouthed sister rosemary his first childhood lover fletcher joe keller kerry fox from an angel at my table and shallow grave plays rosemary compelling joy nicole burnell who gave such devastating performance in the sweet hereafter plays the teenage rosemary the father of the family whiskey mac peter macneill is an alcoholic autocrat who is more obnoxious than harmful his wife iris seana mckenna says that she would have left him years ago at least go some place warm were it not for her lack of money and her obligations the kids rounding out the family is christine dunsworth as nineyearold violet the sister whom william meets for the first time as the exuberant irish music fills the air at the wedding in the family home william wanders off try on one of his old coats causes him laugh at the size of his former self the director manages stage simple scenes in wonderfully imaginative ways he takes common wedding dress train and uses it set up scenes in fresh and fascinating ways rosmarys trip the bathroom after drinking too much beer is beautifully orchestrated and kerry fox is at her hilarious best trying cope the long train in small bath all while talking her brother as much as anything the is series of character sketches in one of the strongest we watch william in flashback as he has his first sexual encounter homosexual one although he is perfectly happy liking the same sex his mother is aghast woman friend of hers suggests she take william local housewife dusty miller martha irving who for fee will have heterosexual sex william absolute finesse the director crafts subtle scene that manages yield significant emotional punch without being sensational dusty after asking iris watch her daughter takes william and gently introduces him the joys of sex the opposite sex all of this notwithstanding he still prefers males the is at its most poignant in several sequences in the grown william comes facetoface himself when younger this causes his ugly old memories be reignited in the most devastating he has come grips his former self who was so overwhelmed the stress that he tried hang himself even here the director touches your heart without ever letting the story dissolve into anything approaching tearjerker the ultimate result is an uplifting story that has more hope that one would ever expect from the outline of its plot the hanging garden runs it is rated for strong sexuality language violence and some teen drug use and would be acceptable for teenagers only if they are quite old and mature

dimension films scream distributor has asked press say extremely little if anything about the films twisty plot that is no easy task considering the wit that deserves be mentioned here but will do my best be vague now there is first the first one was good but all the rest sucked said cinematicallysavvy teen in last winters wes craven thriller scream her statement referring the films of the nightmare on elm street series but really putting down franchise overkill in general the comment certainly carries clout for every truly great sequel there appears be couple of duds making one wonder if writers are better off sticking solely fresh ideas but like it or not along comes scream and believe it or not it is doozy slick sinister madly subversive good time at the movies as intent on sending up hollywoods sequel syndrome as much as its prequel poked fun at slasher conventions scream is definitely that rare movie thing followup that can stand along side its original pride it is been two years since pair of overzealous horror movie fans clad in edvard munchesque getups carved their way through the young populace of woodsboro california those surviving the ordeal have gotten on their lives plucky heroine sidney prescott neve campbell is drama student at the midwestern windsor college her pop culturewhiz pal randy meeks jamie kennedy has tagged along trash tabloid reporter gale weathers courteney cox has written bestseller based on their ordeal the basis of has been turned into very bad movie called stab and dewey riley david arquette still suffering from wounds inflicted during scream has left his job as police officer for while life is tranquil at least for while several sudden murders bring sidney randy gale and dewey together again but suspicious eyes cast on each other and most of those in their surroundings if these four people learned anything from the past it is trust no one thus the possible victimpotential killer list includes said quartet as well as derek jerry oconnell sidneys new beau cici sara michelle gellar chatty sorority gal joel duane martin gales cameraman who is not too thrilled her bloodsoaked past hallie elise neal sidneys sassy roommate debbie laurie metcalf local reporter who gives gale some nottoofriendly competition and mickey timothy olyphant randys good friend and fellow student cotton weary liev schreiber the man sidney wrongly accused of her mothers murder in scream also shows up on campus but why like the first scream craven and screenwriter kevin williamson inaugurate things bang this time it is an extended sequence that finds an africanamerican couple jada pinkett and omar epps attending sneak preview of stab making sly references about everything from sandra bullock the lunchmeat nonroles of blacks in slasher cinema before tragedy ensues at the screening the moviewithinamovie setup allows for plenty of jokey moments including scene from stab turns screams nowfamous drew barrymore prologue on its ear hang up the phone and star his pinkett yells at the screen it is funny creepy stuff do not think will ever feel safe in movie theater again that effectively foreshadows the ratio of smart scares and spoofy laughs down the road another flawless example of this is riotous cell phoneassault of the killer on randy dewey and gale in broad daylight it builds comedically and ends genuine terror because of the emotional investment made on these delicious characters there are other superb set pieces but explaining them risks ruining their effect there are more players this time around as provide both higher number suspects and staggering body count it is something of tradein the new characters are too large in number be as fullydeveloped as the original scream gang but this movie packs in knowing performances especially kennedy and cox and more death for your dollar it can be argued that while the original might outclass it tad scream is both scarier and funnier it certainly does not skimp shocks major one being the killing of one cast member very near and dear my heart actually questioned craven and williamsons judgment here considering how much this person has added these films sometimes you wish that more could have been done stab the two scenes we are shown are deadon but for fans there are plenty of subtle nods movies like the usual suspects aliens and the empire strikes back still scream does so many things right it is petty quibble its penchant for parody is irresistible discussions of the merits of sequels and all the attractive solid cast is definite bonus and the denouement while not as shocking as scream is priceless the films final revelation incorporates bits of particular horror prominently referred in scream one of the best bad guy motives ever put on paper all this and scream is in the works knowing the series tendency for selfreference perhaps one of its characters will again discuss the concept of sequel justice mentioning scream ll help them in their argument

edward zwicks the siege raises more questions than it can convincingly answer or even clearly articulate its subject is the rising threat of terrorism in american cities denzel washington is anthony hub hubbard who runs the fbis antiterrorism task force in new york his investigation into arab terrorist cells intensifies when suicide bombers take out busload of people hub focuses on mysterious cia operative annette bening whose goes both elise and sharon as the terrorist attacks continue and the body count rises the question of martial law is raised enter general devereaux bruce willis who opposes martial law at first but who as soon as the president decides send in the army begins herding arab immigrants into prison camp and attacking every link that hub uncovers in the terrorist chain hub listens as devereaux tortures and murders suspect the future zwick and screenwriter lawrence wright offer is all too possible what would happen they ask if terrorism became as much fact of daily life in new york as it is in cities like beirut and belfast what would happen our civil liberties if soldiers patrol our streets machine guns these questions the siege answers in realistic detail it implies tougher ones though what can be done combat terrorism without sacrificing justice and freedom if we encourage terrorism abroad from benings character we discover that the cia trained the bombers will it inevitably come back us siege avoids the tougher questions endowing its hero hub uncompromising sense of clear right and wrong this comforting fantasy of sir galahad confronting the evils of the modern world is an escape from the thoughtprovoking issues the movie raises still zwick deserves credit for at least addressing the issue as much realism as he does where so many movies willis die hard series for example offer only comicbook view on terrorism

a movie that is been as highly built up as the truman show reviews boasting the of the decade and breakthrough can only be leading up letdown that is no doubt it seems any movie critical acclaim makes you think you are going in for the ride of your life that you will end up changed on the other side and you come out of the theater going eh that is what all the fuss was about so naturally the truman show was building up what was going be dissapointment and convinced myself as nestled into my uncomfortable movie theater chair actually try not enjoy it let me tell you that is an impossibilty the truman show is truly the of the decade and breakthrough and more and you will come out changed on the other side such movie comes around only once in lifetime where you find yourself feeling everything that the character is feeling and this friends is it jim carrey shows that he does not need talk out of his butt entertain us that he can be as dramatic as any of hollywoods leading men the has difficult premise tackle trying set us up thirty years into the truman show is run but tackle it it does and perfectly flashbacks actually being flashbacks on the television show you get the sense that you are viewing real primetime hit and the way the camera constantly takes the forms it would in the real truman show is clever and welldone people rejoice this is the first oscarworthy of not only this year but of the last five years not since schindlers list has movie captured human spirit and true despair so well this is classic in the making and borrow line from esquires review it stars jim carrey nothing in his career date and nothing he can do in the future will ever be able top his role as truman burbank mark my word for as said this is the movie of lifetime and the role is of the same calibre forget specialeffect ladden summer fodder drop your romantic comedies in the trash toss your thrillers and teen flicks on the pile you need nothing more than the truman show carry you through the summer or for that matter the year oh and in case do not see you good afternoon good evening and goodnight

gos is gloriously slick hip machine director liman who also photographed go and screenwriter august celebrate the drugrave scene in a preferring take comedic snapshots of troubled youth rather than critique them after more than ninety minutes of pillpopping tantric sex car chases and attempted murder go even has happy ending this is the sort of that gives members of the dove foundation splitting headaches as go wound down anticipated an antipillpoppingcasualtantricsexcarchaseattemptedmurder sermon that blessedly did not arrive la tarantinos pulp fiction go is comprised of three separate but related stories the basics are as follows ronna polley is bitter grocery store clerk facing eviction who turns drug dealing for extra dough her coworker simon the improbably named askew is clubber from britain ecstatic about his first trip vegas zack mohr and adam wolf are soap opera stars escaping careerthreatening conviction assisting peculiar cop fichtner in drug bust perhaps because the innovative structure of tarantinos nonlinear masterwork is now old hat the idfueled go delighted me but rarely surprised me the exception of that mindreading cat pulp fiction zigzagged down roads unforeseen but we see gos wheels turning from its first flash frame the last torontonian polley of the sweet hereafter refused do publicity for this picture on the basis that she was not pleased her turn as the illfated cashier in go she delivers handsdown her best performance date heres an overrated actress who agreed appear on the poster but not support her team at the junket or in interviews this sort of arrogance is commonplace for ms polley as anyone who has read of her political agenda in the canadian press will tell you if she does not want be the ingenue of the moment she should have said no not go but digress go is fun so chipperly depraved one cannot help but turn off his moral judgment for its duration and enjoy the ride in that sense it is departure from limans last swingers at least lectured against selfabsorption in the form of vince vaughans trent and his subtle comeuppance in the storys clever epilogue has been aped mcdonalds for their latest commercial wish cared more about gos characters like the techno music they listen the bands of anarchists on display here are at once absorbing and vacuous when the lights came up and stung my eyes it was difficult recall what about it entertained me yet entertain me it did go is light and frothy featuring compelling if not endearing work polley timothy olyphant scream and especially fichtner whose homoerotic behavior is milked for effective laughs fichtner is character actor best known for playing backstabbers in heat armageddon and others his previously untapped comic abilities shine in go unlike much of the fichtner is unpredictable

what is shocking about carlitos way is how good it is having gotten bit of bad rap for not being big box office hit like pacinos previous scent of woman and not having as strong performance as he did in that one he had just won an oscar carlitos way was destined for underrated heaven that is what it is an underrated gem of movie and what shame because pacino and de palma both do amazing jobs it and turn it into great piece of pulpy character study carlitos way deals well carlito brigante pacino puerto rican exdrug kingpin who gets out of long jailterm when his cokeaddicted curlyhaired lawyer sean penn points out legal technicality of course carlito was actually awoken in prison and has decided go straight even if he is really crook at heart carlito like barry lyndon is man who is trapped fate at every turn and cannot escape into something he is not carlitos attempts at clean legal life are thwarted at nearly every turn when he first gets out friend of his ends up leading him into big shootout where he has kill couple people survive he is constantly getting bugged the government see if he is doing anything illegal and his lawyer finds himself neckdeep in pile of shit needing him try and help him out includes him doing some prison breaking carlito like ratso rizzo wants go miami since according logic that is where it is at but needs some funding being legend he is quickly able get nice job running big dance club this is the the way and since some of this takes place in night clubs we get hear all sorts of classics including several c and the sunshine band tunes my personal favorite he gets bodyguard the great luis guzman at his best and is soon running pretty good business even if he is constantly attracting underworld young thugs like benny blanco from the bronx john leguiziamo who is more than once pointed out be young version of carlito on the other side the symbol of promise and hope is gail penelope ann miller what happened her his girlfriend from before prison she is goregeous ballerina and stripper and soon carlito is trying get back her and take her him when he finally leaves for miami while this relationship is never fully defined or anything we get sense of love between them and they have some truly interesting scenes between them she never gives him addresses or locales he always has track her down all of these elements clash together at the end in brilliantly executed emotional climax is inevitable when say inevitable mean we see it at the beginning and then backtrack putting great spin on it sure it is going eleveate some of the tension but it gives the lot of depth as carlito is seen trapped fate what is amazing is the big chase sequence amazingly done de palma has lot of tension and thrills like apollo we know what is going happen but we are still thrilled what happens in the middle it is also very emotional thanks great script david koepp and amazing performances pacino and miller de palma is famous or infamous for lots of violence in his films his earlier flim scarface starred pacino in the lead has ton of it especially at the end and nasty chainsaw scene towards the beginning am still not over but de palma actually reigns in more quieter scenes me the best scene in the is when carlito is on top of building looking down into the room where gail is doing ballet this is the most brilliantly done and most emotionally stimulating scene in the entire and probably the best in de palma history gorgeous soprano duet in the background and rain pouring down onto trashcan lid covering carlitos head and saddened remorseful look on pacinos face it is tearjerker well for me dunno about you the acting from all is great especially from the three leads pacino was panned for his performance chiefly because his accent was not puerto rican enough and well it was not as strong as his oscarwinning role in scent of woman well his scent of woman performance was great and all but it was nothing really but as comic kevin pollack said foghorn leghorn impression in carlitos way he is emotional and strong despite the fact that he is remorseful over his entire lifestyle he cannot change felt more for carlito brigante than did for the tangodancing insultthrowing blind guy in scent of woman as said penelope ann miller is great and she and pacino actually have very good chemistry and they are scenes are wellwritten some good clever dialogue adds some interest an otherwise bland relationship and sean penn is amazing as the cokeaddicted rat attorney every scene he is in he has great energy and even measures up the greatness that is pacino in smaller roles john leguiziamo and luis guzman are great carlitos way is one of those films you heard about briefly but when you finally watch it you are absolutely blown away it is wonderful highly underrated little masterpiece was shelved after it did not do so hot but trust me and check it out it is great little and proof that the residential critics and mass populus are not always right

life is beautiful is rare treat lighthearted comedy that tackles very serious subject without committing the sins of being disrespectful or even worse humorless it combines charming romance dash of farce stirs in little poignancy and ends up very enjoyable movie it is an italian but do not let that discourage you subtitlephobes will be missing wonderful experience life is beautiful opens as sweet romantic comedy the clownish but good natured guido roberto benigni arriving in rustic italian town work as waiter for his uncle the year is and guido literally stumbles into the girl of his dreams dora nicoletta braschi their romance seems be picture perfect only one stumbling block she is already engaged another man can guido overcome the odds and win his girl what do you think however five years later things have taken turn for the worse in italy the fascists have stepped up their race initiatives is bad news for the jewish guido and his new son giosue giorgio cantarini who are rounded up and shipped off concentration camp unable protect his boy in any other way guido attempts shield his young son from the horrors of the labor camp he pretends that everything is all an elaborate game points awarded for such tasks as hiding being brave and being very very quiet as you can tell from the description life is beautiful has two very different tones but manages excel at both of them as romantic comedy it is sweet and funny as bittersweet tale of hope amid despair it is touching roberto benignis work here has been compared some of the best of chaplins and it is easy see why he is able run the gamut of comic expression from slapstick farce warmhearted feeling that celebrates his downtrodden heros triumph of the underdog spirit life is beautiful treads thin line when it turns its attentions the holocaust however it is able successfully navigate the minefield without demeaning the gravity of the horrors involved nor without losing its humorous edge that allows you smile through the tears life is beautiful benigni has created triumphant but bittersweet comedy it is quite simply one of the most enjoyable times have had at the movies this year

you have probably heard the one about the priest and the rabbi but never the same dosage of featherweight charm that is sprinkled over keeping the faith it is fluffy comedy thoroughly glazed sense of innocuous innocence and good cheer regarding two moral topics love and religion and how romantic triangle causes the two collide headon as youngsters brian finn jacob schramm and anna reilly were an inseparable trio while their friendship progressed anna always had the compassion shower them both the same love and support so neither would feel excluded but tragedy soon struck as anna was forced move away now adults brian edward norton and jacob ben stiller hold similar but contrastive jobs the likable and kindhearted father brian is catholic priest while the spry and outgoing jacob acts as jewish rabbi on the basketball court they refer themselves as the god squad in the relationship field brian abides his catholic principle of celibacy but jacob has reached the point where finding jewish bride is practically mandatory everything changes when anna jenna elfman returns new york visit her childhood chums now workaholic she devotes endless hours per week her business but does find spare time reminisce brian and jacob both ecstatic about seeing their elementary school sweetheart once again these oddball ingredients tossed into one cocktail there is bound be some awkward romance between our three central characters predicting the outcome is not entirely difficult but keeping the faith is open entertaining and refreshingly relaxed as it travels en route from point point edward norton has emerged as one of the finest most flexibly versatile actors in success story sparked his critically lauded debut in the thriller primal fear after shockingly bitter roles in american history and most recently david finchers vicious fight club quaint romantic comedy might seem like peculiar choice not in the least norton slips into the directors chair for the first time keeping the faith and here his incisive resourceful approach helps add additional craft surprisingly perceptive screenplay stuart blumberg weighing every aspect it is unanimously an impressive directorial debut in addition norton pushes all the right buttons the sheepish sweetheart brian generating thoroughly likable screen presence stiller the zipper guy from there is something about mary is firm and funny boasting fullyripened comic maturity elfmans perky repetition can grow tiresome such is occasionally the case on tvs dharma and greg but she seems perfectly rambunctious here the remaining cast members offer fine support from anne bancroft as jacobs animated jewish mom milos forman as an elderly priest quick contribute intelligent advice keeping the faith is the perfect date flick though perfection is not word associate the in general there is turbulence during the process of liftoff as numerous failed attempts at establishing the situation cloud the projected comedy ahead once the does settle in it is often funny and always cheerful stiller norton and elfman have created three enormously lovable personalities we enjoy their interaction understand their various dilemmas and feel humbled realize everything rings perfectly true this is excluding the ending is acceptable and all but seems lack the charm and spontaneity of the preceding romantic entanglements nonetheless narrowly mishandled finale certainly will not wipe the smile off your face nor anyone elses in the audience keeping the faith is highly enjoyable romantic comedy although one that is more observant while surveying the questions of love rather than religion aww what the hell the quality is not quite heavensent but this little charmer could revive our faith in potentially tired filmmaking genre

naturally at the core of leon gasts when we were kings is the fight itself for what fight it was thanks the business savvy of don king an ageing muhammad ali was pitted against the formidable hulk of heavyweight champion george foreman fans were treated an round battle of endurance and strategy as much as brute strength that immediately entered boxing lore the benefit of the firsthand recollections of that old expug norman mailer this classic conflict is brought back life but when we were kings tackles issues that are harder pin down than the simple facts of boxing match questions of political power and social justice appear throughout this documentary gast could hardly choose otherwise considering the vocal uncompromising politics of muhammad ali member of the controversial black separatist movement the nation of islam ali opens gasts forceful swipe at the united states when ali hollers damn america the audience knows the imprecation is heartfelt the brutal yet casual way it is uttered leaves no doubt that ali is speaking his mind his decision buck the draft for vietnam is defended the same admirable fury no viet cong ever called me nigger ali reasons despite showcasing alis proud unequivocal politics one of the most impressive features of when we were kings is the subtle way in the documentary considers the difficulties inherent in the overarching philosophy of black unity and black symbolism that ali and his supporters champion listening the films numerous commentators it is clear that the geographic location for this rumble in the jungle is etched more in the imagination than anywhere you could place on map spike lee tells us that the event was pilgrimage coming home africa foreman reminds us that africa is the cradle of civilisation fair enough but this homeland is specific nation cursed less than inspiring reality it is the newly founded zaire and it is ruled president mobutu brutal dictator while ali respects mobutus ability forge an independent african state mailer notes that beneath the stadium in the titans battled lay hidden the presidents wellstocked torture chambers mailers insights are lost on most of the films commentators george plimpton recalls that he always felt he was in the congo rather than the newly christened zaire admirable restraint gast quietly suggests that for many the grandeur of myth and history all but obscured the reality of zaire squalid ruling elite mobutu is not the only dubious character benefit from the heady symbolism of black power don king resplendent in yellow kaftan and at ease the messiah label attributed him loyal disciple passes himself off as the voice of new black international solidarity understandably foreman believes he has gotten raw deal he may be as one sympathiser notes blacker than ali but he is denied the iconic status shared ali the thuggish mobutu and the tacky huckster don king africa zaire inspirational leader or vicious dictator all is left undifferentiated unconsidered in this optimistic celebration of black unity little wonder that the people of zaire were shocked find that alis opponent was not white admittedly these issues are only hinted at rather than substantially explored the audience must consider the significance of these issues themselves in their own time there is just too much cover too much that is truly worthy of celebration for protracted political analysis be justified the excitement of james brown and b king in concert for instance and of course there is always ali consider as he shamelessly and hilariously hams it up in front of the camera shadow boxing and uttering one inspired rhyme after another we gonna get it on coz we do not get along doubtlessly considering the multifaceted nature of the extravaganza they chose cover the makers of when we were kings faced numerous difficulties in deciding what issues and what personalities best deserved their attention fortunately refusing simplify their complex subject matter they have captured the richness and excitement of this unique event

kolya is one of the richest films have seen in some time zdenek sverak plays confirmed old bachelor who is likely remain so who finds his life as czech cellist increasingly impacted the fiveyear old boy that he is taking care of though it ends rather abruptly and am whining ecause wanted spend more time these characters the acting writing and production values are as high as if not higher than comparable american dramas this fatherandson delight sverak also wrote the script while his son jan directed won golden globe for best foreign language and couple days after saw it walked away an oscar in czech and russian english subtitles

anna and the king strides onto the screen in full regalia wearing brilliant suit of sumptuous landscapes deep vibrant colors and an epic storyline it is true beauty comes from it is subtle ruminations on the politics of power whether it is between governments or the interplay between man and woman anna jodie foster is widowed british schoolteacher touch of wanderlust trying grasp her quicksilver feelings concerning the recent death of her husband son in tow she takes the employ of king mongkut chow yunfat tutor his son in the english language mongkut sees the strength of the british and correctly surmises that his countrys future lies in opening itself up the ways of the western world anna function is help provide that link the core of the of course deals the blossoming love between anna and mongkut as it attempts germinate in the unfriendly soil of shifting political climate foster plays anna equal parts clenched jaw and wideeyed wonder she is assertive yet respectful of the king as she initially tries impose her western sensibilities upon him it is one of fosters strongest performances since silence of the lambs in role she could not have played earlier in her career she brings mature self awareness and determination that might not have come across from younger foster it is joy watch her cagily bargain for her own measure of influence within the realm of mongkuts monarchy when she makes her entrance into politically charged banquet midfilm she exudes hypnotic beauty that is deepened her textured performance chowyun fats king mongkut is every measure of fosters anna perhaps even more so this is the chow yunfat that hong kong cinema has been in love for nearly twenty years he is imposing yet vulnerable playful but stern it is an impressively assured and nuanced performance precious time is stolen from the movies minutes running time an unengaging subplot involving one the kings concubines bai ling and her love of commoner it strikes the subtlety of siams fabled white elephant as it stomps through the leisurely paced story some may be put off the action filled climax of the movie although bit inconsistent in tone from the rest of the it fits within the established subplot of perceived siege neighboring burma country backed the british anna and the king transcends being predictable traditional love story avoiding mawkishness it shows seduction of intelligence ever mindful of each others positions anna and king mongkut negotiate maze of social customs conflicting world views and lost loved ones connect on level that ultimately proves deeply satisfying if not achingly bittersweet

while screen adaptations of john irvings novels have been disappointingly uneven the films have all shared one particular strength key casting who can forget john lithgow as roberta muldoon the transsexual quarterback of the world according garp or nastassja kinski as susie the bear in the hotel new hampshire lot of good casting decisions have gone into the making of the cider house rules an adaptation of irvings poetic novel about restless young man called homer wells among those sound judgments was the decision have the splendid tobey maguire assume the pivotal role the decision cast michael caine as his mentor and father figure dr wilbur larch the etheraddicted head obstetrician of the st clouds orphanage maine and the decision offer jane alexander and kathy baker supporting roles as his head nurses then there are the brethren who populate the apple orchard where homer wells finds himself shortly after leaving st clouds including delroy lindo oscar worthy as the foreman of the migrant work detail that drifts up and down the coast as the seasons take them there is kate nelligan as the matriarch of the cider house and charlize theron as candy the lovely lonely wife of wwii bomber pilot paul rudd sent away on mission overseas leaving candy set lobster traps homer wells man who is never seen the ocean before let alone lobster am forgetting anyone yes kieran culkin and paz de la huerta as dissolute orphanage residents who make you sit up and take notice every time they are on the screen but the cider house rules the good people decisions do not end the cast irving has written his own screenplay in order get it right this time last years simon birch loosely based on his prayer for owen meaney was bigscreen example of irving handled substandardly the author appears fleetingly as stationmaster here rachel portman composer of such sweet and lyrical tenderness provides score that is absolutely right for the projectsweet lyrical and tender there is impressive new england photography oliver stapleton too last but no means least is my life as dog director lasse hallstr who shows enormous skill in pulling this collective together and helping bring irvings marvelously touching story life for the many beloved who pass away in the cider house rules it is an extraordinarily lifeaffirming story and now thanks these talented individuals it is an extraordinarily lifeaffirming

scream has titillating little scene that lays down the unwritten law of horror movie sequels quite well during filmclass discussion windsor college students articulate what these inevitable laws are and why sequels never live up the originals few rare exceptions are noted but they left out one scream surprise horror blockbuster scream became an instant hit and developed an obsessive coterie of fans included almost every teenager in america sequel was unavoidable but luckily the reteaming of writer kevin williamson and director wes craven gives us nothing fear in the way of lost entertainment in fact at the risk of sounding sacrilegious all the adorning fans of scream would say that scream might even be the better sidney prescott neve campbell the sinuous heroine who survived series of murders in woodsboro ca in the original scream is now two years older and off college majoring in theater meanwhile tv journalist gale weathers courtney cox who covered the murders in the first has since written book about the dreadful events book titled stab has been developed into major motion picture as scream opens crowd of overzealous teenagers are piling into crowded movie theater for the premiere of stab and before long young couple are butchered death unnoticed in the midst of hysteria this marks the beginning of new murder spree as an unknown copycat sets out repeat what is been done and finish what has not of course the killer is just as obsessed movies as the killer in the first and yes movies play huge role in the bizarre psychological outlook the murderer holds as heshe goes about slaying an assortment of gorgeous twenty year olds but this is sequel and without deviating from the original groundwork we are still given fresh outlook on horror movies this is in large part due williamsons deliciously written script will easily leave you satisfied as much as the condemns the use of cliches it is riddled them but it is done so effectively and skillful direction craven that you are not bound complain will note however that the whodunit did wind up being the first person suspected but believe me kept changing my mind as tried stay one ahead of the movie all the actors outdo themselves here we are not talking oscar performances but cambell cox david arquette as dewey riley and jamie kennedy as randy all give surprisingly satisfying performances that go beyond their last outing the characters remain true their roots and yet show clear sign of development over the last two years we can see how the events in the first has affected them but we do not lose any of the luster that made them such delight watch in the first place the nice thing about scream is that it does not seem offkilter from it is predecessor it is natural smooth and believable as far as horror films go transition from we skip two years but there does not seem be any holes or shortcuts taken in connecting the two flicks it flows so well that you feel more like you are reading chapter two of book long chapters eh than just revitalizing cast of familiar faces while main characters are usually the only connection in sequels scream entire plot structure correlates completely the first making for immediate fondness and absorption as said before scream easily lives up if not surpassing it is precursor the only reason scream will likely be hailed above scream is because it was the first this does not mean that it overcasts the unique whimsical humor or overall caliber of it is sequel it just means that scream will forever be known as the movie that mocked it is own while maintaining it is soughtafter qualities if ever followed it is original so well it would be scream and it makes this definite mustsee for all those unbridled scream fans out there scream fits snugly alongside scream and will hopefully receive as many high remarks it would top off the series quite well if it were not for the fact that two movies do not really make series it is unlikely assume that scream will not appear in the next few years but if they do decide turn this into an undeniably acclaimed horrortrilogy let us hope they can keep up the fantastic work like they say do not mess perfection but when moneymaking smashhit is almost guaranteed who is gonna listen

devotees of robert heinlein be forewarned paul verhoevens starship troopers is less an adaptation of heinleins novel than it is literary satire the authors jingoalltheway militarism and his tendency create plastic characters plastic conflicts had me expecting soulless faceless parade of carnage from the version and suppose that is exactly what verhoeven delivers sometimes hilarious results heinleins basic motifs are so faithfully rendered that their flaws become source of amusement while their strengths become the stuff of highenergy entertainment outlining the plot of starship troopers is fairly silly endeavor since it is basically big bug hunt aliens in broad daylight sometime in the future humanity is threatened giant malevolent insects have evolved into twentyfoottall action figures arachnids superimpaling spikes beetles that spew forth lava dragonflies guillotine legs among those who sign on save the earth are group of high school classmates from buenos aires conflicted rich kid johnny rico casper van dien his math whiz girlfriend carmen denise richards dizzy dina meyer who secretly carries torch for johnny and carl neil patrick doogie howser harris who notsosecretly carries torch for dizzy and also has talent for speaking telepathically ferrets while carmen heads for flight school and carl joins military intelligence johnny and dizzy become mobile infantry their various battles intertwining romantic subplots out of third season episode from beverly hills so if starship troopers is another movie where onedimensional characters wade through trite situations on their way killing bunch of aliens what makes it any better than say independence day movie where onedimensional characters waded through trite situations on their way killing bunch of slightly different aliens for one thing you sense that the filmmakers are aware of the pulp nonsense they have as source material the very absence of major stars in the cast feels thematically appropriate not just fiscally prudent if starship troopers had been turned into tvmovie aaron spelling would have produced it it is story requires emoting not acting it is prime time soap opera big guns played for all the dopey melodrama it is worth the noname cast also plays into verhoevens treatment of heinleins most controversial conceit in this society we learn one can only be full citizen after completing some sort of federal service military for most verhoeven pays the notion plenty of lip service then proceeds skewer it brilliant mock recruitment ads named after the world war iiera why we fight series in youngsters are indoctrinated into the joys of firearms or the pleasures of stomping cockroaches these characters really are just fresh meat for the grinder as one character puts it makes their lack of familiarity all the more fitting it is not that starship troopers is antimilitary because it never treats the true horror of war as anything but great big violent video game in fact the characters are living the propaganda particularly johnny who receives so many field promotions he may not remember his own rank the time the ends verhoeven is actually having it both ways he is making fun of gungho boosterism even as he fires his freshfaced recruits into battle on gungho booster rocket of visual effects if that makes starship troopers hypocritical at least it is enthusiastically staged hypocrisy there may not be person worth caring about in the whole but it moves like nobodys business verhoeven stages some thrilling action sequences sending swarms of bugs after the anonymous grunts then having various body parts strewn about the screen like landscaping it is that rare special effects blockbuster demonstrates sense of pacing match its budget was caught up in the action enough of the time that was not perpetually groaning over the absence of real human beings wish could find it in myself work up more outrage over the callous way humans are dispatched in starship troopers but it did not work out that way that would be punishing verhoeven for getting the heart of his material

no it is not bad in fact it is so good in achieving its purpose actually wished for the end itself quickly event horizon is not your runofthemill scifi am sure many who have watched this will agree me it is not even original in that sense and it does borrow heavily from films like alien hellraiser and even blade runner the magic of this lies in its unorthodox setting and methodical buildup that makes it wonderfully horrifying the story brings us the year where space travel have since enormously progressed the event horizon is actually ship built for secret experimental purpose it has the ability fold time and space thus making it possible for travelling distances not reachable in mans lifetime the ship disappeared as soon as it went into operation but after years it reappeared again within the orbit of neptune search and rescue team led miller fishburne is given the task check for survivors of the event horizon the designer of the ship dr weir neill follows along satisfy his curiosity on what actually happened his otherwise technologically impressive ship event horizon is scifi horror much truer the word than say alien would ever be while in alien the crew has cope ferocious creature while encased within tight spaces in event horizon the forces goes against the crew is undefined but yet so powerful and horrifying the story unfolds itself slowly and the suspense buildup is superb up till the point where really felt like saying out loud enough cannot stand this anymore there are more than enough jolts send your adrenalin pumping overtime the story in itself is not exactly something very exciting and also the acting is only at most average most commercial standards even so the essence of horror is carried out very well in this thanks its wellpaced storytelling disturbing set designs and some really gory sequences incidentally has been quite generously removed our censorship board director paul anderson who did mortal kombat and his team of atmosphere creators have done well in keeping event horizon within the bounds of the term horror this picture did not do very well in the us boxoffice most probably for the dreadfactor impact it has on most audiences people will not see it again and not many would recommend their friend watch this although on the face of it event horizon is mostly molded for massentertainment many thrills spills and suspense keep audiences in focus however the offbeat horror element it ultimately convey audiences is very disturbing my friend and could not say word each other for quite while after going through the experience of event horizon guess it was just the immense feeling of dread the had cast upon us be forewarned this is not for the fainthearted nor for pure entertainment be prepared be disturbed if you should decide watch this event horizon is highly recommendedbut at your own risk it has been long time since goodhorror embraced the big screen and event horizon is one

the italian hitchcock and acknowledged master of the giallo murdermystery dario argento again offers us fascinating turn on the formula in pheneomena this time the twist comes in the form of jennifer corvino jennifer connelly bright teenager gift for telepathically communicating insects sent girls boarding school in switzerland she soon learns of series of bizarre disappearances and at least one murder that has the schools population terrified chance meeting brilliant entomologist donald pleasance leads the two of them team up and solve the mystery the aid of her remarkable gift phenomena is an imaginative original thriller writerdirector argento creates several sequences of surreal haunting beauty here including masterfully shot sleepwalking episode and striking scene when swarm of flying insects descends on the school at jennifers beckoning the plot takes some wonderfully bizarre turns and the killers identity is genuinely shocking and surprising the director took big gamble soundtrack that mixes elements as diverse as heavy metal band iron maiden exrolling stone bill wyman and argentos favourite gothicelectronic outfit goblin but it gels surprisingly well the films opening music reccurs several times an eerie and evocative score that perfectly sets the overall tone argento fans beware the was released outside europe in terribly butchered form retitled as creepers this deleted nearly half an hour of footage mainly of key dialogue scenes

adaptation of hunter thompsons infamous semiautobiographical hallucinogenfueled book of the same title director terry gilliam of twelve monkeys and brazil fame took over the helm of this project after fellow director alex cox sid and nancy apparently alienated everyone associated the movie according gilliam plot writer thompson depp heads down las vegas his attorney dr gonzo del toro cover motorcycle race during their trip they systematically consume two bags of grass seventyfive pellets of mescaline five sheets of high powered blotter acid salt shaker halffull of cocaine whole galaxy of multicolored uppers downers screamers laughers quart of tequila quart of rum case of beer pint of raw ether and two dozen amyls the movie presents us the results of that heavy drug use critique have given this movie two separate ratings because believe that the enjoyment of this psychedelic picture is highly correlated the amount of drugs or alcohol that would be floating around in the viewers own mind whilst inhaling this cinematic vision of excess if you are prepared get high or intoxicated before watching this would say that this is one picture that you will thoroughly enjoy on multitude of colorful levels if on the other hand you decide stray from the addition of nefarious elements your system could not imagine you truly appreciating much of this druginduced pictures entire ride for all those sober dogs note have not read thompsons book having said that joblo did engage in an alcoholbased consumatory session before and during the viewing of this so his critique of the should be appreciated on that level this movie relies heavily on style and peculiar humour rather than substance or plot it moves admirably from one scene the next without much basis of their being while presenting us the two days in the life of writer hunter thompson during he seemed consume more drugs and alcohol than anyone could ever imagine it was and the times were apparently changing in the states johnny depp chews into his role like an overgrown child sucking on chocolate lollipop during the filming depp apparently become fast friends reallife writer thompson and was known wander off the set from time time for the sake of checking out the newest barmaid at the local watering hole thought he did seem exaggerate his walk little bit too much but then again this movie is supposed be wild exaggeration of everything and anything so who am talk the one thing that did blow my mind was the actual physical transformation endured actor benicio del toro for his role as dr gonzo could not believe that this fat samoan lawyer was the same guy who played the slick mumbling criminal in the usual suspects word on the street is that gained over pounds for this role and must say that his look was deliciously reprehensible plenty of cameos also pepper this kaleidoscopic moving picture in the form of ellen barkin christina ricci tobey maguire and cameron diaz along bunch of others other than that the soundtrack was expectedly eclectic the style was not as wild as thought it would be and the ending was certainly not much of barnburner but then again who really noticed this movie is about visions of bats floating through your head johnny depp looking goofy and being bald and the cornucopia of drugravaged scenes filling your own intoxicated system ideas of anarchy rebellion and the lost american dream and for all those who plan on seeing this movie without the partnership of mean drink or mighty doobie suggest you move further down the aisle buy yourself ticket godzilla and enjoy the visual fabrications manufactured for the unstimulated mind little known facts depp and del toro snorted plenty of powdered milk instead of cocaine bill murray also portrayed thompsonbased character in the where the buffalo roam johnny depp turned down roles in the three musketeers speed and legends of the fall for smaller and quirkier roles in benny and joon and what is eating gilbert grape in depp told rolling stone magazine that he would tried every drug the age of johnny hung out some of the members of oasis while filming the uncompleted divine rapture in ireland and later played some slide guitar on the album be here now johnny was born in kentucky is highschool dropout has nicknamed himself mr stench has been engaged four women until now including actress winona ryder whose winona forever tattoo had be altered wino forever after their breakup currently plays guitar in band called and owns the viper room nightclub in a

what is freedom how does one determine who is free in those questions were more difficult answer then they are now yet the mistakes of our forefathers must be examined in order rectify current situations that is in essence what steven spielbergs gripping drama amistad is about through its various dramas spielberg presents case about group of africans who after being seized from their home were forced onto ship and sent the united states aboard la amistad on their way there the slaves led cinque djimon hounsou rebelled killing off part of the crew however the ship was still directed towards the united states where the africans were brought trial under murder in the court various factions claim ownership of the slaves and therefore try seize them away the united states government led president martin van buren nigel hawthorne and secretary of state secretary forsyth david paymer try ship the africans spain where an year old isabella ii anna paquin wants them back the two spaniards who own la amistad want the slaves for themselves the american ship that found the slaves also wants them in the midst of this are two abolitionists stellan skaarsgard and morgan freeman who want the slaves be free they enlist the help of lawyer matthew mcconaughey who tries free them through various legal proceedings the case appears before the supreme court where it is argued expresident john quincy adams anthony hopkins the itself is visual wonder spielberg favorite janusz kaminski sets the in dark somber mood when appropriate and visual setting when appropriate as well at times the is very slow and very methodical however spielberg is not at his finest here because the courtroom scenes have tendency lag the is in essence courtroom drama one whose events are oversimplified the characterization is also weak displaying weaknesses in building up characters such as the lawyer baldwin mcconaughey and especially morgan freemans abolitionist but spielbergs finest work in the the opening scene scene of cinques family and the brutal voyage of the slaves america is altogether stunning it is this emotional force that carries the mcconaughey is superb as the lawyer defending the africans hopkins is sensational as the old adams freeman is outstanding when used spielberg vastly under uses his supreme talents and the rest of the cast is stellar the movie however belongs hounsou his emotional intensity is brilliant spielberg manages make even the slowest scenes sparkle focus on hounsou and the films extraordinary power is simply captivating the is flawed for most of the supporting characters are merely cardboard but that does not matter the story is gripping one and one of extreme importance kudos spielberg for finding it finding the right men for the job and letting the audience listen the words of cinque good job all around

your friends and neighbors is rather bizarre about people who hop in and out of bed each other written and directed neil labute who is first in the company of men was simply marvelous disappoints bit here this one the story involves two couples ben stiller catherine keener and aaron eckhart amy brenneman an artist assistant nastassja kinski and an egotistical women abuser jason patric the characters names are not apparent and are not mentioned in the entire movie each of the characters has their own sexual style and they do not seem merge together well so the group experiments behind their respective partners back there are some hysterical scenes one involves jason patric aaron eckhart and ben stillers characters they are all in sauna talking about their best lay when jason patrics character makes surprising confession the whole scene is hilarious and exceptionally well written and acted the enjoyed this movie although it seemed tad lengthy even though it only runs min the films cast is exceptional oscar caliber performances catherine keener aaron eckhart and jason patric would not recommend this people who are offended conversations that are very sexually explicit it did seem offend people more than half of the people in the theater left during the although your friends and neighbors does not have the power of labutes earlier it still manages be somewhat entertaining and funny while maintaining melancholy philosophy on human relationships
