i remember seeing the trailer of the black cauldron on the pinocchio video it really scared me and did not want go see it however after heard about how wonderful it was wanted see it did not get chance do so until now the disneys th animated feature opens menacing shot of great black cauldron unshrouded mist as narrator begins tell the tale long time ago in the land of prydain there was king so evil that his spirit was captured in the cauldron it has been hidden for centuries and whoever possesses it will have the power conjure up an army of deathless warriors and them rule the world and destroy it then we meet farmerwizard dallben and his young apprentice taran taran dreams of being warrior instead of being pigkeeper they have pig named henwen one day as he gives hen wen nice warm bath the pig goes crazy and dallben then realizes after watching hen wens thoughts through bucket of water that taran must hide hen wen in the forest an evil ruler known as the horned king is searching for the black cauldron and only hen wen has the power show its location taran leads hen wen into the forest but of course he loses her and tries go find her along the way he meets up mischievous little creature named gurgi who desires munchings and crunchings much his dismay besides he stole an apple that taran was trying use bring back hen wen when he hears hen wens squeal from far away though he races her rescue only see her get kidnapped dragonlike gwythants taran chases after the gwythants and finds himself staring at the horned kings castle from far away taran climbs the castle walls and brings himself into the castle where he attempts rescue hen wen he manages do so but he is himself captured and thrown into the dungeon there he meets princess eilonwy and her magic bauble another thing the horned king was hoping use find the cauldron and the two escape through the deep castle walls along the way taran finds sword in burial chamber and they rescue comic bard named fflewdurr flamm who has harp whose strings break whenever he tells lie the three manage escape the horned kings castle but not before taran realizes that his sword is magic as they rest in the forest gurgi reappears claiming have found hen wens trail he leads taran eilonwy and fflewdurr way of pig tracks whirlpool suddenly they all get sucked under and they meet the fairylike fairfolk taran is reunited hen wen and informed that the black cauldron is hidden in the land of morva he then devises crazy idea that if they can destroy the cauldron it would prevent the horned king from destroying their world the help of grumpy fairy named doli the four travelers manage find themselves at mysterious cottage it turns out be no ordinary cottage three comically strange witches inhabit the place when taran tells them that they are searching for the black cauldron they agree let him have it in exchange for his sword taran agrees much eilonwys horror but at least they get the black cauldron but the cauldron cannot be destroyed only its evil powers can be stopped the only way do so is for living being climb into it of his own free will never return alive things take turn for the worse when the horned kings henchmen capture taran eilonwy and fflewdurr along the black cauldron and lead them back the castle taran eilonwy and fflewdurr watch in horror as the horned king unleashes the supernatural powers of the cauldron ressurect his army of deathless warriors this is the most horrifying scene in the because here dead army comes alive just when all seems lost though gurgi reappears and rescues taran eilonwy and fflewdurr taran is about jump into the black cauldron but gurgi stops him not wanting him throw his life away gurgi then jumps into the black cauldron and the deathless warriors decay taran tries find way rescue gurgi but he is forced do battle against the horned king he kicks the horned king away who is then magically sucked into the black cauldron where its powers immediately destroy him completely taran eilonwy and fflewdurr manage escape from the horned kings castle just as it selfdestructs the witches then reappear and attempt take the now useless black cauldron away but fflewdurr stops them saying that they never give anything away they bargain in response this the witches offer taran his sword back but taran instead has new trade the cauldron for gurgi the trade is made gurgis seemingly lifeless body reappears before the heartbroken group as taran cradles him in his arms though gurgi stirshe is not dead after all the happy group then returns home where hen wen brought home the fairfolk once the dangers are past dallben and even doli await their triumphant return as spectacular as it sounds the black cauldron really suffered lot in its past times before ron miller was fired from his position as chairman of walt disney productions he had bought novel lloyd alexander called the black cauldron sword and sorcery tale for the studio bringing this book the screen was the studios fondest dream miller who entitled himself as the executive producer promised that they would do so after they had proved themselves on other projects when micheal eisner and his executives arrived at the disney animation studio the animators were struggling complete the black cauldron this time things had gone really rocky for the animation department many of the studios old men had retired or died therefore the animators suffered hard time making this originally budgeted at million the costs raised million because of constant changes on everything and when it was finally released on june the black cauldron was greeted praising reviews from some critics but somehow the flopped the was rated pg and the although disneyfied from lloyd alexanders chronicles of prydain is what this is based on was much more scarier and darker than disneys other previous efforts such as the rescuers and the fox and the hound is probably why so many people considered it too scary and stayed away from it in addition other critics rejected it for having no heart and unmemorable compared other disney animated features but whatever the real reason the black cauldron was financial disaster grossing only million the failure of the grounded the studios animation department and exiled the animation team annex buildings in nearby glendale and it seemed like animated features would no longer become part of the studios reputation the next two disney animated features the great mouse detective and oliver and company although little more lighthearted than the black cauldron did not do much better although oliver and company grossed much more than the black cauldron and the great mouse detective only the little mermaid did the studio regain its reputation for successful animated features as for the black cauldron it was rereleased in some cities for temporary time under the title taran and the magic cauldron finally the studio locked the in the vault and denied that it ever even was released because of all this you might ask yourself was the black cauldron really such bad movie the people who had seen the did not think so in fact many people had calls buena vista home video requesting for the but of course they denied it for while it seemed like the black cauldron would never be released video until september disney released the black cauldron video in the united kingdom few people imported the video from england and converted ntsc including me and for those who had not seen the yet am included here they got quite treat but people who had bootleg copies of the black cauldron noticed that in the scene where the horned king raises his army of deathless warriors about seconds of ghoulish looking skeletons were slightly trimmed so that the would get u rating in the uk the rating means universal suitable for all ages kinda like their own version of somewhere online team of diehard the black cauldron fans signed petition that said bring back the black cauldron and because of that disney finally decided release the video the united states before that time rumors online had been made that the video would be trimmed like the uk video so that it would get g rating and that they would add in songs those rumors were put rest when the walt disney company announced that the black cauldron would be released in its pg rated version even still when it was finally released the us some reaction was mixed some felt that it was indeed cut but some felt that it was not but these where only minor criticisms seemed laughable since that was absent for thirteen years was finally available as for myself when saw the movie for the first time on converted ntsc video did not expect much at all in fact had heard so many mediocre things about it that did not think the would ever be such good much my surprise when saw the first few minutes of the was asking myself this is the same everyone saw the one that flopped at the box office the one that critics and filmgoers alike called bad movie this does not seem like all of the above instead it is classic in its own right the has wonderful cast of characters there is taran grant bardsley an assistant pig keeper who would rather be warrior than pigkeeper the storys hero the critics have said that taran is not likeable at all but the opposite is true he is brave loyal and eventually learns lesson about friendship later on there is likeable character here not that he is the only likeable character in the there is gurgi john biner lovable little uh thing who remains loyal taran even though they do not quite hit it off at first but another likeable character is the bad guy comic henchman dwarf named creeper phil fondacairo who is loyal the films imaginative and sinister villain the horned king voiced gruesomely john hurt yet he also fears his neck the other characters including the sidekicks spunky but sweet princess named eilonwy and the comic bard fflewdurr flamm and three comically wicked witches who hide dark secret although pleasant and likeable are not quite as well rounded as they should be the story itself is an adventurous one quest involving the mystical pig hen wen the black cauldron itself and an army of deathless ones everything hooking opening spectacular finale elmer bernsteins music also tells the story perfectly in dark yet calming manner the animation itself is surprisingly good considering that this was created in the darkest time of the studios even though there are some occasional effects that are not quite good like the ground opening when the black cauldron rises out of the earth the animation overall is top notch overall this is an entertaining endeavor fans unfamiliar the lloyd alexander chronicles of prydain will get kick out of this one except young kids there are some extremely scary scenes are more darker than disneys other films although some consider the stampede sequence from the lion king and frollo observing esmeralda in the fires of hell in the hunchback of notre dame are just as scary is the main reason why this is rated pg fans familiar the lloyd alexander series will recognize the differences between the novel and the movie even though it does not have all of the ingredients of true disney this is classic in its own right and deserves far better chance than what it has been given that better chance has finally come whatever reason about why the black cauldron was such big failure seems have disappeared and the has finally achieved its place among disneys most proudest achievements cannot help but think though whatever would have happened if the black cauldron was box office success

quiz show an almost perfectly accurate true story is based upon the events of the popular television show of the mids twentyone on this trivial game show contestants were placed in isolation booths and then answered questions corresponding category of their choice on they wagered an amount of points on the game went on until player reached twenty one points on felt they had earned enough points win but after ratings began fall when players were struggling break the zero mark the producers decided fix the game giving the answers contestant before the game began quiz show illustrates the true stories of two particular contestants herbie stempel and charles van doren stempel john turturro former i and your jewish man raising family stempel has been the reigning champion on twentyone for many weeks and has accumulated thousands of dollars in his mind he is the best thing on television and the people love him although in the mind of the show is producers herbie stempel is getting old dan enright david paymer in particular feels that the people are tired of seeing jewish guy from queens bad teeth and that the kids need someone better look up therefore they need find another contestant whom would be worthy role model and the people will look up and cheer win someone who can defeat stempel even if they have resort cheating enter charles van doren ralph fiennes welleducated professor from widely recognized family van doren had decided try out for the game show tic tac dough because his friends thought he would be good at that sort of thing but when albert freedman hank azaria enrights assistant spots van doren the two decide that they have found their soontoberuler of the twentyone kingdom van doren is not too keen on the idea of receiving the answers ahead of time so enright tells stempel that he is going give the wrong answer on purpose in order lose the game after stempel loses the throne van doren he starts feel cheated he should meanwhile on his own dick goodwin rob morrow harvard law graduate has decided start an investigation on twentyone try and find out if there have been any wrongdoings his investigation yields shocking results and leads trial for enright and the others involved quiz show is an extremely well done movie and robert redfords direction is especially superb the performances turned in john turturro ralph fiennes and rob morrow are very good although it seems that turturro stands out more than any quiz show is also very precise when it comes explicating the true events that inspired the definitely you should not miss

is jimmy stewart the greatest actor of alltime it is quite possible his career spanned over years and he acted in more movies than most actors ever could yet when he is talked about in the media he is generally thought of as an actor who played one type of role the nice guy and that is really shame the naked spur features jimmy stewart in role completely different than what people would expect from him it is western stewart specialized in around this period and it casts him as desperate man out collect bounty on man who used be his friend before he finds that man though he runs into two men who agree help him thinking he is sheriff when the criminal is eventually caught the two men discover stewarts secret and decide they want piece of the action too the rest of the is suspenseful journey in each man suspects the other constantly also featured is the woman travelling the criminal well played janet leigh we are never too sure who is side she is really on until the end leigh is an actress probably best known for her role as the shower lady from psycho and that is unfair she gives strong performance as woman who is pulled between these two men stewart gives performance unlike anything have ever seen from him he usually keeps cool no matter what occurs but here he gets downright hysterical at times think perhaps he took this role prove the public that he was more than just nice guy his performance borders on psychotic at times but loved watching every second of it it is roles like this one that make me admire him as much as do he was an actor unafraid take chances and even ruin his public image

every once in while you see that is so effective in delivering the goods that it is easy forget and forgive its glaring imperfections such is the case good will hunting subtle character study about socially inept mathematics genius who struggles find his path in life despite some serious character problems this is still very good you probably know about the plot so ll make it quick will hunting damon is janitor at i he really smarter than einstein but nobody knows it he likes go out his friend chuckie affleck and their other workingclass buddies and drink beer he goodlooking charismatic and witty but has terrible time authority and stiff college folk after getting into tiff the law distinguished professor skarsg rd discovers will genius and offers him chance clean up his record and avoid jail time at price he must attend weekly sessions therapist and work on various mathematical problems that have stumped the academic elite the professor after outsmarting and scaring the hell out of couple of different psychologists he meets his match when hooked up oncepromising therapist named sean maguire williams who has his own problems in the meantime will meets british medical school student driver and they begin fall in love the story starts out well enough and is pretty original basis for even though we ve seen movies about misunderstood erratic prodigies before shine ring bell the script here creates complex narrative that doesn just focus solely on one character alas though this is not perfect as much as you feel like it could ve been while watching it the one real problem had it is the unrealistic nature of the main character is it possible for lowly janitor be this intelligent of course is it possible for him be estranged from any deep human relationships usually yes but is it possible for him also be so handsome funny quick the tongue and citystreet tough not very likely come on usually these guys are total nerds who can even buy their own shirts much less talk down harvard student in hip pub while picking up phone numbers from pretty med school girls will is just little too perfect and in order accept the character your disbelief suspension needs be in excellent working condition the heavyhanded antiwar statement made will at government job interview late in the is also boorish overlong pompous and completely unnecessary all this sounds pretty bad but the somehow makes up for it in other ways damon acting overshadows the fact that the character is slightly unbelievable his performance is truly extraordinary leads me the really good part of the review the strength of this movie can be summed up in one single word acting can recall seeing recently that was so wellacted from top bottom from minnie driver frustrated lover ben affleck laidback best friend and all the small roles in between the performances are magnificent robin williams skill is given as bereaved psychologist who could ve had legendary career but was knocked off the path somewhere down the line the real gem though is stellan skarsg rd turn as professor lambeau an awardwinning mathematician who feels reduced in comparison younger smarter will hunting the scenes between williams and skarsg rd as two old college pals who ve been brought back together this enigmatic kid display some of the best acting ve ever seen when say delivering the goods this is what m talking about watching these two work is what going see movies is all about gus van sant die for drugstore cowboy cold urban direction is right on as well as danny elfman sauntering musical score highly recommend good will hunting despite its faults it is still an intriguing and fascinating and you are not likely see better acted one this year

men in black is an explosive mix of science fiction action and comedy that hits the target in every possible way although another alien movie men in black succeeds in every way that independence day did not and towers above many other movies of its type the brilliant acting especially tommy lee jones as agent kay is also as good as it gets director barry sonnenfeld who was behind the camera for the addams family movies and get shorty has crafted masterpiece the story behind men in black is just as interesting as you would want it be the men in black or mib are topsecret governmental agency that is not known exist the mib are responsible for saving the world from the scum of the universe though job indeed the opens truckload of illegal aliens the human kind being transported across the mexico border and into the united states presumably these aliens are all migrant workers that is until the mib show up and begin interrogating them agent kay selects particular suspicious worker and takes him away from the other local authorities discover that he is not an illegal human alien but real extraterrestrial alien when the alien makes run for it agent kay is forced eliminate the alien one of the mibs very unique weapons and after one of the local law enforcement officers witnesses this bizarre occurrence agent kay is forced use another very unique device on them the device described as out of state eliminates the memory of anyone it is used on from here we are introduced james edwards played very well will smith edwards police officer is chasing fleeing criminal the criminal gives very good chase and at one point when edwards confronts him the criminal pulls out very different looking weapon that disintegrated when it hit the ground edwards continues chase the very athletic criminal the top of building where the criminal informs edwards that he must let him go because someone is after him edwards does not take this seriously but when the criminal shows very nonhuman characteristics and leaps off the building he begins wonder back at the police station agent kay shows up ask edwards few questions he informs edwards that is was in fact nonhuman that he was chasing and that the gun he pulled out was definitely not manmade he has edwards identify the gun and asks edwards come the mib headquarters the following day edwards arrives and finds that he is involved in recruiting process along various other men who seem bit more qualified than he after goofing up for half of the time edwards puts on show at the firing range and agent kay notes the reason why he feels edwards should be the man join the mib he chased down the criminal on foot is something that no one is supposed be able do in the meantime an upstate new york farm has very close encounter edgar vincent donofrio owner of the farm investigates strange crash landing and is attacked the inhabitant of the flying object presumes jump inside edgar and use his body as human transport the bug as he is called is an intergalactic terrorist who has come earth attempt kill two ambassadors and it up the mib newly recruited agent jay formerly james edwards exterminate the bug and save the planet from intergalactic war men in black delightfully combines fastpaced action often hilarious comedy is usually from will smith although tommy lee jones opens up his comedic personality in this the special effects are also very well done and are not the entire source of the plot as in another big alien from the past summer screenwriter ed solomon writer of super mario bros and the upcoming xmen has surely struck gold this story all ages will enjoy men in black it is an extremely fun that you will want see again although it runs very quick and speedy minutes the entire from beginning end is nonstop adventure the ending of the ties up few loose ends for one of the main characters is also very well done sequel is already being planned so there is more look forward

ralph fiennes is carving out nice niche for himself in the genre of period piece romances for his followup the academybeloved the english patient he has once again turned love story this time directed accomplished australian maker gillian armstrong little women despite some obvious overplotting oscar and lucinda is mostly effective and often affecting motion picture that touches our hearts while daring our minds balk at its implausible coincidences the opens in the mids parallel storylines in new south wales australia and devon england as the helpful narrative voice of geoffrey rush informs us lucinda leplastrier cate blanchett is headstrong young woman being raised in the australian outback meanwhile half the world away oscar hopkins fiennes has broken his puritanical father over religious issues and has gone away school study be an anglican priest lucinda is fascinated glass oscar is obsessed theology lucinda is rich oscar is poor lucinda is forward and selfassured oscar is timid and uncertain of himself yet one characteristic unites these two diverse individuals the compulsion gamble whether it is on horses dogs cards or the flip of coin and fate has decreed that they will one day meet that day does not occur until minutes into the when oscar boards ship bound for sidney australia where he hopes change his life and minister anyone in need of his help another of the passengers is lucinda who is returning from england where she was shopping for machinery equip her newlyacquired glassworks factory at first their relationship is that of reverend and confessor but it does not take long for both of them recognize kindred spirit in the other friendship is born and once they reach australia it develops into something more potent but oscar is uncertain of lucindas affection and feels he must do something prove himself worthy of her oscar and lucinda is not beyond little manipulation get the desired emotional response and there are times when the storyline curves in preposterous directions on more than one occasion it is apparent that events are occurring specifically funnel the characters into position where there is only one possible route coincidence is crucial plot device without it this movie cannot go anywhere the voiceover narration never one of my favorite techniques is too verbose and breaks into the story at undesirable moments however without it the final twist will not reveal would not be as poignant yet despite these quibbles enjoyed oscar and lucinda storyline faults pale in the light of two such finelyrealized characters thematically the is also strong the unifying motif that everything in life is gamble is successfully delineated oscar and lucinda do not just wager their money they bet their hearts minds and souls card game they engage in shortly after they first meet could easily be considered form of emotional strip poker where defenses are peeled away reveal their shared secret passion oscar does not see gambling as vice in fact he believes that the greatest chance one takes in life is betting ones immortal soul on the truth of religious faith ralph fiennes who normally plays strong confident men is very much at home as the fumbling insecure oscar the actor brings variety of nervous tics the part all of subtly add vague sense of discomfort whenever oscar is onscreen as good as fiennes is however he is eclipsed cate blanchett the actress who appeared earlier this year as one of the leads in bruce beresfords paradise road is mesmerizing as lucinda she gives this liberated woman her flash and feeds the chemistry between the two lead characters so that it sparkles rather than fizzles effective support is provided ciaran hinds the male lead in jane austens persuasion as lucindas close friend tom wilkinson the full monty as oscars mentor and clive russell as selfserving adventurer there is real magic in the way armstrong develops the story keeping things moving in unexpected directions without lingering too long on any one moment or sequence in fact wish she had devoted little more time the luminous middle act has oscar and lucinda together the skill of consummate storyteller she weaves romance friendship passion humor and tragedy together into complete package the characters all of their human foibles and neuroses are wonderfully developed fiennes and blanchett so who cares if the storyline is little ripe and unwieldy oscar and lucinda still offers abundant pleasures reward the viewer

in october of the united states found itself on the brink of nuclear holocaust when spy plane flyovers of cuba revealed that the soviet union was actively deploying and installing medium range ballistic missiles miles from the us president john kennedy bruce greenwood and his staff must face this major threat world peace and stop soviet expansionism in director roger donaldsons dramatic recreation of the most dangerous crisis in american history in thirteen days one of the highlights come out of madefortv movies was entry called missiles of october that also recreated the historic event that almost embroiled the us ussr and the world in an all out nuclear showdown that teleplay starring william devane and martin sheen as john and bobby showed the political tensions of the period that brought the fore the danger the world faced in those two weeks in now quarter of century after the landmark tv movie director roger donaldson and producer kevin costner team together again the last time was for the taught spy thriller no way out reenact the events of that most dangerous time in americas and the worlds history taken from the viewpoint of special assistant the president kenneth odonnell costner donaldson and crew recreate that volatile event once again as the country is plunged into what could have been total nuclear war as odonnell gets ready head work one october morning he deals the usual family crises and problems meanwhile u spy plane photo mission over cuba has produced some startling images medium range nuclear missiles in the first stage of deployment suddenly kens routine day switches into crisis mode as the president and his key advisor bobby begin muster the considerable forces of the us military face the soviet threat where thirteen days differs most from missiles of october is as expected in the scope of the project there is big difference budgetwise between making television docudrama and one that goes the big screen it shows as the makers of thirteen days craft recreation of the cuban missile crisis that encompasses not only the political intrigue within the white house it also depicts the events that took place as america girds itself for nuclear confrontation the cast true ensemble is led surprisingly bruce greenwood as jfk and not kevin costner costners odonnell represents the family guy thing as the drama of the crisis has its impact on him and his family this puts personal spin on the as we see both the crisis and americas preparation for war and the pressure it brings bear on those in the know kenny reassures his wife and kids that all will be okay and they will be safe but he knows that if the crisis comes head his family will be no more the meat of thirteen days is in the big picture not the microcosm of family though this is where the stands out as we see the workings of our government on the highest levels the story does not just cover the faceoff between the worlds two most powerful countries it also depicts the animosity between the president and the militarycia the disaster of the bay of pigs invasion the year before left distrustful taste in the mouths of the generals and admirals who blame the kennedys for not backing the cuban expatriates fighting fidel castro the missile crisis becomes struggle for power as the armynavyair force want flex their might and invade cuba while jfk wants end the confrontation peaceably but americas dignity and world leadership intact while the internal battle for power rages in the white house air force chief curtis lemay kevin conway advising the president bomb cuba into the stone age our armed forces are set into motion stop the soviets blockade of offensive weapons cuba this is where the political intrigues of high office are replaced exciting action when the first confrontation takes place between us warship and soviet freighter the tension is palpable the most involving action sequence takes place late in the game as another is sent up shoot some snaps of the buildup and the fully prepared soviet forces launch an antiaircraft attack on the hapless pilot of the spy plane this is sweaty palm sequence say the least making you squirm in your seat as you try help the pilot avoid those missiles the ensemble cast places greenwood as the first among equals like weight given all the principle players greenwood does not play act at being caricature of jfk foregoing the typical kennedy boston accent instead he plays the man as powerful figure who has maintain the dignity of the office directing his subordinates but giving them the latitude make clear all of his options kennedy used this decision committee method good effect as his senior staff uncovers all the options available the president costner as ken odonnell is really supporting cast member as kennedy crony brought on board as personal political favor costner plays odonnell as if he crammed on old jfk speeches forced kennedyesque twang his speech the rest of the players are first rate from start finish steven culp looking and sounding just like robert kennedy the rest of the familiar players in this drama are uniformly well cast too standing out are michael fairman as the beleaguered us ambassador the un adlai stevenson who was forced become the challenging voice of the united states in the united nations and remember the confrontation vividly the filmmakers capture the accusations laid down stevenson accuracy using old style video footage good effect dylan baker has the look and feel of the intelligentsia as the brainy secretary of defense robert mcnamara kevin conway gives his general lemay the right bomb them hell attitude also notable is christopher lawford as navy pilot william ecker who his wingman takes on the dangerous mission of lowlevel photo recon into the heart of cuba bravely challenging kenny odonnells admonition don get shot tech credits are superb across the board an admirable depiction of the us armed forces being placed on war footing it is an impressive production the careful use of period aircraft and ships that gives the veracity fitting the event solid costuming isis mussenden is subtle but has the look of the kennedys there is the usual array of vintage cars from the period make things look right the special fx of the sequences are nice crafting of computer imaging the cuban missile crisis is probably the most intense two weeks that the united states has ever faced in its survival as world leader helmer donaldson and his fine crew and cast have given the depiction of this crucial event the care and attention details that make this one of the finest docudramas of the year give thirteen days an

true faith and its expression through organized religion is difficult subject for motion picture tackle headon is probably why so few of them do it even the most religious directors like martin scorsese or ingmar bergman usually address issues of faith in implicit rather than explicit religious terms so it is not hard see why it took robert duvall fifteen years get the apostle onto the bigscreen as matter of fact even after fifteen years he still never managed get financial backing and he ended up paying for it million of his own money he also wrote the script directed the and starred as the central character fiery texas preacher named euliss sonny dewey few filmmakers have the courage and sheer audacity take on that kind of financial technical and creative responsibility singlehandedly and it is testament what an intensely personal project this was for duvall and thankfully every bit of that personal investment translates onscreen into power and honest emotion sonny is an energetic pentecostal preacher who has been speaking actually shouting from behind the pulpit since he was twelve he spends much of his time traveling about the country evangelizing other preachers at tent revivals unlike most characterizations of intense preachers sonny is not phony or swindler and the films purpose is not unearth hypocrisy and sin in either sonny or the church duvall makes it abundantly clear that sonny truly believes in what he says although like all humans he has weaknesses one of his weaknesses become apparent when he finds out that not only does his longsuffering wife jessie farrah fawcett want leave him for another man in the congregation but the two of them have secretly plotted remove him as preacher faced the loss of two things he loves passionately his church and his family that same raw power that allows sonny get entire congregations rocking and swaying transforms into violent temper at his sons baseball game sonny snaps and smashes his wifes lover in the face baseball bat inflicting wound that may be fatal not knowing what else do sonny disappears he throws away his identification drives his car into lake and takes bus louisiana hoping start over again in the tiny mostly poor coastal town of bayou boutte sonny once again finds his calling after befriending simple auto mechanic walt goggins and tracking down the towns exminister john beasley sonny sets up his own church the one way heaven temple rechristening himself as the apostle f he quickly draws together an eager congregation and together they realize real change in each others lives but always sonnys past is lurking step behind him waiting swallow his progress duvall has made his intentions in making the apostle clear in recent article in newsweek he wrote filmmakers hardly ever depict spirituality such strong emphasis on the holy spirit and when they do it tends be patronizing full of charlatans and snake handlers but what really wanted do was try understand what these preachers go through and what they believe and portray it in an accurate way the strength of duvalls convictions turn out be the strength of his the apostle always rings true even in the most painful moments because we know he is being sincere the subject matter after fifteen years of traveling the country listening all shapes and sizes of ministers and taking studious notes on what they said duvall has captured the energy and vitality of what it means be truly spiritual his sonny is man who speaks directly god and expects be spoken right back have always called you jesus and you have always called me sonny he says when neighbors call and complain that he is being too loud one night in one his rants the man upstairs sonnys mother june carter cash just hangs up on them because she knows there is no sense trying interrupt him the main theme emerge from the apostle is the fact that good can come from any situation sonnys act of violence toward another human being is inarguably horrific thing and duvall never shrinks from that fact however that very same act of violence is what brings sonny bayou boutte where he finds people whom he desperately needs and who desperately need him in his short time in louisiana he does world of good and when the police finally show up take him away he goes quietly knowing that he deserves the punishment that is awaiting him and as scene during the final credits shows he even turns his punishment into positive opportunity for change and betterment it is that strength in sonnys character that makes him so appealing and magnetic others he is flawed but he is powerful enough overcome those flaws weak men are the ones who simply accept their weaknesses and lack the desire better themselves watching duvall onscreen it is not hard imagine that he would have been magnificent preacher if he had chosen that vocation over acting as sonny he completely inhabits the character and his performance is certainly the best of the year because he spent so much time absorbing the traits methods quirks and personalities of real preachers duvall was able create complete character who always feels indelibly human as director duvall feels that less is more his camera simply takes in what goes on in front of it very little intrusion there are no fancy crane shots or extended dollies or excessive closeups duvall knew that the power of the films characters enhanced the fact that he cast mostly nonprofessional churchgoers and actual ministers did not need be artificially enhanced in this way the apostle almost plays out like documentary not only in its technical simplicity but more importantly in its sense of reality

when someone journeys the theater see comedy he always risks having sit through inanity such as what we recently saw in films like edtv and office space it really is too bad that comedies are so hit andmiss because when moviegoer goes in theater expecting be amused it really is shame when the alleged comedy fails deliver but weep not dear readers because the latest comedy out of the movie mill is nothing less than sure bet austin powers the spy who shagged me is one of the funniest things have had the pleasure see in long time completely looney delightful parody of the often pretentious james bond flicks if all comedies or even half or what am saying even fifth of them could be this consistently hysterical would take up residence at my local multiplex even more this movies credit is the fact that it is sequel the sleepercult hit austin powers international man of mystery the original came out of nowhere it was lowbudget eccentric movie that many expected flop like leslie nielsen parody all of sudden it was being quoted teenagers all over america ironically powers yeeeeah baby yeah has almost become an icon of the late thus another installment was inevitable but it is also undoubtedly welcome the spy who shagged me is one of the most unrestrained over thetop comedies have ever seen in my entire life it brings back most of the characters from its predecessor even if only briefly and adds new ones austin powers mike myers swinging hipster from the transported into the has go back his own time get back his mojo oh you will figure it out dr evil meyers again has stolen he enlists the help of gorgeous secret agent felicity shagwell now that his prior sidekick vanessa has been properly disposed of in hilarious opening sequence played without much distinguishable gusto heather graham and together they go back the defeat dr evil yet again surprisingly the real star is dr evil rather than austin he gets most of the screen time because he was so popular in the first movie perhaps this is true because he is portrayed and written so affectionately instead of being the scheming villainous mad scientist we might expect from character like this he is bumbling often sweet mad scientist wannabe the spy who shagged me has much of the same stuff we saw in the original but that is okay me because the original left us wanting more the time that one was over we have not had nearly our share of shag jokes crude puns and powers antics and this sequel satisfies our appetites even its conclusions am still not sure have had my fill of bits like do you smoke after sex do not know baby never looked this may seem awfully immature of me but understand that the austin powers series unlike most of the crap feeds us these days is genuinely funny do not know if have ever laughed harder at any movie than did during the jerry springer send up or the indubitably hilarious just the two of us rendition dr evil and his new miniature clone named minime do not have any pretensions that this is particularly smart social satire or anything of the sort indeed there is little beyond the joy viewer feels when he sees something that is able entertain him as much as this movie did but as far as am concerned that is enough eugene novikov

almost full decade before steven spielbergs saving private ryan asked whether could be both anti war and prosoldier john irvins hamburger hill proved it could lost in the inundation of critical acclaim that greeted oliver stones platoon this excellent was dismissed as too militaristic it is hard understand exactly whyunless irvin in assembling his motley collection of young men who for predictable and often naive reasons chose show up for the vietnam debacle has refused present us the stone killer drugstoked psycho and ruthless opportunist who have become vietnam war epics what the polack the hillbilly and the kid from brooklyn became wwii movies hamburger hill based on true story is not an easy watch there is scene that will have graying antiwar activists squirming in their seats or moved genuine tears and the climactic final assault on the hill in question is visually confusing gristly realities are presented in brief flashes as if the brain dared not acknowledged what it had encountered and in the mud and smoke officer and enlistee veteran and newbie black soldier and white become almost indistinguishable from each other as they do in the chaos of actual combat the acting throughout is solid an absolutely stellar performance rendered courtney vance as docin role that will have many flatly disbelieving that this is same actor they cheered as seaman jones in mctiernans red october if you have seen private ryan you owe it yourself see hamburger hillif only determine that the all the valour and horror of spielbergs vision was as present in the ashau valley as it was at omaha beach

in these days of overlong movies meet joe black the thin red line the mask of zorro it is shame that films like waking ned devine cannot be longer than paltry minutes this is just cute movie even through its mildly risque subject matter old friends jackie bannen and michael kelley try find the lottery winner they deduce must live in their dinky town of about so that they might kiss up him and share the winnings through process of elimination they find that it must be lovable old ned devine who they find sitting in front of his tv clutching the winning lottery ticket in his cold dead hand what results is thuroughly amusing as jackie tries convince his wife that not claiming it would be wrong and that they could really benefit after all old ned will not miss it rather than divulge the later twists and turns will stop here merely pointing out that jackie and michael get into all sorts of trouble in their little sleepy irish villiage bannen and kelly are perfect pair one slightly stout the other as thin as rail both getting on in years they make such cute pair of old codgers waking ned devine may even be seen as full monty for the geriatric set especially since kelly gets buffo for one amusing scene waking ned devine is no means perfect but it is so sincere and touching that it looks so much better than most films the performances everyone in the town are great particularly the two leads there is one twist at the end find unnecessary but it hardly ruins the picture writerdirector kirk jones should be held up as an example all those screenwriters scripts as creative and endearing as this should be the norm not the exception perhaps it makes us appreciate this wonderful even more had held off on my years bestworst list for another day waking ned devine officially released in late november of surely would have graced the short group of the years finest films it is light but thought provoking and sweet cannot think of anyone who should not see or would not enjoy this

dark city is such rare treat it a stunning hyperkinetic vision of place where our reality is fused noir science fiction and the darkest nights in manhattan and london boot it is accompanied an intense well written and thoughtful story movies of this caliber and idea aren made too often and it unfortunate that waited this long see it alex proyas who previous the crow looked good but couldn cover up the terrible acting or story here shows near masterpiece combination of metropolis edward hopper and phillip marlowe fused seemlessly at times it moves beyond into artwork it is the story of strangers aliens from another planet and we know they re aliens because they shave their heads and wear overcoats one of the detractions of the who experiment on humans discover what makes them live what makes up our soul these aliens are superior humans because they have mastered the ultimate technology of shaping matter their mind called tuning they are aided human scientist played kiefer sutherland who has betrayed his kind and at the start of the watches as the entire city stops at exactly midnight during this time john murdoch played swiftly rufus sewell wakes in bathtub in room swinging overhead light terrific visual effect not only is murdoch confused but so is the audience without memory and strange guilt that he may be killer he receives phone call flee as the strangers are after him don want proceed much further the explanation of the story one of the pleasures of the is watching it develop in way regaining murdoch identity along him it a pleasure watch the characters develop through the cinematography murdoch wife anna is introduced through stunning beam of light she is lounge singer who sings into bright spotlight shadows outlines of men in hats watch as she gently curves through the shine we see the outline of her body from behind an hourglass as she sings slow rhythmic song great entrance however such as this is only successful if the morals and themes behind it are strong enough leave the viewer satisfied the city is nice look at but if it a poor story then it not worth watching blade runner was popular not only because it visuals but it story and themes were thought out and provoked strong response from the audience it is discussed it and argued therefore success other science fiction films of recent times such as the fifth element are nice look at but are dropped and forgotten because the cookie cutter moral behind them is so flimsy we re left love conquers all after finishing the fifth element dark city is not so easily explained away as the strangers discovered locating the human soul and discovering what makes us survive is not such an easy task where is reality dark city is certainly the best science fiction of the and ranks along the best made in the such as blade runner and the two aliens films perhaps it the best of the both decades it had the darkness of the aliens films as well as the visuals and compelling story of blade runner but moved beyond think because the themes behind it were much stronger anyone who wants make an argument for better science fiction films please feel free write d love hear it

anyone who saw alan rickmans finelyrealized performances in truly madly deeply and sense and sensibility will be unsurprised that the actorturneddirector is bit of poet at heart however for those who recall him only as the maniacal villain of die hard and robin hood prince of thieves this recognition may be something of shock nevertheless poetic is an excellent term describe rickmans feature debut as director the winter guest the has simple unhurried rhythm that uses all of the available elements fashion successful whole the result is an occasionally haunting sometimes magical and always insightful human drama the winter guest is not about resolving plot threads and advancing story line it is about exploring relationships and examining life in all of its stages the winter guest does not tell traditional tale nor does it ascribe conventional narrative structure there is no real beginning or end instead we are given an opportunity observe one day in the lives of eight humans they represent both sexes multiple generations and variety of relationships male and female young middleaged and elderly friends wouldbe lovers and kin we see expectations fulfilled and disappointed emotional boundaries eroded and truths unveiled there is comedy and tragedy most importantly much of what transpires during the course of the winter guest will find an echo in our own lives in this fiction can be found much truth the setting is small town in scotland on the coldest day of the year it is so frigid that the sea has begun freeze over the onshore wind cuts like knife and snow blankets the beach giving the terrain an alien appearance it is against this backdrop that the relationships of the are captured there are four pairings and although there is some interaction between the different twosomes the winter guests focus is on the dynamics internal each relationship the first meatiest pairing is that of elspeth phylida law and her recentlywidowed daughter frances emma thompson these two have stormy relationship they love each other deeply but both are stubborn and willful and neither is willing admit that they need the other much of their interaction is argumentative but during the course of long walk the frozen shoreline they come an unspoken understanding of how much each means the other frances adult son alex gary is lonely young man who has been caring for his mother since the death of his father on this day he meets girl nita arlene cockburn who has secretly been spying on him for weeks although their first encounter is antagonistic she throws snowball at him both quickly become aware of an undeniable attraction once they retire place where they can be alone however things do not go exactly as planned lily sheila reid and chloe sandra voe are couple of old friends who are frequent funeral attendees death is topic of endless fascination for them perhaps because they are so close it and they spend their spare time scanning the obituaries looking for the next funeral or cremation in the area it does not matter whether or not they knew the deceased it is the ceremony that they are interested in sam douglas murphy and tom sean biggerstaff pair of schoolboy chums are spending this cold february day cutting classes and hanging out at the beach horsing around building small fire for warmth and walking on the frozen water unlike lily and chloe these two have their entire lives ahead of them they are young enough still believe in magic but old enough recognize that the process of crossing into adulthood robs life of the simple joy that only children can experience the acting is strong and believable the mixture of veteran performers and firsttimers is effective the most successful choice being the casting of reallife mother and daughter phylida law and emma thompson in the most prominent roles there is chemistry in their interaction that would be hard replicate two different nonrelated actors and of course the physical resemblance makes it that much easier accept elspeth and frances as parent and child the winter guest began its life as stage play in rickman as the director four of the films principals phylida law arlene cockburn sheila reid and sandra voe appeared in the theatrical version before moving the unlike several recent motion pictures adapted from plays the winter guest has been successfully opened up the rough bleak scottish countryside becomes as much of character as any of the eight humans in fact considering how important the climate is every relationship under rickmans microscope it could be argued that this is the single most important element of the movie if you appreciate character studies the winter guest is solid effort enough power stay you after you have left the theater

i want correct what wrote last year in my retrospective of david leans war picture still think that the bridge on the river kwai does not deserve being the number in the american institutes list of the greatest american movies and think that angry men witness for the prosecution and paths of glory would have been better choices for the oscar for the best picture of but cannot deny the importance of the bridge on the river kwai cinematically and in its contents the is set in burma in batallion of british soldiers in japanese war captivity is forced the japanese build strategically momentous railway bridge over the river kwai but the british commanding officer colonel nicholson alec guinness insists corresponding the geneva conventions that his officers need not work as simple workmen struggling toughly col nicholson forces the japanese commandant col saito sessue hayakawa give way in this respect afterwards col nicholson assiduously commits himself for the building of the bridge he considers it an opportunity raise his mens morale and he wants prove superior british capabilities the japanese but the british high command sends few soldiers who shall destroy the bridge among them the american shears william holden an escapee from the japanese prison camp and the british major warden jack hawkins flaw of the picture is the clich characterization of the japanese people they are presented as if they were intellectually inferior the british as if the japanese were incapable of building bridge and the does not consistently question the military spirit as kubrick does in paths of glory lean seems rather fascinated the military hierarchies this is also perceptible in the conversations between col nicholson and col saito in this regard it is symptomatic that shears who doubts the military logic is presented as somehow unpleasant person the audience is supposed applaud col nicholsons perseverance concerning the question if his officers shall work on the bridge or not the spectators are supposed neglect the risks col nicholson takes for his men the plot bypasses these risks that means the picture is not perfect but it has lot of virtues as well the bridge on the river kwai shows the madness of war and what it can produce in peoples minds it shows how colonel nicholson becomes possessed the idea of being hero and that others like shears get cynics and leans is an interesting study of characters clashing interests these points and the sometimes ironic dialogue make this an antiwar despite inconsistencies in the treatment of this theme david leans direction is really effective and atmospherically perfect his is highly suspenseful especially in its dramatic if not wholly plausible showdown the is also wellphotographed and has an apt score alec guinness does magnificent job of bringing col nicholson life and making him such an interesting character the other actors deliver fine performances as well like this extraordinary despite its weaknesses karl rackwitz klein ris germany
